Yesterday I was fishing near the old Fort and those bastards up there started shooting at my boat! I heard them laughing while I was rowing to get away.
Context: BanterDef Ernie_VillagerMale_17 Text  Fort not taken

Text: Don't worry, mate. There's plenty of fish in the sea. Trust me.
You won't let those bandits take the Fort back, right? That place has the best fishing spots!
Is it true that they were building a secret weather control device at the old Fort?
Context: BanterDef Ernie_VillagerMale_19 Text  Fort taken, world flip

Text: My good man... What the devil are you talking about?
Is not for you to know. !
I can neither confirm nor deny the existence of a secret weather control device.
You can deny it as much as you want. I know the New World Order made you sign a contract to never tell anyone.
Context: BanterDef Ernie_VillagerMale_19 Text  Fort taken, world flip

Text: I don't trust Pierre. After all that he has done, he thinks he can be one of us? He should think again.
It's a good thing that Pierre has returned. He has so many stories to tell! And after all, who has a better story than Pierre the Prisoner?
Context: BanterDef Ernie_VillagerMale_21 Text  GoT reference Pierre returned

Text: Good job shooting that traitor Pierre! My only regret is that his father wasn't there to see what happened to his spoiled son.
Damn! That's cold, dude.
I know that your REAL mission was to shoot Pierre, because he learned something he shouldn't know! I'm not asking questions.
I heard that Martha and Herman are working for you! I knew it. They were your undercover agents all along!
Context: BanterDef Ernie_VillagerMale_24 Text  Martha and Herman hired

Text: I just found these... uh... on the dead body of some Legion guy. Er, you must have forgotten to loot him or something. My wife told me... I mean, I thought you could make use of them.
Thanks, partner! Happy trails to you.
Well, your wife is a good influence on you. Repeat that to yourself as often as necessary.
But you keep body for yourself? That is okay. Fidel understand.
Are you Ms. LaFontaine's mercs? Go on inside - they are expecting you.
Go on in. The door is open.
We took care of some of those Legion guys for you. You're welcome.
I thought about joining A.I.M., but Adonis has better health benefits and a retirement plan.
Hey, if any of those big bad Legion guys scare you, just come running back here and we'll take care of them for you, all right?
Miss Santiago is away. You have no business here.
Context: BanterDef FlagHill_Goon_Male_05_LeaveApproach Text  when Corazon left

Text: I don't know anything. It's not my job to ask questions.
Context: BanterDef FlagHill_Goon_Male_06 Text  when Corazon left

Text: Disinterested and incurious are not exactly great qualities in a security guard.
Context: BanterDef FlagHill_Goon_Male_06 Text  when Corazon left

Text: Miss Santiago is probably on the mainland. Aren't you supposed to be there as well?
Context: BanterDef FlagHill_Goon_Male_07 Text  when Corazon left

Text: I am only ever supposed to be precisely where I am.
Context: BanterDef FlagHill_Goon_Male_07 Text  when Corazon left

Text: Go save the president of the Big Dog or whatever. We've got a real job to do.
Context: BanterDef FlagHill_Goon_Male_08 Text  when Corazon left

Text: Go play mercenaries while you still can.
Context: BanterDef FlagHill_Goon_Male_09 Text  when Corazon left

Text: Mercenary is my role! Your role is Male Goon #2. You very good at it!
Context: BanterDef FlagHill_Goon_Male_09 Text  when Corazon left

Text: Please, don't tell them! I'm begging you!
I appreciate you keeping your mouth shut. Here, have these for saving me. I just kept a few odds and ends so Martha and I can get out of here as quick as possible. I'm sure you understand.
Well, I learned my lesson! Don't trust marauders. Here, have these for saving me. I just kept a few odds and ends so Martha and I can get out of here as quick as possible.
Thank you for pulling my Herman from that Deedee's filthy paws.

Herman told me how he helped you deal with those Legion thugs!

I pretended that I believed him.
I told him. I said, "Herman! You stay away from that Deedee or it'll be the death of you!" Well, I was right.
Well, I guess he got what he deserved! I'm taking my Herman away from this wretched island!
If anyone is going to hang my Herman, it would be me.
Damn it, Luc, why'd it have to come to this?
The projector won't start. Someone with higher Mechanical should know how to fix it.

<mechanical-f>
The movie projector just doesn't start.
Yeah, I figured that much. I also tried switching the power on and off, and I even removed the lens cap!

<mechanical-s>
The lamp was intact and just some wiring needed reconnecting. Now the projector should be working.
Hey, it's working! Wow! Uncle Basil, they're even better than you are at fixing stuff!

"Okay Tony, it's your turn to bring grenades. Carry them by hand. NO DRIVING. You know that wacko can't find "safety" in the dictionary."
Pierre
You had ONE job, Tony.

<mechanical-s>
Equipment dismantled for Parts.

<mechanical-f>
The car looks smashed beyond repairs, but perhaps there is something useful in this mess.
Putain! It's gonna BLOW!
The dead person is covered with burns and blast injuries. It is a miracle he crawled this far.
I dinnae think he died from sunburn.
Important lesson: Do not play in minefield.
Ehehehee, look at that! Fidel wishes we were here sooner. We could be doing bets on how long he crawl!

Don't trust Deedee's flags, I tell them. They do not listen.
Hopefully, you will listen better, yes?
The sign is hand-scribbled over pieces of old newspapers. It is almost unreadable. A NTION MI S
The sign is hand-scribbled over pieces of old newspapers. It is almost unreadable. ATTE N NES

A fresh grave, covered in flowers and candles, with a few words scribbled on the cross.
"Tinhay Tenan
Founder, father and friend
We will miss you dearly"
Fidel come late to the party...

I... I'm sorry, uncle Tinhay. It didn't have to come to this. But you shouldn't have shot at my men!
...What am I doing, I'm arguing with a dead man.
Fidel told you this tree is perfect for hanging!
Served you right, snitch.
We should have stopped this from happening. It wasn't justice, it was a lynching.
I will pray for his soul.
What a damn fool! He got what he deserved.
Fidel told you this tree is perfect for hanging!
We should have stopped this from happening. It wasn't justice, it was a lynching.
Good job. His son should be next.
Nice sandals. Now that Shaitan has his soul, he does not need them.
I will pray for his soul.
Shame. Such good tree, and not used to hang.
They shoulda hanged that snitch.
It is good we dissuaded them from committing a mortal sin.
It makes my neck itch just looking at it.
Perfect tree to hang a man, eheheheee...
Don't know why, but this tree gives me the goosebumps. Brrr.
I don't like the aura of this tree. It emits bad vibes.
Hello, mercenaires. This time I welcome you. Will you lend me a hand in dealing with these Adonis bastards? I believe you may have a score to settle with them, non?

Welcome back to Ernie, mercenaries. I heard some troubling things about you recently, but Ms. LaFontaine assured me that you have been betrayed by Adonis just like us. I hope you are here to collect payback as well as back pay.
Welcome to Ernie. If you are here to help us fight those Adonis bastards, then let me be the first to kiss you.
The commandos are here to save us once again! I'm so happy to see you! Are you going to make bombs out of bird poop? Or maybe a tank out of scrap metal?
I have returned to make things right. We will take back our home, and I promise you that I will never let anyone take it away again.
These Adonis thugs are worse than the Legion! They think we are their property.

Yes. The Legion was cruel, but they wanted you to help fight for the Major's vision for Grand Chien. It was wrong, but at least it was a cause. Adonis has no cause other than stealing what is rightfully ours.

Yes. The Legion was cruel, but they wanted you to help fight for the Major's vision for Grand Chien. It was wrong, but at least it was a cause. Adonis has no cause other than stealing what is rightfully ours.
The Legion at least made a show of being "patriotic"... While these bastards care only about the diamonds.
Will you help us take back our home?
Do not worry! We chase those carpet-bagging rustlers out of town for you!
You got it, chief. Let's get to work.
Everything gonna be all right, mon.
The commandos will set everything right, you'll see!
It was nice fighting with you... and not against you. Finally, we're facing the real enemy together.
Good job throwing out the trash, my friends! For the first time in my life, I feel like fighting back - and I like it.
Yay! We showed them! No one can stop the commandos and the Ernie Rangers!
Victory for the Ernie Rangers!
Okay, good. Now we have victory food, followed by victory nap.
I should take a picture. Mother always likes to see proof of death and happiness.
It is always good to be righteous and victorious at same time.
Thank you, mercenaires. You did not disappoint me.

But our job here is not yet done! Our home will only be free when those greedy Adonis bastards are off our island. You may count on the Ernie Rangers to help you retake Fort L'Eau Bleu from Corazon Santiago.
Once we met here in battle, and I thought you were the enemy. Now we are fighting side by side against other mercenaires... The irony of the situation does not escape me.
But this time we are fighting the real villain. Just say the word, and we will start the attack.
Is she really so stupid to believe that you have come here - after everything - for her money?! Even I know you better than that, and most of the time I've known you I was trying to kill you!
Please, go on and show her the meaning of honor. This is your fight and I know you can win.
"This site marks the spot where five brave French commandos held off a full company of German Kriegsmarine, giving the garrison at Fort L'Eau Bleu time to prepare."
A monument to the colonizers slaughtering each other. It is a good thing, yes?
This is Santiago. What are you doing here? The government of Grand Chien has forbidden me from having any further contact with you after the massacre of the refugees.
Context: BanterDef FortCorazon01_radio Text  when deployed above ground

Text: Your being here puts us both in a very precarious position. I suggest you leave immediately. My lawyers will contact you to settle any grievances you may have. I'm sure an agreement can be reached that satisfies all parties involved.
Context: BanterDef FortCorazon01_radio Text  when deployed above ground

Text: This is Santiago. Have you gone mad!? I did not want to believe the reports about you, but now I see who you really are.
Context: BanterDef FortCorazon02_radio Text  when Fort defeated

Text: Very well. If you leave now, I will arrange to have cash and transport out of Grand Chien secured for you. Don't be stupid, mercenaries - take the deal!
Context: BanterDef FortCorazon02_radio Text  when Fort defeated

Text: Stop! Not a step further! I will sue you and, and, and... I will shoot you!
Context: BanterDef FortCorazon03_setpiece Text  when met underground

Text: Guards! Here! Get in position to cover my withdrawal... or retreat or whatever its called. Just... keep them busy!
Context: BanterDef FortCorazon04_setpiece Text  when starting her retreat

Text: Don't worry, ma'am, we have set up a defensive perimeter. They cannot advance further.
Context: BanterDef FortCorazon04_setpiece Text  when starting her retreat

Text: They better not, or you will be unemployed for the rest of your life!
Context: BanterDef FortCorazon04_setpiece Text  when starting her retreat

Text: Beats being dead.
Hey, guard-guy, don't worry about it. You ain't gonna be alive much longer anyway.
Don't worry, Mr. Guard-man. Soon you will have a full time job... as a corpse.
I told you there'd be hell to pay when you crossed me. Well... Hell's come to collect.
You got me shaking in my boots, Woodstock.
Drop your weapon and get on the floor! Now!
I've been sued by exes more times than you have bullets in your gun. Neither of those scare me.
Shoot them! What are you waiting for?! Kill them!
Context: BanterDef FortCorazon05_command Text  when entered the command room

Text: Please, don't shoot! I give up! I'll do whatever you want... pay you whatever you want!
Context: BanterDef FortCorazon06_defeated Text  when Corazon defeated

Text: I did a lot of killing for you, Santiago. Now I'm doing it TO you.
Fidel gets first pick of body parts!
You're wrong, bitch. This here is justice.
This is not murder. This is revenge.
The lion cares not for the opinion of the lamb.
Frontier justice! Yee-haw!
That was unnecessary. We should have brought her to the authorities.
That was stupid. She does deserve it, but she should have first been made to weep openly in front of a court of her peers.
Oh, uh... That was... sudden.
I would have liked to see her confess to her crimes in a court of law, but I suppose she might have talked her way out of that, so this will do.
Here they come! Gas, gas, gas! Tighten your gas masks, everyone!
Context: BanterDef FortCorazonSoldiers01_gas Text  (Muffled - speaking with a gas mask on) when gas is released

Text: Mask-up, everybody! Check respirators and seals!
Ach! Of course there's gas! What's next? A flood of acid, I'll wager!
I bet it's not the fun kind of gas, either.
Goddamit, man, they're here! Move, move, move!
Context: BanterDef FortCorazonSoldiers02_dining Text  soldiers trapped in the dining room

Text: It's too late, you idiot, they mined the door already!
Context: BanterDef FortCorazonSoldiers02_dining Text  soldiers trapped in the dining room

Text: I'm sure I heard something click. Watch out!
I won't move my leg, I won't move my leg, I won't move my leg...
Gott im Himmel, how did I get myself into this?

<explosives-f>
Landmine detonated!
Scheisse! Ugh... Am I alive?

<explosives-s>
Landmine disarmed!
Thank you! You saved my life! You have the hands of a surgeon!
Damn! Fidel cut the wrong wire.
Yours are not the first dangly bits I've had to save that way, lad.
Heeeey, boss! Long time no see!
Herman has stepped on an old anti-personnel mine. Someone that can handle Explosives may be able to disarm it.
Pierre, this is not who you are... Robbery, slavery, murder! How can you take part in such things, my son?
Do not call me that! It is not for you to say who I am, but I will tell you one thing - I am not soft and weak like you. This country needs strong people and a brave leader like the Major.
Is this why your leader has kidnapped President LaFontaine? To prove how brave he is?
LaFontaine is a fool. The Major was right to take him down, and now I'll capture his daughter as well. She fled to this island like a coward, just like you and your friends did all those years ago.
Mon Dieu! I... I have to warn her!
You have to sit on your ass and do nothing. My men should have captured her already. Now stop wasting my time! I need to go back to the Fort and report.
Hold your fire! These are the mercenaire dogs that threaten my country. Let them come closer. I will speak with them as equals before we settle our differences.
Context: BanterDef Pierre_FirstMeeting Text  Pierre met for the first time

Text: Lgionnaires, attention! Any trespassers are to be shot on sight - especially these mercenaire dogs here. Now back to your posts!
Context: BanterDef Pierre_Retreat Text  Pierre retreating deeper in

Text: Dance, Herman! Move, or I start shooting!
Context: BanterDef Raiders_AproachingHerman Text  Emerald Coast - initial set piece

Text: Come on, guys...
Context: BanterDef Raiders_AproachingHerman Text  Emerald Coast - initial set piece

Text: Dance, I said!
Context: BanterDef Raiders_AproachingHerman Text  Emerald Coast - initial set piece

Text: The village is full of them... They shot Tinhay and took Herman, and... I decided to sneak away. But there are more of them here! You will sneak up on them and shoot them, right?
Are you commandos, like in the movies? Coming to shoot those Legion bandits?

<wisdom-s>
The papers on the desk contain an elaborate minefield map labeled EMERALD COAST. There are a lot of crossed out circles, arrows, huge exclamation marks and a few words in red ink:
"That crazy bitch keeps moving and replacing the goddamn mines!!!"

<wisdom-f>
It is hard to sieve through the paperwork of the Legion, as it mostly consists of incoherent notes, bloodstained reports and obscene pictures drawn on every free spot.
Look! Fidel found new weapon schematics! It is grenade launcher with two grenades!...
"Louis"
"Antoine"
"Gaspard"
"Hans"
"Gnther"
"Rudolf"
"Heinz"
"Friedrich"

"Sprengstoffe"
<wisdom-f>
What a strange name...

"Sprengstoffe"
<wisdom-s>
This is definitely not a name. There is something buried underneath the cross.
This "Spreng-" thing is not name.
"Sprengstoffe", hahahaha... Das ist nicht ein Name.
This sounds weird. Wait, let me check... Hey, this isn't a name at all! It means "explosives".
Is this, um, some German joke?
Elementary. In German, "Sprengstoffe" means "explosives".
This is just where they buried some extra grenades.

The sad remains of a mass grave, with an inscription in German engraved on a rusty metal tablet: "They all fought bravely." There is a chance to find something useful in the mound. But is it the right thing to do?
Friends or enemy, in the end they are just soldiers. May they rest in peace.
God give rest to their souls.

<mechanical-f>
There seems to be nothing here but bones and rusted helmets.
We shouldn't be doing that. It is disrespectful.
We must not disturb the peace of the resting ones.

<mechanical-s>
With some careful rummaging through the remains, some surprisingly well-preserved equipment is found.
Look what I found under pile of spooky bones!
This is completely disgusting and I do not want to have anything to do with... Ooooo, look at this!
My babusya always told me that the gifts of the dead are not cursed as long as we use them with good intentions!
Come on, Yorick buddy, don't you look at me like that. You are dead and you don't need this.
This is bad thing. We are doing sin.
They don't need this anymore. By taking their weapons, we honor them.
This isn't right. We shouldn't be doing that.
Hey! Don't break them bones! Fidel needs for collection.
This teddy bear has doll's eyes, black and lifeless.
I think you're right, Ted. We won't get any answers from this one.
Huh... I wonder if other people use sobriety bears, too.
Be careful. It is common to hide explosives in furry symbols of innocence.
I pick up enough discarded toys at home, I'm not touching that one.
This teddy bears silent witness to the horror.
Alright, Ted, let's question him. I'll be good cop, you be bad cop.
That... is not a sobriety bear.
I came half-way around the world just to wind up at another crime scene... I don't suppose this country has a forensics unit?
Nope. Nope, nope, nope.
The teddy bear is motionless... brooding in silence.
I think you should speak Bearish to him, Ted. He might respond to a friendly face.
Oh man, maybe there's a rehab clinic nearby and all the patients escaped and dropped their sobriety bears... That's bad. Very bad.
It's like Toys for Tots around here... but where are the Tots?
There is more to this random distribution of children's toys than meets the eye.
The teddy bear seems to be smiling at the gruesome scene.
Another dead body, another teddy bear. Coincidence?
A teddy bear may improve the decor of many areas, but a murder scene is not one of them.
This teddy bear stares at death and does not look away.
Um... Ted? You know that guy?... No, I DON'T think you know every teddy bear! That's not fair, Ted.
Oh, man... Ted, you'd never do something like that, right?... Right, Ted?
Oh, man, this is bad!... Okay, calm down, Larry. My bear is my friend. My bear is my friend. My bear is my friend.
Greeeat... It's official - it's a serial killer. Okay, I'm going to need access to a forensics lab, a cryptologist, a lot of coffee... and a therapist.
These bears are working under a witch's curse, I am sure of it. We must destroy them, and if anyone sees a man made of gingerbread... shoot to kill.
This is some messed up shit, right here.
Dang! This is dark, Woodstain. Real dark.
I know it is a silly thing to say, but... You do not suppose these bears are evil, do you?
The killer that leaves a calling card is one who is obsessed with the flesh of his victim, not the soul. Our murderer is nothing more than an animal.
Multiple instances of sharp force trauma consistent with chop wounds... The blade was likely too big for a teddy bear to wield, if anyone was worried about that.
The eyes of this teddy bear are wide with terror. They seem to be looking at a set of fresh, heavy footprints nearby.
Who's been playing with my teddy bears??? Oh... Look who's come to play! Let Teddy hug you! I'll hug the stuffings out of you!
Context: BanterDef TeddyBear_3_TedSpawned Text  vague reference to "Little Snow-White" >> Ted is spawned nearby

Text: Go for the eyes, Ted! Go for the eyes!
I'm gonna wake up! I'm gonna wake up! I'm gonna wake up!
Sorry, mister, no touching!
Nope. Nope, nope, nope, a flamethrower full of nope!
Oh, no... I will surely need a new pair of unterpantsies.
Your aura is like a spiderweb of terror! Where is mein Flammenwerfer?!
Feet... run. Run, feet! Please!
All those nights watching true crime documentaries should have prepared me for this, but I am quite, quite frozen in terror.
Why won't you give Teddy a hug?! No one ever wants to give Teddy a hug! Bad! Baaad! Baaaaaaad!
Context: BanterDef TeddyBear_3_TedSpawned Text  sounds increasingly angry >> Ted is spawned nearby

Text: You want someone to hug?! Hug me! I will squeeze you until you are nothing but a wet pile of pasty fig-nothingtons!
I am so happy I don't have to take this guy in alive.
Shoot first! We'll check to see if he is made of gingerbread and witch's blood after!
You got that right, Teddy-boy. I'm about as bad as they come.
Finally. It's time to put this scoundrel who calls himself a Doctor where he belongs.
Yes. In the grave. Next to his cursed ancestors.
What the hell?! Is the madness of Twin Manors contagious or what?
Ha! See, the officers have caught the murderer!
Hell yeah! Let justice be served!
But be careful! He knows magic!
I knew it! It was the Doctor all along! He wanted to chase us away from our property!
That's why he summoned the restless souls of his relatives straight from hell!
His murderous rampage stops now! What say you, good people? Shall we execute him?
Yeah! Let's shoot him!
Shoot him before he puts a spell on you!
You halfwits, you deserve everything that happens to you.
Shut up, murderer! As for you, dear officers - here, this is for your trouble.
Abraham! You blockhead! Those "officers" you invited are just criminals here to rob and murder us!
It is you who invited them, you crazy witch!
No time to argue! Grab your guns, now!
Get away from our property!
Caroline, I knew you were a poisonous witch, but this...
Don't even speak to me, you barbaric murderer!
Wait, so there were no ghosts? The Van Tassels have been murdering our people?
So, the Devil isn't responsible for poisoning my auntie. It's been the Le Domas family all along!
No, the Van Tassels shot my uncle before that!
When you have eliminated the impossible, whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth.
Context: BanterDef TwinManorsFinale_FamiliesCombatFFA Text  Quoting Sherlock Holmes

Text: Oh, this gonna be good.
HA! This is exactly what my family get-togethers are like.
I smell a good, old fashioned family feud cooking.
I thought it was just the Doctor, but now I see who the real enemy is! Van Tassels, to arms!
You think you can get away with it? Le Domas, arm yourselves!
If you could reason with stupid people, there would be no stupid people. The best you can do is to pit them against each other.
It is clear the doctor is behind all this and now he has you under his spell! What else could compel you to make such outrageous accusations!?
I'm afraid it was elementary, my dear Caroline.
Context: BanterDef TwinManorsFinale_FamiliesCombatPlayer Text  Quoting Sherlock Holmes

Text: It grieves me to admit that we have all been duped by these people. They aren't even real constables. I checked.
The hypocrites! The Pharisees! They lied to us!
Well, well, well, if it isn't the pot calling the kettle black.
Me thinks the lady doth protest too much.
Don't try pouring poison into people's ears. You're not any good at it.
They are mocking us! Will we leave this unanswered, people?
Hell no!
To hell with them!
What is most dangerous about stupid people is that when their fear and hatred reaches a critical mass, they are all too easy to manipulate.
About time, constables! Someone has to stop this... murderer!
But how could they? We are dealing with the supernatural here! This isn't a job for law enforcement. We need an exorcist to banish those vengeful spirits! No offense, officers.
Ah, but this is all part of his plan. He wants you to THINK that there are spirits involved, and in the meantime he's killing us one by one! Just like he killed our Romeo and Juliet here.
Nonsense. This is clearly work of the devil!
I guess it takes one to know one.
Simpleton.
Witch.
Well, it looks like I have a lot of annual check-ups to cancel. Good job!
Um, at least there's no need for autopsies this time.
That's some cold shit, Doc.
Nothin' more satisfying than resolving a family feud!
That's kinda dark, Doc.
Anyway, thanks. I mean it. If you hadn't put down those mad dogs Abraham and Caroline, I would've needed to abandon medicine and become a gravedigger - assuming they didn't kill me first.
I was hoping they'd come along quietly, but I guess that was never going to be an option for them.
Was fun! Maybe we come back and do it again sometime.
Well, somebody's got some graves to dig, that's for sure.
No sweat, Doc. Call us any time you need someone to murder half a town's worth of people.

So you need me to help that crazy hag Kronenberg. Normally I would say no, but since you did a good deed and slaughtered half the town, I have no choice but to show appreciation for your persuasion skills.
The clinic archives might be worth checking out.

<wisdom-f>
The cabinet is full of documents written in a horribly distorted and unreadable doctor's handwriting. One thing is clear: the Le Domas and Van Tassel family names are mentioned a lot.

The cabinet contains the Doctor's archive, consisting of medical documentation about members of the Le Domas and Van Tassel families, as well as some frighteningly accurate autopsy notes about a number of murder victims among the families.
It's a good thing that I have such extensive experience reading doctors' handwriting.
Ah, the unmistakable handwriting of a doctor. Makes me want to pull out a prescription pad.
I guess all that time I spent forging prescriptions for rich kids back in college really paid off!
In the Doctor's cabinet there is a small bottle with a skull and bones sticker labeled Cyanide.
In the Doctor's desk there is a 9 mm pistol and an unopened box of standard 9 mm bullets.
In the cabinet there is a small bottle with a skull and bones sticker containing Strychnine.
The pistol on the murder scene is a real weapon, not a stage prop. It is loaded with hollow point 9 mm bullets, one shy of a full magazine.
Wow! She die just like Brandon Lee!

<medical-f>
One of the actors seems to have been poisoned with an unknown substance.
The potion one of the actors drank during the performance shows a high concentration of Strychnine.
Strychnine. Very deadly.
Any first year med student could tell you this person died from strychnine poisoning.
Strychnine. Filthy stuff.

"Here lies Huey L'Enfer 
who brought despair.
Too tragic was his death 
for us to bear"

"Here lies Dewey L'Enfer 
for whom we cared.
To speak of his demise 
we wouldn't dare"

<strength-f>
The stone slab seems like it could be lifted by someone who is good at lifting weights. Unfortunately, that would be someone else.

<strength-s>
Inside the tomb there is a dry skeleton holding a box. The box contains a copy of the L'Enfer family will. According to it, the land upon which the manors are built can never be sold while there is a living L'Enfer heir.
I am stronger than you, dead person! Look at your puny biceps! No wonder you are dead.
Don't skip leg day.
That's my levitation trick.
Not cool. I got dead guy dirt on my vest.
The stone slab is easily lifted. In the tomb, there is a dry skeleton holding an opened and empty box. It looks like someone got here first.
Gah! Someone was pushing from inside, I swear!!!
There are several boxes of hollow point 9 mm bullets. One of the boxes has been opened.

<dexterity-f>
Someone died under mysterious circumstances - there are no visible wounds, no signs of violence, and no traces of poison.
Creepy.
Shaitan took this one for himself.
Guess they just sat down and died. Okay, everybody, careful where you sit.
This is spooky!

Someone died under mysterious circumstances. It seems like the victim expected to be poisoned, so she struggled not to drink the wine. Careful investigation reveals she was choked by forcing an empty bottle of Strychnine down her throat.
Certainly not how I'd like to be choked out!
. Very bad death.
This is some messed up shit we're looking at right here.
I'm going to go close my eyes and think happy thoughts now.
Inelegant. Inefficient. No consideration for the victim's dignity.
That's a rough way to go.
Certainly a very curious incident.
Another mystery solved.

<medical-f>
Someone was chopped up with supernatural strength and cruelty.
Looks like the butcher didn't bother to clean up after himself. Lots of ketchup for the pasta.
Careful medical examination shows that the person was shot in the heart with a 9 mm HP bullet before he was chopped up with the axe.
Umm... Yeah. Here's the bullet. As you may notice, it has the typical mushroom shape expanding ammo takes as it makes its way through soft tissue.
The negative energy coming off this corpse is powerful.
Was it a cover up or was it hate?
This is gruesome, Woodrow. I wouldn't want to meet whoever did this in a dark alley. Well, not without an assault rifle, anyway.
There is an open Bible on the pulpit with lots of notes and odd-looking scratches scribbled in the margins.

<wisdom-f>
The notes and scratches are probably some sort of code - perhaps suggesting where the paranoid pastor was hiding the diamonds he found. Unfortunately, the code is indecipherable.

"Take us the foxes, the little foxes, that spoil the vines: for our vines have tender grapes."
Mmm, we foxes are troublemakers for sure.

"And I heard a voice in the midst of the four beasts say, A measure of wheat for a penny, and three measures of barley for a penny; and see thou hurt not the oil and the wine."
Was ist das I am reading?! Das ist still the Bible, ja?

"And I looked, and behold a pale horse: and his name that sat on him was Death, and Hell followed with him."
I always liked that one.

The notes and weird marks are a sort of code that indicate a specific passage in the bible - Jeremiah 17:1. Could it be a clue to where some diamonds are hidden? "The sin of Judah is written with a pen of iron, and with the point of a diamond: it is graven upon the table of their heart, and upon the horns of your altars."
I knew it! It had to be Exodus, Jeremiah, or Ezekiel. Nowhere else in the Holy book are diamonds mentioned.
Hey, neat! This code is the same one doctors use to write prescriptions.
So, we need to look for diamonds on something with horns? Well, that could be any one of my ex-wives.
Just as it is hinted in the passage of the Bible, there are some diamonds hidden in the horns on the table.
Mana from Heaven!
A treasure unlocked by a riddle!
It's not really stealing from a church if the church isn't being used as a church. A lot of people don't know that.
This is most unholy devil worshipping device.
Spooky!
I honor the altar of Death.
Silly superstitions everywhere.
The teddy bear stew bubbling in the cauldron has a dizzying smell.
A witch's cauldron! And look! She's made a stew out of some wayward child, teddy bear and all!

<medical-f>
The teddy bear stew turns out to be some kind of herbal concoction that is definitely not safe for eating.
Time for second breakfast! Mmm, this stew is good! I'm sorry, Mr. Bear, but please excrete some more or I'll have to squeeze you.
Food! I am starving. Mmm, strange but good. Teddy bear is not very tasty, but this is life - some time bear eats you, other time you must eat bear.
Quite an exotic taste, but one should always give a second chance to local cuisine.
This reminds me of something my mother once said: "It's your fault the teddy bear fell in the soup. Now eat it!"

<medical-s>
The teddy bear stew turns out to be some kind of herbal concoction with powerful analgesic properties that can cause curious side effects, like short term memory loss.
A very potent potable, indeed. I would not touch it.
Amazing! I mean, incredibly unethical, but still amazing.
I am a believer in alternative medicine, but this sort of thing is closer to home-made meth than a home-made remedy.

<mechanical-s>
The shed hides a deep hole that looks like a mining shaft.
Well, that is totally disappointing, but not really surprising.
Dang, Woodrow! Looks like somebody's got a little mining operation they want to keep secret.
Ain't nothing but a hole in the ground, but I bet it ain't for dumping trash.
Look to me like somebody been doin' some digging and don't want no one to know.
There is a hole under the canopy that looks like a mining shaft.
Is the shooting and screaming over? Not to complain, but why did you have to shoot my customers?
Because they were shooting at us. It's not something we approve of.
You need a better class of customer.
It's alright though, they were all small fish. But you! Ah, I bet you would be interested in some serious trading.
Please don't start any trouble, it's bad for business.
Shut up! Getting shot in the guts is more bad for business!
Trouble IS our business.
I left my door unlocked last night, and you know what? I was not robbed! I don't know how you did it, but boys who used to be in gangs are now keeping the peace in the militia.
Being in the town militia gives people permission to feel good about themselves.
Joining the town militia gives a youngster a sense of self-worth, which is what a gang can give but for the wrong reasons.
I'm glad we're keeping the streets safe, ma'am. Now, if we can just figure out how to keep them clean...
My sister works in Rimville. She says it's very nice, but they make her empty her pockets before letting her leave.
She has an outfit that has pockets?! Where does she shop?
I know some people who can sew pockets into jacket linings. I'll put you in touch.
You don't need pockets to make things disappear. It's called misdirection, ya dig?
I heard you are paying good wages for people to work in Mfumu's Mine. My husband is eager to work for you - at least, he better be. He'll sign up tomorrow.
Mfumu's Mine income increased
There are worse places than Fleatown, my friend... just not by a whole lot.
The communists pay their miners little but have good benefits. The capitalists pay better, but work you to death. These are my options.
You with the smugglers or the gangsters? You don't look like miners, that's for damn sure.
The market has everything you might expect to find, as long as you don't expect to find much.
Ciao ragazzi! Welcome to Rimville! I just made Caponata - my own family recipe. Come, be my guest.

Hey you! Get out of here! This is your last warning. I'm counting to ten!
