This is a special operation for liberating le President, haha.
The Legion have abducted le President because they wanted to start a civil war! But we'll show them. We'll show all of them.
Maybe the President was really kidnapped, maybe not. We don't know all the facts.
Mercenaires, eh? You did not fight in the war, but now you come for the diamonds. Scavengers.
We're just here to help resolve a hostage situation.
Hey man, we all gotta make a living, right?
Yeah, I guess that's about right. You got a problem with it?
What right do you have to meddle in our internal affairs?
None of your damn business.
I've been doing this for a long time, lad. There is nay such thing as an "internal affair".
Meddling is our business. And business is good.
We have to free our brothers in the South from the occupation of la Lgion.
Bandits, smugglers, slavers, headhunters, "Legionnaires", all kinds of criminal scum... And now mercenaires.
We're not here to complicate your mission, Lieutenant. We'll try to stay out of your hair.
Don't butter us up, Lieutenant, tell us how you really feel.
Halt. What is your purpose here? Are you les mercenaires?
Context: BanterDef FortBrigandFaucheux_01_approach Text  approached before world flip

Text: Come on, you merdes! Shoot them already! Do I have to do everything myself?!
Context: BanterDef FortBrigandFaucheux_02_battle Text  starting combat after world flip

Text: What the... Les mercenaires! Or should I say, war criminals?
Context: BanterDef FortBrigandFaucheux_03_sneak Text  approached after world flip

Text: Hello, Jules. I'd give you the chance to surrender, but I already know you're too stupid to take it.
Death has come for you, Colonel.
The only war criminal here is you!
You talk too much, man. But don't you worry a thing about that - I got a magic trick that'll shut you up for good.
Now you will know death at the hands of a Dolvich. I give warning: It is very painful.
Soldiers, alerte! We are under attack!
Context: BanterDef FortBrigandFaucheux_03_sneak Text  approached after world flip

Text: Putain... Team Bravo, provide covering fire for extraction! Team Charlie, prepare my barge!
Context: BanterDef FortBrigandFaucheux_04_defeated Text  defeated, trying to escape

Text: He's trying to get away!
The little rabbit is running!
Got him on the run now, Ace!
Looks like he's trying to withdraw.
Hey! I ain't finished with you yet!
The perp is on the run!
He's getting away, Woody!
That filthy bugger will be trouble for us later if we let him slip away.
I feel compelled to make the argument that we are very competent, unless you mean your own soldiers. Hello? Hello?... I guess he's dead.
Oh come on, don't die just yet... I wasn't done kicking your ass.
Here lies Colonel Fuckface. What a piece of shit.
It was great fun killing you. Fidel will miss you.
Good riddance to bad rubbish.
This is worthy of major commendation! Perhaps medal?
Halt! Are you les mercenaires of Mademoiselle Lafontaine? Report to le Colonel, he is expecting you.
Context: BanterDef FortBrigandGuard_01_beforeBetrayal Text  approached before world flip

Text: Soldiers! Alerte! Les mercenaires are attacking us!
Context: BanterDef FortBrigandGuard_02_attacked Text  starting combat after world flip

Text: Watch where you're shooting, you fool!
Context: BanterDef FortBrigandGuard_02_failedattack Text  reference to "Watch where you're going ya fool" from Courage trying to start combat before world flip

Text:
<wisdom-f>
The painting seems to be an example of contemporary art.
Ah, this is a reflection on the legendary "Red Sun" with Toshiro Mifune! I see someone here is a man of culture.
Let Fidel guess! This picture must be called "Blood and guts at sunset."
When I was little, Mother brought me to a museum of contemporary art. What we see here is a monochrome painting.
What can I say, Woodfella? I never understood modern art.
This looks like something I might have drawn as a child.
Oh, I know! This is one of those pictures to be stared at until something appears... Okay, I see the naked lady now. Not bad!

<wisdom-s>
At first, the painting seems to be some piece of contemporary art. A more careful look reveals that someone simply doodled over the plan of the camp with a paintbrush.
Normally, I would say this is a terrible attempt at monochrome art. Instead, it is simply a terrible attempt at camouflage.
Mein Gott, whoever painted this is certainly no Jackson Pollock. Oh, wait - this is just a plan for the camp with some doodles on it. You see what can be perceived with an open mind?
I suppose if I were going to hide the plans for the camp in plain sight, this would be one way to do it.
It is just my personal opinion, but I really think hanging blueprints on the wall is both tacky and, to put it delicately... stupid.
I am in appreciation of such art as this. It is very educational.
Hmmm... An interesting choice. Disguising valuable intelligence behind something that is quite painful to behold is a very clever tactic.
<leadership-f>
I have no orders to issue supplies to you. Let little Miss Fontaine supply her toy soldiers, hehe.
Clues check successful
Okay, you can have it, but the casing remains here with me. Cannot issue anything with Adonis logo on it. Le Colonel's orders.
Alright, alright, you can have it - but let me remove the Adonis logo first. Le Colonel's orders.
<leadership-s>
You sure that le Colonel allowed you to request that?
Alright, alright. Anything for Miss LaFontaine's toy soldiers, hehe.

<leadership-f>
There is a pile of papers that seems to be written in gibberish, and a book: "Commentaries on the Gallic Wars" by Julius Caesar.
A friend gave me this book as a gift. I only had it for a week before the kids turned the pages into paper aeroplanes.
I am a great admirer of Julius Caesar. He wore a magnificent red cape in battle! I must get one for myself.
"Commentaries on the Gallic Wars"? The poor radio guy has gotta be bored out of his mind to read something like this!

The pile of papers is written in an outdated military code. The cipher is a direct copy of the Caesar Shift encryption method, a sample of which is found in the book lying nearby: "Commentaries on the Gallic Wars" by Julius Caesar. Once deciphered, the papers seem to contain communication between Corazon Santiago and Colonel Faucheux.
The Caesar Shift is the oldest code in the book... and the book is right here!
The Caesar Shift? Colonel Faucheux must not care who reads his mail!
You gotta be kidding me, Woody. The Caesar Shift? I guess the Colonel isn't too worried about security.
Boy, this brings me back. I used the Caesar Shift to pass notes to the other cadets back at the Academy!
The Caesar Shift is a lousy way to send secret messages. The ordinary housewife could crack it... Don't ask me how I know that.
This code was invented by one of the most arrogant men of all time. I am not surprised to find it here.
The globe is a beautifully crafted work of art itself, but there are tiny cracks on it that are masked as parallel and meridian lines. It seems that a portion of the globe can be opened.
There is something odd about the decorative globe. There are tiny cracks on it that are masked as parallel and meridian lines. It seems that a portion of the globe can be opened.

On the decorative globe there is a password panel hidden under Africa. It opens when you press Grand Chien. However, the locking mechanism has a loose spring and it could be opened by someone with nimble fingers and a lot of patience.
Stupid thing! I will break you!
This thing was sent by Shaitan himself to taunt me.
Can't get my fingers in there, Ace.
Somebody with smaller hands than these bear paws of mine should take a crack at this.

On the decorative globe there is a password panel hidden under Africa. It opens when you press Grand Chien. However, the locking mechanism has a loose spring which is easily opened by someone with nimble fingers and a lot of patience.
It always makes me happy when I get to show off my finger skills.
Is simple task. No problem.
They ain't made a lock Magic can't get past.
Having small hands sure is useful sometimes.
There is an electrical board with power switches for an installation above ground.
The board is a mess of cables and poorly installed switches. A good Mechanic should be able to figure it out, but the clock is ticking.
This thing is like a Christmas Tree with an attitude. Gonna take us forever to untangle all this.
Whoever designed this thing didn't have the full Quid. This is madness!
This is problem, glavny. I need to eat sandwich and think.
Shutting off this thing is like trying to disable a parking lot full of car alarms, Scooter.
Sparks are flying and lights are blinking. Something is wrong. A good Mechanic should be able to find the right switch and flip it before someone notices.

<mechanical-s>
After flipping a few switches and reconnecting a loose cable, the board stops blinking.
Lights turned off
Calm ya'self, ya bangin'-flashin' piece of junk!
It has been de-actuated and it is now submissive.
All she needed was a little Magic touch.
That thing was screwier than my trailer hook-up, but we got it squared away, Woody.
Not to be too critical, but that electrical board is so poorly designed it is a wonder this place hasn't gone up in flames.
There, there, strange little light board. You are all better now. Go back to sleep.
The wall has been patched up here but the construction doesn't look all that sturdy.
No hidden latches or engraved riddles... I think we just need to blast it open.
I could punch it until it breaks, but I think the explosion people should get a chance to prove themselves.
Nope, definitely not a door disguised as a wall. Only key that will work here is the exploding kind.
Well, I think we can blow it open, chief... Just not quite sure how.
I do not fear this place, but I worry what the Major will do when he learns I no longer control it.
Context: BanterDef GoodPlace_Jackhammer01 Text  no Major in the squad

Text: Looks like you're back where I found you, Jack. How's life treating you in the Good Place?
Context: BanterDef GoodPlace_Jackhammer02 Text  have the Major as merc

Text: Are you here to kill me, Major?
Context: BanterDef GoodPlace_Jackhammer02 Text  have the Major as merc

Text: Not my call to make anymore. Hell, they'll probably throw me in here with you before too long.
Context: BanterDef GoodPlace_Jackhammer02 Text  have the Major as merc

Text: You are only saying what they would like you to say, but I know better. The Major cannot be caged.
Context: BanterDef GoodPlace_Jackhammer02 Text  have the Major as merc

Text: I am sorry it had to end like this, Jacques, but you have to pay for your crimes.
Context: BanterDef GoodPlace_Jackhammer03 Text  Pierre trying to be forgiving

Text: And what of your crimes, Pierre? Who is paying for those while you walk free? Me, that's who - so go fuck yourself.
Context: BanterDef GoodPlace_Jackhammer03 Text  Pierre trying to be forgiving

Text: At least while I am stuck here, I can have some fun beating the shit out of that little fuckhead, Elliot.
Context: BanterDef GoodPlace_Jackhammer04 Text  Elliot is in the same prison

Text: I have absolutely no problem with that.
I guess that's our fault. This prison has limited recreation options. Maybe we should bring in some ping pong tables.
I think he'd be disappointed if you didn't. He seems to like being dominated.
My old cell! Feels almost like home.
Here I am, back at the start.
It's a bit of a rough ride, going from prison director back to prisoner.
When you find you have walked in a circle, it is a sure sign that you have lost your way.
I'm sure all the other inmates ain't making the "ride" any easier.
You'll be fine. Just remember to, uh... watch your back.
Don't shoot, Your Highn-... I mean, Your Mercenary-ness. It's just me, Elliot.
Don't shoot! I'm an idiot.
Prove it!
Prove it!
Prove it!
I served a psychotic megalomaniac in Arulco and then went and did the same thing in Grand Chien.
It actually sounds funny when you say it like that!
Congrats, Woodhead. You are a first class idiot.
Yeah, that checks out.
The Major didn't like it when he learned about... well, everything. That's why I'm here. But I'm better off like this.
Context: BanterDef PrisonerElliot_03 Text  if sent to Camp Bien Chien

Text: I've seen some sad sacks, but you are the droopiest.
You came crawling back to your master and he locked you in the dog house, huh? Tough break.
Not gonna argue you with you there, pal.
I see a little silhouetto of a merc...
Context: BanterDef PrisonerElliot_04 Text  sadly, softly, singing to the tune of "Bohemian rhapsody"

Text: I'm just a poor boy, I need some sympathy.
Context: BanterDef PrisonerElliot_05 Text  sadly, softly, singing to the tune of "Bohemian rhapsody"

Text: The constant beatings notwithstanding, I find my life is so much better when someone else controls it.
Trapped in a cage in Grand Chien, I've never been so free.
I didn't mean to kill my friend, I swear! You see... I was just a victim of a series of accidents.
Context: BanterDef PrisonerElliot_08 Text  vague reference to "The Sirens of Titan" by Kurt Vonnegut  if you know his story

Text: Aye, lad. The first one being your conception.
You know what I see, Elliot? I see a man about to live the first day of the rest of his life!
Save it for the judge.
I don't want a walk! I don't want it! Jackhammer is always bullying me.
Context: BanterDef PrisonerElliot_09 Text  vague reference to "The Sirens of Titan" by Kurt Vonnegut  sent to the Good Place and Jackhammer is a prisoner too

Text: So? I thought that kind of thing was your jam.
Sounds like just your type.
What are you bitching about? Ain't that the kind of thing you're into?

<wisdom-f>
It's impossible to find any useful information in this pile of badly written and poorly organized documents.
After carefully examining this pile of badly written and poorly organized documents, it is clear that the prison director is giving loans to people whose names frequently appear on prisoner lists.
His penmanship is atrocious! And what are these? Grease stains?!
Look at this. Every time he spells a word that has a double "o" he just draws a pair of boobs.
I can't be sure, but I think these documents are organized by the size and shape of their food stains. At least, I hope it's food...
Wait! Let's be reasonable... Let's talk.
Heeey, ragazzi! Over here! Get me out and I'll love you forever, eh?
That's how you do it, bambino! Eh, I can smell freedom in the air already!
Ugh, Luigi, dat was me. Sorry.
Joseph... mio amico! Everything smells good now, eh? We're free as birds - maybe jailbirds, but free is free, right?
If you say so, Luigi, Boss.
They made me sign some paper and I thought I got a job... and the next day Jackhammer comes with armed men and arrests me! My woman waits for me back in La Boue... Please...
God bless you, good people! I will give Father Tooker my best chicken to sacrifice as a blessing for your health!
I'm from Port Cacao. I took a small loan and was one day late paying it back. I was told my debt had tripled! I could not pay... and they told me I will rot in prison for that.
I like every type of shark except loan sharks. They should be hunted to extinction.
Thank you! I'll never take out another loan again!
Context: BanterDef PrisonerInnocent02_Leave Text  >> +5 Port Cacao Loyalty

Text: If you do, just come see me. My rates are very reasonable.
Context: BanterDef PrisonerInnocent02_Leave Text  >> +5 Port Cacao Loyalty

Text: Hey! Did the great Chimurenga send you to release me from prison so I can rejoin the fight against the capitalist oppressors?
Look! I have found a commie in his natural habitat!
High Loyalty with Pantagruel
Comrades! Comrades Mercenaires! I am one of Chimurenga's men, from Pantagruel! Have you come to release me from prison so I can fight again for the Revolution?
Thank you, comrades! Vive la Rvolution!
I know you are here to release me from prison! Last night, Lami the Witch appeared in my dream and told me you would come!
Thank you! I will ask Lami to visit you in your dreams and give you happiness and health.
Please release me, I haven't done anything! I'm from Ille Morat. I tried to escape the slavers in Belle Eau, but river pirates captured me and sold me to Jackhammer.
Thank you! May the Beast watch you while you sleep!
Context: BanterDef PrisonerInnocent05_Leave Text  >> +5 Ille Morat Loyalty

Text: I hope you are not working for Siegfried Von Essen, or Boss Blaubert, or the Legion... Now that I think of it, it's probably safer for me in here.
Thanks... I guess. I know you mean well. I guess I'll go back to Landsbach... if I have to.
Please let me out... I never did anything wrong, except for being born poor in Port Cacao.
Oh, how I miss the smell of home! Thanks to you I'll be back at the Dump soon enough!
Context: BanterDef PrisonerInnocent07_Leave Text  >> +5 Port Cacao Loyalty

Text: Yo, buds! Let me out of here, eh? I am no criminal, man! I swear, I didn't do a thing!
Seems legit...
Scoundrel perk activated
Yo, buds! Let me out of here, eh? I'm innocent, I swear! I was just drunk and trying to have a good time.
Yeah, I've used that excuse before, too. Nobody bought it then and nobody's buying it now.
For reasons that are entirely personal, I have been keeping an eye on Grand Chien's list of most-wanted criminals and I've seen your face there.
That's an excuse a lot of boys use. Most of them get away with it, but I guess you didn't.
Woo! Thanks, buds! Time to have a drink or five and have a little fun!
Let me go! I'm no criminal! I'm, uh... I'm with the communist Maquis. I'm being repressed because my communism is so powerful, man!
High Loyalty with Pantagruel
Hey, let me go! I'm no criminal. I'm, uh... I'm with your communist buddies, man. Totally. Yeah, I have more commie-chlorians in my blood than Lenin, man! Trust me!
Yeah! Long live the Rebellion, right? I, uh... I'm going to the secret rebel base, now. Down with the Empire!
I have deep suspicion that this person is putting on act.
Let me out! Let me out! Let me out! LET ME OOOOUUUUT!
Context: BanterDef PrisonerJailbird03_Approach_failure Text  psycho killer crazy talk

Text: Psycho perk activated

Heyyyyy, I know you guys! Blood and guts. Blood and guts. Blood and guts. I'm a big fan! Want to see my collection of pelvises? They never found them... I can show you! Let me out! Let me out! Let me OOOUUUT!
Context: BanterDef PrisonerJailbird03_Approach_success Text  psycho killer crazy talk

Text: You remind me of my cousin. We keep him in a cage, too.
You... You are fan of Fidel? And you have pelvises to give me?... No. Fidel is too smart to fall for such obvious trap.
I may be a little crazy, but this guy's a fucking lunatic.
Yes! Yes! YESSSSSSSSSS! I'll show you. You'll see I'm just like you! I'll bring you the meat, but the bones are mine! MINE!
Context: BanterDef PrisonerJailbird03_Leave Text  psycho killer crazy talk >> -5 Port Cacao Loyalty

Text: Hey, you have to let me out of here! My wife made up all of those things. She just wanted me out of the way!

I didn't do anything! She brought it on herself. I am the man, but she would not listen to me! She would only complain. What was I supposed to do? The bitch just wouldn't shut up... just had it coming.
While you rot in your cell, I hope some parts of you fall off faster than others.
Oh, wow... You are everything I don't like about men.
I be sorely tempted to let you out of that cell so you can see what YOU got coming!
I suppose my faith in the Grand Chien justice system is at least partially restored.
Damn, I'm conflicted! Do I shoot your kneecaps off first or your elbows?
If you are very quiet, and VERY lucky, I won't make those the last words you'll ever speak.
I once knew a man who thought the same way as you. He's dead now.
You are the very real type of monster that makes girls run from home and into the dark forest.
If I were you, I would not mention that last part at your next parole hearing. Also, if I were you, I would kill myself.
Go to Shaitan, pig! I would shoot you dead right now, but my bullet is too good for you.
Fuck yeah! Thanks for letting me out! I'm going to La Lys Rouge where the women will do exactly as I tell them - whether they like it or not!
You so much as hurt those ladies' feelings, I'll break every bone in your body.
Boss! Hey, boss! Please, let me out! I'm no trouble-maker. I do what I'm told.
<leadership-s>
Boss! Hey, boss! Please let me out! It wasn't my fault. I was only following orders. I'll never go back to Camp du Crocodile, I swear!
Good soldiers follow a leader. Idiots follow orders.
Thank you, boss! You're the best! Do you know the easiest way to cross the river and reach Camp Savane? Uh, I'm asking for a friend.

You are those mercenaries! Please, let me out of here. I did nothing you have not done - a little breaking and entering, a little illegal salvage, some black market deals... and maybe some light murder.
If you think you are like me, you are gravely mistaken.
Ah, yes! The mercenary life, eh? Take what can be taken and kill whoever you need to!
God put a plague on the wicked for their sins, and then delivered you unto them as his angels of death.
Context: BanterDef Grimer_VillagerFemale_01 Text  saved lots of villagers >> Proud

Text: We are angels of death of our own accord.
We do not have divine mandate. We have mercenary contract.
Angels of death, huh? I kind of like the sound of that.
The spirits have punished us for our sins.
Context: BanterDef Grimer_VillagerFemale_02 Text  didn't save save lots of villagers

Text: Poor Montel! He was such a nice boy, and see what that whore Bella has turned him into!
Poor Montel! First his parents died, then that bitch Bella broke his heart, and now he has suffered such a horrible death! There is no justice in this world!
Context: BanterDef Grimer_VillagerFemale_04 Text  Monday dead >> Guilty

Text: There is no such thing as justice. There is only vengeance.
May the spirits bless you for killing that bitch Bella. It was all her fault that they punished us.
I'm not saying she shouldn't be killed for what she did, but Bella had good reason. The men of this town are pigs! She was only treating them the way they treated her.
Do you need any of these? Monday was about to throw them in that monstrosity he uses to brew moonshine.
I am always of interest to new reading materials.
Using magazines to brew moonshine!? ...I guess I can see it.
I feel fine! We're all fine. Don't send us to the Sanatorium please!
Our Monday really knows how to party!
If I had to choose between turning into a cadavr and drinking myself to death, well... It's a clear choice, isn't it?
Young Montel was out of his mind, but he was a good boy, all things considered.
Young Montel may be out of his mind, but who wouldn't be in his place? Please, go kill that bitch Bella. She deserves it for all the misery she has brought. Not just to Montel, but to everyone!
Context: BanterDef Grimer_VillagerMale_05 Text  Bella quest given, not completed

Text: Sounds like this lady is a real femme fatale.
I always wanted to meet a femme fatale. Now I'm not so sure.
I realize Bella may be a bit promiscuous, but are we sure we're not victim-blaming? Just a little bit?
Now that Bella is dead, we can use her villa to lock up the infected!... In case there were any infected. But there are none. Please don't send us to the Sanatorium.
Context: BanterDef Grimer_VillagerMale_06 Text  The last part is said quickly, with sudden fearful realization Bella killed

Text: I don't agree with what Bella did, but I understand why she did it. Every man she's ever known has mistreated her. It was only a matter of time before she snapped.
I just signed up for your Mili-*HIC*-tia. Me. Gonna kick some ass! This some good drink, this moonday moonshine. Wanna try some?
Context: BanterDef Grimer_VillagerMale_08_Loyalty Text  sounds drunk >> +1 Militia

Text: +1 Militia in Wassergrab
No. Nope. Not at all. Not even a tiny little... Well, maybe just a sip.
Hell yeah, man! It's what I'm here for - it's, like, my specialty.
Yes! It is mandatory to drink with comrade soldier.
Oh non! Les cadavrs! Wait, these are not them.
God and spirits! We're saved!
Don't shoot! Are you here to save us?
Don't eat us, don't eat... Ah! Don't shoot us, don't shoot us!
Have no fear, good woman. I, Alejandro Diaz, will not eat or shoot you.
We're saved! We're saved!
Finally! L'arme is here!
Non-non, don't kill us! We are not cadavrs, I swear!
You're not here to shoot us, right?
I haven't made up my mind yet.
Fidel is here to shoot EVERYONE!... But maybe for you I make an exception.
Non! Les cadavrs! Wait... They have guns. LES CADAVRS WITH GUNS!!!
Lightning Reactions perk activated Something stirs in the cage and only lightning-fast reflexes can slam the door shut before whatever is inside escapes. One of THEM lurks within!
I just saw a shadow move and it wasn't mine!
You keep your ugly ass in there!
Ambush! Take cover!

Night Ops perk activated Something hisses in the darkness and only reflexes honed by rigorous Night Ops training can slam the cage door shut before whatever is inside escapes. One of THEM lurks within!
There is a monster under the carpet!
Bloody biscuits!
The cage is dark and full of terror!

Pessimist perk activated The air turns sour with terror and only the pessimistic expectation of the worst possible outcome can slam the cage door shut before whatever is inside escapes. One of THEM lurks within!
Knowin' me luck, that must be one of 'em scabby bastards waitin' to bite me arse.
Oh, shit, man. If the Sanatorium taught me anything, it's DON'T go near the cages!
Bloody hands reach out. It's one of THEM!
Well hello, cadavrs! Don't be shy - step right up, I'm a reasonable guy.
Context: BanterDef Grimer_Monday01_ApproachInitial Text  Reference to a Voltaire song "Brains" initial

Text: A talking monster!
Dang, Woodrow! You don't look so good. Maybe you should lie down.
Was that a threat? It sounded like a threat to me.
There's been a lot of shooting! I like it. Gives rhythm to my drinking.
I am in agreement with monster.
Do we shoot it or talk to it? I could go either way.
This moonshine still looks like it was made by a drunken zombie. It leaks and smells like paint thinner. Perhaps the design could be improved.
The moonshine still gurgles and emits an odor best described as toxic. Its mismatched parts rattle in protest. Only a skilled mechanic would be able to tell how to get this thing working efficiently.
This is not a machine for producing alcohol. This is a machine for producing pain.
Somebody ought to take this thing out back and shoot it.
This thing supposed to make Prairie Dew, partner? It look more like shit from sick cow!

<mechanical-s>
It takes a skilled mechanic to properly clean the condenser, refit the pipes, and remove the redundant parts.
This condenser be dirtier than most carburetors I've seen! And this pipe? No, no. This pipe no go here, mon. And what be the purpose of this mouse trap here then?
I can't believe I'm saying this, but the only way this thing could've worked in the first place was by magic. I think I got it fixed up so it won't poison nobody, but no promises.
This machine was under a curse. I think I have lifted it by removing the parts that smelled bad. I cannot wait to see what kind of potion it brews!

I am no mechanic, but this device is govno. Look, THAT piece belong on machine gun, not here... But, if I make this pipe go to that and then that piece go here... See? Now you can make potato vodka like a boss!

...As you can see from the charts, living in harmony with nature and eating only healthy food like those tasty mushrooms you have just tried will increase your life expectancy by up to sixty-two percent!
Context: BanterDef Hermit01_approach Text  Mike is joyfully praising the good effects of natural drugs

Text: Now let us circle back to your life fulfillment goals. You need to go deeper and leave your comfort zone in order to synergize with nature, adopt the most useful mindset to achieve your goals and master your true self.
Context: BanterDef Hermit03_approach Text  Mike is preaching you

Text: And if you have the growing suspicion that all these buzzwords are just some bullshit that I pulled off to trick you into giving me money just because you are lonely or confused, then don't forget that anything can be a valuable learning opportunity!
Context: BanterDef Hermit03_approach Text  Mike is preaching you

Text: As a life coach, my job is to challenge you to get specific on what you want for your future, set up your life goals, and develop the right strategies to achieve them.
Context: BanterDef Hermit04_approach Text  Mike is preaching you

Text: That is because life makes perfect sense and you just need a stranger to explain it to you, and then tell you how to live it.
Context: BanterDef Hermit04_approach Text  Mike is preaching you

Text: With my help, you will find a greater sense of purpose and meaning. You just need to believe in yourself, and moreover, to invest in yourself - and what better investment than life coaching?
Context: BanterDef Hermit05_approach Text  Mike is preaching you

Text: The outcomes of coaching can be life-changing. Trust me and you will feel as successful and content as all of my past clients, such as Mr. Pangloom from Bien Chien who achieved inner peace and utmost fulfillment of his life goals.
Context: BanterDef Hermit05_approach Text  Mike is preaching you

Text: I'm so glad that Mr. Ditch is still alive. Thank you once again for helping us find each other. We won't be alone anymore.
This shack requires a lot of repairs. Mr. Ditch is a genius when it comes to mushrooms and herbs, but he needs my help to live like a civilized person.
Those bandits don't bother us much lately, not since we're together. I guess the rumor about the couple of evil old men has spread along the Adjani.

<wisdom-f>
It is hard to determine what the chart is about.
I don't get this, mate. Seems like the chart shows "fungible" and "non-fungible" something, whatever the hell that is.
This makes about as much sense as selling sun block in a rainstorm.
Fungible? Non-fungible? That's some bullshit, I don't get it.

<wisdom-s>
The data points on the chart seem to actually represent body count.
I am rather convinced that the "fungible" data points show how many he has poisoned, and the "non-fungible" must be those who were not susceptible to food poisoning.
See, the "fungible" chart represents those who he poisoned with mushrooms, and the "non-fungible" ones are probably those who just got the axe.
This guy's got some guts, Woody - he's been showing off how many jerks he's poisoned right in front of the ones he's about to poison! Dang!
Dead bodies of several Legion soldiers. Most of them have no visible injuries, but there is one with his head bashed in.
This is what happens when you don't eat your 'shrooms!
Someone didn't eat their mushrooms and got the axe.
I can count at least five fungibles and just one non-fungible.

<wisdom-f>
Some of the herbs have healing properties while others are poisonous. Trial and error is not a wise way to find out which is which.

<wisdom-s>
Some of the herbs have healing properties while others are poisonous. It is important to know which is which.
Mandalas are key to achieving inner peace, especially when your job is to life coach people you have just poisoned to death.
The positive vibes of the mandalas make me feel like I can improve other people's lives.
Interesting designs. There is a sense of harmony with nature here.
Pretty! I wonder if they are magical?
I had a carpet with this same design until my youngest spilled juice all over it.
There is blood on the axe, but not on the stump.
This axe was used somewhere else, and then just placed back on the stump.
Someone was life coached with this axe.
Life coach with an axe - that's what I'm talking about!
Someone must have refused to eat the mushrooms.
That's what you get when you don't eat your mushrooms.
Looks like sometimes life coaching teaches some hard lessons.
Have you been to Belle Eau across the river? Did you see my daughter? I worry that those Legion ghouls are not feeding her well...
I have heard the Beast only eats people with guns. Maybe it's attracted to the smell of gunpowder on their clothes...
Hmm, maybe I'm a Beast in my own right.
When beasts smell me, it is already too late for them to eat me.
They say when the Effigy is glowing, that's when you know the Beast is on the hunt!
Maybe it's part of some sort of summoning ritual, or a talisman that warns of danger, or an ancient spirit that warns of approaching demons...
So, if it starts glowing, I should find somewhere else to be. Good to know.
What, you mean like a bug-zapper or something? A beast-zapper?
Our lady Beast, she owned that sunken mansion. Her Beast-cave was down in the cellar, but those Legion ruffians broke the dam upriver and the whole thing was flooded.
It's a good thing you're around to help our Beast lady. I've always worried that she bears a cross too heavy for her shoulders.
How could you let our lady Beast die!... How could you! She was the best thing we ever had.
Context: BanterDef IlleMorat_VillagerFemale_07 Text  Beast dead >> Guilty

Text: The Legion has taken our young people and left us old-timers here to rot. May the Beast eat their souls!
Henri has just sent me money from his paycheck. It is so nice you're actually paying our young people for their work!
Context: BanterDef IlleMorat_VillagerMale_02 Text  when the mercs have liberated the nearby mine

Text: Be careful if you go into the Cursed Forest, for you may encounter the Beast!!!
I have encountered more beasts than you can count, monsieur. They are no more - and I am still here.
There's a place called the Cursed Forest? Can we go?! Can we?!
I'll pack extra camo.
That scary Effigy on the hill is the only thing that protects us from the devilish fury of the Beast. Be careful not to touch it, or the Beast will have your smell and eat your soul!
That shit is giving me moose bumps, man! That's like goose bumps, but worse.
How do you like our Beast? She seems to like you, because you're still alive.
I like the way she hunts, so I have not killed her... yet.
She's one badass lady.
She makes me feel like a little girl... But in a good way!
Oh my! Not to gush, but when I'm her age, I hope I'm half the woman she is.
She hunts. She makes snacks. She is perfect woman.
She kicks ass and doesn't take shit from nobody! What's not to like?
Our Beast is dead! Who will protect us from the bandits now?
Context: BanterDef IlleMorat_VillagerMale_07 Text  Beast dead >> Guilty

Text: You don't need a protector, you just need to realize your potential and self-actuate!
You will have to learn to take care of yourselves.
We shall protect you, love.
With that brain of his, our Wlad could have worked in some big company making soft-weary programs or something! But instead, he stays here making our lives better.
You should have seen those Legion idiots trying to use our Wlad's weird fishing device. Three of them fell into the river, and the crocs even ate one!
Idiots be using a machine the wrong way and be punished by the laws of physics? Ya, mon, tell me more.
Sounds about right. That's what you get for not reading the fucking manual.
If the Beast can do it, I can do it as well! I've signed up for the Militia. I'm doing my part!
Context: BanterDef IlleMorat_VillagerMale_10_Loyalty Text  Starship Troopers reference >> +1 Militia

Text: +1 Militia in Belle Eau

<mechanical-f>
Who knows what this mechanical monstrosity does.
I've spent enough time in jacuzzis to know one when I see one. Good thing I packed my bikini!
I hope this is a water filtration system. I'm getting tired of dumping tablets into my canteen!
What interesting moonshine still!

<mechanical-s>
This wonder of engineering turns out to be a Jacuzzi AND an oversized moonshine still at the same time!
This is a crazy idea, mon. I love it!
This is some nice work. I bet a lot of magic happens here.
This is genius, Woodruff. I think I'm looking at the perfect place to treat my leg pain.
You like it? You should have seen my Autofisher that was also designed to rewind cassette tapes! But... Erm, the Legion broke it while trying to use it to pull their sunken boat out of the river.

<health-f>
There is certainly something valuable deep in the waterlogged cellar, but who can hold their breath long enough to reach it?
The trap door leads to the waterlogged cellar of the sunken mansion.
Who knows what otherworldly horrors slumber deep beneath the murky waters.
Context: BanterDef IlleMoratInt_ TrapDoor_noIntel Text  TrapDoor_noIntel Lovecraft reference

Text:
<health-s>
Hazardous junk clogs the watery depth, but like a pearl in an oyster, an open safe holds glittering diamonds.
A slimy monster tried to wrap its testicles around me! Let's get out of here! Now!
A loose rope got wrapped around my ankle. For a moment, I thought I wouldn't make it back to the surface.
There is commendation for escaping watery death trap, yes?
Task is finish. Breath is also finish.
That was some Houdini shit I just pulled, right there.
Perfect hiding spot. Dangerous, but perfect.
Again we see that there is nothing that can't be accomplished with the power of positive thinking!

<wisdom-f>
The drawing board is full of schematics and formulas hastily scribbled all over each other. Only an expert could decipher any meaning here.

<wisdom-s>
The drawing board is a jumble of schematics and formulas. When carefully sorted out, they display evidence of genius-level engineering skills.
Whoa, mon! This one looks like a car with fangs!
This one here looks like a safe-cracker that can also make bread. Um, the kind you eat, I mean.
I have a confession to make, and I hate making those, but I think I am in love with whoever made these plans.
There is a horrible effigy on the hill overlooking the village.
Bathed in light, the effigy throws its ominous shadow on the canvas of the sky.

<mechanical-f>
There is a powerful projector on top of the pylon, but there is no power switch in sight.
There doesn't seem to be any point in turning the light on in daylight.

<mechanical-s>
There is a powerful projector on top of the pylon and a cable connects it to the grid. There is no switch, but snapping the cables together is an easy job.
Whoa, mon, look at the sky!
The deathly figure has painted its shadow on the pale sky.
Man, that's awesome! They have their own bat-signal here, but with horns! That's cool, man!
Hey, man, is that... Is that something like a bat-signal, but with horns? I thought I was clean, but I think I might be hallucinating again.
Well, now we got some David Copperfield shit goin' on.
Oh, I've seen this in a movie! That signal brings a vigilante who beats up all the criminals... Excuse me. I suddenly remembered I need to be somewhere else.
Snapping the cables together powers up the projector and lights up the effigy.
This lonely grave is overgrown with bushes and weeds.
They told me that Mom wanted to see me, but... I came back home too late.
Context: BanterDef IlleMoratOutskirts_02_FrancisInitial Text  gloomy villager near a house with a skeleton and a portrait on the bed >> GraveGiven

Text: She left a note saying that she wanted to be buried with dad, but I can't find his grave at all.
Context: BanterDef IlleMoratOutskirts_02_FrancisInitial Text  gloomy villager near a house with a skeleton and a portrait on the bed >> GraveGiven

Text: I know his final resting place is somewhere in this forest, in view of the river.
Context: BanterDef IlleMoratOutskirts_02_FrancisInitial Text  gloomy villager near a house with a skeleton and a portrait on the bed >> GraveGiven

Text: The grave of Francis's father is overgrown with bushes and weeds.
THAT is where his grave is?
Context: BanterDef IlleMoratOutskirts_04_FrancisGraveFound Text  grave found and interacted with >> gain Loyalty

Text: I guess it is for the best. The Beast and the spirits of the forest will guard it, so he can rest in peace.
Context: BanterDef IlleMoratOutskirts_04_FrancisGraveFound Text  grave found and interacted with >> gain Loyalty

Text: "Death did not do them part, because they wished to be together."
I guess I will sleep outside for now.
You want fight? Talk to Bounce. I do not fight noobs.
Nice of you to stop by, cuz. I shut down the Night Club. I got me some bigger responsibilities now.
Now's the time, cuz. I'm packin' steel and trippin' on Diesel. Let's show those fools at the mine who's boss.
Oh, man... I can feel the Diesel laying down a dope ass beat in my veins. Let's get this party started.
Chill, cuz. It'll be good for both of us.
I said this club is members only. Get lost.
Are you deaf? Take a hike if you don't want some trouble.
I ain't never hiked a day in my life, but I sure don't mind getting into a little trouble now and then.
Most disappointing. Agent has once again forgotten to call ahead and put my name on VIP list.
It's cool. This place is dead anyway.
Go on inside. Remember: The first rule of Night Club is you do not talk about Night Club.
Forgive me for saying so, but that does not seem to be a rule that is strictly enforced.
Huh. I guess everyone in town must be referring to some OTHER Night Club then.
You might want to revise that rule, mate. I think the cat's out of the bag.
The fights are bare knuckle. No weapons allowed. No funny business.
You wanna mingle with the girls, that's just fine. You wanna fight? Just pick an opponent, but you should check in with Bounce first.
We got ourselves a new champion! I saw some nice moves in there.
You're alright. A friend of Bounce is a friend of mine.
This club is for members only. If you know, you know.
Got a token? All right then... Welcome to Night Club.
I am a virgin. I'm just not very good at it.
Howdy there, cowboy. Looking to have a ride tonight?
Uh... sorry, little lady. I ride with my posse tonight.
Hey, cutie. Bounce said you are new in town and maybe need a proper welcome.
How about YOU bounce, sister? Innuendo is MY game.
That sounds very nice! I would love to see your home and be formally introduced to your mother.
I don't suppose this "welcome" you have in mind comes with a complimentary raincoat?
Hey, it's the new Night Club champion. Want to go a few rounds with me in my room?
You are the one who crushed The Bonecrusher. Will you show me some of your moves in bed?
Looking for a shoulder to cry on? Or maybe something... a little lower?
My name's Horny. What's yours?
Magic, baby.
What a coincidence! That's my name, too!
Hello gorgeous. Find us some Diesel and we can go someplace quiet and have fun.
Want to write a story with a happy ending on me?
Terribly sorry, but... I think my pen just exploded.
I like a girl who's not afraid of getting a little ink on her skin.
Come my friend, come. What's your poison? Mole will get it for you. Feel free to check out my stand.
Stolen Diesel? Yes, I may have heard something. But this information is expensive, my friend.
You will find a pile of old tires next to that half-sunken boat in the docks. Put $5000 inside the tires and Mole will tell you everything you need to know about the Diesel.
Yep. Nothing shady about that at all.
You want me to put a phat stack of dough in some old tire? You straight trippin'.
If I put money down a hole in a tire, information better be coming out of that hole in your face!
You heard the deal, no? $5000 in the tires and then I will give you information about the Diesel.
Pleasure doing business with you, my friend. Go west until you find an abandoned gas station. Travis lives there. Talk to him, he knows about the Diesel.
That's all I can tell you for $5000. If you want to know more, Travis is your man.
Be strange but don't be a stranger. If your throat is too dry, your nose is too clean, or your wife is too tall, better call Mole.
Business is a little slow, now that Bounce is the new boss. But such is life, my friend. Things change, but the Mole survives.
Well, If it isn't our new mine owners! Don't forget that diamonds are the mole's best friend.
I heard you can get into Night Club. You should not trust Bounce. Anything he offers, I can find it for you for half the price.
I'd stay away from Diesel, if I were you. It turns your brain into muck! I will never sell that shit again. Too many dead customers.
Psst. You need to take the edge off? Relieve some stress? I've got everything you need. For the right price, of course.
Not listening. Not listening. Not listening.
Yeah, man, that sounds niiiiice. I'll take one of everything.
I do not need to relieve stress, I lift. Show me your vitamins.
If you happen to have an all-natural, organic enema kit, I might be interested.
Don't you try doing something funny, you hear?
Well, shoot. I had this whole stand-up routine I was working on.
I never do anything funny.
If you need something go and talk to Bounce
If you came to buy Diesel, we're not selling it anymore.
Hey! How did you get inside?
In this corner... Weighing in at 194 pounds. You know him. You love him... The Bonecrusher!
And in the other corner... A new face straight from the Association of International Mercenaries... Player One!
I want a clean fight. No fucking around. Let's get ready to rumblllllllle!
In this corner... Weighing in at 173 pounds. Only the very best... Dr. Fracture!
In this corner... Weighing in at 162 pounds. Don't you underestimate the power of his dark side... Bulldozer!
In this corner... Weighing in at 166 pounds. He is raw. He is crazy. He is... Eraser Head!
In this corner... Weighing in at 132 pounds. He's the devil waiting outside your door... Sebastocrator!
Go ahead and take the mine. I have more important things to attend to.
No funny business. We are watching you.
Siegfried said we shouldn't attack you. Unless you step off limits. So you'd better watch your step.
I would not stay too long in Landsbach if I were you.
I don't like you, mercenaries. It's only a matter of time until I get to do something about it.
Why wait? If it's Blood you want, Blood is here.
Trust me when I tell you, that's nothing we haven't heard before.
Well, don't rush yourself on our account, Woodcock.
What are you looking at?
Did the Mole send you? You bring something for me? My stash is almost empty, man.
Bummer, man... Like, how almost is almost?
And you haven't knocked over a drug store yet? Oh man, you got better restraint than I ever had.
Woah, man. You won't believe the thing I saw. There was a van came screaming by, chased by this huge monster truck with speakers all over it, and... electric guitars... and maybe bassoons?
I think they headed west, but I was high as a kite at the time, so they could've gone straight up in the air... Nah, I would've remembered that... I think.
I tried Diesel once. Best trip of my life. But the after effects are harsh, man. Couldn't stand up for three days.
This is a busy road, you know. Vans with big canisters on the roof pass by all the time, coming from Landsbach and going god know's where.
Sometimes I like to go to the desert and try to fall asleep while I'm walking... A friend told me that was daydreaming. Or was it lucid dreaming?
It's called somnambulism - sleepwalking. Judging by your condition, you might actually be doing it right now.
It's called a Vision Quest, and there are much more holistic ways of doing it than perhaps the methods you are using.
It is helpful to have an unclouded mind to achieve lucidity. Your mind seems... foggy.
I can still hear that monster hi-fi truck... Life's one big race, man... Set the controls for the heart of the sun. Ride the highway west, baby. Ride the snake.
Diesel will be the next big hit, man. Forget about anything you've tried. I've only tasted it once... but, oh boy. I'm not the same man anymore.
I think those guys with the monster truck are with the Legion. They have a camp nearby, with rally cars or nascars or bumper cars... I don't know cars, man. I travel with my mind.
Please let it be bumper cars. I can't imagine anything that would make me laugh harder.
If this country has Monster Truck competitions, I take back anything negative I ever said about it.
If you be lying about a camp full of cars nearby, you gonna wish drugs be the only thing wrong with your head.
I use this place as a shelter, but it's not safe at night. Those Legion soldiers like to come here and play cards. They used to sell me drugs, but now they just tell me to get lost.
Hush man... Those Legion soldiers will hear us. I used to buy drugs from them, but a couple days ago they told me to get lost or they'd kick the crap out of me.
What's up? I'm Travis. Easy with those guns, okay? I'm just a hippie pacifist, y'know? I like to pass my idle days with my idle ways.
Stay away. Don't touch me. I'm not one of Bounce's girls.
They killed my husband in the Night Club. Now I'm alone with my child. Not too many options left for putting food on the table.
I've heard Siegfried gets up to all kinds of weird activities in his big, fancy house.
My man Louis is up to something. He goes to the warehouse, but only at night! I've heard loose women hang around there.
I'm not going near that Mole... He said he wants me to become one of his... girls for sale.
I see the lights... The lights are talking to me...
They say such yellow things, right!? Don't believe all of it.
Don't go into the light. Don't go into the light!
I don't approve of what you did in Landsbach, but at least you rid us of that horrible Night Club.
Ok, you killed one Landsbach crime lord. You happy? There are hundreds waiting in line to take his place.
That's what we like to call job security.
Then I will crush hundreds more! Do you think I am afraid of reps?!
That's the reason we're mercenaries, love. Getting rid of crime lords is a growth industry.
The only kind of super-soldier I see around here is you! How do you do it?
Hey, I can do this all day!
Five-hour workouts, vitamin supplements, and an all-protein diet.
A never-ceasing commitment to excellence and exemplary personal hygiene.
Someone is secretly spreading this poison called Diesel. My husband got some for his leg pain, but now there is no more and his legs have stopped working.
I'm sick of this place. I really want to join the Night Club, but they won't let me in.
I'm not touching Diesel. I heard that your flesh starts falling apart if you stop taking it.
You'd better watch your mouth around here. Siegfried has eyes and ears everywhere.
I used to repair cars, but now I work in the mine and collect some bets in the Night Club. You've gotta make a living, right?
If you be honest about repairing cars, I got another kind of living you might be interested in, mon. You willing to relocate?
You won't find judgement from me. I once pretended to be a bookie for a sporting event that did not even exist.
Hey, you make ends meet any way you can. And when they don't, you just go ahead and force 'em.
You looking for some fun? Go and talk to Mole, he's your man.
Don't trust the Mole. I can't believe the shit he sold me... He'll never see even a single Grand Chien Frank from me again!
This rotten place. I hate it here... But I don't have anywhere else to go.
There is always place to go. You join French Foreign Legion. They teach you.
How do you feel about killing? For those who kill, there are always... opportunities.
A.I.M. is always looking for new recruits. Keep it in mind.
Hey. You heard about that Diesel shit? That's the stuff, man. It will take you far... far from this forsaken land.
Thank you for getting rid of that crazy old Nazi. Now we can start living a normal life. Anyway, gotta go. My shift in the mine starts soon.
There's been no more Night Club since you came to town. What are we going to do for fun now?
Nice moves! I bet on The Bonecrusher and lost all my money, but I figure it was money well-spent on a fight worth watching.
What do you think about Bulldozer? I'm thinking of putting some cash on him tonight.
I haven't seen you in Night Club.... Oops, I forgot. I'm not supposed to talk about Night Club.
I don't fight, man. I only come to gamble here. If you want to pick an opponent, they are right there in the back.
This place is the only good thing about Landsbach.
Hey there, Mr. Prizefighter. That was quite the match against The Bonecrusher.
Damn it... I've lost all my cash. My wife will kill me.
Man, I can't buy Diesel anywhere. I heard Siegfried buys tons of it, but why doesn't he sell it here?
Hey... Have you tried Diesel? That thing is the bomb!
Dunnae tell me what a bomb is, ya wanker!
Oh, yeah, man... I want the bomb!
Oh, man... This is not a good place for me to be.
Psst... do you have Diesel? Putain... I need to find some. It helps me survive in this hell hole.
You do not want Diesel. You want to go home and think about your life choices.
You disgust me.
Excusez-moi... Do you have spare change?
Bounce's girls are the best, aren't they? But stay away from Mole's filthy hoes. You will catch something nasty.
If you wanna buy something... more exciting, you'd better go talk to the Mole.
Did you hear what they say about Siegfried? He's a god. He's a man. He's a ghost. He's a guru... What's the deal with that guy?
I want to live a normal life. That's why I came to Landsbach. I intend to make my fortune here. Vive la Landsbach!
I want to enter the Night Club. But they don't let us in... Special members only.
This place reminds me of that one weekend I spent in Paris. Paris, Texas that is.
I wonder if vending machine still works.
Oh, could be some old car parts around here, mon.
It's a pleasant change of pace to see a proper manor house after all the squalor we've seen, eh what?
This is a colonizer house, built with the blood and sweat of people who had their land stolen from them. Makes me sick to look at it.
I wonder if this place has a hot tub? I would very much like to soak mein feet for a bit.
This takes me back to the secret cock fights of my youth. We never had any cocks, mind ye, so we just used our own.
Hey, these guys aren't kidding. I can't wait do some sparring in the ring.
Gorgeous ladies, dim lighting, and a lot of people willing to bet all their cash. This is my kind of place.
I was stuntman in Bloodsport. This is more or less same. Only, more blood.
One of those fighters has clearly suffered a severe rib fracture, but I don't see any medical staff anywhere... I think this place might be dangerous.
Typical biker bar, only less leather.
There's something strange about these soldiers. The unnatural size of their muscles and popped-out veins suggest they've been using some kind of anabols.
I sense the presence of unnatural stimulants in the bodies of these soldiers.
These guards are definitely not using all-natural ingredients in their diets. I can see the taint of synthetic chemicals on their auras.
Severe acne, popped-out veins... These soldiers have been taking something.
I like a guy who takes care of his body, but these soldiers all have muscles that bulge like hard plastic. I prefer a natural bulge.
I know junkies when I see them. These guards have zero body fat and their pupils are dilated so wide their eyes are black. They're going steady with Dexie, man.
Look at how well-pumped all these soldiers are. They must all belong to the same gym, or maybe they take the same... steroid.
Look at these punks, Woodrow. Back in my day, if you wanted to look tough, the LAST thing you would do is dress up like a dang Christmas tree!
The soil here is soaked with fuel and blood. Must have been some kind of satanic scuzzwad cult.
This baby looks like it's been pulled straight out of a monster truck show... Can we keep it?

<wisdom-f>
There seems to be some fuel in this tank.
The fluid leaking from this fuel tank looks suspiciously similar to Diesel.
I know this model. The first ones would burst into flames if the gas tank was ruptured. They fixed that in later models.
And I looked, and behold a wrecked car: and his name that sat in it was Death, and Hell followed with him.
I suppose it's too much to hope that's some kind of Halloween decoration they forgot to take down.
The chair sits uncomfortably empty, as if its former occupant has just evaporated into thin air.
The old codger ran away. I guess he must have had his reasons, just like I did with my fifth wife.
Well, well... the old man had a trick up his sleeve, did he? I shall have to keep an eye - and a scope - out for him.
I can still sense his aura. We leave a tiny part of ourselves on everything we touch, especially the places where we sit.
How did he leave without his chair? A man in his condition isn't ambulatory... Unless...
Is it all right if I claim the chair? My babusya would love it!
This must be Siegfried's stolen Diesel.
The door seems to be locked.
Stay away from that door. This is your last warning.

<wisdom-f>
People usually store water in this type of tank. It's probably for the miners.

<wisdom-s>
A strange, faint chemical smell indicates the liquid stored in this tank is neither water nor fuel. Huge tubes snake away from it and disappear into the ground.
Look at these tubes. They are descending down even into the ground. Something is not of correctness here.
This is obviously no water tank. It's probably connected to a pump somewhere underground.
That ain't no water tank, Woody. Those tubes must lead to some place nearby, but I'll be dipped if I know where.
There seems to be a hole in the wall that is poorly hidden behind some empty crates.
The battle between security and convenience is forever the yin and yang of the human condition.
Oh. Someone used the old "blast through wall" entrance method. Fidel's favorite.
That's the laziest wall repair job I've ever seen.
Boss said they're cutting our Diesel with something else, making it into something better. We gotta find out how.
Swap the fight pit for a stage full of jazz musicians and the Nightclub could be something real nice.
Context: BanterDef Landsbach_MagicNails Text  "Nightclub" is the name of the night club

Text: I think it's perfect the way it is. Just needs a couple garage door entrances.
Garage doors? What for? Let in more flies?
So people can bring their bikes in! I always wanted a night club where I could sit on my bike, drink beers, and watch a couple of drunk assholes beat the shit out of each other.
Well spent cash, my friend. If you want to buy some more, come again tomorrow. I am always digging up new inventory!
Not enough money.
$5000 thrown into the hole.

<wisdom-f>
The pages are filled with hastily scrawled notes in German.
Damn it all to hell, I know my accent sounds German, but that doesn't mean I can read it!
That's even worse handwriting than I've seen on most prescriptions.
Beats me, chief. My German is worse than my French, and I don't know any French.
Stay away from my desk! You have no business there.
<wisdom-s>
Ah. This is my mother tongue.
While I don't agree with most of what's written here, I understand it completely.
This is German. And, of course, I can read German - as any properly educated person should.
Written in German, these are clearly Siegfried's notes. They make several references to Human Growth Hormone research.

<mechanical-f>
Turning all the knobs results in an even stronger wave of static and nothingness.
Yep. Nothing a good whack couldn't fix.
Work, damn you!
There we go, mon. Just needed a bit of convincing.
After a bit of tuning, a voice bursts out of the static. "...We're running out of Diesel for the new mixture. If he wants his batch ready for next week, he needs to get more down here ASAP..."
This van has spilled a puddle of dark, greasy liquid onto the ground. It is not clear what it is, but it does not seem to be motor oil.
This van has spilled a puddle of dark, greasy liquid onto the ground. It is not clear what it is, but it does not seem to be motor oil.
That's the Diesel, man! The Legion killed the driver, took the canisters, and went after the other van. It's weird... I thought those Legion guys were the ones producing it.

<mechanical-f>
Unfortunately, access to this terminal is password-protected.
After bypassing the password, a peculiar folder named Hormone Levels stands out. There is a list of names and numbers inside. One of the names is The Bonecrusher.
Swordfish. The password is always Swordfish... or Swordfish69.
A computer is like a wizard. Once you know their true name, they are powerless before you.
Magic has the keys to all the locks, even the digital ones.
This has to be the place Mole described. He wants $5000 placed inside the tires.
This vendor's table displays meds for sale
Now we're talking. Say hello to Dr. Feelgood. This place isn't so bad after all.
Not looking. Not looking. Not looking.
Well, these certainly look to have their seals intact... but the brand names have been scratched off the labels.
Well, it's not the shopping trip I wanted, but I suppose it's the one I deserve.
There's nothing money can't buy. And there's nothing the Mole can't sell.
Attention, soldiers! This is President LaFontaine. I am being kept in the Major's tent on the top of the...

A rather extreme metaphor for colonialism.
I'm no art critic, but this seems bloody tasteless.
It's wonderful to find self-expression through art, except in this case.
This is a huge pile of Grand Chien currency, worth only a bit more than the paper it is printed on.
We could use this to stuff pillow cases or maybe make fun party hats.
This a lot more than just fistful of dollars!

<wisdom-s>
There is radar footage in video files carefully hidden in a folder with adult content and pirated movies.
This operating system is from the Stone Age! Okay, let me see. My computer, View, Folder Options, View, Hidden Files, Show all files. See? The radar input is right here in the "Private" folder.
I hide files in same place on home computer. Errr... same directory, not same folder with such other unmentionable things.
I feel like I should be wearing gloves sorting through these files.
I wish it didn't have to be this way, old buddy, but I can't see that you left me much choice.
Da. In acceptance speech for meritorious medal of brave valor, I will say you died like soldier.
Final death scene, partner. Adios.
I took an oath not to do any harm, but I guess in your case I can make an exception.
I suppose this is the last favor I can do for you, old friend.
Dismissed, soldier.
Keep going, soldiers! Don't worry about me, I'll take cover. Fight on, you're doing great!
Thank you, soldiers. That was an amazing display of tactical skill and courage.
Would you like a cup of tea?

Throw in a biscuit or two and I'm happy as a clam.
We ain't got no diamond! And even if we had one, I'd never give it to them!

Text: I bet me old pa buried them stupid diamonds in the middle of somewhere. Stupid pa.

Text: I wish I had a diamond too. My old pa had some diamonds and money, and he just buried them somewhere, and then went and died!
Mario! That is not a nice thing to say about your dear old father. After all, he left you this farm.
But HIS farm was so much better! And he gave it to stupid Mr. Gattz and then he died! No farm, no diamonds, no nothing.
No money, no diamonds, no nothing.
You didn't have to shoot those useless goons. They are no match for a skilled hunter like me.
The Adjani is teeming with "hunters" who are skilled at bragging.
Hunting goons is not like hunting foxes. Foxes do not have grenades and automatic weapons.
Good to know. If we meet any more goons, we'll send them your way.
Did my useless brother send you to search for pa's money? Tell him not to bother. It takes a real tracker to track down buried treasure!
Let me see your profile...  Oui, just as I thought. Your head would look better with a pair of horns nailed to it.
Why? I do not think treasure leaves footprints.
If I ever catch you digging around the trees on my property, the hunting season will be open for you! It is MY treasure to find.
I like to hunt les braconniers. For me, it is always open season.
Trust me, you won't even notice us.
If I ever catch you digging under the rocks on my property, the hunting season will be open for you! It is MY treasure to find.
I like to hunt les braconniers. For me, it is always open season.
I find your death threats... amusing.
There is a Beast that terrorizes these woods, but I have almost tracked it down already!
To say "almost tracked" is the same as saying you have done nothing at all.
Splendid! Well, don't let us keep you. Release the hounds, eh what?
Farming is useless. I have a Beast to track and a treasure to find!
Better stick to farming, mon ami.
We'll take care of that treasure for you. You go ahead and hunt that Beast.
We will protect your homestead for you! Ride, partner!
I can't rest while innocent, frail old ladies like the one next door are depending on me to catch the Beast!
You are being a good Christian, protecting old ladies in the neighborly way.
Welcome to my home. Do try to respect my property while you are here.
Do you like my house? You can enjoy the view from outside.
I do hope you are not trying to steal from me. I detest thieves.
Ugh, I know exactly what you mean. They are the worst! Um, I do not suppose I could use your bathroom?
I do not allow people to wear boots in my house. Therefore, you should keep yours on.
Why did you have to mention taking my boots off? Now my feet are itchy.
Didn't want to see your nasty-ass crib anyway. Probably smells like dead cats.
This is my house. I have inherited it. I have a document to prove that.
I got a document that says I can visit my kids any time I want, but that doesn't make it true.
You were not by any chance sent by those filthy Baggzes, were you? You better not be.
What are you doing on my property?!
Shoo, shoo! Get off my property, all of you!
You can be quiet or you can be dead. Choice is yours.
My treacherous son sent you to dig for my late husband's money, hasn't he?! It's not here, not here!
Context: BanterDef XwhereMaBaggz03_GiveX Text  angry >> Give MiddleOfXWhere

Text: If the money was here, I would have found it! Now piss off! Away from my property! Shoo! Shoo!
What do you figure the odds are on that old lady having a shotgun close by, Scooter?
That stupid husband of mine was always burying stuff in the corn... But which house, which house?!

Text: Perhaps it is time we reap some corn.
Ah! Are you still here?! Shoo! SHOO!

Text: I wish I could grow corn myself. Stupid corn.

Text: Welcome, welcome! I love guests.
I get the feeling this is the kind of place where guests can check out but never leave.
Ah! How kind. No offense to your countrymen, but that is the warmest welcome we've ever received... without having to pay for it, of course.
He's happy to see us, chief. That either means he wants to kill us or have us kill someone else.
I hope you will survive for a while! I mean, stay for a while. I would love some company!
Yes! Fidel show you his collection of body parts!
Not one moment longer than we have to, is what I'm hoping.
Don't get many visitors, huh? Hard to imagine why.
We have so much to talk about! And don't you worry - if you stop responding for a while, I will bury you properly with all the others.
You are so nice to Fidel!
I'm just going to go ahead and pretend I didn't hear that.
All the others?... I just remembered that I have a shipment of antibiotics I need to pick up from somewhere very far away from here.
How's my nephew Mario? Still searching for buried money? No use, no use. If it's anywhere, it'll be right here in the Middle of Everywhere - and I'll never let him on my property!
I don't remember where I set some of the older traps. Don't you poke around just yet, I would appreciate your company for a while!
Fidel will clean old traps for you. No charge. I just keep any body parts I find.
People come and people go, and then they start decomposing. I'm lonely.
This is life of Fidel. When bodies begin to rot, they are no fun anymore.
I'd recommend that you get some counseling... but then I'd feel real guilty about what would happen to the counselor.
My brother told me the money is buried somewhere near water, yes. But there is water everywhere around here! Sometimes there is even water on my sofa when I get too excited, hehe.
Ew... I didn't need to know that.
Fidel would like to know more about this.
Same thing used to happen to me, man. It wasn't from being excited - I was just really, really drunk.
How am I supposed to dig under a rock in the swamp?! It fills with water all the time. My brother must have been crazy to hide it there.
True. In swamp, only hide bodies. And mines.
A brother of yours was crazy? That's so hard to believe.
Man, you sure about this? That old asshole could have buried the treasure fucking anywhere.
Not just anywhere, it's on one of those Middle of Shit-where farms.
Yeah, but there are five of them! And where exactly are we supposed to dig?
We will ask his relatives very nicely.
The last time you "very nicely" asked someone where they hid their money, we never found anything and I was picking pieces of brain out of my hair for two days!
Okay, okay, next time I'll shoot them AFTER they tell us.

Context: BanterDef NowhereCourage01_BeforeAttackApproach Text  (whimper) Initial approach of Courage
BanterDef NowhereCourage01_TriggerWalk Text  (whimper) Initial approach of Courage

Text: A big shiny diamond gleams as it is removed from the odoriferous pile. Those marauders were right - their jewel was stolen... by a canine!
The things I do for diamonds.
They may call me Magic, but that's one trick I ain't ever pulled. Respect, Dog.
Ew. Ew, ew, ew.
A grenade shredded the car's fuel lines as well as the marauders within. The resulting fire turned it into a wreck, but there are still some parts that can be salvaged.
Car broke, salvage yes?
Some good salvage here. Just have to scrape off the bits of melted marauders.
This car be totaled, but some bits and pieces still in good shape.
Courage doesn't seem interested. Perhaps this isn't the right spot.
Come here, you pesky little doggy.
Come on, man! You can do it! You want me to show you how?
I do not mean to complain, but I have to admit that this is not quite what I expected the life of a mercenary to be like.
Stupid beast! Come make your excrements already.
Tell me again, why exactly are we doing this?
Perhaps the adorable little creature requires a laxative?
Courage looks excited. This must be the right spot!
Good boy! Who's a good boy?
We're in position! Let's get ready for an... um... extraction.
Well come on, little boy, don't be shy.
This looks like a good spot. Drop that deuce and let's get out of here.
Hey, gimme that diamond! The hyena is ours, so the diamond is ours!

Text: Blah, blah, blah. Stupid mercs.
