Text: It was only one grenade! And Courage fetched it and brought it back to them.
Context: BanterDef NowhereTiggered01_InitialApproach Text  approach >> start attack countdown

Text: Stupid hyena! Now more of them will be comin' because of him!
Context: BanterDef NowhereTiggered01_InitialApproach Text  approach >> start attack countdown

Text: Maybe they won't.
Context: BanterDef NowhereTiggered01_InitialApproach Text  approach >> start attack countdown

Text: Blah, blah, blah! They called on the phone and said our house will burn tonight unless we give them their diamond! And I ain't got no diamond!
Context: BanterDef NowhereTiggered01_InitialApproach Text  approach >> start attack countdown

Text: There is nothing to worry about. Nothing at all!
Sounds to me like you got trouble coming for dinner.
Oh my, that was horrible! Time for a lovely cup of tea.
What's up with you, Courage? Constipated again?
Oh my... Can you please lead Courage to his favorite number two spot? You must search around for it - he changes it every day! In the meantime, I'll make some tea.
Tea! Brilliant!
Tea sounds like a capital idea!
Hold up. Did you just ask us to walk your dog?
Ahahahaheee!...
Context: BanterDef NowhereTiggered04_DogPile Text  after DogPile set piece

Text: Mais, qu'est-ce que 'est ca?
That is the worst case of diamond-induced constipation I have ever seen.
I wish you hadn't done that.
Context: BanterDef XwhereGattz_Attacked Text  attacked Gattz before finding the treasure

Text: Exhaustion makes it impossible to dig right now.
There is a strongbox buried at this spot.
So there it was after all? And nice digging, too. It would be a terrible waste not to fill that hole with something.
Context: BanterDef Xwhere_RightSpot Text  Gattz attacks after finding the treasure

Text: After long and exhausting digging nothing is found.
What are you hoping to find on MY property?
I didn't request any landscaping, thank you very much!
Yes, I checked there as well.
How are you doing? Busy with diamonds and guns, I suppose. For me, it feels like I am living a whole new life.
Le Lys Rouge is a wonderful place. Never felt as relaxed in my life.
Aye. Plenty of relaxation to be had in a place like this!
Looks like retirement suits you just fine, mate!
That's it. I know what I'm doing when I retire.
Liliane knitted me a sweater herself! It's a bit saggy and the sleeves are too tight so I can't wear it, but all things considered, it is a very nice sweater.
Nice to see another happy couple.
That is so sweet!
This is too wholesome. I need to shoot something.
Look, I've taught the girls something! Girls?
Vive la rvolution!
Hihi! Vive la rvolution!
Aren't they adorable?
You got yourself one hell of a cute politburo there, that's for sure.
I was in mood for sexy time, but not any more.
Ach! Aren't these poor girls already corrupted enough?
My Maquis keep visiting every day. Not sure if it's because of me, or the girls.
Of course it is because of you, my lion! And you know, one of them keeps calling me "Momma"... Always melts my heart.
Now that I'm sober, I'm picking up on so much more innuendo.
The only antidote to mental suffering is physical pain. The only antidote to physical pain is our finest Grogue selection.
Welcome to the Red Dragon, where history repeats itself. Every day from 18:30 to 19:30 you can get three beers for the price of two.
Have a glass of absinthe. That's the true absence of opposition to socialism.
Absinthe causes the absence of a lot of things. Mainly, clothing.
I remember my first time with absinthe... errr... No. No, I don't.
Make mine a double! Gooooo communism!
Nothing can have value without being an object of utility. Feel free to check my heavily utilized menu of exotic drinks.
So you talked with that traitor Serge? I'd never let him drink unless he pays off his debt and quits with his lies.
I guess I can let him in if he gives me back my watch. Yesterday it was on me, today it's gone. The bastard must have taken it.
I was here the whole day. Serving drinks to my red comrades and occasionally restocking supplies from the backyard.
My father's golden watch! Thanks, man. You don't know where this baby has been. WW1 survivor right here.
Really? I guess it's seen a lot of nasty shit.
You should make sure you put it someplace secure and out of sight.
Sounds valuable. You should put it somewhere safe and temperature-controlled.
Boss Blaubert was the love of my life! And I used to live in a mansion! Look at me now...
I'm lookin'.
Boss Blaubert was kind and gentle, and rich! He was in love with me and you killed him! I'm still mad at you.
He was a pig! You deserve better than him.
I guess some princesses are better off not saving.
Yeah, our fault there. We should have waited until you got him to sign a pre-nup.
I'm not talking to you, ever! Is Smiley alright?
Pffft. Handsy and obnoxious, but yes, he's still alive.
The lad's heart is in tatters, thanks to you. But he's still just a bairn. He'll get over it.
The poor boy's heart is broken, but I suppose he'll live.
Have any spare change for a poor soul like me? Ah, forget it... it won't be much of a help, anyways.
Well, if it isn't my favorite gang of mercs. You wanna play a drinking game with old Serge? Come on, it will be fun.
Nope. No way. I start playing those games and I begin intentionally losing.
Russian Roulette. You win, everyone drinks. You lose, everyone drinks but you.
Sure! Can my invisible friend play, too? Just put his drink right next to mine.
Drinking games are daft. Drink if you want to drink. Want to play a game? Go home and play with yourself.
Hey. Couldn't help but notice you snooping around that commie scum Chimurenga. I'll tell you something that might be of interest to you if you help me out.
That old bastard Heinrich won't let me in the bar no more, just because I told him he was as communist as a piggy bank. I was a bit drunk. But frankly, that's what he is.
I tried to apologize but he won't listen. Please, if you can get him to calm down, I promise I'll make it worth your while.
That's what you are, Heinrich. One inflatable capitalist pig. Greeting your new customers with your left hand. Taking their money with your right one.
That was... unexpectedly poetic.
I'm thinking you were never in the service industry, am I right?
Perhaps you are not so very different.
Heinrich told you I stole his watch, didn't he? Ha! I might be broke but I have my honor, unlike that German crook. I'm sure it just fell off his wrist somewhere.
Hey, my saviors. Now, you didn't hear this from me, but Maman, the owner of the brothel, has a soft spot for Chimurenga. I'm sure that might prove useful.
Hey, my saviors. I wanted to tell you something about Chimurenga. But I'd never speak ill of the dead. No matter how lefty they are.
Alright. Bottoms up. On three. Un, deux, trois...
Sant!
To our health!
Is it three already?!
Welcome to the best clinic in the region! The "Vulture of Hope" is here for you!
I shudder with enthusiasm.
It's just... I mean... The phrasing. Maybe you can... You know what? Forget it.
That was name of movie I was almost in! Did not take part. Too many feathers. Allergies.
Sorry, but the clinic can't provide medical help while there are ongoing combat activities in the area... Somebody might get hurt! The Donation Board would never approve of such risk.
Um, isn't that the point of a clinic's existence?! I mean, to provide medical help when most needed...
Oh, sweetie, someone has got to teach you how to use your hands when they're most needed.
Useless. You fail to truly understand your purpose.
Welcome to El Quinto Posado Gemelo! The "Fifth Twin Inn" for you gringos!
Context: BanterDef Pantagruel_Manny_01 Text  Latino/Mexican accent (from Arulco); phrase is meaning "the Fifth Twin" in Spanish

Text: Here at the "Fifth Twin Inn" we slash booze in half! We got white booze, black booze, Spanish booze, yellow booze. We got hot booze, cold booze, smelly booze...
Context: BanterDef Pantagruel_Manny_02 Text  Latino/Mexican accent (from Arulco); reference to "From Dusk till Down" movie

Text: One Bloody Mary please.
If we buy one bottle of booze at the regular price, do we get another booze for a penny?
The "Fifth Twin Inn" is where Grand Chien meets Arulco! The best bar of two countries!
Context: BanterDef Pantagruel_Manny_03 Text  Latino/Mexican accent (from Arulco)

Text: I kinda doubt that.
Manny! I see you have your own bar now! How is Charlie? And I hope your brothers are doing well!
I wonder what's up with de guy in Room One. He hasn't come out for three days in a row.
Context: BanterDef Pantagruel_Manny_04 Text  Latino/Mexican accent (from Arulco) Infected not killed yet

Text: Thanks for dealing with that guy! I just opened this place and already someone trashes one of my rooms. These people have no sense!
Context: BanterDef Pantagruel_Manny_05 Text  Latino/Mexican accent (from Arulco) Infected killed

Text: De nada, amigo.
I hope this inn is not built on some ancient pyramid or something. My brothers warned me that can be very bad.
Context: BanterDef Pantagruel_Manny_06 Text  Latino/Mexican accent (from Arulco); reference to "From Dusk till Down" movie

Text: I think things would be better in Grand Chien with the Maquis in charge and it's not just because they told me to say that.
Thanks to you, it is much safer to walk the streets at night! The only danger is if Maman learns I'm working without a license.
Madame Lecoq really was a classy lady! Her diamond necklace was more stylish than anything that slut Maman Liliane ever wore.
Context: BanterDef Pantagruel_VillagerFemale_03 Text  >> lead to the necklace (Twelve Chairs)

Text: I wonder what happened to it... I bet it was stolen by that weasel Lalee from Fleatown.
Context: BanterDef Pantagruel_VillagerFemale_03 Text  >> lead to the necklace (Twelve Chairs)

Text: I'm telling boys they have to sign up for the Militia if they want to impress me.
+2 Militia in Pantagruel Downtown
Oh, see, more of them commandos!
Guess he thinks we're some M.E.R.C. knuckleheads.
Wonder if he's talking about Apscott's group.
I believe this chap thinks we're part of Biff's team.
They got a "mine diggers night" every week at Le Lys Rouge, so... Me and my friends want to work for you. You don't even have to pay us, just keep us fed... and hydrated.
Fosse Noire mine income increased
Have you been to Le Lys Rouge? Most of the girls are nice. Some are not nice, but they smell good.
Have you been to the Red Dragon Maquis? You will go for the drinks but you will stay for the propaganda! Really. You won't have a choice.
Have you seen the Queen of Carnival? I do not know her name, but I know she is one of Maman Liliane's girls.
If you are looking for information, maybe go and check out the Red Dragon bar.
It is excellent idea!
Have I been there? I don't remember... I better go check.
I'm saving up for beauty school.
You can look for free, but trust me - touching is worth the money.
I don't doubt it for a second, darlin'.
You look like one of those people that likes to talk. That costs extra.
Maman Liliane is not so bad. Molly says she's getting a raw deal, but that girl thinks she is better than everyone. Queen of Carnival, my ass.
Make yourself at home, and by that I mean you can take off your pants.
Long as I can keep my jacket on, you got a deal.
So what's your thing? Kentucky Klondike Bar? Panamanian Petting Zoo? Alabama Hot Pocket?
Oh my...
Something tells me those are not appetizers.
You're making those up. She just made those up, right?
I was a mercenary just like you, but then I took an "arrow" you know where.
No, I do not - and please don't show me.
Do you like gladiator movies?
Well, yeah! Wait, why do you ask?
I like to give and I like to receive. Which do you prefer?
Um... Yankee Swap?
What do you want? Maman sent you, didn't she? You won't start a shootout at the market over a fucking whore, will you?

responsible Communist.

The golden throne on which they carried Mollie the Carnival Queen.

Carrying a naked girl on this thing can't be good for her health, eh? I'm just a concerned citizen, mhm.

"The People's Command Post"

Backpack with the M.E.R.C. logo stamped on it

There is a note on the dead body: "My dear Herve, Peter, Alberto and Carlito! I am happy to tell you that here in Grand Chien lady Luck finally smiled at me and I opened my own bar! In your honor, I named it El Quinto Gemelo! Love, Manny
One can tell by the footprints on the dusty roof that someone was hiding behind those barrels. There is a dry flower dropped nearby and all of its petals have been picked.
Awww! Someone's been playing "she loves me, she loves me not."
That creep has been watching the young lady bathe!
Looks like the best place to watch from, he-he.
Ew, creepy.
He saw her bathing on the roof.
Her beauty in the moonlight overthrew him.
The bathtub where Mollie bathed looks in perfect order - no signs of fighting and the towels are diligently put to dry. She wasn't kidnapped from here.
No sign of struggle here.
I've seen this before. I call it "the last bath". She left by choice.
She bathed and cleaned. Too bad. No scent to follow.
There is no sign of struggle in the room. Some of Mollie's garments are missing though - it seems she had the time to sneak in and change before she was "kidnapped".
It was easy to get in here from the bathhouse roof, but I bet this window wasn't forced.
I'm pretty sure she let him in. I can imagine the talk they had here on the window! It looks like Romeo and Juliette, not like a kidnapping scene.
Looks like she went willingly... or maybe at gunpoint.
This was no crime. This was 'girl runs away from sex house'. Don't ask me how I know.
Once, I shot an antelope with horns so big we had to cut them in half to fit in the truck!
And then your mother woke you up for school.
Once, I tried to catch a lion with a bear trap. When I checked, an elephant with HUGE tusks had his trunk caught in it!
It is more likely you caught an elephant beetle sniffing around in your underwear.
Once, I was hunting antelopes when a lion attacked me! I was out of ammo, so I had to crush the skull of the beast with the stock of my shotgun!
You mean, the lion slipped on your shit while chasing you.
We were just about to slaughter those Legion assholes, but then you showed up and played heroes. You stole our kill.
Ha! I was here when the Legion first appeared. I remember a dumb buckhead pissing himself. It was you, wasn't it?
Well... never mind. Let's change the subject.
Ah, the thrill of the hunt - when you finally sneak up on the unsuspecting prey, take aim and end it all with a well-placed shot! Makes you feel alive.
After the first few hundred kills it's just more of the same.
A real man doesn't need to kill helpless critters in order to "feel alive".
This Flay... He is a sneak and a murderer. On top of that, he mutilates corpses and then leaves them to rot! Who even does that?
Someone like yourself.
Sounds like some kind of filthy poacher to me.
Sounds exactly like what a poacher would do.
The Legion! They robbed my shop! They have taken everything, even the silver! They weren't supposed to do that!!!
How could they do that to me?! I even named my shop La Lgion, so that they would not rob it!

If someone named their shop after me, I would NEVER rob it, I swear!
Scoundrel perk activated

It is terrible the lengths some people will go to rob innocent civilians of their hard-earned money. Smart people know how to hide it well. That is why I am sure you have stashed away your most valuable assets where no one can find them, yes?

As gouverneur of the Adjani province, I condemn the illegal activities of the Legion and I will strongly consider any and all punitive measures, up to and including imposing stiff sanctions!

While I do approve of the general idea of saving my good friend Alphonse from his predicament - so much so that I contributed substantial funds to the endeavor - I was never warned that it could lead to unsanctioned military activities in my city!
. Is this coward on our side?

Text: You look like a tough group, but you should have seen our Hue and Lurch back in their headhunter days! No Legion wanker would have dared come within a mile of this place.
I miss the good old days when this bar was a headhunters' den. Hasn't been the same since Ma Baxter died and her son took over.
I wish that Lurch and Headshot Hue were still in business like in the old days. They would find President Alphonse and bring him home in no time!
I just don't believe that "ricochet" story Hue keeps telling. If you ask me, I think he and Lurch shot each other.
Ma Baxter was a glorious woman. I only saw one guy ever give her trouble. Can't recall his face though - not that there was much to recall after she blew his head off with that shotgun of hers.
Sounds like my kind of bartender!
That does not seem glorious to me, that just seems like the way trouble is handled.
Now that is the type of problem solving I can appreciate!
I know that wasn't really Ma Baxter, but part of me still wants to lay face down with my hands behind my head!

You're lucky old Ma Baxter is gone. She would have shot all of you dead if you even thought about hurting her boy... No offense.
A robber walked into the Aye Bar, but no robber never did walk out! hehehe.
The junk must flow.
Yeah, man, let it flow! Let it flow right into me!
Ugh. Come on, man, give me a break. I just got clean!

You were not born to the junk as I am.

Actually, I was born in a junkyard. This place is sorta making me feel homesick... And I do mean sick.
Don't be putting on no airs around me. I built mi first car out of junk when I was still too small to drive it!
The waste-land takes the weak. My waste-land. My junkyard. My Dump.

Thank you for giving Pepe a distraction. Although, now I worry that he might go blind.
Just remind him to stay hydrated... and blink every once in a while.
The Shaman has been fooling us! I thought the spirits were giving him his power, but he needed a doctor to cure his own family!
You look in pain. Maybe you have constipated bowels? Go to the Shaman - he has a spell that will help you unleash your inner volcano!
Ew!... No!
Yeah, we've got some bullshit to deal with, but this shit ain't part of it.
That's just a crock of shite, lassie.
We hoped you would talk some sense into that smuggler who has been extorting us, and what did you do? You joined him! Shame on you!
I got a letter from my husband! I thought he was dead, but you saved him and gave him a job! We will be together again. May the spirits bless you!
The lady on the TV said the new government is negotiating with the separatists! Maybe we'll be able to return home soon.
Do you like my tent? Cozy, isn't it? I moved in after the Legion took the people who lived there.
No fish in the river - too much garbage. But you can get food rations for some of it! Amazing what people throw away.
You are fishing... garbage?!
My best catch so far was a dead man with nice clothes and a shiny gold earring!
Well, how... um... nice for you.
I watched "Much Dust, Many Bullets" yesterday on the TV.
Oh, if you want autograph with movie star, I can arrange that!
It's crap. The plot is dumb, the costumes are stupid, and my dog is a better actor than the lead. They should make movies with you guys instead!
Uh... Thanks?
Thank you for lifting the curse over this camp!
You are welcome, friend! Those Legion desperados will trouble you no more.
Ha! I lift so much, I didn't even notice! How much did this curse weigh?
We lifted a curse? Did we kill an evil wizard and I missed it?
I mean, that American woman... Karen. She was a curse! Everywhere she went, she made people feel bad!
I paid twelve eggs to get a healing ritual for my family, and now that HIS family is sick, Sangoma calls a doctor?! I want my eggs back.
Excusez-moi... You come from outside the camp, right? Have you seen my sister, Claudette? The Legion, they took her somewhere North of here...
Context: BanterDef SavingClaudette_Antoine_00_approach Text  >> give quest (bool CludetteLead)

Text: If they took your sister, why are you still here talking about it?
Context: BanterDef SavingClaudette_Antoine_01 Text  Claudette not saved yet

Text: The Legion marauders came into the camp, rounded up whoever they wanted at gun point and took them away. What could I do? I have no weapons and no one will help me!
Context: BanterDef SavingClaudette_Antoine_01 Text  Claudette not saved yet

Text: Great. Kidnappers. I hate kidnappers. The order of lowlifes goes criminals, then pond scum, then kidnappers.
Context: BanterDef SavingClaudette_Antoine_01 Text  Claudette not saved yet

Text: I fear they will make Claudette a slave, or... worse.
Context: BanterDef SavingClaudette_Antoine_02 Text  Claudette not saved yet

Text: Not on MY watch, kid!
Don't worry yourself, mon. We not gonna let that happen.
Have no fear, muchacho. Whenever a woman will be used as a slave, Alejandro Diaz will come.
My sister... They found her dead. She fought the Legion with a stolen knife!... But they shot her anyway.
I was planning to leave this camp with Claudette, but now... I don't care what happens to me.
I know you were there and tried to save my sister... At least that counts for something.
Thank you for saving my sister! When I heard she actually fought the marauders with a knife, my heart sank... But luckily you were there to tip the scales in her favor.
Yeah, your sister has bigger balls than you, that's for sure.
Your sister is one brave chica! You should have seen the way she moved!
Next time, we will make you tip your own scales... useless buckhead.
Thank you once again. I had no chance without you!
You are the real hero, . !
You keep that knife. The next asshole who tries to grab you is gonna lose a finger... and maybe some other pieces.
Keep practicing with your knife. That way, you can protect yourself... and your brother.
Now that we are together, we can leave this hell hole and start a new life somewhere.
Yes! I've been thinking I could join the Militia. I hope we'll see each other again! Farewell.
You the mercs? Talk to le Colonel.
Halt! Who are you? Aaah, les mercenaires. Report to le Colonel.
I... I was just following orders.
I am just doing my job. Ask le Colonel.
This is a special operation of the Grand Chien Army.
Move on. Nothing to see here.
They have gassed themselves! Ha. Ha.
Le Colonel said that these people have been plotting a coup! They got what they deserved.
These "refugees" were all foreign mercenaires under cover... Just like you.
You want to talk to somebody? Why don't you go on and talk to Le Colonel?
Les mercenaires. I'll have a word with you.
Lieutenant, take command of the squad and shoot them. I'll have your report when it's done.
Sir! Yes, sir!
A very muddy passport in the name of Karen Gosling lies in the trash.
Nothing even closely resembling a passport can be found in the trash.
Various pieces of papers can be found throughout the junk but no passport.
Nothing important can be found in this junk heap.
Some workers from the Refugee Camp will appear as miners at Diamond Red.
Sometimes the best way to help someone is to give them an opportunity to help themselves.
Got mah start with explosives in a mine. Cannae say I recommend it, but it beats sittin' on yer arse in a camp.
Not a job for just anyone, but it might help some folks out.

<wisdom-f>
The notice board is full of mundane notes about life in and around the camp. Someone with a lot of patience might be able to pick out some useful information.

<wisdom-s>
The notice board turns out to be a treasure trove of information about the surrounding area.

Hey! Any chance you know how to hack a satellite TV? No matter what I try, some channels are always scrambled... Please help! There is nothing to do here but sit in the mud and watch the news. It's depressing!
Oh, I know what kind of channels are always scrambled. You naughty boy!

<mechanical-f>
The TV signal goes through an old encryption module. A better mechanic would probably know how to hack it.
Let me do that, mon. That be easy.

<mechanical-s>
The encryption module is old and easily removed. After a bit of tinkering with its settings, it is replaced and the TV screen springs to full, vibrant, titillating life.
Ah, it's a lame Videocipher II, mon. Simple to bypass. Been doin' it since I was twelve.
Oh wow! You did it! All the porn channels all the time! I'm going to be up for days!
This is why you wanted it fixed? So you could watch this filth? I need a shower.
There is a surprisingly large VHS tape collection of 80's action movies and adult films.
Some of these are... revolting. Who would ever want to do THAT thing?!
Hmm, this one looks kind of... exciting.

Such big collection! And not one of my movies! 
...They are lucky I have this copy of "Much dust, many bullets". I will leave it here.
This place has a rich aura of contained power and ancient menace.
I feel connected to the Great Beyond where the spirits roam free. I shall pay my respects to this place of power.
Fidel not approve. Not strong enough to hang a man. That one in Ernie was better.
The blood is not fresh, yet no clotting has occurred due to some kind of anticoagulant. This, um, Shaman guy, he knows his business.
Is this... human blood?!
Doesn't smell like human blood. And... Mmm, non, it doesn't taste like it either. I think it's pig.
This is just pig blood preserved with secret herbs.
It seems like the Legion had presence in the camp, but not anymore. There are no visible bullet wounds on their bodies.
The refugee has died a painful death. The symptoms indicate the use of a highly toxic chemical agent.

Erosive lesion of the upper dermis, blisters, irregular darkening of the skin, brown-red lesion of the eyes. Symptoms of convulsions and cardiac arrest. The cause of death is a chemical agent, most probably some form of mustard gas.
I have seen a lot of death, and I cannot mistake this one. This is work of Shaitan's breath, the mustard gas. Curse the hands of those who used it!
Convulsions, body lesions, blisters. This must be mustard gas, a lot of it. Poor civilians.
I've seen this before, Woodman, and I don't like it one bit. This is goddamned mustard gas, no mistake.
?    ? This is... fascism .

<medical-f>
There are no visible wounds, but that person seems to have died a painful death.

<explosives-f>
Fragments of a mortar shell.

<explosives-s>
There are fragments of a chemical shell that contained a deadly chemical agent.

<explosives-f>
There are two separate chemical precursors in the casing. It takes certain skill not to... Too late.
Unexploded chemical shell. Possibly very volatile. There is a sticker on it: "Tixa Inc."
Tixa?! Must be some coincidence. I hope it is. That must be handled with extreme care!
There is a mix of mustard gas and some other chemical agent in the casing. Cautiously separating them from the detonator disables the weapon.
Mustard gas! Fidel's favorite flavor.
I see mustard gas, but also others gases. This is not as described in textbook.

<wisdom-f>
For some reason the Shaman has been shot, while everyone else was gassed to death.

Probably because of the unexploded shell, the Shaman survived the gas attack - only to be shot later. It seems that before he died, with a last effort he scribbled a chemical formula in his own blood: C4H8Cl2S
Uh, let me check this... Easy! This is the formula of mustard gas.
This is undoubtedly the formula for mustard gas, but his handwriting can be improved. On second thought... I suppose he won't have another chance to do that.
The Shaman's wisdom provides us with the gift of truth even from beyond the grave. This is the formula of mustard gas.
It's barely readable even for a Doctor, but I, um... I'm pretty sure this is the formula of mustard gas.
Don't touch me! I'll stab you like this one here!
The poor asshole deserved it. He got himself killed by a little girl, for fuck's sake.
I'm big enough to kill you! Stay... Stay away!
You brought a knife to a gun fight, girlie.
Non-non, don't shoot her. Damn, I thought she was hot before, but now she really turns me on.
Yeah, she has some real fire in her! It's warming me up.
Stay away, or... Or you'll get a knife in your ugly faces!
Get her!
Context: BanterDef SavingClaudette_Crossroads_02_TimerExpired_1 Text  timer expired >> Claudette is killed >> next

Text: Get off me...
Context: BanterDef SavingClaudette_Crossroads_02_TimerExpired_1 Text  timer expired >> Claudette is killed >> next

Text: Aaaargh! She bit me! The bitch bit me!
Context: BanterDef SavingClaudette_Crossroads_02_TimerExpired_1 Text  timer expired >> Claudette is killed >> next

Text: Why did you kill her?! Now look at this... Blood all over my new shirt! You were supposed to hold her!
I told you, she bit me! I don't like bitches who bite.
Who the fuck are you?!
Context: BanterDef SavingClaudette_Crossroads_03_StartCombat Text  alert enemies before timer expires >> start combat

Text: Help! Shoot them!
Context: BanterDef SavingClaudette_Crossroads_03_StartCombat Text  alert enemies before timer expires >> start combat

Text: Shut up, bitch! We'll deal with you later.
Context: BanterDef SavingClaudette_Crossroads_03_StartCombat Text  alert enemies before timer expires >> start combat

Text: You will find that difficult once I finish sending your worthless souls back to Shaitan!
I think you will be too dead to do much of anything later on.
The only thing you'll be dealing with is my boot in your ass!
Thank you for intervening. I... I would not have been able to fight both of them off by myself.
Context: BanterDef SavingClaudette_Crossroads_04_CombatDone Text  combat resolved and Claudette is alive >> leave to Refugee Camp

Text: I wouldn't be so sure. You did great! You can put the knife away now.
You are very brave! You may have been a damsel in distress, but you fought like a hero.
Wow! This girl is a natural with a knife.
I wouldn't be too sure of that, Woodstock. It ain't the size of the dog in the fight, it's the size of the fight in the dog.
! Such brave people here.    - .
Now I should get back to my brother in the Refugee Camp! He must be worried sick about me. Please, come see us if you are ever nearby.
Context: BanterDef SavingClaudette_Crossroads_04_CombatDone Text  combat resolved and Claudette is alive >> leave to Refugee Camp

Text: You must tell him you defeated the monsters yourself using your wits and bravery. It will make for a better story.
If anyone tries to bother you, just tell them the Raven is watching.
Just make sure you don't stop on the way home to take any candy from strangers. Trust me, the candy is a lie.
Alright, but do me a favor and don't stop on the way to take candy from any strangers.
I am not responsible for anything going on here.
Resident, huh? Gotcha.
That is... worrisome.
I've used that line on every one of my ex-wives. It never works.
I can't comment on Dr. Kronenberg's methods for handling this pandemic. We just don't know enough about the virus.
Context: BanterDef SanatoriumNPC_Doctor02 Text  Educated, doctor (Covid reference)

Text: Remember to keep a meter and a half distance from everyone. It gives you time to react if they decide to jump up and bite you.
Context: BanterDef SanatoriumNPC_Doctor03 Text  Educated, doctor (Covid reference)

Text: Say what?
If they decide to do what, now?
Personally speaking, that is my general policy regardless.
Oh, so it's like a single's club then?
Remember to wear a mask. They are less aggressive if they don't see your face.
Context: BanterDef SanatoriumNPC_Doctor04 Text  Educated, doctor (Covid reference)

Text: Listen Doc, the only time I wear a mask is when I'm cleaning the shitter.
I knew I should have brought my Queen Gedren mask! And they told me there's no cosplay when on a mission.
Masks don't help, but you should wear one for your own peace of mind.
Context: BanterDef SanatoriumNPC_Doctor05 Text  Educated, doctor (Covid reference)

Text: Red Rabies induces aimless shambling and a hunger for human flesh. The victim essentially becomes... Well, we don't like to use the "Z-word".
Context: BanterDef SanatoriumNPC_Doctor06 Text  Educated, doctor (joke with Z-word, zombie movie reference)

Text: We need to learn more about Red Rabies before we are able to treat it.
Dr. Kronenberg may have her eccentricities, but she is one of the greatest medical minds of our time.
I am sorry that Dr. Kronenberg had to die like this... But she died for science. I hope it wasn't in vain.
Perhaps we shouldn't forget that she was a bit of a walking horror show, love.
She was the reason why doctors of science and doctors of medicine should be kept very far apart.
Why did you have to kill our security team?! We had enough problems containing the disease as it was...
They were in our way.
You no need security team! Fidel is here to kill whoever you want.
More like INsecurity team! Hahaha! You know... because they are small. And dead.
A word of advice - make sure you don't touch anything here. Trust me.
Context: BanterDef SanatoriumNPC_Guard01 Text  Sanatorium guard - mercs are allowed inside

Text: Dr. Kronenberg says you've got clearance.
Context: BanterDef SanatoriumNPC_Guard02 Text  Sanatorium guard - mercs are allowed inside

Text: I don't think, I don't judge, I don't care - my job is to make sure les cadavrs don't do something bad, okay?
Context: BanterDef SanatoriumNPC_Guard03 Text  Sanatorium guard - mercs are allowed inside

Text: Out of my way! If you need your diapers changed, just ring the bell and wait your turn.
Context: BanterDef SanatoriumNPC_Nurse01 Text  Nurse - stolid, professional

Text: They won't, though. That's the thing.
The bell! Oh, I love the bell.
I am suddenly very tempted to ring the bell.
Don't forget to wash your hands before you touch anything.
Context: BanterDef SanatoriumNPC_Nurse02 Text  Nurse - stolid, professional

Text: Don't forget to wash your hands after you touch anything.
Context: BanterDef SanatoriumNPC_Nurse03 Text  Nurse - stolid, professional

Text: Stop waving those guns around. You are scaring my patients.
Context: BanterDef SanatoriumNPC_Nurse04 Text  Nurse - stolid, professional

Text: Well, your patients are scaring me, so fair is fair.
Apologies, ma'am. All right, people, let's have some firearm discipline!
I am overworked taking care of my normal patients, not to mention the other kind, so if you will excuse me...
Context: BanterDef SanatoriumNPC_Nurse05 Text  Nurse - stolid, professional

Text: I just... love nurses!
A lot of people don't know this, but nurses are what make hospitals possible.
Can't you see I'm busy? If you need anything, ask the doctors and they will give you an explanation why you can't have it.
Professional. Accurate. Succinct. This is my kind of nurse.
Just a tip. Don't ask more than twice.
Not true! I asked a doctor for a sleeping pill and the next thing I knew I was out cold!
Ye got British doctors here, do ye?
I was just getting a handle on my work load, and then you up and decide to shoot the guards! Great! Just great.
Do you know something about my family? Are they in here as well?
I cannot sleep at night. There are horrible noises coming from underground. Please, do something!
Is trouble. We look for it.
Yeah, this place is all kinds of creepy.
Please don't let them turn me into one of les cadavrs!
When can I go home? Please let me go, I promise I will self-quarantine at home.
I'm healthy, I'm healthy! I feel great! Don't kill me.
This does not seem normal patient behavior.
What in the name of god is going on in this hospital?!
Dang it, Woodchuck, settle down!
I don't want to become one of les cadavrs.
Hey, who are you?
Context: BanterDef SanatoriumNPC_Doctor01_Approach_success Text  Educated, doctor - suspicious

Text: Scoundrel perk activated
What do you mean who am I?! Is this how you treat an immunology specialist personally invited for consultation?!
I am the new nurse. Would you like to examine... my credentials, Doctor?
I'm a... visiting physician, ya dig? You can call me Dr. Feelgood.
Ah, okay.
Context: BanterDef SanatoriumNPC_Doctor01_Approach_success Text  Educated, doctor - mercs have a plausible explanation why they are here

Text: Oh, are you the new doctors? You should go to Dr. Kronenberg to get your lab coats.
Context: BanterDef SanatoriumNPC_Doctor02_Approach_success Text  Educated, doctor - mercs have a plausible explanation why they are here

Text: What are you doing here? We have an outbreak to handle, this is no place for unauthorized personnel!
That was unnecessary bloodshed. Who will help us keep the infected under control now?
Context: BanterDef SanatoriumNPC_Doctor04_Approach Text  Educated, doctor guards killed

Text: Come off it, mate. Those guards were useless as tits on a bull.
I would be honored to guide them to their final rest.
My apologies, sir. We'll help make sure this facility is secure.
Sorry, we can't allow you inside. The Sanatorium is under quarantine by order of Dr. Kronenberg. I must warn you that we are authorized to use lethal force.
Context: BanterDef SanatoriumNPC_Guard01_Stealth_failure Text  Sanatorium guard - mercs caught sneaking in

Text: Hey! You can't go in here! The facility is under quarantine by order of Dr. Kronenberg. You need to leave, NOW, or we will have to shoot you.
Context: BanterDef SanatoriumNPC_Guard02_Stealth_failure Text  Sanatorium guard - mercs caught sneaking in

Text: Excuse me, but you shouldn't be here! This medical facility is under quarantine.
Context: BanterDef SanatoriumNPC_Nurse01_Approach_failure Text  Nurse - stolid, professional

Text: Hey, what are you doing here?! This medical facility is under quarantine.
Context: BanterDef SanatoriumNPC_Nurse02_Approach_failure Text  Nurse - stolid, professional

Text: Terribly sorry. It appears I've lost my way. Is this the Tennis Club?
I will go where I please, woman!
Dinnae raise your voice at me, lass!
Excuse me, but you shouldn't be here! This medical facility is under quarantine!
Context: BanterDef SanatoriumNPC_Nurse03_Approach_success Text  Nurse - stolid, professional

Text: Are you telling me how to do my job, nurse?
It is wise of a nurse to be observant, for the Doctor may appear in different clothing.
Oh... Apologies, Doctor. I didn't know you were the new transfer.
Context: BanterDef SanatoriumNPC_Nurse03_Approach_success Text  Nurse - stolid, professional - mercs have a plausible explanation why they are here

Text: Why have you killed our guards? Now who is going to handle the infected? Maybe you?
Context: BanterDef SanatoriumNPC_Nurse04_Approach Text  Nurse - irritated, sarcastic

Text: Do not worry, little lady! We are here to clean up this town... er, hospital.
I, Alejandro Diaz, will make sure no one bites you in any inappropriate way.
Depends on what your definition of "handle" is.
You won't lock me up with les cadavrs, right? I feel healthy, I swear!
You won't send me underground, right? Please, I don't want to become one of them!
Are you going to kill us as well?
Context: BanterDef SanatoriumNPC_Patient03_Approach Text  guards killed >> Guilty

Text: Relax, mon! We only be killing the bad folk.
Er... We'll get back to you on that, chief.
Certainly a reasonable question.
I heard that you let her continue with her satanic experiments! My children may turn into les cadavrs because of you!
Context: BanterDef SanatoriumNPC_Patient04_Approach Text  human experiments >> Guilty

Text: Mademoiselle, if that happens, I will make sure they are... taken care of.
Funny, I don't remember asking you for a guilt trip.
Oh, dear... Stay strong, love. I'm very nearly certain that won't happen.

<medical-f> 
The soil of Grand Chien is stony. A man digs what he can, and sometimes it's just rocks and stones.

<medical-s>
The ground of Grand Chien is sour. Its high acidity and specific chemical properties facilitate some unique mutations.
I've never seen anything like this!
Very curious.
Whoa. Like, acid, man.
It's, like, acid... Someone else should hold this.
There is a lot of bad energy in this ground.
A sheet looks to be wrapped around a motionless body.
Ozzy is a legend. He was the one who ate the bat in the first place.
Spirits bless Ozzy. He taught us how to properly play ball.
Shush, let Ozzy have some rest. Spirits know he deserves it.
Don't mind them, Ozzy. They can't understand.
The withered, long dead body of Ozzy provides his last gift to humanity.

<medical-f>
Just another infected corpse.

<medical-s>
The body shows all necessary infection markers according to the notes of Dr. Kronenberg. It can be used as a sample for her research.

<mechanical-f> 
The metal suitcase survived the crash relatively intact, but it takes a certain amount of engineering skill to release it from the bent and scorched remains of the plane.
Stupid box! What if Fidel plants TNT and destroys what remains of plane?
That's one piece of luggage that is going to stay lost.

<mechanical-s>
It takes a certain amount of engineering skill to release the suitcase from the bent and scorched remains of the plane.
It is full of broken vials that leaked out.
One is still intact.
That's some shit I wouldn't try to smoke, Scooter.
Aaah, I'm not touching that thing, Woodinger.
Next time, you be retrieving your own luggage, mon!
A magical potion! Just kidding. Yeah, this looks dangerous.

<medical-f> 
Some of the bodies are prepared for incineration, which is perhaps a perfectly normal practice in Grand Chien.
Food for the flames.

<medical-s>
Some of the bodies are prepared for incineration. They seem to have been recently infected and then euthanized.
These people have been euthanized before the infection progressed. They shouldn't be any more dangerous than those outside - just the opposite.
Needle marks... It looks as if they have been infected and then killed before the disease was allowed to progress.
It looks like someone is trying to get rid of evidence.
Context: BanterDef SanatoriumAG_BodiesIncinerator_success Text  high Medical >> gain clue

Text:
<wisdom-f>
Dead bodies loaded on a truck. Export or import, who can tell?
I need a drink.
Yuck! People should no be toting around dead bodies in a truck like this!
Bad scene, partner.

<wisdom-s>
All bodies have been carefully bound and secured. One might think the staff was taking precautions against the dead rising.
I wonder where they dump all these bodies.
I'm damn sure of one thing, Woodman - I don't want to go to the sector east of here.
There are many tire tracks that head off to the east.
There is movement inside!
The corpus is moving!
Oh, HELL no...
Get behind me! Get behind me!
We're about to have company!

<mechanical-f>
Classical music playing.

<mechanical-s>
It takes some time to find the right frequency.
"I repeat, what are the Doctor's orders? Should I hire more healthy subjects, or is the last batch enough for now?"
Why would a Sanatorium need healthy patients?!
What the hell is going on here, Woody?
This right here is why you don't see me signing up for clinical trials. Uh-uh. Not ever.
"Canine Test Subjects"
"Beware of the Leopard!"
"Director"
"Human Test Subjects"
"Lab"
"Morgue"
"Storage"
Get back in line! Sir, please have patience and get back in line. Sir! What the hell...
Context: BanterDef SanatoriumNPC_event_GuardInitial Text  Sanatorium guard - outbreak starts

Text: Thank you for your help. Now we have to clean this mess... I'm sorry I can't let you in, but the facility is closed by order of Dr. Kronenberg.
Context: BanterDef SanatoriumNPC_event_GuardOutbreakEnd Text  Sanatorium guard - outbreak handled

Text: Shoot! Shoot to kill! It is an outbreak of les cadavrs!
Context: BanterDef SanatoriumNPC_event_GuardOutbreakStart Text  Sanatorium guard - infected attacking the guards

Text:
<medical-f>
Lots of dead bodies.
Time for body parts puzzle!
Rest in peace... please?
Behold, the Dance Macabre.

<medical-s>
The bodies seem to have been euthanized with cyanide before the infection progressed.
If it wasn't an outrageous idea, I would think they infected these people on purpose and left them to die.
These were test subjects. This is horrific!
I'm thinking that maybe this place isn't really a hospital at all.

<medical-f>
Dead body on the dissection table.

<medical-s>
The fatal injury seems to have been inflicted after the autopsy started.
It seems the autopsy wasn't finished because the subject raised some objections to it.
Looks like the autopsy was never finished, because the body wasn't dead enough at the time.
Perhaps this person decided to try to come back from the spirit world.

<wisdom-f>
Lots of medical supplies with complicated names written in long dead tongues.

<wisdom-s>
The cabinet is loaded with a startling amount of cyanide, but there are some medical supplies as well.
This is why I distrust modern pharmaceuticals. They are all like this.
I am no doctor, but I really don't think having this much cyanide around is healthy.
So many death chemicals. It is a thing of worry.
No murders since you murdered half of the population. You surely know how to maintain the peace.
They still don't like me very much, but they come to me when they get sick.
If nobody hates you, you're doing something wrong.
Context: BanterDef TwinManorsNPC_DrLEnfer04 Text  Dr. House reference

Text: This explains why many people upset with Fidel. I do everything right.
It is true! As Mother is fond of telling me, "If they are shooting at you, it is because you have successfully created a distraction for Mommy."
Oh! Could you repeat that into this recording device so I can send a copy to my father?

A hundred years ago, the L'Enfer brothers killed each other under very suspicious circumstances. They sold their souls to the Devil, and now they are here again, trying to pay him back by murdering my family!
Yes. Such things are common.
Seems unlikely.
A bargain with Shaitan is not to be entered into lightly.
I shudder when I think of that creepy old cemetery. You better stay away from the L'Enfer brothers' grave... It is a door straight to Hell.
I have seen it with my own two eyes! The Doctor was performing filthy rituals to summon his demonic relatives, the L'Enfer brothers! They ride in the night and spill the blood of the innocent!
I wouldn't be surprised if it turns out that those filthy Van Tassel farmers have brought this curse upon us. They pray only twice a day. Can you imagine?!
It is very brave of you that you're getting involved with this murder case, but I have to warn you: Be careful! The owls are not what they seem.
Context: BanterDef TwinManorsNPC_LeDomasCaroline05 Text  Twin Peaks reference

Text: Thank you, officers! You brought to justice that vicious Doctor. Now we can live in peace, without any other "accidents" involving firearms... Or poison, of course.
Well, where the hell is the fun in that?
When beautiful women are threatened by injustice, Alejandro Diaz is always there!
Yeah. Accidents. Right.
I would rather marry a vengeful spirit than one of those Van Tassel blockheads.
Surely, there are other options.
Bonding yourself to a vengeful spirit is not for everyone.
Personally, and not to sound too judgemental, but if I were you, I would run very far away very fast.

Once, I took a peek into the Doctor's archive, and I found bloodstained notes scribbled in devilish writing! Surely that was the contract he signed with the Devil for his soul, just like his L'Enfer ancestors.
That fateful night, my little sister was playing Juliette. Who could have known that the gun she shot herself with was actually loaded with REAL bullets?!
This my greatest fear - death by prop gun!

You surely know who the murderer is, inspector, don't you? I can see it in your eyes! You noticed a broken leaf or a scratch on the wall, and now you know that the culprit is a bald carpenter with a limp in his left leg!
Quite so. The world is full of obvious things which nobody by any chance ever observes.
Context: BanterDef TwinManorsNPC_LeDomasFemale04 Text  Quoting Sherlock Holmes

Text: Now that I think of it... Why do the vengeful spirits only brutally murder members of our own family? I'd much rather die from poison like those Van Tassel simpletons.
Thank you for putting things right, officers. But did you really need to shoot my auntie?
Oui, but it was a boring kill. She did not even try to run.
Regrettably, it was necessary. I'm sorry for your loss.
Hell yeah! That bitch had it coming!
Be vigilant, because your adversary, the Devil, as a roaring lion, walketh about - seeking whom he may devour.
Context: BanterDef TwinManorsNPC_LeDomasMale01 Text  Sleepy Hollow / Bible reference

Text: St. Peter certainly knew a thing or two about that!
My cousin went to the graveyard and never returned... Maybe those demonic L'Enfer brothers got him!
Everyone is on edge lately, and those Van Tassels never stop waving their guns... That's an accident waiting to happen.
There he is! The devilish Doctor! Do you know what his name means? It means he comes from hell!!!
Did you know that the Doctor has the same gun as the one that killed our Juliette?
I got the same gun as the one that was used to kill some dweeb who was messing with my bike. Doesn't mean I did it... I mean, I DID do it, but that's beside the point.
God bless you for putting a stop to those murders! I really enjoyed when you shot those Van Tassels. But when you shot my cousin as well - somewhat less so.
I don't know want to point fingers, but I have some suspicions. Who else but a medical man could get his hands on lethal poison?
Well, your average grocery store clerk, for one.
That seems suspiciously like a pointed finger.
Ex-wives. Next question.

That gun on the stage... I checked it myself! It was empty like the heart of that bitch Le Domas, and yet it fired! Someone sneaked in and loaded it with live ammo - it is either that, or I'll start believing in ghosts like the others.
Who has the motive? It's easy. Dr. L'Enfer is the last heir of the family from whom we bought the manor. And now he's trying to scare us out of our own houses!
Indeed. When a doctor does go wrong, he is the first of criminals. He has the nerve and he has the knowledge.
Context: BanterDef TwinManorsNPC_VanTasselAbraham03 Text  Quoting Sherlock Holmes

Text: That highbrow snob Caroline thinks that we'll buy her "vengeful spirits" nonsense... She's probably plotting with that creepy Doctor to scare us out of our house!
That Doctor is a crafty old fox, but I'm sure you will eventually catch him red-handed!
Good job! Now that murderous Doctor will poison no more!
He won't be doing much of ANYTHING anymore.
Poison is terrible weapon. No commendations for poisoning.
He is food for scavengers now.
Now that I think of it, just before the scene where our Romeo and Juliet died for real, the Doctor was nowhere in sight.
Maybe he went to get snack.
I don't blame him. I hate that scene.
Maybe he didn't like the play.
My cousin went to the graveyard and never returned... Maybe those demonic L'Enfer brothers got her!

A hundred years ago, the ancestors of Dr. L'Enfer butchered their servants and then killed each other while trying to please the Devil! I've heard that both of them had only one soul between them, and one of them had to die so that the other could claim it!
Did you know that the Doctor keeps cyanide in his cabinet? I saw it with my own two eyes!
Far out. Like, what else does he keep in there?
Now that I think of it... Why are the members of our family the only ones being poisoned? Is the Le Domas family immune to poison or what?
I hope you did the right thing... Because if those murders continue, you obviously didn't.
Never trust those sneaky Le Domas bastards. They lie as often as they breathe, and sometimes they can lie breathless.
The Manor is safe thanks to us Van Tassel sharpshooters. We fought off bandits during the Civil War, and if necessary, we can fight off those demons from hell!
That fateful night, my cousin was playing Romeo. Who could have known that the potion he drank during the play was actually poison?!
Ah, that was the play of his life.
At least one person knew. We just need to figure out who.
The poisoner certainly knew, but whoever they are, they're not likely to be chatty about it. The game's afoot!
Don't worry. We'll find out who's responsible.
It was the Doctor all along! He hates us and he wants us out.
I think it was that witch Caroline who did the murders. That "vengeful spirits" obsession of hers finally took over.
It's good to have a meal without being afraid it may be your last.
My man was taken to the Witch's Hut yesterday night. Cursed Witch! I know she is sucking the life force out of our men, that's why she remains so young and attractive at her age.
Wait, that works?! I thought the first guy I did that to was just making that up.
That sounds... Ew. Gross. Just... gross.
That is a myth. Vigorous exercise and a high-protein diet are the only things that can... Wait. That didn't come out right.
Good thing you stopped that wicked Witch from abusing our men!
I was digging for diamonds when I found these. I did not loot them from a dead body... whatever my neighbors say.
That would be okay with Fidel.
Do not worry. My mother taught me never to listen to what the neighbors say.
I've been digging for diamonds under my house and... now I have no house. So, er... I'm joining the Militia! I hope you can do something about lodging.
+1 Militia in Wassergrab
There is a poem by Edgar Allan Poe.
"Ah, broken is the golden bowl! - the spirit flown forever!"
"Let the bell toll! - a saintly soul floats on the Stygian river"
"And, Guy De Vere, hast thou no tear? - weep now or never more!"
"See! on yon drear and rigid bier low lies thy love, Lenore!"
"Come, let the burial rite be read - the funeral song be sung!"
"An anthem for the queenliest dead that ever died so young"
"A dirge for her the doubly dead in that she died so young."
<wisdom-s>
This is not a doll but a female corpse, cemented and painted over.
I serve only Commander Chimurenga! He is such a great and inspiring leader! He has taught me everything.
I wish Commander Chimurenga would banish that filthy prostitute Maman Liliane from our town.
No matter what you have done at the Refugee Camp, comrades, we support you! No crime is a crime if it's done in the name of the Revolution.
Innocent until proven guilty.
You know nothing of what I've done. Let's keep it that way.
You have liberated the President so that you can install him as your puppet, right? And now you will govern the country in shadow from the Red House here in Pantagruel. You are wise, comrades!
Context: BanterDef Shared_NPC_MaquisFighterFemale_02 Text  Succeed Chimurenga + President saved

Text: Uh... Thanks? I guess?
Do a couple nice things for people and everyone thinks you want to take over the world.
The Maquis Manifesto pamphlets are inspiring, but not attractive. You should talk to Maman Liliane from Le Lys Rouge - she knows how to get people's attention.
The Maquis Manifesto pamphlets are looking good! They grab the attention of the reader and squeeze it hard in an iron grip until they come to recognize the struggle of the proletariat!
Context: BanterDef Shared_NPC_MaquisFighterFemale_04 Text  Maquis Manifesto + girls

Text: There is certainly a lot there to think about.
I have looked at it many times. Each time, I am gripped.
I'm certain it raises... a lot of interesting points!
"The Vulture of Hope" can't be a good name for a clinic. It should be labeled "The Vulture of Health"!
Good thing you have protected our sisters at Le Lys Rouge. They are our natural allies in our struggle against the patriarchy!
Context: BanterDef Shared_NPC_MaquisFighterFemale_06 Text  Abusers quest done

Text: You said it, sister!
You just let ol' Norma know if anything like that happens again.
Comrades! With your inspiring leadership, even the girls at Le Lys Rouge will grab a weapon and fight for the Revolution!
I wish you hadn't executed Slave Master Graaf, so that I could have killed him myself.
You did good when you hired Slave Master Graaf as a foreman. After all, he comes from the working class!
Context: BanterDef Shared_NPC_MaquisFighterFemale_09 Text  Graaf hired as foreman

Text: I already miss Colonel Chimurenga. Sometimes I consider going back to Le Lys Rouge so I can see him more often.
We will squeeze the meaning of production!
There's no party like the Communist party!
Is big problem in Russia. Communist party was reason for much drinking.
You liberated the diamond mines for those filthy Adonis capitalists, but they do not realize that it is you who really controls the means of production! Well done, comrades!
We shall join you in your struggle against those filthy Adonis capitalists. Let the world know we stand united like the hammer and the sickle!
It is good to have friends in glorious struggle!
Never thought I'd be teaming up with a bunch of commies!
You should have seen the great Biff Apscott at the Carnival celebrations when the fireworks went off! He led his team in a perfect demonstration of how to take cover.
Those were fireworks?! Oh, man, I thought they were pixie farts!
Memory is a little foggy. I do remember Biff hiding in a porta-potty.
You must have been trained by Biff Apscott himself! You were lucky to serve under such a fearless leader of men.
Pffft! Biff Apscott can lick my Browning!
Yeah, Biff's a great guy! He's real good at making sure I don't, um, wander off.
I hope we will see the great leader Biff Apscott again one day, once he returns from his secret mission.
There is no one better at accomplishing something completely unknowable as seor Apscott!
One can only admire the courage of Larry Roachburn! He let himself be captured so that Biff Apscott could lead his team to safety!
Context: BanterDef Shared_NPC_MaquisFighterMale_09 Text  Diamond Red liberated

Text: I did? Oh, yeah, I did! I'm amazing!
Context: BanterDef Shared_NPC_MaquisFighterMale_09 Text  Diamond Red liberated

Text: Well... I just did what came naturally.
Context: BanterDef Shared_NPC_MaquisFighterMale_09 Text  Diamond Red liberated

Text: Biff Apscott is a military genius! He easily escaped a Legion trap, and now he's on a secret mission to kill the Major himself!
Context: BanterDef Shared_NPC_MaquisFighterMale_10 Text  Diamond Red liberated

Text: Old Chimurenga is a great leader! But he is just a Maquis like us, not a military genius like Biff Apscott.
Woody, you got to get yer dang head screwed on straight about this Apscott fella.
Yeah, man, and I'm a relentless fighter.
Oh, gimme a break!
You have been trained by Biff himself, right? Under your command we will perform great feats!
I will show you everything seor Apscott showed me. Where is your bathroom?
Wait, what?!
Apscott can barely train himself not to piss his pants!
I am ready to die for the Revolution! Just say the word!
The Maquis Manifesto pamphlets are looking good!... No pictures though. I heard that Maman Liliane has an idea how to make them more appealing to the proletariat!
Do you have more Maquis Manifesto pamphlets? For some reason, mine has pages that are stuck together.
Context: BanterDef Shared_NPC_MaquisFighterMale_14 Text  Maquis Manifesto + girls

Text: I went to the Vulture of Hope clinic and met one of the lovely girls from Le Lys Rouge there. We're both in great health!
At the clinic, huh? Kinky. Which one of you played the Doctor?
Very good! Regular medical checks are highly recommended for a person in her line of work.
Nice to see affordable healthcare isn't just for the rich.
She was very nice and offered me a free sample, but I bravely refused! If one likes a service, one must pay for it, otherwise it's piracy!
Then call me Blackbeard, because I would have boarded her ship right there.
Pirates do tend to get a lot of booty.
What kind of sample? Does it grow muscles?
With comrades like you, we can execute a coup d'etat twice over!
Turns out, the Major himself was a Maquis undercover agent! Good job, comrade Major!
Yeeeah... Right.
I went to Le Lys Rouge to see Colonel Chimurenga. Even in retirement, the Savanna Lion is still brave and strong and determined, a proud father of the Revolution!
But now he is holding a frying pan instead of a gun. His pancakes are revolutionary!
He was cleaning the pipes in the bathhouse. Oh, how tall and proud he stood with the plunger in hand!

Have you seen the statue of Great General Chien in Port Cacao? He was a glorious leader! His statue is made out of pure gold, but it's covered with bronze and pigeon shit so that no one will steal it.
We will blow all enemies of the Maquis like leaves in the wind!
Did I hear that right?
No man can best me, ever since I worked in Le Lys Rouge!
I've heard of your work. Huge fan!
No man may have me, unless he's beaten me in a fair fight. That's why I left Le Lys Rouge and joined the Maquis!
If you give yourself only to someone who is better than you, then prepare to be bettered!
I'm just curious, but does that deal work the same if it was a girl?
What kind of fight? Pillow fight? Mud wrestling?
I hate men, except for Monsieur Chimurenga and my comrades. But they are more than just men, they are Maquis!
I'm ready to fight all day and night if I have to!
That's what I like to hear, soldier!
I know how to shoot and even reload!
Well, that's... really something.
See this amulet? It keeps the bullets off me!
No, that one keeps away flies. Is common mistake.
Please take a photo of me with the gun! One day I will show it to my kids.
My shoulder hurts from shooting this gun, but I will shoot and shoot again! No more bandits!
Pain is temporary. Death is eternal.
These bandits now know the courage of the people of the Adjani!
That's the spirit! Well done, I say.
Did you see me shooting? I'm like Ranbo!
Good for you! Give them a war they will not believe!
I clean my gun every day, just like you showed me!
Then explain all this carbon buildup on your firing pin. Unacceptable!
Soon I will shoot even better than you! I practice!
I like your spirit, Woodman. Keep it up!
No one to protect us from those bandits! No one but us.
We're literally standing right here.
They'll never have our land! We fight like lions!
Today... is your INDEPENDENCE DAY!
I remember good friends who joined the Spirits. I am ready to go meet them any time.
Good... but you should be even more ready to do the same to the enemy.
We are the Adjani Militia! We are strong and proud! We have the power of the Spirits in us!
Bunch of absolute badasses!
This is my rifle, this is my gun! This is for fighting, this is for fun!
Context: BanterDef Militia_14_Rookie Text  quote from "Full Metal Jacket"

Text: You're goddamn right it is.
I like being part of the Militia, but I do not understand why we need to do so much marching in formation.
Do it until you can't tell the difference between yourself and the soldier next to you. Then you'll understand.
I'm a really good shot. I can hit a bird on the wing from 100 meters!
The town is not being threatened by malevolent avians, love. Just aim for center mass.
I'm ready to do what needs to be done. No questions asked.
Alright, go get me a burger and some cheese fries... I'M WAITING!
I'm ready to take on anything they throw at us!
I like your confidence, but don't let it get your head blown off.
They say this place is cursed. A director was shooting some kind of a movie here. Three years later, the whole crew died under mysterious circumstances.
Dealing with ancient curses is an occupational hazard in our field of work. I assume you heard about the Curse Of Ernie Island, oui?
Um... the WHAT of Ernie Island?
I have brown bear pelt underwear. It protect me from curses.
Apparently, SOMEONE left that out of our mission briefing.
Let's see... Oh! It says here: "Look into the eyes of the three-headed beast. The right head sees into your future, the left head looks into your fortune."
Context: BanterDef Archeological_LuckyVeinard03 Text  talking to himself

Text: Hey! Don't sneak up on me like that... and forget anything I said about a three-headed beast. There's no such thing.
Context: BanterDef Archeological_LuckyVeinard03 Text  noticing mercs listening in

Text: Come on, Schliemann. Don't be afraid of that curse. It only works on desperate independent filmmakers.
I can feel it in my guts. The great treasure of the three-headed monkey will soon be mine.
God damn it, Schliemann... What did I tell you about playing with frying pans?
What a good chicken... What a nice, juicy, pan-fried chicken...
It looks to me like your chicken has a death wish.
I am hungry again, glavny.

I can feel it! I'm on the verge of making the greatest find of my career. This might sound crazy but... this area has some of the clearest evidence of alien visitation in the world! Who knows what a little digging will uncover!
You're right. It sounds crazy.
You hear that, Ted!? We're going for another spaceship ride! Weeeeee!
Oh, no... No, no, no. No more probes for me, man!
Oh, who am I kidding? I suck at this. I should just go back to my advertising job. I haven't found a single thing and I never will!
Not with that attitude! You need to learn how to say yes to success.
Come on, don't say that. Look at Schliemann! Schliemann's not giving up.
Leave me alone. No fortune and no glory for this poor soul.
Oh, shut up, Schliemann. You're no good, either. Go and do whatever you like. I will just stay here and examine the miserable wreck of my life.
Cluck.
Cluck. Cluck.
Looks like the little pecker has actually found something hidden here.
Och! This better not be a buried box of chicken feed, ya wee feather-head!
The adorable little creature may have found something of value here!
Fortune and glory, my friends. Fortune and glory!
Some of these markers don't even have names. No pyramids or mausoleums for these poor fools. It's sad but you get used to it in my line of work.
Now if you excuse me... I have something important to tell my wingman excavator here. Would you mind giving us some privacy?
Please, leave my bird friend alone. We have an important issue to discuss. Come, Schliemann.
What is it, Schliemann? Is your gold radar picking up something?
Hurry up, Schliemann, or this sun will turn us both into a bucket of fried you-know-what.
Oh, come on, Schliemann. I'd fancy a refreshing beverage on the beach as well, but we have a treasure to find.
Looks like treasure to me!
This chicken has very good sense of direction! Haha!
This bird has a nose, er... beak for finding fun!
My name is Veinard. Lucky Veinard. I am part-time professor of archeology, expert on the occult and, um, obtainer of forgotten valuables.
Oh, this is Schliemann. My little feathered tomb raider. He has the mystical power of discovering hidden treasures. Come on boy, snatch!
You remember Schliemann, right? It seems my fellow raider of lost valuables has once again picked up the scent of nearby treasure.
Can you believe those idiots? They are digging for tiny diamonds among the ruins of legendary King Mfumu's Palace! A very rich man, he was!
I'm sure the treasure of Mfumu is somewhere close by. The scripts clearly mention a certain tree... But I can't find anything matching its description.
Oh, you're still here? Did I say tree? I meant three... stones. A treasure near three stones. Yes.
Oh, look. He got a trail. That's it, Schliemann, make papa rich.
What is it, boy? What did you find?
God damn it, Schliemann. We've talked about this. The price of corn is terrible these days.
Hey Scooter, I think you've got to feed your pet from time to time.
You can't get away from corn. They are putting it everywhere these days. I'd go with something more keto.
Ha! The little birdy found some snacks. Aren't you adorable.
Are you insane? You killed my friend! Get out of here, I don't want to speak with you ever again... Oh, Schliemann...
We eat chicken now, glavny?
You are here to find the lost Mask of Manbo, legendary Voodoo Warrior Priestess, aren't you? I hate to be the bearer of bad news but I am going to find it first.
I'd be careful around this place if I were you. I think these Voodoo cultists are definitely keen on animal sacrifice, and I don't think they are picky about what animal... including humans.
That was a joke, right... Right?
Okaaaaay. I'll just wait in the car... which I parked in Milwaukee.
That's really not something I needed to hear right now.
You thought I was gonna tell you where the treasure is? Well, you thought wrong. Only the ritual book contains that knowledge. And I still haven't found it, so the joke's on you, haha.
Context: BanterDef Voodoo_LuckyVeinard03 Text  talking to himself

Text: Look at him. He's doing that thing with his head again. That's always a sign there is a profitable artifact nearby.
What is it, boy? Get papa a brand new leather satchel and I promise you an endless pouch of barley.
Oh, Schliemann... He still can't process the loss of his girlfriend. You know how keen voodoo cultists are on chicken sacrifice.
Tough break, Schliemann. Don't worry. There's plenty of chicks in the coop.
Death is the great equalizer. We are all chickens awaiting our turn on the chopping block.
You gotta be kidding me...
There's an ancient burial ground underneath us. You should always be careful when dealing with the dead's final resting place.
Welcome to the Broken Hill Cemetery. This is a place where they bury people who had no one in their lives who cared enough about them to bury them somewhere else.
Thank you for getting rid of those illiterate bullies. Please, watch your step. This is a fragile archeological site.
We found it, Schliemann. Manbo's long forgotten heritage is somewhere nearby.

<strength-f>
After a thorough check, this turned out to be just a pile of rocks.

<strength-s>
There is something interesting about this ritual stone. Moving the stone reveals a hidden treasure beneath the altar.
Three animal skulls are looking in different directions.

<strength-f>
These planks are warped and stuck together. The entire assembly must be lifted, which seems like it would take near-Olympian strength.

<strength-s>
The warped planks groan and snap as they are lifted. Underneath, a hidden treasure lies partially covered in dirt.

<strength-f>
Digging up a grave is tiring and frustrating. It also happens to be pointless.

<strength-s>
A few swings with the shovel are enough to reveal the resident of this grave.

<strength-s>
A few swings with the shovel are enough to reveal the resident of this grave.

<strength-s>
A few swings with the shovel are enough to reveal the resident of this grave.

<strength-s>
A few swings with the shovel reveal a strange box instead of a dead body.
Listen to me carefully, Schliemann. I want you to tune all those navigational neurons inside your head. The treasure is somewhere close by.
Cluck.
I found a man named Bill Carson dying in the savanna. He told me he buried a treasure somewhere in Broken Hill Graveyard. Do you understand why I brought you here now?
Cluck. Cluck.
He kept going on and on with some mumbo jumbo about seeing angels, but he did say something that may be a clue: "Look for ice." Hmmm... maybe he was just having a heat stroke.
Look no further, the Iceman is right here.
Diamonds, baby. Gotta be.
Rather a mystery, wouldn't you say? Intriguing... What kind of ice forms in the desert? Dry ice? Oh, rot. That's not it.
Arch Stanton
Ha! No buried treasure here, partners. Already seen movie.
Context: BanterDef Graveyard_Tombstone_1 Text  The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly reference

Text: Tony Sombrero
Trickie the Kid
J.D. Cassidy
Unknown
Blonnndieeee!!! Haha... Um, anybody got a shovel?
Context: BanterDef Graveyard_Tombstone_2 Text  The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly reference

Text: Angel Eyes
A Man With No Name
Juan Wild
Buffalo Bill
Jean Luc
Bernadette
The Marquis

<strength-f>
After a thorough check this turns out to be just a pile of rocks.

<strength-s>
There is something interesting about this ritual stone. Moving the stones reveals a hidden treasure beneath the altar.

<strength-f>
The stone slab atop the sarcophagus is way too heavy to be moved.

<strength-s>
After a solid push the stone slab is shoved aside. There is a hidden treasure inside the sarcophagus.

<wisdom-f>
It's just a big stone. There's nothing particularly interesting about it.

<wisdom-s>
The runes written on the stone look familiar. They are pointing towards a secret stash buried near a bigger stone.

<dexterity-f>
This looks like a pile of dirt no different than anything else around here.

<dexterity-s>
This is definitely the tomb of an ancient warrior. And he's definitely buried with something valuable.

<wisdom-f>
One of the skulls would make a nice trophy above the fireplace. There doesn't seem to be anything else of interest.

<wisdom-s>
There's something unnatural about this pile of bones. A thorough search reveals a hidden treasure beneath them.
Three spirits are resting inside. Seven more are waiting outside. One of them is missing.
This stone seems perfect for performing a sacrifice, but there is no evidence of animal remains.

<strength-f>
This stone is even heavier than it looks. It doesn't move an inch.

<strength-s>
After a solid push the stone is shoved aside and reveals a box hidden beneath it.
Come here, mes amis. I got something real special to show you!
This "real special" thing better not be in your pants, mon.
Heeey, how are you, my friend? Take a look what I've got for you, eh?
Here, here, take a look! It all works! If you die on the spot while testing the goods, you get full refund!
Do you offer partial refund for dismemberment?
First world quality, third world prices!
See here, only good stuff! It's all legal in Grand Chien!
Come-come! Buy-buy, buy goods! Me goods is good buy!
I'm so confused right now...
I believe he wishes us to purchase something and then quickly leave, but I may be wrong.
Hey! Try the soup. Finest bushmeat. It has all the major food groups - claws, hooves, scales, and roof insulation. It turns boys into men and men into heroes!
I will try anything once!
I know this soup. It is "Swamp Stew". Delicious, but gives heartburn.
Terribly sorry, but did you say "roof insulation"?
I have the best wares just for you. Come and check what's in stock!
Come back tomorrow and I will have some more goods for you.
I'm all out of stuff, my friend. Come again some other time.
I will have more steel for you tomorrow, my adventuring friends!
We will pay extra for enchantment!
I am all out of filthy magazines. You will have to use your imagination until I can restock.
Use my imagination for what? I'm not sure I understand...
Come back tomorrow and we'll be able to buy some more Meds from you.
I see you have a burning passion for Molotovs! Please come back tomorrow when I restock.
Can't enough of my junk, huh? Come back tomorrow and I'll be ready!
Way to make it weird, dude.
I see there is high demand for weapons - as it should be, my friend! Come back tomorrow and I'll have something for you!
Assorted ammo! Buy now, shoot later!
No refunds! You buy, you shoot, bye-bye!
Come, friend! Best prices in Grand Chien!
Fresh secondhand blades! Hand may still be attached!
Hehehe... I like that.
Buy a knife! Save on ammo!
A good philosophy.
Big bombs! Naked guns! Fitness tips!
Hey, that cover model looks like Fox!
Yep, there I am... with my guns out.
Dirty magazines for sale! Clean ones for display only!
If you have any spare medicaments we can buy them from you. We'll put them to good use in the Sanatorium.
Feu d'artifice improvis! Hot deal!
Smoking hot! Buy here, use somewhere else!
Vodka has truly done so very much for the world.
First class junk! Imported garbage directly from the Dump!
That's not really the enticing selling point you might think it is.
My junk has been personally inspected by her Ladyship the Baroness!
I wonder if she'd be willing to take a look at mine...
Dirt cheap guns! Give 'em a shot!
If you have enemies, buy a gun!
Better yet, hire a mercenary.
Got friends to protect? Buy a gun!!!
And a mercenary to shoot it for you.
Got no friends? A gun will be your best friend!
