I got everything under control. I'll get these lazy maggots digging out more diamonds than you'll know what to do with!
Don't worry, those maggots will never steal from you! Not on my watch.
Boss Graaf is crazy, man, he shoot us like dogs! Thank you for stopping him. Now shoot him back! Kill him dead!
Context: BanterDef DiamondRed_Worker01_Success Text  battle won with few casualties

Text: Don't you worry, people, we'll do the right thing.
Do I get medal now?
I got no problem with that.
Boss Graaf is crazy, man, he shoot us like dogs! I wish you could have stopped him sooner. He killed Mateo and Lucille, and many more... Please, shoot him back! Kill him dead!
Context: BanterDef DiamondRed_Worker02_Failure Text  battle won with a lot of casualties

Text: Death has fed well this day.
I'm sorry for your loss. We'll try to make this right.
You did good to shoot that crazy man dead!
Context: BanterDef DiamondRed_Worker03_BossKilled Text  just executed the Boss

Text: . Fascist must die.
Ehehehee, Fidel kills for good! Good Fidel, nice Fidel!
After what I've seen here, I would have killed a man like that in cold blood in the middle of a church on Easter Sunday.
Will you close the mine now? No need, no need... We can work for you. Just give us some money for the diamonds we find, and let us go to our families some time.
Context: BanterDef DiamondRed_Worker03_BossKilled Text  just executed the Boss

Text: Why you let this killer go? He deserve death!
Context: BanterDef DiamondRed_Worker04_BossSpared Text  just spared the Boss

Text: Many deserve death, and some, uh... Some deserve to die later, okay?
More death will not heal your soul. It is time to grieve and move on.
Will you close the mine now? Some will leave, but others may be convinced to work for you. We have families to feed. Just give us some money for the diamonds we find, and let us go home some time.
Context: BanterDef DiamondRed_Worker04_BossSpared Text  just spared the Boss

Text: Non-non, why not shoot that crazy man dead?!
Context: BanterDef DiamondRed_Worker05_BossHired Text  just spared the Boss

Text: Shut up! This is new boss! New boss says: you don't have to die here, and you get money for the diamonds you find. What more do you want? Now get back to work, maggots.
Context: BanterDef DiamondRed_Worker05_BossHired Text  just spared the Boss

Text: When I was young, I was poor. But after years of hard work, I am no longer young.
When the Legion was here, their guards strip-searched everyone. I got more action from them than from my wife!
Thank you for being so nice. You would not believe what those slavers did to us.
They say that during a full moon the Witch has an orgy with her crocodiles! This is her punishment for a deal she made with the Devil.
Working for you is like being blessed by the spirits - nothing has really changed, but I feel better.
Feeling better IS living better!
Working for those bandits was exploitation of the people by the other people! When we're working for you, it's just the opposite.
I never hide anything! Please don't hurt me like the Legion did.
I'll do worse. I'll make you fill out your own performance evaluation.
All this started with the Pastor. He was doing some repairs and the workers discovered diamonds under the church. People found out and we all started digging...
God was testing your faith!
I'm considering letting God into my heart, hehe.
But then the Legion got wind of the whole thing and came here swarming like jackals.
I'm exhausted, I can barely stand... I must have been at the Witch's hut, but I don't remember anything.
I feel you, man. Sometimes I can't remember my own name.
She cast a spell on you! You should, um, maybe check for warts.
It often happens when vodka is involved.
I wonder when I will be summoned to the Witch's hut to be horribly and relentlessly used for sex to satisfy the needs of her wicked satanic rituals.
Whoa, man, where do I sign up for this?
Interesting, does she take women for her rituals?... I'm asking for a friend.
They say that in the morning the victims of the wicked Witch are completely drained because they had to fulfill her perverse sexual desires all night long! I'm full of... um, concern.
Beware the Witch! She has great power over minds and bodies. Both spirits and beasts obey her will! Even the lowest form of life, the Legion shitheads, are scared of her.
Our witch is so much greater than that so-called Shaman at the Refugee camp! She has some real power. She can lift any curse and heal any wound, but if you disrespect her, she WILL destroy you!
God bless Lami the Witch! When I sent her gifts, she performed a ritual and told me exactly where and when to dig - and I found three diamond specks the same day!
The Witch doesn't summon men for her wicked rituals anymore. That's a relief... I guess.
Find a purpose for your body that does not include thrusting it into a witch's tent.
Our Witch has bested you, eh? Don't worry, you're not the first.
Why did you kill our Witch?! She was powerful and scary, but... what we are going to do without her guidance?
Sorry, mate. Looks like you'll have to take things into your own hands from now on.
Mining is hard work, but it beats hanging around at the refugee camp... sort of.
Good to have a real job! Much better than searching through the garbage that washes up on the river banks.
I never liked Siegfried. That arrogant bastard would never come near the mine. He did not want to dirty his fancy white suit!
Working in the mine is hard, but it's nice to have some money to piss away in the Night Club.
This must be the safest place to mine diamonds in all the valley with you and the Beast protecting us.
I would never steal from you! I'm very happy to be working for you! Please, don't shoot me!
Hehehe. Being boss of diamond mine is fun!
More digging and less crying!
I'll think about it.
Your soldiers are very nice! If someone steals, they shoot only the thief. I've worked at mines where the guards also shoot the thief's friends.
Ach, it's so good to be able to go out in the sun! Not that I have the time for that.
I feel some strange love to this country that fate has bound me to. This is my new Mutterland.
Context: BanterDef Gruselheim_Anywhere_02 Text  Reference to "Dr. Strangelove"

Text: It doesn't feel right that no one remembers the War. As if it didn't happen! Sometimes I feel the snow of the years creeping in to bury me.
Context: BanterDef Gruselheim_Anywhere_03 Text  Reference to Vonnegut's "Mother Night"

Text: Siegfried?!...
...Ach, it's you. I tend to get confused. Sometimes I'm not sure who I am anymore.
I wonder what happened to my friend Dr. Richter and his Helium-3 project.
Context: BanterDef Gruselheim_Anywhere_06 Text  Reference to "Iron Sky"

Text: The Diesel Klinik is doing well. All parameters are optimal.
I restored the production of Wunderfrostschutzmittel. It has so many medical uses! In a few years, we may turn this country into a leader in the field of cryotechnology .
When we finally harness the regenerative properties of Wunderfrostschutzmittel, natural selection will stop playing a definitive role in human evolution.
Context: BanterDef Gruselheim_DieselClinic_04 Text  Vague reference to "Idiocracy".

Text: Sometimes I worry that with Wunderfrostschutzmittel, I have started a chain reaction that might destroy the entire world.
I can handle the science, we already have a vaccine! But I can't handle people. How could they not care about their health?!
People just refuse to vaccinate. I'm thinking of an ultimate solution based on aerosol formula that can be delivered by spraying from a plane.
The methods of Dr. Kronenberg have proven to be remarkably effective, especially considering her limited resources at the time.
Dr. Kronenberg's medical proficiency is only matched by her people skills. Ach, the tricks she would come up with in order to convince people to take the shot!
White flag! White flag! I surrender!
So, this is the end of Siegfried. Now I can finally capitulate.
Wisdom check successful, Medical check failed There are pages and pages of sketchy doctor's handwriting, and it's all in German. This is too much for a humble mercenary to comprehend.
Medical and Wisdom checks successful The archive shows the lab was in use between 1983 and 1988 for research on the Red Rabies virus.
Wisdom check failed There are pages and pages of sketchy doctor's handwriting, and it's all in German. This is too much for a humble mercenary to comprehend.

<medical-f>
It is not clear what is kept inside, but it certainly doesn't look safe.
The chemical installation contains isolated prototype of a bio weapon.
Whoever used explosives to break into the Drop, apparently didn't know about this tunnel. The railroad seems intact and can be repaired.
Operation is available: Clear the tracks
Some tunnel sections are collapsed.
Mechanical check failed The machine has sheets of paper inside with little holes punched in them.
Mechanical check successful, Medical check failed The punch cards of the machine contain incomprehensible medical data.

Medical and Mechanical check successful According to the log, this cryo chamber was used quite a few times: 1945-1955, 1958-1968, 1973-1983, 1988-1998. The medical condition of Dr. Gruselheim who was held inside has been deteriorating with every procedure.
The chamber seems to be occupied.

<mechanical-f>
The modern computer is somehow connected to a piece of older analogue technology.

The reads from the cryo chambers are relayed to a computer, with a name and military rank for every chamber conveniently stored on ultra-modern floppy disks. It seems that all occupants are Nazi officers from WWII.

<wisdom-f>
The chaotic collection of documents in German require the efforts of a whole team of manic archivists.
Patient sorting of the archive reveals a production timeline of the combat drug Diesel between 1968 and 1973, and then in 1998-1999.
<medical-f>
The retorts contain unknown bubbling substances that are better left alone.
<medical-s>
The retorts contain precursors for production of the powerful combat drug Diesel.

Wisdom check successful, Mechanical check failed Mechanical schematics on one hand, and the German language on the other are hard enough when taken separately. Together, they are not a challenge for the faint-hearted.
Mechanical and Wisdom check successful The research tables contain extensive documentation about the development of Kompositum 58 - a wonderful new armor material produced between 1955 and 1958.
Wisdom check failed Mechanical schematics on one hand, and the German language on the other are hard enough when taken separately. Together, they are not a challenge for the faint-hearted.
Red, I do not see in manual anything about "dummy button."
That is because it is not in the manual, lad. "Dummy button" is what I call a "dead man's switch."
Oh. Of this, I have heard. Very dangerous.

Daft is what it is! Holding a trigger down with your hand - pffft! Too many damn things can go wrong - and they always do! Explosives are like women - they dinnae want ye to hold their hands, they just want to slap ye!
Uh... I will make note of this in margin.
Hey, Magic, let me ask you something, man. What is "soul food"?
Come on, man. Ain't no brother alive don't know what soul food is.
Well, this brother doesn't. Is it Angel Food Cake? Deviled Eggs? That sort of thing?
Shiiiiiit... Blood, we got to get you stateside, man.
Omryn, what are you eating?
Egg Surprise.
But... the shells are still on those eggs.
Is like candy coating. Here, try.
...GAH! Omryn! These are raw!
Yes! Sometimes there is baby chick. Egg Surprise!
Why are you against eating meat, Thor?
I am not against eating meat, I am against cruelty to animals. Most animals are made to suffer so we may eat them.
But don't plants suffer when we eat them?
Plants do not feel pain.
You wouldn't be saying that if you ever watched me stuff a pepper!
Helmut, why are you fidgeting?
It is this soap I am using. The bars come in all sorts of adorable shapes, like grenades and landmines and such! They are so much fun at bath time, but I fear they may have given me a rash.
Bar soap. Helmut?! You are using bar soap? How many times have I told you - liquid soap for sensitive skin!
Oh, mein Liebchen, you scold me exactly as Mother would! I... meant that in a good way.
I am aware of that, but it might benefit you to know that it is not quite the compliment you believe it to be.
But it is my highest compliment!
That man in the fedora... What was his name? Veinard? He's a bit eccentric, don't you think?
I daresay he is at that, but I suppose one must be a bit of a nutter to take up treasure hunting as an occupation.
I agree whole-heartedly, Sidney. Marching into dangerous territory to dig up some old treasure that might not even exist is madness!
Yes. Far better to get paid up front and be allowed to shoot people who get in your way.
Oh Sidney, don't be cheeky!
Someone help me here. Is Buns... flirting?!
Here, this is for you.
What's this? Antimalarial pill?
No. It is a laxative.
How'd you know I been having problems taking a dump? You been spying on me?
No. I simply overheard you in the latrine. You are very... expressive.
These Legion soldiers lack proper training.
Like Peshmerga training?
None of them would survive a single day of training with Peshmerga.
Sounds intense! How about you show me sometime... Or maybe not.
Context: BanterDef FaudaHitman Text  confused at the end

Text: Why are you carrying that stick around?
I think it might be a witch's wand. If we run into any witches, maybe I can exchange it for a wish!
Do you know what I carried with me when I was your age?
A magical amulet that warded off evil spirits?
An AK-47. It gave me all the protection I needed.
Wand is okay. Amulet is better. Kalashnikov is best.
Fidel sees you.
I wasn't trying to hide from you, Fidel.
That is good. It would be very dangerous to creep up on Fidel. You think you are sneaky, but Fidel is the master of surprise! Out of nowhere, two grenades land in your lap - SURPRISE!
I think you and I have very different definitions of surprise.
Yes. Mine is fun. Yours is boring.
Major Spike, I have killed many people. It is great fun for Fidel. What do you think? Fidel is good fit for your Legion?
It's just Spike now, Fidel. And hell yes, boy, you're grade-A prime Legion material.
I knew it! Fidel is very happy this day!
Yeah, but the Legion's dead, boy. Ain't you been paying attention?
Fidel never like to pay for attention.
There's something wrong with you, boy. You know that, right?
Fidel cannot wait to blow something up again!
Do not be standing next to me when you say stuff like that, mon!
But you can help! Just tell me where is best place to put bomb on a car I wish to drive into enemy outpost.
WHAT?! No. No and no and no. Never in my life would I do such a thing! I am opposed to car bombs with every fiber of my being.
Fidel can sense something is upsetting you. I give you some time to calm down. Fidel will ask again later.
Do you see this here? This is one of my favorite trophies!
What? This is your wallet.
It is made from the skin of a man who insulted me in a bar one night. I took him into an alley and skinned him alive. Do you know how long a man can survive without his skin?
No. Please, tell me!
*laughing* I do not know either! I left him that way!
*laughing* You have given Fidel much joy! It is fun to make new friends!
Why do they call you Nails?
Because that's my name... Flay.
Context: BanterDef FlayNails Text  mocking emphasis on "Flay"

Text: So, Nails is what your mother calls you?
You say one more word about my mother and I'll FLAY your ass cheeks and NAIL them to your forehead... Ass-face.
I kinda feel sorry for those Legion boys. Some of them are really cute. Like that last guy who ran away from us. He had the body of a puma. Mrrreow.
Ugh... One with a sense of propriety should know not to give in to such... temptations. Not that I would have expected anything different from you.
So you agree he was a... what was it... temptation? Interesting. Wasn't he a bit too young for you?
*blushing* Missing the point completely as always... And he was not that much younger than me... AND I WAS DEFINITELY NOT LOOKING!
Oh, come on. Loosen up a little!
I think having one loose woman in the squad is more than enough.
I don't know how you do it, Fauda. You're so cool and badass all the time!
There is nothing bad about my ass.
Oh, I didn't mean it like that! I'm sure it's lovely... for a woman your age.
You should watch your mouth, little Fox. I have cut out the tongues of greater warriors over lesser insults.
See, that's what I mean! You don't take crap from anybody. Absolute Queen!
You like her, don't you?
Who?
Emma.
Uh... she's okay. Not really my type.
Mais non! You do not like ze pretty petite French girls?
Context: BanterDef FoxGrizzly Text  exagerrated fake French accent

Text: Gimme a break, Fox...
Why do you people like living here, anyway? It's kind of a shit hole. No offense.
Saying "no offense" after you have clearly intended offense makes what you have said even more offensive.
Well, excuse me, Mr. Sensitive. I'm just saying, I haven't even seen a single bowling alley or ball park since we came here. What do you people do for fun?
You may not believe this, but the worth of a country is not measured in the number of bowling alleys it contains.
Says the guy who's probably never bowled a strike in his life.
I kinda always figured the first president I'd rescue would be our own. Know what I mean, Shadow?
I do. They get elected because most people vote for them, and then halfway through the first term, most people hate them.
Man, you got that right. All politicians instantly turn into jerks as soon as they get into office. I wonder if this LaFontaine guy is any different.
Well, we know one person likes him... and she happens to be co-signing our paychecks.
Igor, I am overcome with curiosity. How much are you getting paid for this contract?
A Dolvich never discloses details of contract, my friend.
That is very professional of you. I respect that. It is too bad, though. I was hoping we could have a nice friendly chat while sharing this bottle of Schnapps I have here.
A Dolvich never discloses details of contract... except to dear friends who come bearing gifts.
Ivan, Mother wanted me to give you something.
It is a book that contains common American expressions. It will help you with your English.
Let me see book. Hmm. HIT THE SACK... Grunty, is book for talk American or torture American?
Well, Mother did say it would be very useful in a variety of situations.
Hey, Len, do an old buddy a favor, would ya? Rub my leg. It's crampin' up like it's got woman problems.
I'm not falling for that again, Gus.
Dang it, Len, last time I just ate too many beans for lunch. Won't happen again. I promise.
Nope. You should have retired, old-timer! Rub your own damn leg.
Okay, okay. Hey, Len, I think my finger is dislocated. Pull it for me, would ya?
Hey, Woodhead, tell me again about that "arthur-scoop" thingee.
Uh, well... For starters, it's called "arthroscopic surgery" not "arthur-scoop thingee."
Oh, settle down, Woodburn. I didn't ask you to pass me a dictionary, I just need to know if it'll fix my leg!
Well, maybe, but mostly it'll help a doctor see what's wrong with it.
I already know what's wrong with it! My dang house fell on it! Not sure why I'm supposed to trust doctors when they can't even spot something as simple as that.
Hey, Grunty, what do you make of this LaFontaine guy? He's from your part of the world, ain't he?
President LaFontaine is from Grand Chien. That is... nowhere near my part of the world.
Oh... I thought he was German. Ain't there a lot of German folks around here?
There are many German folks around everywhere, except - I am guessing - your part of the world.
Hitman's not from any part of the world. He's from Mars.
Omryn, you okay? You look sad.
Yes. This is very sad country. No places to buy convenient snack.
I know what you mean. I'd give my left nut for a candy bar right about now.
I get a knife... to split this candy bar I carry with me, I mean.
*leering* Charlene, it looks like your bandolier is a little loose. Want some help tightening it?
You know, Frank, you're lucky I'm a married woman. It means I have to behave responsibly. If I was single, I'd take this belt off...
Yeah?!
...and use it to tie you up...
YEAH?!
And leave you naked and helpless on top of a colony of fire ants.
OUCH!!!
Honey, that's fine by me. Just make sure you take some pictures.
Yo, Blood, what you readin'?
It is a local recipe for fish stew.
Cool. Break me off some of that.
You want me to... break it?
*laughing* Nah, man. When you cook that shit, imma try some.
Yo, Grizz, check it: New pair of Jordans, baby!
Why waste your money on that crap, Ice? Jordan is overrated. Larry Bird never needed his own shoe.
Oh yes he did, except his were orthopedic. DAMN... I wonder if he can feel that burn from here.
That's a low blow, Ice. The only reason Bird's back hurt so much was from carrying an entire franchise for over a decade!
Do not disrespect Chief like that, Grizz.
Yo, Smiley, man I gotta say... you lucky your ass is still alive.
Yes, I would be lost without seor Apscott's training.
Nah, man. I'm saying Biff is the reason your ass should be dead right now. I bet the only training he gave you was how to be the first one to run away when shit gets real.
Si. Seor Apscott is an expert at tactical withdrawal!
Kalyna, I am sorry about the other day. I did not mean to steal from you. I just needed ammunition.
Then you need to ask me. You cannot just invade my space and take my things!
You were busy talking with others. I was afraid they would think I do not know how to manage my own supplies.
You should never fear something like that, Igor! And if you ask nicely, then they will only think better of you. My babusya taught me that.
Hmmm... My own babushka taught me that having no ammunition is no excuse for being a coward. I see bigger meaning now.
Bobby, I am wondering... Are you thinking there is commendation for biggest muscles?
If there is, you will not win.
No? What if I took your special vitamins away?
What if I took your face away... from your face!
Too much walking makes Igor thirsty. Maybe we can find some vodka around here.
, ,   ! Mission first. Vodka later.)
*laughing* Even great Dolvich family needs a black sheep, Uncle Ivan!
Alejandro, what are you holding in your hands?
Sweet Kalyna, it is just my heart that I hold in my hands.
Oh no! How did it get into your hands? Did a sorceress do this to you?
Perhaps. It only happened just now when I looked at you.
Oh... Well, there is but one thing to do. This is clearly some sort of curse. We need to pluck out your eyes to make sure your heart does not jump around.
Ummm... Actually, I think I'm feeling much better, Kalyna. Thank you!
So, you're a doctor, right?
Yeah, um, yes. Yes, I am.
That's cool, man. So, like, if I get the urge... y'know... you got my back, right?
I... have no idea what you're talking about right now.
To USE, man! If I start to fall off the wagon, you'll get out the cattle prod and the restraints and all the other stuff. Y'know? To keep me straight?
What?! No! Jesus Christ, Larry!
Pffft... And you call yourself a doctor.
Hey, Smiley... I've been wondering something. Why weren't you at Diamond Red, man?
It is a very sad story, my friend. I was waylaid.
Oh wow, man! That sounds bad. Were they bandits or something?
Eh... I guess you could say that. It was the sort of bandit that only steals... hearts.
Oh, I know what you're talking about, man! I knew they stole kidneys, but they're stealing hearts now?! What's this world coming to?
I don't know about this job anymore, man. This whole thing just seems like a bad idea any way you look at it.
You not much good at being plucky sidekick when sober, Larry. I think you should have a drink.
That's not what you're supposed to say to a recovering addict, man!
Did you say shivers, Red? No thanks, man. I already got plenty of shivers.
Chivas! Chivas! It's a scotch whiskey.
Oh... Yeah, that does sound good.
It is good - for a blend. But it's the single malt scotches that you really want to taste. One sip of the Glen Grant and... ah, lad... then you're up in the high country.
Whoa... Yeah, man, I want to be up in the high country!
Ye seem plenty high enough already, lad.
Hey, Tex, I think I saw one of your movies, man.
Really? Which one?
It was the one where you were, like, riding a glowing dinosaur and shooting purple gum drops from your hands at a bunch of zombie rhino people.
Um, Larry? Were you watching movie or huffing paint?
Uh... Not sure. But at the end, you and your friends hopped on a missile and flew across the world to do an awesome dance battle at a wedding.
Oh! You are talking about the Bollywood film I did. I learn many new dance moves for that part!
Heeeeeey, Thor... God of Thunder, right!? What's up, man?
The answer is still "no", Larry.
It's not for me, man! It's for Ted. He gets, like, nervous and stuff. He just needs some of nature's healing... of the opioid variety, y'know?
Larry, I do not possess anything like that. Even if I did, I would throw it away, which is something you should consider doing with your teddy bear. It is beginning to smell like dysentery.
Don't take it personally, Ted. Thor doesn't know about bears. He doesn't know that you're supposed to smell like that.
Context: BanterDef LarryThor Text  talks to his teddy bear

Text: Omryn, is that a feather I see on your weapon?
Yes. Spirit of hawk now lives in weapon.
It's covering the gun sights!
How else will spirit of hawk see target?
Never mind about the damn spirit hawk! How will YOU see the target?
Through spirit of hawk! Pah!
Len, sometimes you remind me of my father.
Oh, yeah? In what way?
You're tough but fair and you have a big heart. Also, you hate it when I put bubble gum on your things.
So that was YOUR bubble gum on my ammo clip, huh? Well, consider yourself in time-out, soldier.

Hey, Red...
Hey, Red...
Heeeey, Reeeeed.
Oh for the love of... What? What is it this time? No, I don't want cashews. No, I don't want almonds or any other nut imaginable.
That is a surprisingly angry response to a very friendly request for your attention. I feel wronged for reasons beyond my behavior and/or knowledge.
Anyway, that chocolate covered almond I gave you is melting in your front pocket.
For fuck's sake! Stay away from me, you chattering demon!
Sidney, I have been wondering about something - why do Englishmen always carry umbrellas?
Ah, well that is because no respectable Englishman ventures forth without a brolly, my dear. It is considered bad form.
And that is because it so often rains in England? I guess that makes sense. But what if you are not in England? Would it still be bad form?
Of course! An Englishman is expected to maintain proper manners wherever he finds himself.
Are you carrying one now, Sidney? I don't see one.
Well, that is because I always keep it right here in my... Did you steal my umbrella?!
Mister... um, Mister Flay? I have some ointment for that scratch on your arm.
I do not need your ointment, boy.
You sure? I mean, you don't want it to get infected.
If it does, then I will cut off my skin and replace it with the skin of some buckhead.
Oh... I think I might be sick.
*lauging* I am - how do you Americans say - fucking with you.
Ice, are you wounded?
Nah, man, I'm cool.
Oh... It's just that... Well, I noticed you're walking with a limp.
Yeah, that's my street strut. It's how I show people I've been through shit and they better not be messing with me.
Oh... Can you teach me?
Nah, man. You've got to be street to walk street.
Context: BanterDef MDIce Text  saying it in a friendly way

Text: Fidel, you got any smoke grenades?
All of Fidel's grenades make smoke! Also, they make explosions... and severed body parts and much screaming.
No, no. I'm talking about a smoke bomb - something I can throw down in front of me so I can do my thing and disappear. Like a magician, ya dig?
Si, but... Why not throw exploding grenades at enemy and make THEM disappear?
It's called showmanship, baby. Gotta save the explosions for the finale.
What you listening to, youngblood?
Mozart.
Say what?! I thought you liked hip-hop and rap and all that.
I do. That don't mean I can't like classical.
Look at my brother getting some class over here. And would you like a glass of Pinot Noir with your swordfish tonight, Mr. Williams?
Come on, Magic, you can't drink red wine with swordfish. It's gauche.
Hey! Guzzleman! What time is it?
Context: BanterDef MeltdownFox Text  deliberate slur of "Guzman"

Text: It's pronounced "Guzzman"... and it's time for you to buy a watch.
I asked for the time, not your sass.
What's the matter? Don't you think my sass is cute?
Ah, hell... Fox, you can take your innuendo and stick it in-your-end-o!
Nails, gimme some gum, will ya?
No.
No? Well, why the hell not?
What do I get out of it?
I'll tell you what you WON'T get. You won't get my foot in your ass. You won't get my knuckles in your crotch. And you won't have to watch me take a dump on your jacket!
Context: BanterDef MeltdownNails Text  voice rising to a shout by the end

Text: Christ, Norma, all you had to do was say please.
...WELL I DON'T KNOW HOW TO DO THAT!
Hey! Needledick!
Context: BanterDef MeltdownSidney Text  deliberate slur of "Nettleson"

Text: Sorry, but it's actually pronounced "Nettleson."
Yeah, well, I ain't too good at pronouncing Limey names. Anyway, I just wanted to say - you fight pretty good for a British guy.
I... am not at all certain how to respond to that.
You're supposed to say "thank you." Sheesh! I thought all you Brits knew how to be polite.
Um, Norma? Can I ask you something?
Yeah, I figured this was coming. Look, kid, you're cute and all but I ain't interested.
What? ...Oh! No. That's not what I was going to ask you about.
Why the hell not? Something wrong with the way I look? Hey, I got guys and girls back home lining up to get in my trailer, if you know what I mean!
Of course! I'm... I'm sure you do. But, say one of those guys or girls upset you, how would they make it up to...
Standard procedure for getting back on Norma's good side is cleaning the bathroom, walking the dogs, getting an apology tattoo, stripping naked and assuming the position.
That is... very specific.
Red, I think one of your boots is untied.
Aye, I know!... Damn women always telling me my business.
Context: BanterDef MouseRed Text  the part after the pause is grumbled

Text: Fine, be that way... Grouchy old chauvinist.
Context: BanterDef MouseRed Text  the part after the pause is grumbled

Text: I'm no chauvinist! I just dinnae want to hear a woman's opinion unless I ask for it!
Red, that is the textbook definition of chauvinism!
Och! You kids with your harassment handbooks and sensitivity seminars... Bah!
Man, I wish I had my bike here. All this walking around is lame.
I know what you mean. I'd give anything for a police cruiser right about now.
Those things suck. I had one on my tail in LA once. I leaned hard and took an exit ramp at speed. The cruiser tried to do the same - flipped over. Man... still makes me smile.
That... That was me!
Hey, Scully, take a look at this.
What do you got there, a picture? Oh... *whistles* She's a beaut, mate.
Yeah, she's one of my favorites. She got a waxing before this picture because I wanted to ride her in front of my pals.
Oh, I bet she liked that!
Yeah, she was roaring and purring all night long.
Well, I'm jealous. I'd love to have a sexy beast like that, but the exes would kill me if I tried to pick up one of my kids from school on a motorcycle.
What is this? Rock candy?
No. That is a meditation crystal. I use it to help align my chakra.
You put chalk... in line?
No. CHAKRA. It's my energy.
Hmmm... I eat food for energy. Also, take naps.
Your untroubled mind inspires me.
What do you read?
What? Oh, this is guidebook for pre-World War Two French land mines.
Where did you find such a thing?
At library near home. I like being in preparation for mission.
I have never been to a library. What is it like?
It is best place in world! Books from everywhere about everything. But you must be quiet. Librarians do not like noise and can kill you with laser eyes.
Why are you staring at me?
Maybe I am fitting you for a pair of horns. What do you think about that?
You don't scare me, Flay. I've fought both for and against bigger monsters than you.
And yet I AM a monster, non? Being in the presence of a monster should cause at least a little fear, n'est-ce pas?
People fear you because you show them their own cowardice. In this, you are like Le Major. The difference between the two of you is... you are honest about it. I have no fear of honesty.
So, Frank, how's the hitman business going?
Ron, I told you - that's just my merc name. There is no evidence anywhere that I was ever employed by any person or persons to murder anyone.
I'm well aware, Frank. I checked. So, I guess you must have that name because you can't stop yourself from hitting on women at every available opportunity.
Hey, that's not true. I can show some discretion.
No, you really can't. Take my wife, for example.
Believe me, I would if she'd let me.
In your dreams, Hennessy!
Ron, honey, let's have a cookout when we get back and invite all the neighbors over.
Great idea! I haven't seen the Flandersons in forever.
Ugh. Maybe not THOSE neighbors. All they ever talk about is their vacations and their jobs.
What's wrong with that?
No one ever gets shot in any of their stories! Not even a single aggravated assault.
Dr Q...
Carl?
Nobody calls me Carl.
And yet I just did. Life is full of little moments of surprise and revelation.
Life is empty of meaning until the moment of death.
There is an ancient Chinese saying: "You say potato, I say potato."
Context: BanterDef ReaperDrQ Text  You say "poTAYto" I say "poTAHto"

Text: I just want to say, I admire your work.
What work do you speak of?
The delivery of death. The noblest profession. You take life with such intensity, yet also with such economy of motion.
You are a very strange man. I am a soldier. This is my job.
You may tell yourself that, but I know you are an avenging angel. The souls you take pass before your brother's spirit before facing their final judgement.
...You talk too much.
When we find the Major, I will take his soul quickly. Without their leader, the Legion will fall apart.
Don't you think we should question him first? Like, maybe ask him where the President is?
If you give a snake room to breathe, it will sink its fangs into you.
Okaaaaay... So, that's a "no" I guess?
Did you enjoy the biscuits, Grunty?
Ja, I certainly did! They were almost exactly like the ones Mother used to bake, except they did not have her special ingredient.
Oh? And what ingredient is that?
Pain. If I reached for a cookie, she would strike my knuckles with a metal spatula and say, "You do not TAKE the cookie. I GIVE you the cookie."
Oh, my! Well, that's certainly an ingredient I shall... have to consider.
Context: BanterDef ScopeGrunty Text  astonished but polite

Text: 900 meters, 8 mile per hour wind, full value, dusk.
Please, I've made that shot in my sleep. How about this: 950 meters, 10 mile per hour wind, full value, dusk... and no scope.
Very nice, love! I'm glad you're getting closer to my level. How about this one: 1,000 meters, 12 mile per hour wind, half value, pre-dawn, moving target... and no scope.
Heard about that. Figured it was you. Two months later, I did the same thing. Okay, try this one: 600 meters, 10 mile per hour wind, full value, pre-dawn... smooth bore.
Smooth bore?! Oh, love, now I know you're lying.
...Damn it.
You can't hide from me... Shadow.
Got any kids, Gus?
Nope. Not that I didn't want any, I just never got around to it.
Want some of mine?
I expect you got more than a few to spare. I don't know how you do it.
Which part? The making of 'em or the raising of 'em?
I think I got the first part figured out, Woodcock, but I'll let you know if I have any questions!
Raven, I don't know how you and Raider manage it. Seems impossible to me.
Marriage isn't easy, Scully. Anyone who says otherwise is hiding something.
Right. Well, that's what I'm getting at. How do you two hide the other people from each other?
What other people?
Right. Gotcha. Mum's the word, eh?
Guess what? Little Sheila took first place in a marksmanship competition.
Oh, Robert, that's wonderful! Is she using the trick I taught her to steady her breathing?
Can't rightly say... Her mum was there, so I couldn't come within five hundred feet. Watched the whole thing through binoculars.
Oh, Robert, I'm so sorry. Divorce can be quite messy. Here, have a biscuit.
You're kind of quiet.
I'M kind of quiet?! What about you? If I don't look directly at you, I usually forget you're there.
Force of habit. Want to talk about it?
Talk about what?
What happened between you and Stella?
...I liked you better when you were quiet.
Hi, Thor.
SCHEISSE!... S-sorry, Shadow. I did not see you approach. I was communing with nature.
Really? I like to commune with nature, too. Sometimes I commune for so long, I forget there's any difference between me and the bush I'm hiding in.
I have very little difficulty believing that is true.
I say, Spragg old chap, I rather enjoyed that explosive bit of work you did the other day.
I dinnae do it for the applause, but... thank ye.
I could not help but wonder if perhaps you used a tad too much. Just a smidge. It was a bit loud.
Well, I wanted to make sure the job got done right... I wasn't thinking of your tender eardrums, ya fantoosh sassenach.
Context: BanterDef SidneyRed Text  after pause, all said under his breath - "fantoosh" is pretentious, "sassenach" is Scottish derogatory for a British person

Text: Sheila, those biscuits were the very thing! I am reminded of that time we were in Amsterdam.
Amsterdam?! Oh god, those biscuits were sinful! The Dutch use an indecent amount of butter.
Yes, but we made do with them until our target arrived.
And then you went out wearing that ridiculous bowler hat and distracted him.
Well, it worked, didn't it? And I thought I looked quite dashing.
I suppose you did, at that... right up until my head shot splattered his brains all over you. Terribly sorry about that, love.
I could not help but notice your hands. They are very strong and yet also delicate and feminine.
What you be talking about? They usually covered in gun grease or motor oil.
You know what I would like to see those hands do?
You be very careful what words be coming out your mouth next, boy.
I would like to watch you paint. I would love to give you a brush and watch your hands work magical strokes.
You keep your nasty little paintbrush in your pants, ya rude boy!
Made your mind up about me yet, kid?
I have decided to think of you as I think of all foreigners. You are a child playing in a sandbox, building castles and then knocking them down.
Well... You ain't wrong, kid. But, it's your sandbox, so what are you gonna do about it?
That is the part I have not made up my mind about yet.
You're the assassin, right?
We are all assassins... Major.
Context: BanterDef SpikeReaper Text  sarcastic emphasis on "Major"

Text: Enough with that Major crap. Just call me Spike. Listen, I need you to do me a favor.
And what favor would that be... Spike?
When we get to the end of this and they come to take me away and throw me into some kind of hell hole prison for war criminals... I want you to... take me out.
...I would enjoy that.
Hey, Grizzly, what were you doing during that last combat?
I was fighting, Bobby. I don't have to ask what you were doing. I saw you oiling your chest!
It is important to portray proper pump-osity in front of the enemy! Do not even pretend you were not doing the same. I saw you rip your shirt to show off your abs!
I... I thought I got hit!
You did not. I was looking very closely.
Where are my vitamins!? They are missing! Larry, did you take them?
What? No way, man. I only took the red ones... and the yellow ones... and maybe some blue ones.
Larry! You took ALL of them?!
Don't be silly, man. I stuffed the rest of them in my underwear, so you wouldn't find them. Hey, man... these vitamins are great. We should work out... right after the sky stops melting.
*laughing* You are the funniest little man I ever met! Imagine you trying to work out with me?! Now, give me my vitamins back.
Yeah, man, I would... But my underwear is WAAAAY down there... When did I get so tall?
Steroid, what is best in life?
Going for a personal best when getting pumped and ripped!
Huh? No, no. Say the line from the movie you were in - the one with the swords and sorcery!
I told you, that wasn't me. You do not listen! And if you do not listen, then to hell with you!
Context: BanterDef TexSteroid Text  Last line is Conan reference

Text: Hey, partner, I got great idea for movie. "Tex and the Wolf."
Huh... Really? You want me to be in a movie with you?
No, it will be me and a wolf you will provide.
Wait... You think I own a wolf?
Why else they call you Wolf?
Why do they call you Tex? You sure as shit aren't from the Lone Star State!
Dr. Dawson, I was wondering if you have heard about Reiki?
No, I don't think so. Is that someone I need to be afraid of?
No, it is an alternative medicine technique where healing energies are passed from one to another without physical contact.
Oh, that sounds... really neat. Can it heal gun shot wounds?
...No, but it can help heal several undiagnosable illnesses.
Okay, great. I'll look into it. In the meantime, I'll keep putting my hands in people and taking out bullets.
These Legion soldiers all be terrible shots!
Their inability to aim does not offend me nearly as much as their inability to wash themselves.
Ya, mon. They smell almost as bad as that rotten fish stew we had the other night.
It wasn't fish, it was crocodile... and don't remind me.
Yeah, sorry. I'm still working on that recipe.
I enjoyed it! Good texture. Good flavor.
Hey! That be one of mi head wraps! What you be doing with it?
Apologies, Ms. Waters. I borrowed it.
Well, you gonna be unborrowing it right now, I think!
Of course. I hope you do not mind, but I took the liberty to inscribe upon it the Chinese symbol for balance.
Oh? Well, that be nice of you, mon, but I got pretty good balance.
I was not referring to physical balance. You have astounding spiritual energy, but it is focused in your hands. This will help you distribute it more evenly, when necessary.
Hmpf. We see about that.
Hey, Barry, you doing okay? You seem a little jittery.
It is nothing. I have perhaps taken too much coffee.
So it's not the bullets and the explosions or anything like that?
I have perhaps taken too much of those as well, but no - it is the coffee.
Hey there, foxy lady. How's about you and me sneak off into the bushes and you can show me how you like to hunt for nuts.
Oh, and maybe we'll find a couple of melons and you can show me how you determine if they're ripe.
Sure thing, baby. I think I've got just the right tool for the job...
I don't know how much more of this I can take.
Oh, for the love of... Will you two just get a room already?!
Wow! You both are interested in so many things. That's nice!
Hey, Ivan, you want some water? You look thirsty.
Yes. I make water.
Ummm... You TAKE. With a "t." You take the water.
Take, make.  ?
Quite a bit when you're talking about my canteen!

Text: The soul of my brother rejoices in our victory! This is a good day.

Text: Magnifique! But what shall I hunt now?

Text: I am in possession of much fulfillment from this success! And I am thanking god I have retained all of my extremities.

Text: No better taste than the taste of victory! Well, maybe a nice chili con carne has it beat, but not by much.

Text: I am satisfied that I performed as superlatively as I always do. I know this wouldn't have been possible without me, so I feel this victory is one in which I can take some measure of pride.

Text: This was a damn fine victory. You should all feel proud of yourselves. Working with you has been an honor and a privilege. And, commander? Nice work.

Text: This was one hell of a ride, Scooter. Thanks for the invite. I'm gonna take off and see what kind of trouble I can get myself into. See you down the road.
Context: BanterDef Radio_EmmaFinal_MercInterjections Text  Triggered after resolving all 3 final quests  radio

Text: That was a hell of an operation, but we handled it. Nice work everyone. Well... it's been real, it's been fun, but it hasn't been real fun. Actually, that's not true. Sorry. I suck at goodbyes.
Context: BanterDef Radio_EmmaFinal_MercInterjections Text  Triggered after resolving all 3 final quests  radio

Text: We have reached the end at last, but I feel my dark work is not yet finished. I must depart and continue my journey. Until we meet again.
Context: BanterDef Radio_EmmaFinal_MercInterjections Text  Triggered after resolving all 3 final quests  radio

Text: Well, ya tried yer best to kill me, ya bastard, but ol' Red is still here. I dinnae think this group of hooligans was gonna pull it off, but we managed it. Keep in touch, but don't bother me!
Context: BanterDef Radio_EmmaFinal_MercInterjections Text  Triggered after resolving all 3 final quests  radio

Text: Well done, everyone! That was first-rate work. I'd stay and chat, but I must get home to my kids before they burn the house down. Ta!
Context: BanterDef Radio_EmmaFinal_MercInterjections Text  Triggered after resolving all 3 final quests  radio

Text: I have to say, I'm feeling very proud of myself. I made it through this whole campaign and didn't get married even once. I feel like I learned some important lessons.
Context: BanterDef Radio_EmmaFinal_MercInterjections Text  Triggered after resolving all 3 final quests  radio

Text: I'm not the kind of person that shows much, but... I think we did some good work here and that makes me feel glad. Good working with you all. I'm going to go disappear for a while.
Context: BanterDef Radio_EmmaFinal_MercInterjections Text  Triggered after resolving all 3 final quests  radio

Text: I cannot wait to tell the lads at the bridge club how well this mission went. It was a smashing success! Damn good working with all of you. Sorry, but I must be off. Cheerio!
Context: BanterDef Radio_EmmaFinal_MercInterjections Text  Triggered after resolving all 3 final quests  radio

Text: Well, I'll be damned. You actually did it. Not sure what that means for me, but I expect I'll soon find out.
Context: BanterDef Radio_EmmaFinal_MercInterjections Text  Triggered after resolving all 3 final quests  radio

Text: All of our enemies have been properly pummel-fied! It makes me feel powerful. Excuse me, I need to go lift now. It is a day of achievementals. Time to go for a personal best.
Context: BanterDef Radio_EmmaFinal_MercInterjections Text  Triggered after resolving all 3 final quests  radio

Text: We rounded 'em all up, partner! This is best posse I ever rode with! Now I ride into sunset. Happy trails!
Context: BanterDef Radio_EmmaFinal_MercInterjections Text  Triggered after resolving all 3 final quests  radio

Text: I feel like we all achieved something special here today. Hold onto this feeling. Let it guide you in life. I love you all and I feel all of your love. I'm going to go meditate.
Context: BanterDef Radio_EmmaFinal_MercInterjections Text  Triggered after resolving all 3 final quests  radio

Text: This was a real victory here, mon! I be so proud of this whole team. Next time you need some help, don't be hesitating to call on Vicki Waters.
Context: BanterDef Radio_EmmaFinal_MercInterjections Text  Triggered after resolving all 3 final quests  radio

Text: That was some solid leadership, chief. This team is full of some colorful characters, but you really pulled 'em all together. Nice job. Keep in touch, all right?
Context: BanterDef Radio_EmmaFinal_MercInterjections Text  Triggered after resolving all 3 final quests  radio

Text: My father would be so proud of you, because you fought to save his beloved country! Now this is my fight as well. Thank you for showing me the meaning of courage, resilience and valor.
Context: BanterDef Radio_EmmaFinal_PresidentDead Text  Triggered after resolving all 3 final quests  radio

Text: I knew that I have trusted the right people! Thanks to you, my father is still alive - but moreover, you fought to save my beloved country! Thank you for showing me the meaning of courage, resilience and valor.
Context: BanterDef Radio_EmmaFinal_PresidentSaved Text  Triggered after resolving all 3 final quests  radio

Text: My father... He didn't make it, did he? I was holding on to hope and you seemed so close to rescuing him...
Context: BanterDef Radio_EmmaPresidentDead Text  Triggered after taking the Major's Camp  radio

Text: But no, I understand that you did what you could. Even more, you got in trouble yourselves while trying to help me. I won't forget that. I'll see what I can do to help you in turn.
Context: BanterDef Radio_EmmaPresidentDead Text  Triggered after taking the Major's Camp  radio

Text: My father just called me... You really did it! He is alive and well! I cannot thank you enough. You not only helped a daughter, you saved a country!
Context: BanterDef Radio_EmmaPresidentSaved Text  Triggered after taking the Major's Camp  radio

Text: But I'm getting carried away. You got in trouble yourselves while helping me. I won't forget that. I'll see what I can do to help you in turn.
Context: BanterDef Radio_EmmaPresidentSaved Text  Triggered after taking the Major's Camp  radio

Text: Emma LaFontaine, if you're listening to this - your father is a fool and so are you. You think you can stop the Legion with a bunch of mercenaires? Think again!
And you, mercenaire dogs! You have defied the Legion and attacked my village. For this insult, you will pay with your life. Pierre over.
(to do) Examine Marker 1
Why do you look like that? Have you been drinking again?
Non, ma chre! I've been playing chess.
But you reek of alcohol!
Geez, do you want me to reek of chess?!
Why do you think they came here and fought the Legion?
I don't know, but I guess you and your friends have got some crazy theory.
It is not a crazy theory! I know for sure! These foreigners plan to install 3G towers in order to brainwash us and make us stupid!
I wonder if they have done it already.
What do you mean by that?!
Nothing, my love. I am just agreeing with you.
Emmanuel, you have a smudge on your cheek.
Keep your distance, citizen!
Is that what you call your mother?! Give me your hanky at once, or you'll feel the back of my hand!
Mom... Stop it!
Well, I did it. I went to the Red House yesterday.
You joined the Communists?
Of course not. I went to see if I could get my toaster oven back. I let them borrow it during Carnival.
And?
They didn't give it to me. They said it belonged to the people now. Called it the People's Toaster Oven.
But aren't you one of the people?!
They said I could use it but I have to fill out a form, pay a tax, and wait for my request to be processed.
The Carnival costumes were really something this year.
Yes! I especially liked those foreigners dressed up like commandos! Very cute!
Yes. Not very convincing costumes, but they were very funny.
Remember when that firecracker went off and they dropped their guns and started running everywhere?
And bumping into each other and falling down! I've never laughed harder in my life.
I saw my husband at Le Lys Rouge.
Oh, no! Maybe he only went in for a drink?
No one goes into Le Lys Rouge for just a drink! He fucked a whore, I know he did.
That doesn't seem like Robert at all. How can you be sure?
Because it was me! I was the whore. I had a mask and corset and cheap perfume and everything!
Those Commandos are nice, but soon they will leave and then the Legion will return.
I heard that the Shaman was a Commando himself!
Then why didn't he deal with the Legion?
I don't know... Perhaps the Spirits forbid him from killing.
They didn't forbid him from killing my only chicken and cooking it.
Maybe your chicken was possessed by a demon!
I saw old Sangoma hiding in the toilets.
God and Spirits! This is bad! Do you think demons are chasing him?
Oh, non-non, nothing like that. He is just trying to stay away from that crazy woman, Karen. She is always going to him and complaining about... um, everything.
So I was right. A demon IS chasing him.
...And then she says, "don't do that, sir, it hurts!"
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Civilians_09_Abusers Text  Male voice quest NeverHitAGirl

Text: Ahahaha, the whore got some nerve.
Yeah! I paid for the bitch so I own the bitch, I'll do whatever the fuck I want with her.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Civilians_09_Abusers Text  Male voice quest NeverHitAGirl

Text: Amen, brother.
All this fighting. What's the point in working your ass off when a stray bullet can just ruin everything?
I, I can't... It's too much to bear!
Don't be sad, honey. Dominic was a good donkey, but we'll find another.
Then find one or help me, you idiot! I can't lift what he was carrying by myself!
Old Hyena should just pay the Legion. They'd deal with this asshole Flay in no time! I heard you can pay them for "protection."
Yes, you pay them to protect yourself FROM them. That's how "protection" works.
Oh... So we should pay Flay to keep him from killing us?
Judging by the horns he's nailing into the heads of dead poachers, I don't think he's interested in money.
I wish we were more like Wlad and the Beast.
At least one of us is just like them.
What do you mean?!
Umm...
Are you saying that we also fight all the time, but unlike her, I still have patience for your bullshit?
Yeah. Totally.
The Major himself was one of the mercenaires, believe it or not!
Last week you were convinced that he is an alien from Alpha Centauri.
That too!
And I bet he's responsible for the chemtrails?
Don't be silly. Those are done by the government.
Le Gouverneur's weapon regulation is getting absurd! Okay, I can see why I need a license for owning a gun, but a machete license is just crazy!
You still got access to axes.
Nope. He banned them last week... not that the Legion and other murderers let his regulations stop them.
Well, I'm looking forward to my hoe license.
Mr. Ditch, isn't it time for my paycheck?
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Civilians_16_Hermit Text  when Hermit and Butler are reunited >> Proud

Text: But of course, Mr. Luthando. In what currency would you like to receive it this month?
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Civilians_16_Hermit Text  when Hermit and Butler are reunited >> Proud

Text: I think parsley leaves will do, Mr. Ditch.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Civilians_16_Hermit Text  when Hermit and Butler are reunited >> Proud

Text: Very well, Mr. Luthando. Here, I even added a bonus in rosemary.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Civilians_16_Hermit Text  when Hermit and Butler are reunited >> Proud

Text: Thank you very much, Mr. Ditch! I will make sure to deposit them in the cooking pot.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Civilians_16_Hermit Text  when Hermit and Butler are reunited >> Proud

Text: My man was taken by Lami the Witch yesterday night. Curse her black heart!
Oh, that's horrible! Does he remember anything? Any details? What about the wicked sexual rituals she performs on our men?
Non... I don't know! He acts very confused and says he can't remember. He better be telling the truth, because if he's lying to me, THEN he will see what a witch I can be.
If the Legion means to recapture the Docks at night, how will they know who is on their side and who is not?
Don't be stupid, woman! They will bring flashlights.
But... Wouldn't that make them easy to shoot at?
Yes, but the defenders will have their own flashlights, so they will also be easy to shoot at.
Then what is the point of fighting at night at all?
Because it would be silly to name an invasion plan operation N-Night and have it take place during the day!
Nothing of what you have just said makes any sense.
That is why women should not to go to war - they worry too much about things making sense.
I heard that they are training Militia to man the Fort. I think I will volunteer!
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Civilians_19_Ernie Text  >> +1 Militia at the Fort

Text: Don't think you can escape that easily! You have too much to do at home. Shall I show you the list again?
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Civilians_19_Ernie Text  >> +1 Militia at the Fort

Text: Good idea! You go and get it. I'll, um... meet you back here later.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Civilians_19_Ernie Text  >> +1 Militia at the Fort

Text: +1 Fort L'Eau Bleu Militia
It's all her doing!
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Civilians_20_Farmland Text  >> quests Ted and Witch - Given

Text: Wait, I thought she was just enchanting men and using them for sex, not... playing with toys.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Civilians_20_Farmland Text  >> quests Ted and Witch - Given

Text: Yes, but AFTER she satisfies her needs with them, the Witch turns them into teddy bears and sends them to kill people and take their kidneys.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Civilians_20_Farmland Text  >> quests Ted and Witch - Given

Text: God and Spirits!
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Civilians_20_Farmland Text  >> quests Ted and Witch - Given

Text: That's why I sell protection. You should buy some!
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Civilians_20_Farmland Text  >> quests Ted and Witch - Given

Text: Uh, I doubt you have my size.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Civilians_20_Farmland Text  >> quests Ted and Witch - Given

Text: You first take cover, then take aim...
I know how it's done. I've seen it in movies!
Non-non, it's not the same!
Come on! You just point the gun and shoot like this! Uhh... Why does it not shoot?
You forgot to disengage the safety.
Aaaah... They don't show that part in the movies.
Hey mom, did you see me shoot? See that wall? I just wrecked it! The enemy stands no chance!
I'm so proud of you, mon coeur! I wish your father was alive to see you.
What?! What happened to dad?
He died of drinking and womanizing... and also of being behind the wall you just wrecked.
What do you do if you got no gun and there is enemy nearby?
You shoot him with pistol.
What if no bullets in pistol?
You throw a knife, or try to kill him with machete.
But if you have no gun, no pistol bullets, no knife and no machete, and still meet enemy? Then kill him with karate, oui?
Non-non. Then you just die. The fool who goes to war without gun, pistol, or machete must not survive to make babies.
Which spirit animal gives more power? The lion or the elephant?
The gun.
The gun is no spirit animal!
Then you have not heard mine roar, nor seen it bite.
Gerard! What is in that bottle? Have you been drinking on duty?
Me? Non, Aloise... I mean, constable! Non! Me... be doing them logistiques.
Um... Logistics?
Oui! You said we needed more bottles for target practice.
Give me that bottle.
Hey, can you take my patrol next week?
Again?! What is it this time? Another dead relative?
Of course, it is! We are in the middle of a war zone!
Okay, okay... but before my next patrol, one of MY relatives gets to die!
If I hear one more civilian thank me for my service, I am going to run away and join the circus.
They are being respectful! You don't like that?
I feel like they are patting my head and saying, "Good dog!"
Would you prefer belly rubs?
What do you think of the new owners?
Not sure. To me, they are just more foreigners with guns... The foremen and managers are afraid of them, so that's nice.
Huh... They are not that scary, but maybe a bit crazy.
Just like your mother-in-law, he-he.
Oh non, she IS scary. Why do you think I am always first to arrive for work?
One time when I was digging I cut into some cavity... A grave!
What grave? The Legion bury somebody, maybe?
Non-non! Actual grave! Old tomb with skeleton and everything.
Uh, I see. Anything valuable?
Non. Just old bones and some dumb clay tablets with strange symbols on them.
Tough luck! Those tablets may even be cursed! If it was me, I smash them and run out of there, holding my breath the whole time.
Do I look like a fool to you? That's exactly what I did.
Remember what the Pastor said? We delved too greedily and too deep, and have awoken a dragon who will eat our souls!
Well, I see no dragon, and the Legion shot the Pastor anyway.
Exactly! Don't you see? THEY are the dragon! The holy man knew right from the start!
That much is true - he was the first to start digging. If you ask me, he just wanted to scare us so there would be more diamonds for himself.
I need the money, but I can't take it anymore.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Workers_05_DiamondRed Text  hired Graaf >> Guilty

Text: Because of Graaf?
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Workers_05_DiamondRed Text  hired Graaf >> Guilty

Text: I just... He calls me names and acts like he is still our overseer and we are still slaves.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Workers_05_DiamondRed Text  hired Graaf >> Guilty

Text: Why don't you tell that to les mercenaires? They seem to be reasonable guys.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Workers_05_DiamondRed Text  hired Graaf >> Guilty

Text: They are the ones who made him Foreman, non? They only care about the profits.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Workers_05_DiamondRed Text  hired Graaf >> Guilty

Text: Damn it, those assholes of the night shift have scattered my tools again!
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Workers_06_OldDiamond Text  >> Old Diamond quest

Text: What night shift? Man, there is no night shift.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Workers_06_OldDiamond Text  >> Old Diamond quest

Text: Of course there is. They come to dig a bit after we leave.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Workers_06_OldDiamond Text  >> Old Diamond quest

Text: Then they must be using beach shovels, because I don't see much of a change.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Workers_06_OldDiamond Text  >> Old Diamond quest

Text: Huh... Maybe they are just really bad at mining.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Workers_06_OldDiamond Text  >> Old Diamond quest

Text: Then I do not understand why le directeur lets them work at all.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Workers_06_OldDiamond Text  >> Old Diamond quest

Text: New mining pick, new uniform... same old shit.
Hey, if you don't like it, you can always join the militia.
Non. I'll take risking my neck for diamonds over risking it protecting my neighbor's chickens... I hate my neighbor.
What did you bring to eat?
Just the boring same old thing - chicken, dates, and a banana.
I will trade you my nuts for your banana.
You are not even going to ask me for a date first?!
Whose turn is it to take out the piss bucket?
Context: BanterDef GhostStories_OverheardConversation_Legion Text  Legion at the Abandoned Mansion >> quest Ghost Stories

Text: Don't look at me, boss, I did it yesterday.
Context: BanterDef GhostStories_OverheardConversation_Legion Text  Legion at the Abandoned Mansion >> quest Ghost Stories

Text: Bullshit! You dropped it when you thought you saw a damn ghost! Now the whole staircase stinks like hell.
Context: BanterDef GhostStories_OverheardConversation_Legion Text  Legion at the Abandoned Mansion >> quest Ghost Stories

Text: But I did see a ghost! All white, hovering above the ground, with giant horns and blood red eyes like... like a demon!
Context: BanterDef GhostStories_OverheardConversation_Legion Text  Legion at the Abandoned Mansion >> quest Ghost Stories

Text: Maybe you looked in the fucking mirror. Now stop smoking that shit and go do the job, or you won't get any share of the treasure when we find it.
Context: BanterDef GhostStories_OverheardConversation_Legion Text  Legion at the Abandoned Mansion >> quest Ghost Stories

Text: Any idea what those Legion assholes are doing out there in the Mansion?
Context: BanterDef GhostStories_OverheardConversation_Thugs_01 Text  Fleatown Thugs >> quest Ghost Stories

Text: Searching for a buried treasure.
Context: BanterDef GhostStories_OverheardConversation_Thugs_01 Text  Fleatown Thugs >> quest Ghost Stories

Text: Really? What treasure?
Context: BanterDef GhostStories_OverheardConversation_Thugs_01 Text  Fleatown Thugs >> quest Ghost Stories

Text: Your mum.
Context: BanterDef GhostStories_OverheardConversation_Thugs_01 Text  Fleatown Thugs >> quest Ghost Stories

Text: Fuck you!
Context: BanterDef GhostStories_OverheardConversation_Thugs_01 Text  Fleatown Thugs >> quest Ghost Stories

Text: Okay, okay, calm down. They say the briefcase of the guy who owned the place is hidden somewhere, chock full of money.
Context: BanterDef GhostStories_OverheardConversation_Thugs_01 Text  Fleatown Thugs >> quest Ghost Stories

Text: I see... I wouldn't sleep there even for a briefcase of money. That place is haunted.
Context: BanterDef GhostStories_OverheardConversation_Thugs_01 Text  Fleatown Thugs >> quest Ghost Stories

Text: By your mum?
Context: BanterDef GhostStories_OverheardConversation_Thugs_01 Text  Fleatown Thugs >> quest Ghost Stories

Text: I'll shoot you in the face.
Context: BanterDef GhostStories_OverheardConversation_Thugs_01 Text  Fleatown Thugs >> quest Ghost Stories

Text: Do you have any questions?
Context: BanterDef Hermit02_timer Text  Mike has just poisoned some Legion soldiers with mushrooms

Text: Uh, you sure those 'shrooms were safe to eat?
Context: BanterDef Hermit02_timer Text  Mike has just poisoned some Legion soldiers with mushrooms

Text: Of course they are! They are gifts from Mother Nature! Anything that is natural is good for your health, right?
Context: BanterDef Hermit02_timer Text  Mike has just poisoned some Legion soldiers with mushrooms

Text: I don't know, man, I have a funny feeling in my stomach.
Context: BanterDef Hermit02_timer Text  Mike has just poisoned some Legion soldiers with mushrooms

Text: Ah, you see? That is how fast good natural food will make you feel better and younger and full of energy!
Context: BanterDef Hermit02_timer Text  Mike has just poisoned some Legion soldiers with mushrooms

Text: But I don't need to be any younger!
Context: BanterDef Hermit02_timer Text  Mike has just poisoned some Legion soldiers with mushrooms

Text: Yes, but your organs need to be cleared of toxins. These mushrooms are known to have a detox effect of one hundred seventy eight percent!
Context: BanterDef Hermit02_timer Text  Mike has just poisoned some Legion soldiers with mushrooms

Text: That's, uh, a lot I guess?
Context: BanterDef Hermit02_timer Text  Mike has just poisoned some Legion soldiers with mushrooms

Text: Absolutely, considering the junk food you young people seem to be eating all the time.
Context: BanterDef Hermit02_timer Text  Mike has just poisoned some Legion soldiers with mushrooms

Text: Well, I've definitely never had mushrooms like these before!
Context: BanterDef Hermit02_timer Text  Mike has just poisoned some Legion soldiers with mushrooms

Text: And you never will again! Mushrooms like these are eaten once in a lifetime! I mean, they are quite rare.
Context: BanterDef Hermit02_timer Text  Mike has just poisoned some Legion soldiers with mushrooms

Text: I... don't feel very well...
Context: BanterDef Hermit02_timer Text  Mike has just poisoned some Legion soldiers with mushrooms

Text: Fuck, my stomach hurts like hell... Those mushrooms must be poisonous!
Context: BanterDef Hermit02_timer Text  Mike has just poisoned some Legion soldiers with mushrooms

Text: Hey, this fucker is trying to kill us!
Context: BanterDef Hermit02_timer Text  Mike has just poisoned some Legion soldiers with mushrooms

Text: What the fuck, man! Your goddamned scarecrow is glowing again! I told you to dismantle that fucking... thing!
Context: BanterDef IlleMoratMarauders_EffigyLitNight_setpiece Text  sounds scared Beast - when Effigy lit

Text: Oh, no, it's too late! It is detecting the Beast!!! What do we do?
Context: BanterDef IlleMoratMarauders_EffigyLitNight_setpiece Text  pretends to be scared Beast - when Effigy lit

Text: What do you mean, too late?! Is it already... around here?
Context: BanterDef IlleMoratMarauders_EffigyLitNight_setpiece Text  sounds scared Beast - when Effigy lit

Text: This is not good, man. It's not good!
Context: BanterDef IlleMoratMarauders_EffigyLitNight_setpiece Text  terrified; vague "Aliens" reference - "Game over, man. Game over!" Beast - when Effigy lit

Text: Fuck it! I'm not afraid of no man.
Context: BanterDef IlleMoratMarauders_EffigyLitNight_setpiece Text  reference to "The Predator" Beast - when Effigy lit

Text: But the Beast is out there waiting for us... and it ain't no man!
Context: BanterDef IlleMoratMarauders_EffigyLitNight_setpiece Text  reference to "The Predator" Beast - when Effigy lit

Text: Goddammit old man, hurry up with the repairs! I don't want to spend the night in this dunghole.
Context: BanterDef IlleMoratMarauders_approach Text  trying to hide his fear Beast - initial set piece

Text: Why, mister? Are you afraid of the Beast?
Context: BanterDef IlleMoratMarauders_approach Text  Beast - initial set piece

Text: Hell no! It's just... um, these fucking mosquitoes. What do you feed them to get them to grow this big?
Context: BanterDef IlleMoratMarauders_approach Text  pretending not to be scared Beast - initial set piece

Text: They say they breed on the bodies of the Beast's victims, mister. Of course, that is just some silly superstition.
Context: BanterDef IlleMoratMarauders_approach Text  Beast - initial set piece

Text: Of course it is! You idiots believe in all kinds of bullshit... Now stop blabbering and do your fucking job!
Context: BanterDef IlleMoratMarauders_approach Text  Beast - initial set piece

Text: Yeah! We have, uh... stuff to do!
Context: BanterDef IlleMoratMarauders_approach Text  pretending not to be scared Beast - initial set piece

Text: Return the diamond or suffer the consequences!
Context: BanterDef NowhereTiggered02_Marauders Text  Middle of Nowhere - when MaraudersSpawned; enemy squad NowhereMarauders

Text: Oh my! What consequences do you mean?
Context: BanterDef NowhereTiggered02_Marauders Text  Middle of Nowhere - when MaraudersSpawned; enemy squad NowhereMarauders

Text: We'll kill you both and your stupid hyena!
Context: BanterDef NowhereTiggered02_Marauders Text  Middle of Nowhere - when MaraudersSpawned; enemy squad NowhereMarauders

Text: That is not a nice thing to do to a cute little hyena.
Context: BanterDef NowhereTiggered02_Marauders Text  Middle of Nowhere - when MaraudersSpawned; enemy squad NowhereMarauders

Text: What's... eh? Where's me mallet?!
Context: BanterDef NowhereTiggered02_Marauders Text  Middle of Nowhere - when MaraudersSpawned; enemy squad NowhereMarauders

Text: I think I smell a fight.
Time for your security payment, mon ami.
Context: BanterDef PoacherCamp_Legion Text  Poacher Camp - initial set piece

Text: Oh, I thought it was in two weeks...
Context: BanterDef PoacherCamp_Legion Text  Poacher Camp - initial set piece

Text: Actually, it was last week, but we were too potted to move. That's why you will pay double now.
Context: BanterDef PoacherCamp_Legion Text  Poacher Camp - initial set piece

Text: Double!? We don't have that much cash on hand!
Context: BanterDef PoacherCamp_Legion Text  Poacher Camp - initial set piece

Text: Then we'll take whatever we like!
Context: BanterDef PoacherCamp_Legion Text  Poacher Camp - initial set piece

Text: I already told you, monsieur... I can't make it "grow back", the bullet has destroyed the scrotum.
Context: BanterDef RefugeeCamp_Raiders Text  Refugee Camp - initial set piece

Text: Get some magic herb or make a ritual... DO SOMETHING!
