Text: I told you, Noel - don't put your gun in your pants.
Context: BanterDef RefugeeCamp_Raiders Text  Refugee Camp - initial set piece

Text: Today is a good day - King Chicken gave me a second egg for this week and the guards beat me just once!
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Civilians_14_BienChien Text  Camp Bien Chien prisoners

Text: What for? I want some too!
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Civilians_14_BienChien Text  Camp Bien Chien prisoners

Text: Well, go on and look at them the wrong way, that would be enough.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Civilians_14_BienChien Text  Camp Bien Chien prisoners

Text: Not the beating! I'm talking about the egg.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Civilians_14_BienChien Text  Camp Bien Chien prisoners

Text: So you were here when it happened?
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Custom_01_DiamondRed Text  Diamond Red workers

Text: Yeah... That night, I was on guard duty. The captain and half of the boys were in Pantagruel for the Carnival celebrations. Lucky bastards.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Custom_01_DiamondRed Text  Diamond Red workers

Text: Yeah, I was there. It was quite a party... Got blind drunk and the next day I woke up here with a hangover. I thought I died and went straight to hell.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Custom_01_DiamondRed Text  Diamond Red workers

Text: Nah, the actual hell was the night before. The fucking Maquis commies came swarming at us, and then the goddamn foreign commandos appeared, shooting and yelling "Give up, you Legion scum!"
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Custom_01_DiamondRed Text  Diamond Red workers

Text: Really?! They didn't know you were with the army?...
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Custom_01_DiamondRed Text  Diamond Red workers

Text: Nope. Those idiots thought WE were the Legion. You should have seen their faces when the real Legion hit them from behind.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Custom_01_DiamondRed Text  Diamond Red workers

Text: Damn... Well, you must have gotten a good laugh out of that, at least.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Custom_01_DiamondRed Text  Diamond Red workers

Text: Yeah, we were all laughing... Right up until the Legion overran us and took the mine for themselves.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Custom_01_DiamondRed Text  Diamond Red workers

Text: What is taking Bastien's boys so long? I think I heard more gunshots. They were supposed to just sneak past the guards and kidnap the bitch!
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Legion_13_Outlook Text  Stealth hint banters

Text: Take it easy. They probably sneaked in, then shot them. Then, I guess maybe they shot some more of them, or shot them again, just to be sure.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Legion_13_Outlook Text  Stealth hint banters

Text: What if someone sneaks up on us just like that?!
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Legion_13_Outlook Text  Stealth hint banters

Text: Never happen. We are way too smart for that.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Legion_13_Outlook Text  Stealth hint banters

Text: What do we do now? They took the Fort!
Calm down, pal. We'll do our job with or without Santiago, and we'll get our paycheck next week same as usual. We have a contract.
Fuck the contract, man! I'm worried about surviving until next week!
Don't be dramatic. We can handle those amateurs.
Did you know that those A.I.M.-ateurs have chicks with 'em?
You mean like... Female mercs?
Yeah! And you know, there is a special word for female "mercenaries", hehe.
Ehehehe, yeah!
Did you hear the news? They ran into Fort Brigand, guns blazing, and just took it!
Who? A.I.M.? Amateur mercs defeated amateur soldiers. Big deal. Let them try that shit against us.
Y-yeah!...
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Adonis_03 Text  sounds uncertain Faucheux defeated

Text: Did you read the memo?
No, what's up?
They wrecked the Major's place and probably got Scallion as well.
Who did that? Those A.I.M. guys?! I never thought they'd get that far.
Well, Scallion was part of their group not long ago. Amateurs did the amateur, big deal.
Yeah, I guess.
I did not think there would be so many of those A.I.M. mercenaires!
I heard there is at least one company of one hundred soldiers, not to mention the air support...
Non-non, they were at least two hundreds of them!
That explains why they sometimes attack two sectors at the same time.
They shot le Colonel! Those cursed mercenaires just shot him like a petit chien!
Don't worry, that was all part of the plan. Le Colonel knows his job.
What merde plan is this?! He is dead!
It wasn't le Colonel they killed, it surely was his double. He wanted to lure them out and he succeeded!
They took Fort Brigand from us - just like that!
Don't worry, that was all part of the plan. Le Colonel knows his job.
What merde plan is this?!
It was a gesture of good will! Now their forces will be overstretched and our counterattack will be devastating!
What did you do before the Legion?
Chien army.
Ah, that's fucked up.
Wasn't so bad until the new government started preaching shit about peace and democracy and outlawing looting. So, I quit. Ran off with me gun here. You?
Private sector, heh. Blood Diamond gang.
I've heard they're pretty tough.
Yeah, and dumb as fuck.
Of course they are. They brought someone like you into the gang, didn't they?
Well, fuck you too.
Le Major should never have promoted that little shit, Pierre.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Legion_02 Text  Ernie Fort taken, Pierre not reached

Text: Huh?
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Legion_02 Text  Ernie Fort taken, Pierre not reached

Text: Well, he got a whole island and what did he do with it? Couldn't even handle the fucking locals. No wonder those corporate mercenaries kicked his ass.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Legion_02 Text  Ernie Fort taken, Pierre not reached

Text: Guess he should have taken up fishing, like his dad.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Legion_02 Text  Ernie Fort taken, Pierre not reached

Text: You know, after we lost the mine, I drew the short straw and had to go make a report.
Yeah? Le Major was furious, non?
I was scared shitless he'd shoot me... But instead, he laughed and asked me to tell him exactly how the mercenaries did it.
Oh, Le Major is very smart. He was doing... how do you say... um, "tactical debrief".
Tactical debris, my ass. I was telling him how les garons bought it, and the old bastard was laughing and applauding. He said, "They did what? Ha! That's how you do it!"
Damn. Makes you wonder...
Yeah.
You heard about the mine?
Yeah. The fucking commandos got another one, eh?
Boss said Le Major promised a bounty of two diamonds for every one of them we bag.
Dunno, man. I bet he promised more, but our boss wants to keep some for himself.
Yeah. I say, if we see 'em, we snuff 'em quick and report it directly to Le Major.
Good thinking, brother. We do the work, we should get all the reward!
If I ever catch the asshole who is writing "Legion, go home" on the walls, I'll cut his fingers off and make him write it with his own fucking blood.
Yeah. Les villageois need to respect us.
Fuck the respect. They keep writing it wrong!
What? Really?
Yeah. He is writing "Lgion" in English, like a dick sucking foreigner-lover. He never adds l'accent aigu! I cannot abide such a thing.
THAT is what upsets you?!
If you bother to write something down you should do it correctly, that's all I'm saying!
Got any idea why Pierre wants us to gather all those old explosives?
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Legion_07_Ernie Text  not taken Ernie Fort

Text: What do you want - a sweet lie or the harsh truth?
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Legion_07_Ernie Text  not taken Ernie Fort

Text: Give me the sweet lie.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Legion_07_Ernie Text  not taken Ernie Fort

Text: Well, Le Major is planning some big ass operation in Port Cacao and he needs a boat chock full of bombs to pull it off.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Legion_07_Ernie Text  not taken Ernie Fort

Text: What's so sweet about that? Tell me the harsh truth then.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Legion_07_Ernie Text  not taken Ernie Fort

Text: The harsh truth is, your momma's butt is so big, we need explosives to unclog the toilet after she's dropped a turd.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Legion_07_Ernie Text  not taken Ernie Fort

Text: Go fuck yourself. The first explosive I find, I'm going to stick it up YOUR butt!
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Legion_07_Ernie Text  not taken Ernie Fort

Text: I'm sick of this goddamn swamp. What the hell are we even guarding here?
Shut up! The Major might hear you.
You mean, the "Minor." Some commander, he is. You know what? I think they dumped him here just to get rid of him. I wouldn't trust a guy like that to command a fish to swim.
Tell that to Stony. You want to be the next to feed the crocs?
Pffft. Stony was an idiot.
What's that? I hear someone prowling...
Uh... Who's there?
Must be my imagination.
Must have been the wind.
What was that? Did you hear it? Some weird clicking sound... Click-click, just like this.
Probably a bird.
No, I heard it clicking on the ground!
A mouse then.
You heard about that little shit, Pierre?
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Legion_16 Text  Pierre is in Diamond Red

Text: The Major promoted him to a shovel boy in Diamond Red.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Legion_16 Text  Pierre is in Diamond Red

Text: Really?! Damn it, I'm signing up for a shift there! I'll show mister "I'm too good for you" exactly what he's good for.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Legion_16 Text  Pierre is in Diamond Red

Text: Good luck with that! There is already a waiting list of sixty-something. Me included.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Legion_16 Text  Pierre is in Diamond Red

Text: Do you know who's doing that teddy bear thing?
Might be Butcher Louis, but none of the victims had any bite marks. It's definitely not Jackhammer - you can't collect money from the dead.
True. What about that petite merde, Bastien?
Non. He might be a prick, but he is not insane. Leaving a teddy bear to watch over the bodies is... Well, it gives me nightmares.
That crazy animal lover was trying to feed the hyenas salad and soy milk!
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Legion_18_ChienSauvage Text  Peta is still alive

Text: Haha. Did she lose a couple of fingers?
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Legion_18_ChienSauvage Text  Peta is still alive

Text: Almost! They tried to show her they prefer fresh meat, but she got lucky and pulled away in time.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Legion_18_ChienSauvage Text  Peta is still alive

Text: She'll have a second chance tonight. She's feeding the hyenas in the pit.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Legion_18_ChienSauvage Text  Peta is still alive

Text: Haha. I'll keep 'em hungry, Boss!
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Legion_18_ChienSauvage Text  Peta is still alive

Text: When shall we live in Communism, comrade?
We may not be that fortunate, but our children surely will.
I hoped it would be sooner...
First we must seize the means of production, which is the diamond mines, then we shall unite the proletariat by destroying those Legion dogs.
And that's all?
And when we defeat the Legion, we can proceed to take down the corrupt capitalist government and lead the country to the bright future of Communism.
Can't we just get along with the Legion?
Non, comrade. They are ruthless bandits who only want to steal the people's diamond mines, plunge the country into chaos and usurp the power of government.
Oh, I see.
I have read about the days of communism before the civil war - how they seized the means of production from the rich imperialists, about the collectivization and industrialization...
Good! Good!
And I've been thinking - if they did everything right, why didn't we get to the bright communist future?
Because that wasn't real Communism, comrade!
I was wondering... The diamonds in the mine belong to the people, right?
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Maquis_03 Text  don't have Fosse Noire

Text: Yeah. These are the People's diamonds!
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Maquis_03 Text  don't have Fosse Noire

Text: And... We are part of the people, aren't we?
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Maquis_03 Text  don't have Fosse Noire

Text: Oh, I see where this is going... Non-non!
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Maquis_03 Text  don't have Fosse Noire

Text: Why?
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Maquis_03 Text  don't have Fosse Noire

Text: The mine belongs to the People with a capital "P", not to the people like you and me...
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Maquis_03 Text  don't have Fosse Noire

Text: I don't know, comrade. This capital "P" thing sounds awfully similar to capitalism.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Maquis_03 Text  don't have Fosse Noire

Text: It's too complicated for you to understand, comrade. You should be reading Charles Marx.
Context: BanterDef Shared_Conversation_Maquis_03 Text  don't have Fosse Noire

Text: We should never have trusted those capitalist mercenaries!
Actually, the great Chimurenga was planning to use them against our enemy just like the previous ones... But the treacherous dogs betrayed us!
We should have betrayed them first.
Yes, but it is not betrayal if it's done in the name of the Revolution.
Long live the Revolution!
One, nothing wrong with me.
Two, nothing wrong with me!
(once) I must not repeat banters unless there are unplayed banters.

Four, nothing wrong with me!!!...

The original Jagged Alliance games of the 1990's poked fun at cliches and stereotypes that existed in the action movies of the time.<newline><newline>Jagged Alliance 3 continues this tradition, but also takes jabs at contemporary issues and pop culture.<newline>This game is a work of fiction (where a lot of stuff blows up) and is not based on any real persons, locations or events.<newline><newline>Players are encouraged to use their own judgement and discretion when playing the game<newline>(and deciding which group of enemies gets the first grenade).

Defend Sector
Non-non, no more food rations unless you bring something valuable... Oh, non. Mon Dieu, you again?
Fidel brings something valuable. It is Fidel!
I'm sorry, boss, I wasn't talking to you, I mean, I didn't know it was you! I... I didn't expect to see you here, what a nice surprise!
I bet you didn't.
What brings you here, boss?
Yes, boss, what can I do for you?
Were here to check on you
Check on me, boss? Why? I haven't done anything wrong. Honest! I am helping these people. I swear!
Were here for you.
Non, boss, don't do it, please! I'm begging you, don't kill me! I don't know what you have heard of me, but it isn't true, I swear! I'll do whatever you want!
What is the deal with food rations?
Not a big deal, boss, not at all. Some of my friends are kind enough to deliver food supplies to the camp and I'm just helping the people get fair trade for their valuables!
You're profiteering
Nice racket you have here, man. Such a pity if somethin' happens to it.
You naughty boy! I know exactly what you're doing here, so stop sweating and tell me the details. I won't bite, I promise.
Non-non, boss, I'm just helping those people! I swear! Without me and my smuggler friends, they would have nothing to eat at all, valuables or not!
What valuables?

Well, boss, a refugee doesn't always mean a poor person. They have escaped with their money or Papa's gold watch or Grandma's diamond ring - anything valuable that could be carried. They surely can afford to pay a fair price for their food, eh?
I'm sure they'd get more favorable exchange rates at a Vegas pawn shop.
What is your gain of this?
I'm just helping the poor refugees to put food on their table! I barely make any profit at all!
What if I check your books and find out?
It's alright, boss, but I keep no books. No books, no problem!
You will work pro bono
Here is the deal. You will continue supplying the refugees, for a market price, and we won't shoot you for war time profiteering. I'll personally check on you.

Personally, I dislike unnecessary violence, but in your case it is completely justified. I want you to start helping people instead of robbing them, or I will do what is necessary. You understand, no?
But what's in it for me?...
You get to keep your skin free of bullet holes.
Question is, what happens if you don't do as we say.
That is a jolly good question. I daresay, however, you might not like the answer.
Okay, okay, boss. You are determined to ruin poor old Bastien with this community service you are forcing him to do... Alright, I'll do it, just let me live.
You will work for us
Charity is dangerous business, man. You need protection to do it, and protection doesn't come for free.
Okay, boss! No problem. I get it. You want your share. You'll even have it in advance! Here, the first payment. Come again next week for more! Now, um, I'll just go supervise the operations, yes?
Maquis Manifesto
Oh, these are Maman Liliane's girls! I wonder if she remembers me from the last time I was there. I should go pay her a visit...
Make sure you bring protection! And I'm not just talking about the nine millimeter kind.
On the other hand, better not. My kidneys are allergic to heavy boots.
Give a propaganda pamphlet
Maquis Manifesto
What is this? The communists have you passing out their propaganda? Huh... They pay you anything to do that? Nevermind. Go ahead and just leave it here. Maybe I can trade it for something useful.
Give a propaganda pamphlet
Thats it, youre dead
You bastards!...
Goodbye, boss! May the "spirits" guide you, boss!
Have a nice day, boss!
You killed my Wlad! I have been protecting him for so many years. The Beast... The Beast shall have you. All of you!
Wlad!... You have no right to die! Not after I have been protecting you so many years, not after you have been taking care of me so long!
We're sorry...
I'm sorry for your loss.
May his soul watch over you.
He's dead, and I... I don't care anymore.
Well hello again, my sweet children. Do you recognize me? Are you not afraid of the Beast?
Come, wayward souls that wander through the darkness! Are you not afraid of the Beast?
Are you the Beast?
Yes. The Beast is just an old woman who protects her people disguised as an avenging spirit of the forest. You should never underestimate old women, they are always more than they seem.
Fuckin' A right!
Especially one dressed in an armored stealth suit and packing automatic weapons.
You like?
Like? I think I'm in love.
I did not expect to find a role model today, but here we are.
Wait, I know! You're a shapeshifter! Will you teach me your magic?
There is no magic, dear. There is only the thirst for justice, the lust for battle, and the willingness to do terrible things.
You are the old woman in the woods
good impression on the Beast
You are a formidable fighter
All I can say is I admire your spirit, ma'am.
We have been admiring your work, madam. You are keen, methodical, and effective.
Anyone who takes a stand for justice is okay in my book. You are the hero Grand Chien deserves.
It is an honor to meet you, madam. Your martial technique is an inspiration to us all.
Aww, you know how to make an old lady giggle and blush.
bad impression on the Beast
No, we enjoy killing just like you do
This murder Beast reminds Fidel of his good old granny.
Oh, I know the thrill of the hunt when you track them, trap them and see the horror in their eyes before you slay them.
I consider it a waste of a day if I ain't kicked somebody's ass!
I ain't having fun unless some blood gets spilled.
I kill for vengeance and for justice, but it is true that sometimes I enjoy it. It is a terrible thing to enjoy and I take no pride in it.
Are you here to help us against those thugs?
Oh yes, I will. I am vengeance, I am the night, I am the Beast.
We should do movie! Tex and the Beast. This summer, justice has two guns and four paws!
No.
Okay. I have my agent call your agent.
That is so cool!
Don't oversell it.
Wow... I think I just peed a little. Not that much. Just a little.
Time to fight the bad guys
Yes. The Beast shall unleash its fury upon those naughty children who terrorize its village.
Is this why you have summoned the Beast? To just talk? Be careful, the Beast may decide you are being naughty.
I am never naughty. Mother made sure of that.
Got it. We don't mouth off and you don't come at us all teeth and claws.
And if I'm naughty, do I get a spanking?
Not the kind you'd like, my dear.
But I see you have already slain those who would hurt the ones the Beast protects. The Beast will remain passive and answer your questions.
Oh, good! I have so many. Let's see... Where did you get your powers from? Was it an ancient grimoire? Are you cursed? Did someone make you this way? Are there more like you? Do you have a lair?
Calm yourself, child. Remember to breathe.
You summoned the Beast and fought along side to protect this village. This pleases the Beast. You did well. We shall talk.
No time to talk. The Beast has naughty children to punish.
I'll be going home soon to my lovely cabin in the woods. Just can't stand watching Wlad play around in this filth like a pig.
This is not filth! These are valuable crafting components.
Filth.
Anything else before I leave?
So the Beast is just an old granny
good impression on the Beast
What big hands you have, Granny!
Aww, you're so sweet, I could just eat you up.
Ooohhh...
good impression on the Beast
The power of the Beast is shining through this mortal shell you will soon discard.
good impression on the Beast
You remind me of my mother, only with much more body armor.

Yes, I'm just an old woman. And like all old women, I'm tough, stubborn, and enduring. I have been walking these woods for years now, and I've been murdering lots of people with guns. People like you.
good impression on the Beast
No need for threats, ma'am. Like you, we're here to help.
good impression on the Beast
We kinda been doing the same thing, only we don't make it look half as good as you do.
Do you live here?
Not anymore. I used to be married to this rascal Wlad here, but he prefers to live in filth, because all he cares about are his crazy devices.
Hey! I care about my tools, too! And besides, you kept cleaning and tidying so much I could never find anything!
Only because you refused to look where it made sense to put them!
It made sense to put them where I left them in the first place!
In filth.
Bah!
Anyway, since our mansion was flooded some years ago, I moved into a small cabin in the woods. It is much better this way.
What ties you to this village?
Do you stay here because of the loss of a loved one? Does a curse bind you to this place? Are you an eternal guardian charged with protecting an ancient shrine of mystical power?
My, what an imagination you have.
It's my best quality!
Can you control it?
There's been little evidence of that so far.
There was a time when I lived in the sunken mansion over there with that rascal Wlad, but both our marriage and the house have been washed away by years of conflict.
Wow! You had a mansion?...
I can relate.
War is hard. Marriage is harder.
Now I live a peaceful life in the woods, only returning to the village when it needs the protection of the Beast.
As costumed vigilante origin stories go, that's not bad.
Anything valuable left in the mansion?
Yes... There was my Beast Cave and the prototype of the Beast Suit that Wlad crafted for me. I loved it like a wedding dress, only more so.
Oh, stop being sentimental, woman. The new one is way better!

I doubt the suit survived, but I guess there is still some money and diamonds in the safe. I don't need either anymore. I left in a hurry, so the safe should be unlocked. If you're willing to go for a swim, I can tell you where to dive for it.
Well, come and find it. Are you afraid to wander in the Cursed Forest? You should be. There is a Beast lurking out there.
There is ANOTHER Beast!?
Just to be clarified, you are referring to yourself, correct?
I love wandering in Cursed Forests! When can we go?
Where is your cabin in the woods?
Are you afraid to search for it in the Cursed Forest? You should be. There is a Beast lurking out there.
It's all right. I hear the Beast doesn't eat police officers.
We'll be on our best behavior.
Maybe we'll bring along some Legion deadbeats for her to chew on.
The Beast wouldn't hurt a fella with twenty-one kids to feed, would she?
Oh my... No, it sounds like you've already been through enough!
Anyway. Here, I'll show you on the map. Come over, I'll bake you some cookies.
That would be lovely. We should exchange recipes.
A nice old lady who bakes cookies and lives in a cabin in the middle of a Cursed Forest? Can I come live with you?!
Let's just start with a visit and see how it goes.
Are they vegan cookies?
Are you some kind of superhero?
Because if you are, I want an autograph!
No. I'm just an old woman who murders people to save her friends and family, and who bakes cookies in her spare time.
Not to sound too judgmental, but that fits very closely the profile of a serial killer.
A little scary and a little sweet. I dig it.
I have grandmother very much like you.
Will you help us defeat the Legion?
Me? Are you out of your mind? I'm just a tired old woman who tries to preserve the lives of the people she loves.
You're a hell lot more than just a tired old woman, ma'am.
In that suit, there is nothing tired or old about you.
Don't sell yourself short. You got mad skills.
My place is with my people. They need my protection. Why would I leave them to pursue the Lgion when they can be attacked again right here?
You can show the people of your country that they can stand up for themselves.
Was it not your compassion that made you brave? Why doubt it now?
Believe in yourself! Be the hero you were meant to be!
Well, I have to admit you did set a good example by helping us out here.
To help other people as well
Is that what you do? You work as hired guns and you "help people" at the same time? That's merde, if you'll excuse my French.
good impression on the Beast
Seems to me like it might be time to take the fight to the enemy.
If I learned one dang thing in life, it's that if you don't hit bullies where they live, and hit 'em HARD, they'll never leave you alone.
A lot of people hurting out there. A lot of justice needs to be served.
Well, I have to admit that this Lgion seems to be filled with youngsters who need severe attitude adjustments.
To punish the bad guys
Really. I thought you were mercenaries who just work for money.
Anyway, my place is here, with my people. They need my protection. But if you help make my village a safer and happier place, you are welcome to come to my cabin in the woods and I may reconsider.
Remember, be good kids, or the Beast will come for you at night and you won't even get the chance to scream before your throats are choked with your own blood. Au revoir!
You killed my Wlad! I have been protecting him for so many years. The Beast... The Beast shall have you. All of you!
What have you done?! I have protected Wlad for so many years, and you, you just let him die... Go away, or the Beast will have you.
We're sorry...
I'm sorry for your loss.
May his soul watch over you.
He's dead, and I... I don't care anymore.
Oh, hello, sweet children of mine. How's Wlad?
Hello! Have you been good kids? Are you eating well?
Hello, sweet children. What are you doing in the lair of the Beast?
Hello, sweet children. Has the Beast not gotten to you... yet?
Well hello, sweet children. Are you lost in the woods?
Maybe
We dont know
Can you repeat the question?
You should be careful. These woods belong to the Beast. It munches cute little kids like you for breakfast.
Ooooh, I know, I know! You are an old woman living in a small cottage in the forest, and you are surrounded by those creepy scarecrows, and...
And?
Please, Missis Witch, do not turn me into a scarecrow!!!
Only if you have been a naughty boy.
Most important meal of the day! ...What? Sorry, I zoned out for a second and all I heard was breakfast.
Well, if the wee beastie likes his meat tougher than week old haggis and twice as spicy, he's free to take a bite of this "cute kid" anytime!
It sounds like an evil spirit that feeds on the young and innocent. I can't wait to meet it!
Be careful what you wish for, my dear.
Most of the time it slumbers in its lair, but... But there are times when the moon's too bright, the chain's too tight, and the Beast won't go to sleep.
Context: Conversation Beast_2 Text Leonard Cohen reference

Text: Gulp...
Then it goes out, this murderous Beast, and it roams these woods until it's satisfied with blood and carnage.
I couldn't have explained the dance of an Angel of Death any better myself.
Is werewolf? Is okay. I have silver bullets.
This Beast and I, we are much alike. I look forward to hunting it.
Hmmm... Sounds like a werewolf, but it could be a bugbear or maybe a vampire. Does it drink blood?
Aren't you a curious little one? No, it does not.
Okay, so vampire is out.
good impression on the Beast
YOU are the Beast, arent you?
This Beast. I am thinking it is you.
Unless I'm wrong, and I never am, YOU are the Beast.
Signs of blood under the nails. Powder burns on the knuckles. Excuse me, ma'am, but are YOU the Beast?
Wait, I know! You're a shapeshifter! Will you teach me your magic?
There is no magic, dear. There is only the thirst for justice, the lust for battle, and the willingness to do terrible things.
But I already have those things and I'm no Beast.
Aren't we all? Aren't you?... When you raise your gun at one of those bandits, and...
What big eyes you have, Granny!
Um, thank you. As I was saying...
...Then you catch them on the move, and you feel the recoil when the bullets rip them in half, and... And the feeling is joy.
Gosh... This woman scares me.
This woman fascinates me.
At this moment, I find you very attractive.
Yes! Ay, dios mo! This is what bring laughter to the heart of Fidel!
It's just a job - one I'm good at. Nothing more.
Whats the deal with the scarecrows?
They are here to keep the Beast asleep. They remind it of the good people it had known.
I knew it! You are a good witch that repels evil with her magic!
Oh, man... Let's split up and get out of here.
Oh, kinda like my sobriety bear, only waaay creepier.
Hey, whatever it takes to get to sleep at night, right?
Is this how the Beast lives?
Yes. Most of the time, I'm just a harmless old woman. There are so many advantages to that. No one takes you seriously... until it's too late.
I take you seriously! I don't want to be turned into a scarecrow!
The "sweet little old lady" disguise. One of my favorites.
Always seem less than you are and people will soon reveal their true nature to you.
Woe to the careless traveller who takes the gifts of the forest without paying for them!
Oh, my dear. You almost make me wish I had a daughter.
Are those cookies!?
Yes! Help yourselves. I hope you will find them... enchanting.
Zoinks! Listen to me, people, DON'T EAT THE COOKIES!!! That's how she turned all these people into scarecrows!
Magical cookies from a sweet old lady in a cabin in a Cursed Forest!? I can't wait to try!
There is enough for Omryn, but you will need more for others.
I always tell my kids not to take sweets from strangers, but fresh-baked cookies are a different thing entirely!
Thank you!
Come, have some more! Once people taste my cookies, they just don't ever seem to want to leave my cottage.
I won't touch 'em with a ten-foot pole, man!
Yay! They're as tasty as it gets! May I have one more?
Of course, sweet child. Take as many as you want, there are more where these came from.
good impression on the Beast
Mmm, darling, they are delicious! Would you care to share the recipe?
But, of course! I'll write it down for you.
Marvelous! And this here is my favorite cookie recipe. I would be delighted if you'd give it a try.
Now this is what I call hot cuisine!
I think you mean "haute cuisine" my dear, but thank you.
Okay, it is agreed. Omryn will stay here.
I'm going to need more flour. A lot more.
When do I turn into a gingerbread person?
These are sugar cookies, dear, and you're already sweet enough as it is.
Eat cookies
That almost breaks my heart. Well, I guess I will have to give them to the Beast.
Let's leave this place before the Beast smells them!
It may be a little too late for that, child.
Oooohhh... Keep your eyes peeled, Ted!
Refuse cookies
Are you out of your mind? Put that gun down immediately! You will upset the Beast!
Hands up, now!
I see you're a bunch of naughty kids like all the others. The Beast will have you.
Mercs, open fire!
No, you won't kill the Beast so easily.
bad impression on the Beast
Sorry, we were joking
Goodness! That was one very dangerous joke. The Beast doesn't like naughty kids scaring a frail old lady like that!
My answer remains "no". The people of my village still need their silent guardian, their watchful protector... their Beast.
Will you support us against the Legion?
Yes. Now that my people are safe... I was thinking - do you know the only remaining reward for being the Beast?
Being able to bake top notch cookies in peace?
To see your enemies driven before you?
A bitchin' outfit?
...You just get to be... the Beast! So, I will unleash my true self and show it to all of Grand Chien.
May you reap the souls of the wicked.
Um... We better start sleeping in shifts, Ted.
And a grateful Grand Chien will thank you for your service.
I too wish to expose myself to all of Grand Chien!
Farewell and be careful. Beware of the Beast.
If you see Wlad, remind him to eat and sleep sometimes. He keeps forgetting to do that.
Make sure you watch over Wlad, or the Beast will come for you.
Farewell and beware of the... Oh, I forgot that you already know who I am. Must be getting old. Take care anyway.
Finally! The cavalry has arrived! Thank God, we're saved! You're here to save us, right?... Or... Did she give you some special orders?
We're here to shave you, man!
Larry! Happy to see you! You mean to... um, save me? I'm... sorry we had to leave you back there in Diamond Red.
No problemo. Guys, anybody got a razor?
We're coming for you, man! Not leaving you behind like you did to me.
Larry! Happy to see you! I'm... sorry about that.
Seor Apscott! It is so good to see that you are well.
Smiley! Where have you been?!
It is a long story, my friend. But you will draw your last breath before you hear it from me.
There is no time to talk! They are incoming! Mayday, mayday! DO SOMETHING!
You guys... You're not here to eliminate us, right?!
Of course not!
Don't put ideas in my head.
If we had, you would already be dead.
If we had, you'd never have seen us coming.
Sorry... I guess I am getting a little paranoid after all I've learned about her machinations with Spike.
Why would you think that?
If that was our mission, it would have been pointless. I cannot help but notice that the Legion is already doing a marvelous job on that account.
Such a suggestion defies all logic. Perhaps you are in a delusional state?
Is someone trying to kill you? I mean, besides those Legion guys, of course.
I know too much already. I know all about her machinations with Spike!
What machinations?
Ever wondered why this "Legion" is all over the valley? A couple of years ago this country wasn't all sunshine and roses, but at least the civil war was over and things were getting better.
Is that so? I have lived here my entire life and I have not seen anything get better.
Nothing got better. Only a buckhead foreigner would suggest such a thing.
Then people got greedy. They wanted the diamond mines for themselves, that's why she needed chaos. And boom, now these bandits are everywhere...
Spike?
Major Spike Scallion, known around here as the Major.
Spike is the Major? You gotta be kidding me. Come on, Biff... Spike is a good man!
You telling me Spike's gone rogue? You better be dang sure about this, Apscott!
Spike is that creepy Major guy? Well, I guess that explains why he's never called.
I don't know what happened to him in North Korea, but he's not the man I once knew. She hired him to put together this Legion outfit and he completely lost his mind.
Who is she?
Corazon Santiago from Adonis Corporation! My employer... and I'm guessing yours as well.
As a matter of fact, she did hire us.
Spot on, love. You're sharp as a tack I see.

They paid Spike to create the Legion and take the mines so they could exploit them without any government interference. But then Spike stopped cooperating and Corazon had to hire us mercs to clean up the mess.
I'd make a note of that in my "List of Women Who Are Up Ta Nae Good" except I cannae, because my LIST BE ALREADY FULL!
Sounds to me like she got all kinds of plates spinning.
Adonis created the Legion?!

Adonis only provided the money and the mission. Spike created it for them, but then he decided to work for himself or something. I have this creepy feeling he just enjoys terrorizing people who get in his way.
What is your role in all this?
Corazon hired us to get the mines for her. She told us they were in the hands of those Legion bandits.
She gave to us very same story.
Sounds familiar. Then what happened?
Yeah, she gave us the same 411.
Context: Conversation Biff_1 Text 411 is 80's-90's american slang for "information."

Text: Our first target was Diamond Red, but when we attacked we found it was still held by Grand Chien soldiers! We're probably war criminals by now... How could we have known?
Gee, I don't know, Biff. Maybe you could have asked someone?
Sounds to me like someone set you up the bomb!
Context: Conversation Biff_1 Text "All your base are belong to us" reference

Text: Scouting, observation, and intelligence gathering. Even a novice commander knows this. Have you no military training at all?
Well, I... Um, no.
Anyway, that's how I got this cursed green diamond... And now Spike wants to kill me for it!
Then you must kill him for it first!
Fidel understand. Come. We kill him together. I let you pick which eyeball you want. Is only right.
...Wait. Did you hear that?! Not again! Mayday! I mean, I request immediate combat support! Please...
Show us the green diamond
No! We found it! It is ours! Ours!...
Wow... Biff, I don't mean to alarm you, but your chakra is twisted up like a pretzel.
Easy there, mate. We just wanted to take a gander.
It seems like it is very... precious to you.
I mean... This is not the time. The goddamn Legion could attack any moment! Spike wants it for himself, and he... he said he will kill me and take it, whether I give it to him or not.
Time to face the Legion!
Oh no, no, no!... Mayday! Do something!...
We did it! We're still alive! God, that was scary!... I mean, the situation was complicated. Good thing I was around to provide tactical advice.
Like screaming for help and trying to hide?
I don't know what we would have done without you. Sincerely. I mean that. The possibilities are endless.
Biff, man, you're MOTIVATING. I mean, when you're whimpering and running around, even I feel like a badass merc compared to you.
You're the best distraction for the enemy a sniper could wish for, love.
...Anyway. I'm done with this hellhole. Time for me to bail out!
Where are you going?
Home! Anywhere but here! Good luck dealing with Santiago. You'll need it. As for me, I just want to put this whole mess in my rear view mirror.
Can you help us expose Corazon?
I don't know... If she ever gets brought to justice, I guess I can testify about her shenanigans with the Major, assuming neither of them would be able to, um... do anything to me.
I give you some advice: see a doctor. I think you may be missing some back bone.
I suppose that's better than nothing... but not by much.
Gained a piece of evidence against Corazon
I will keep it as payment for my trouble here. Even if I sell it for a fraction of its real price, I'd probably still get enough to revive M.E.R.C.!
You got it back there in Diamond Red. You ran away with it and just left me there, man.
You were surrounded! There was no way to save you...
Well, these guys here - they saved me and took care of me. And I have as much claim on the goddamn diamond as you do.
Seor Apscott... Biff. We have fought and bled together. This diamond belongs to all of us. You told me at the start that we were all in this together. Was it not so?
Okay, okay! It's precious, but it only brought me bad luck. Alright, I'll leave it with you guys.
Aren't you going to throw it into a volcano?
Uh, what? No!
I was there, man, three months ago. Destroy it!
No!
It's fate is, like, bound to the fate of Grand Chien!
God damn it, Larry, you're out of your mind.
What about the diamond?
It brought me some really bad luck, but... I've decided to keep it for myself as payment for this horrible mission.
It be a bit too big for a wedding ring, mon.
Carrying around a rock that big is like having a bullseye painted on your back.
I completely agree with your decision. If you ever need a safe place to store it, just ask me and I will tell you exactly where you can leave it.
I think I can sell it. Even for a fraction of its real price, I'd probably still get enough to revive M.E.R.C.!
What is dead should stay dead.
Sometimes dead is better.
Ain't you learned nothing, Apscott? You'd do better just shoving that diamond where no one can see it shine!
Then you should check to see if M.E.R.C. actually wants to be revived first. Otherwise, the diamond is wasted.
Context: Conversation Biff_2 Text Dungeons and Dragons reference

Text: Alright, time for me to leave.
What about that diamond of yours?
What about this diamond of yours?
Yes, yes. It's in an envelope over there. No, wait... it's right here in my pocket. Isn't that odd, now? And yet, why not? Why shouldn't I keep it?
I think you should leave the diamond behind, Biff.
I think you should leave the diamond behind, Biff.
Oh, yes... of course. You're right, the diamond belongs to this place... To you. Well, time for me to hit the road. Goodbye, friends.
Until our next meeting.
Until our next meeting.
Well, thanks for the extraction. I'll send you a post card from some place with no weirdos trying to kill me all the time. And if you ever need combat support here in Grand Chien...
Yes?
Yeah?
No.
...Or if you need someone with fighting experience against the Legion...
...Yes?
...Well?
Nope.
...Then please don't hesitate and make sure to call someone else. Goodbye!
This here club is members only, and I don't remember making you one. How did you even get in here? Give me a good reason why I shouldn't throw you out.
Take a look at this coin
Siegfried sent us
I go where I damn well want to go and do what I damn well please. You got a problem with that?
It was easy. Fidel break. Fidel enter. Now Fidel wants to break more - people or things, it make no difference to Fidel.
I'm not real big on rules. If there's a place I want to get into, I invite myself. That's not a problem for you, is it?
Well, you got some balls on you... Alright. If you came looking for a fight, you came to the right place. We got some good fighters here, but we could always use some more.
The good old "break and enter"
Oh, you making some kind of joke? Night Club is MY house. You don't break into my house and then laugh about it in my face. Imma show you what I do to bitch ass clowns who disrespect me.
There's a reason I'm not within everyone's reach, cuz. But after all, it turned out this didn't apply to you.
This was the only way to reach you
I don't have time for this crap, cuz. There's a reason I'm not within everyone's reach. Now, let me show you how we handle unwelcome guests. Guards!
good impression on Bounce
We're looking for information about stolen Diesel, Woodward. We didn't figure that asking at the front door was the best way to go about it.
We're looking for information on stolen Diesel, mate. We got the feeling it's not the type of thing you get by walking in the front door.
We sensed that stolen Diesel is a sensitive subject, so we decided to try to talk to you as discreetly as possible.
Sorry about sneaking in. I just prefer the back door, especially if I'm looking for something naughty... like stolen Diesel, for instance.
I find it is generally a good idea to avoid the front door when trying to acquire information on stolen goods... like Diesel, for instance.
Word on the street is you the man to talk to about stolen Diesel. Didn't figure asking at the front door was gonna get us an invitation.
Yo, let's keep it on the down-low, alright? This place may be mine, but the walls got ears, know what I'm saying? Just relax. We'll talk.
Here's your reason: Diesel
That right? That crazy old German send you? Yeah, I figured he'd try to take me out. What? You think I ain't prepared?! You just a bunch of bitch ass clowns who about to FIND OUT!
You having a good time, cuz? Walk around, talk to the girls. If you want to fight, you just pick someone and I'll set it up.
Nice moves, cuz. You just net me a lot of dough. Most people here thought you were fresh meat, but I knew you were a killer. I cleaned up! That means I owe you that information you been looking for.
This was about money?! Mein Gott... sometimes this country really tests my faith in humanity.
You had us kill a dude just to win a bet? Damn, that's cold.
You bet on us? That's sweet. Bloodthirsty and sociopathic, but sweet.

I saw a van with some canisters strapped to the roof hauling ass away from Siegfried's place the other day. I could swear I've seen the same van down near the abandoned gas station a few times before that.
Tell you what, cuz... If you do find the stolen Diesel, do me a solid and come back here before giving it to Siegfried. I'm gonna make you an offer you can't refuse.
Oh, I know what kind of deal this is! Haha! It is... um, not a good one for us.
Chill, cuz. It'll be good for both of us.
You want to become a dealer or something? Has that become the Grand Chien Dream now?
Nah, I got bigger plans than that.
We'll think about it, Woodscrew. Enjoy your winnings.
Hey there, cuz. Any luck finding that sweet Diesel?
Check your map. The guys who stole the Diesel should be somewhere near that abandoned gas station I showed you. If you find it, come back here and we'll talk.

That's what I'm talking about, cuz. I'll let you in on a little secret. I hired those Legion dudes to steal it from Siegfried. I knew the old man was doing some weird shit with it, but I couldn't risk stealing it myself.
And then you had us steal it back for you. That was a bit underhanded, but also quite clever.
You don't last long in Landsbach unless you're underhanded and clever.
So, you used us. That's just great.
What kind of "weird shit"? I have read many books about weird things.

Don't know what he's done to it, but imma find out. Anyway, I'm taking him down. I'm tired of everything being owned by some rich-old-white dude. Things around here are gonna change. You give me the Diesel, I give you my best gun. Then we go take out Siegfried and split the mine fifty-fifty. You in?
Hahaha... And what makes you think imma let that happen?
Ok. Take the Diesel
10 x 7.62 x 51 Hollow Point obtained 1 x PSG1 obtained Delivered 1 x Gallons of Diesel
This is not street Diesel. It's enhanced.

Well, it looks like you got some brains, cuz. Alright, let me deal you in. I already know this ain't the shit the Legion's been poisoning our people with. Siegfried has been changing it into something that turns his soldiers into damn war machines.
I needed to steal some so I could turn the tables on him. So, I used you and the Legion to do it. Wish I could say I was sorry, but I'm not.
You played us? That ain't right.
No, it ain't. But it is how it is.
I'm about ten seconds from MAKING you sorry, so you better start saying something I want to hear or there's gonna be a meltdown!
Do not be sorry. It would be sad if your last moments on earth were spent being sorry.

Take the mine for yourself, I don't care about it. Just give me the Diesel and help me take down Siegfried. Otherwise, we don't stand a chance against his soldiers. If it makes the deal any sweeter, I'll throw in my favorite gun. You in?
Try to negotiate a better deal, knowing the true nature of Diesel
No way. We're telling Siegfried
That ain't happening.
It's a deal

I knew you were alright, cuz. Now let's get ready for some action. Meet me near the diamond mine. And this here is my best gun - the PSG1. I promise, you ain't never used a weapon like this before. It bites like a raptor.
Get it away from me! It's looking at me!
Bloody 'ell!... Uh, that is to say... thanks, love.
Context: Conversation Bounce_1 Text cockney expression, then she returns to formal British

Text: Thy PSG-1 and ammo clip, they comfort me.
Context: Conversation Bounce_1 Text bible reference - Psalm 23:1-6

Text: This choice will have consequences
You come from the old German Shepherd, huh? Make yourself at home, then. But you know the rules, cuz. If this is your first time in Night Club, you have to fight.
Oh, I had my share of nights and fights, Woodrow. Leave the old man alone, will ya?
Alright! Bring it on.
You got a problem with me, Scooter?
Not for now, cuz. You just make sure it's stays like that.
Anyways. Tell me what's on your mind, cuz.

This fine establishment is called Night Club. Lots of folks come in here to loosen up a bit. After a full shift in Siegfried's mine, everybody needs something to take the edge off. I make sure that edge comes off real nice and smooth.
That's magic to my ears.
Oh, it's one of THOSE clubs. I have a list of my favorite safe words if anyone needs one.
Oh god, I want my edge taken off... Nope. No, I'm okay. I'll just, um... get a seltzer.
Igor loves night clubs. But where are the cocktails and the dancing girls?
Take a walk around, chat up the girls. If you want to join the fights, you just pick someone and I'll set it up.
What's the deal with Landsbach?

This here is Siegfried's company town, cuz. Everybody here works for him or owes him money, whether they know it or not. People with no place else to go come to Landsbach, and the German Shepherd makes them part of his flock.
German Shepherd good with flock. Also good at hunting walrus. You ever cook walrus guts on spike? The best stuff you can eat in all of Chukotka.
They owe their souls to the company town, huh?
Context: Conversation Bounce_1 Text Music reference - "Sixteen Tons"

Text: Some of them don't get a day older, but they all get deeper in debt.
Context: Conversation Bounce_1 Text Music reference - "Sixteen Tons"

Text: Ye dunnae work the mines unless yer in debt to somebody, lad.
When you have no safe place to go, that is when Shaitan's arms look as warm as your own mother's.
Stay out of trouble, cuz. I run Night Club nice and smooth, so I got people watching for trouble. If you start making things rough, you gonna find your ass out on the street.
Be cool, man. Smooth is my middle name... uh, my other middle name. Maybe I should make it a hyphenated last name.
Oh, yeah? Well, I'll build my own night club, then. With blackjack. And hookers. In fact, forget the night club.
I assure you, we will be model guests. Now, point me in the direction of the nearest baccarat table.
Sorry, cuz. This ain't no place for no James Bond, but I like your style.
No worries, mate. We're just here to have a bit of fun and look for clues that won't make any sense to us until several days later.
I will find my ass exactly where it is. If anyone touches it, they will lose both hands and eyes.
Daaamn... Alright, be cool. I was just sayin' is all.
Oh, I promise they won't see a thing.
Be cool and just chill. Don't front. We ain't looking for no fight, but we ain't afraid of none neither.
Oh, I'm chill, cuz. I'm chilly fucking Gonzales. If you wanna fight, you came to the right place. I'm just saying, if you go looking for problems, you gonna find one.
Enjoy the fights, cuz. Let me know if you need anything. I'll hook you up.
Tell us about Siegfried

Siegfried Von Essen... Our holy fhrer. Fancy white suit, sharp tongue and a black heart. You can't miss him. He came to Landsbach several years ago. Didn't take him long to become the boss around here.
Certainly hard to miss the mansion where he plants his arse!
He is exactly the type of man this country doesn't need, but we always seem to get.
I would love to have a house like his one day. I wonder why he has no wife... and several very beautiful daughters.
He owns the land. He owns the mine. Hell, he owns this very Night Club. Everyone's working for the big white man, cuz. Even me.
Who is the Mole?
Shit, cuz. If I were you, I'd stay away from that cockroach. The dude would sell his mother's liver for pocket change.
Near as I can tell, that don't make him no different from most folks around here.
True dat.
His own mother? That... is unbelievable!
Just watch your back around him, cuz... And your liver.
This type of exchange is of interest to Fidel.
Animal organs and skin are sold for pocket change all the time... some of them human.
He sounds like the type of merchant the Legion enjoys working with.
Come to think of it, his pockets were jingling when we met him... I think I might be sick.
Use the bucket near the fight ring.

You gotta make a living if you want to survive in Landsbach, but you gotta be careful where you eat and where you shit. Understand what I'm saying? I can't ever tell when the Mole is lying or telling the truth. Safest to assume he's lying, otherwise you might get served a shit sandwich.
Who stole Siegfried's Diesel?

We both working for the same man, so I'm tempted to tell you what I know, but I ain't sure yet if that's the right thing to do. Trust don't come easy in Landsbach. Everyone in this town is just looking out for themselves.
No disrespect or nothing, but that's true all over the world.
Then Landsbach's no different than my home town... and every other place I've ever been.
Yes, but in point of fact, we are not from here. Therefore, it is reasonable to trust us.
Nice try.
And you think mercenaries are any different?
No worries, then. You'll fit right in.
What's so important about this Diesel?

It's a street drug. Somebody must have given old Siegfried his own supply. Maybe he didn't want to buy from the local dealers. It's on every corner in Landsbach. Didn't you see the junkies? A few shots of happiness and then your brain turns into tapioca.
Oh, I see. I guess he's self-medicating.
I guess the old-timer must be using it for his pain.
Tapioca is wonderful pudding... Now I am hungry.
+1 clue gained
You're saying we shouldn't trust you?

I'm just stating a fact, cuz. We got no relationship. See, I don't know you, so I might just tell you what you want to hear to make you go away. Or I might tell you the truth, but then I'd be breaking trust with somebody else.

Now, maybe I could be convinced to do that, but you got to earn my trust first. See the big fella in the back? That's The Bonecrusher, one of the champions here in Night Club. I want him out of the game, alright? Permanently. Take care of him for me and I'll do something good for you.
Take care of him? What, are we in the mafia now? Should I get you some cannoli, Mr. Corleone?
Context: Conversation Bounce_1 Text faking italian mafia accent

Text: Pff. He is no bone crusher. He does not even look big enough to crush tiny chicken bones.
Em... Isn't there a high chance of a bone fracture in this plan?
No offense, cuz, but it's probably better if you be the corner man rather than the fighter.
I be crushin' your lazy bones, mon, if you be trying to get us into some nasty scheme of yours.
I like your style, sister. If you ever think of switching professions, don't hesitate to call me.
In your dreams, mon.
Why don't you shoot him yourself?
You want us to gun him?
About this Bonecrusher...
Not gun him

I need his ass beat in the ring, cuz. It needs to look clean. I can't have people thinking they might get shot if they become the next champion. It ain't like that. Just go challenge him to a fight and nail him into the ground - as in, six feet under it.
Don't tell me how to nail someone, Scooter. I've been nailing people my whole life.
What's your problem with him anyhow? Been champ too long? Won't accept retirement?
It's personal.
Got it. A woman, then.
Now this sounds like a proper tavern brawl! A bit of bare knuckle fisticuffs, eh? You know, I used to be quite the boxer at university.
This will be fun! If I win, you will put picture of Igor on wall, yes?
Uh... sure, cuz. Whatever you want.
Not sure we really need to get involved in this.
Setting aside the fact that this is highly illegal and unethical, I'm not so sure this is a good idea.
One last thing, cuz. He's one tough motherfucker. I'd suggest challenging some of the other fighters first to see how you stack up against the competition.
We'll do it
Remember, no weapons. It has to be a fair fight... with an unfair ending for Bonecrusher.
Would be better to have shootout. Much more dramatic!
Hijole... What about grenades? Give Fidel something to work with.
If we need to do this, I'm ready. I'll make it quick.
We will see who will be the one crushing the bones and who will be boning the... crush.

Welcome to my little corner of Fleatown! My name is Lalee. You here to buy or sell? Don't tell me, let me guess... You're here about diamonds, right? I got a good nose for diamond traders - they smell like dirt, sweat, and blood. Or maybe that's just your clothes. Errr, no offense, of course.
Have you found the necklace of Madam Lecoq? Please, tell me you got it!
We have the necklace

Let me see it! Oh, looking good! I can't wait to see how much I can squeeze out of those diamond-hungry Adonis fools for it! But I am getting ahead of myself. How do you feel about letting it go for three grand?
sold the necklace to Lalee
Okay, here it is
That's the way to strike a deal! Boom, and it's done! Here, take the money plus a little present in appreciation for not wasting my time. Hope you like it!
May have left a wee bit of money on the table, but the vest will come in handy.
I do like presents, especially ones I can put on... and then take off.
I'll take a Kevlar vest over a dang necklace any day!
A Kevlar vest, huh? It's cute, but not my type.
Fifty grand!
Fifty!? You see the Hope Diamond on this thing or something? No. Best I can do is ten grand.
Then we go sell somewhere else!
I'll tell you what I DO see - a robbery in progress!
We had to ruin a good deal of fine upholstery to find this thing, you know.
A lot of blood was spilled over this necklace... or at least, there could be.
But, wait. No. For you, I can do better. Probably wasn't easy finding it, right? You deserve a little extra for that! Twelve grand.
Good thing I know how to haggle!
sold the necklace to Lalee
Make it twenty
We have already paid you a diamond for the information that has lead us to finding this necklace. We are not, however, bound by contract to sell it to you.
That necklace looks valuable. Maybe we should consider finding its rightful owner.

Allow me to clarify. You were good enough to sell us the information regarding this object. However, since a price for the object was not stipulated at the time, we are not bound to solely consider your offer...
You certainly know how to haggle. Shall we agree to fifteen grand? It's refreshing to meet someone who can really play this game. Haggling is better than chess, change my mind!
Adonis?!
Since they lost control of their mines, they've been gobbling up all the diamonds that appear on the black market. The fools are paying top dollar! Diamonds make people crazy.
I hadn't noticed.
Typical colonizer move.
They seek to accomplish their objective through other means. Makes sense.
Still searching for it
You come to me first if you find it, okay? You won't find a better deal anywhere else, and besides, don't forget that I was the one who tipped you off, eh?
Lie
My friends! I heard that Boss Blaubert wants to meet you. You won't forget your old friend Lalee now that you're swimming with the big fish, eh?
Found a chair but no necklace, eh? Don't get discouraged!
We have more important things to do than playing your game of chairs.
Oh, I never get discouraged. That's what my breathing exercises are for.
I ain't discouraged. You'll know when I get discouraged. Stuff usually blows up.
I'm telling you, the necklace is inside the lining of one of those chairs! Keep looking! Find the diamond necklace, bring it to me and I'll give you a good price for it.
Well hello, my friends! You need information, or you just love to see my face?
Well hello, my friends! I just came up with a great new concept. I call it subscription. You give me a diamond a month, and in return I will mail you a loot box! Great idea, isn't it?
That's a crock o'shit, lad. I willnae be buyin' somethin' I dinnae need, ye ken?
Last guy who tried to sell me a subscription got a magazine jammed up his ass.
I am already subscribed to vodka-of-the-month club.
Are you here to buy loot boxes, or you need information?

Well hello, my friends! Tell me what you think of this: the season pass! You give me a lot of diamonds up front, and I will give you a lot of loot boxes at some point in the future! Sounds exciting, eh?
So we don't even get a cat in a sack for our money, but only the promise of a potential cat in a sack?!
Exactly! This is the future of commerce!
What about opposite: You give me vodka. I drink all of it. Next day, you come for payment while I have hangover. I guarantee you get biggest deal of your life.
Ach! So complicated! I would rather go back to the barter system.
Only season pass I have is for football - the MANLY kind of football, not this sissy-footsy ball you got over here.
Are you here to buy loot boxes, or you need information?

Well hello, my friends! You know, diamonds are great, but with so many people trying to control mining, cutting, selling... bleh! It's confusing! I'm thinking I should introduce a new kind of currency - an electric currency - controlled by just me, trustworthy Lalee! I call it shitcoins! Working title.
In that case, why don't you give me the diamonds and you keep your... er, whatever it is you called it.
Well, you will need some kind of a public ledger, as well as some way to encrypt and broadcast the transactions... Hmm, I'll give it some thought.
Yeah, you might want to workshop that title a bit.
Are you here to buy loot boxes, or you need information?

Oh, I happen to know all sorts of things. If you would be kind enough to grant me a tiny diamond, trusty Lalee will tell you a secret. What do you say? Trade what's in my head for what's in your pockets?
A whole diamond for your pep talk? You be crazy, mon.
If it's good intel, it's a deal. If it's not, then we might have a problem.
I give you a diamond and you give me a story? Better be one hell of a story.
What information?
I know what's cooking! One tiny diamond for each recipe, my friends.
How do we get rich?
Save your money and never get sick. Next question. I am joking with you, of course! It just so happens your friend Lalee has a little get-rich-quick scheme you might be interested in...
<color EmStyle>1 Tiny Diamond</color> required
Clue: Smiley was with Father Tooker in Fleatown
Something about Smiley
I knew it! You are after the boy! You're not the only one. A group of smugglers went after his girl and he killed one of them. They were ready to cut him down on the spot!
Kid's got balls.
Sticks up for his girl, huh? I like him already.
Like a prince from a fairy tale!

I don't blame the boy - the Carnival Queen from Pantagruel is quite a treat. He was about to get sliced into pieces, but Boss Blaubert himself intervened and told the smugglers to get out. You should have seen their faces!
Me, I'm starting to like this Boss.
I'm sure this "Boss" was eying the girl.
That worked? No wonder they call him the Boss.
Smooth. Boss likes things chill on his turf.

And now comes the spicy part: the chick is with Boss Blaubert now! If you want to find her - Mollie, I think is her name - then check Blaubert's place down in Rimville. Be careful, though. The Boss doesn't like trespassers!
A-ha!
A captured princess! But what of the prince... er, I mean, Smiley.
This story is long. Is there popcorn?
As for the boy, my exquisite nose tells me my friend Father Tooker knows more about him than he lets on. Uh, don't tell him I said so, though.
Delivered 1 x Tiny diamond Gained a clue about Smiley
The secrets of this town
Geez, I could write a book on that topic, and it wouldn't be enough to cover it! Where should I start?
When writing books, I start with an outline, followed by a glossary of terms, followed by a list of contributing sources. When those are complete, I...
Never mind the book. It was just a joke, eh?
Hmm, I think I know what you might be interested in. Come on, give me your map.
Listen up, you little shit. How about you stop playing games with me, and I don't break your pretty nose. Deal?
How about Fidel break that many bones in your body?
Are you trying my patience, dumbass?
Okay, okay, I was just joking! Here, have your diamond back, and another one as a way to say "I'm sorry". We're friends again, yeah?
We've never been buds, and we'll never be.
We're not "friends", it's just me not kicking you in the nuts.
You want that?! Friends of Fidel, they no live very long.
What is the meaning of life?
Oh, that's an easy one! It's 42. Next question!
That be a very dumb joke, mon. Give us our diamond back!
Nerd jokes? Man, we didn't fork over a diamond for nerd jokes.
That joke was old when I was young. You expect us to pay for that?
Come on, you asked a question! It was a fair deal.
Pushing yer luck, ye ken?
Actually, looking at the question from a computer programming perspective, this answer is really quite correct.
Ask a stupid question, get a stupid answer.
Can you forge a passport?
Sure! No problem, my friends! Just tell me the name. Oh, it will cost you one diamond, please.
Forge a passport for Karen Gosling
Here you go, even better than the real McCoy.
Delivered 1 x Tiny diamond Gained a forged passport for Karen
Maquis Manifesto
Maquis Manifesto

Nice paper, very soft to the touch. Not many readers around here, but everybody poops, right? You got any more of these? Most people haven't had a good wipe in years. This is the new shit, everyone will love it!
I have no love for communism, but I do not think manifesto was meant to be personal hygiene aid.
Communists believe in propaganda. I believe in supply and demand!
Fuck yeah! Another victory for capitalism!
Well, at least the proletariat will have good hygiene. We will call it a win for comrade Lenin.
Give a propaganda pamphlet
Are you buying diamonds?

Not buying. No, no. Trading! If you have diamonds, I have some very special items you may be interested in acquiring. You see, I have an innovative approach which one day will become the future of commerce! I'm trading only in loot boxes!
Loot boxes?!
Oh yes!...
Loot boxes
Just one tiny diamond for a box, my friend! There could be anything inside. Definitely won't be nothing.
Remind us about these loot boxes

A loot box is a box of mystery! Maybe you'll find a pile of treasure or maybe you'll find a pair of dirty underwear. Who knows? Fun, right? No money involved - just one tiny diamond buys you a box. Buy as many boxes as you like!
Idiot game for idiots.
Just so we're clear - if you sell me a box of dirty underwear, I'll make you eat it.
Is this gambling? Sounds like gambling. I'm in!
Where do we get diamonds?

You should go to my good friend Father Tooker in La Boue! The holy man buys and sells diamonds to support his hobby of saving the souls of the needy - which is good, because those poor buggers are DAMN needy!
The Father has strange ideas, but he has good heart.
I'm guessing you don't get much sensitivity training around here.
Everyone needs a hobby. Mine is collecting early twentieth century clown paraphernalia.
And I'm proud to say that I'm contributing to his noble mission by helping him resell any gems he manages to find.
What is your deal with Father Tooker?

Oh, I'm glad you asked! You see, he pays about 600 per gem. If he resells them to the smugglers, they'd give him merely 400 per gem. That's why he makes a deal with my generous person for 900. Are you following me?
Okay...
I already have questions...
With you so far...

Then he pays 100 more to Boss Blaubert in exchange for protection against acts of God and whatnot, and keeps the remaining 200 for his church. Then I sell the gems to the smugglers for only 400 a piece, because they are my friends and everyone must make a profit!
What the...
My questions have multiplied...
Hold up, homes. You lost me.

The smugglers sell to the Boss for 500 a piece, which he can pay because he's rich. He then resells all the gems to Adonis at 600 each, which they'll pay, because they prefer to deal with the boss instead of all the small fish.
What the hell, mon?!
Did you just say Adonis?
Yeah, okay. That last part I got.
Finally, Adonis pays me 600 as a broker's fee, and everyone is happy, because everyone gets their share! Simple, right?
So, you be nothing more than a middle-man.
I prefer to think of myself as a facilitator who oils the wheels of commerce!
So, you're just using everyone to make money off of Adonis?
Why not? They're the ones with the money.
Ain't you afraid someone will find out you're cheating everyone?
Who's cheating? Everyone sacrifices a little profit to make sure everyone makes a little profit.
You mentioned Adonis?

They used to control the diamond mines until the Legion pushed them out. They must miss their diamonds, because lately they've been buying them off the black market in bulk! Nice people with deep pockets who let everyone get their share!
Nice people with deep pockets are my very favorite kind of people.
Deep pockets often hide deep secrets.
They seem nice. Hey, do you sell snacks? You should sell snacks.
Happily! Just one tiny diamond per loot box! Don't have any? Go buy some from Father Tooker!

There you go! Do you like it? This here is a powerful substance, my friends - it prolongs life, grants visions of the future, and makes your eyes blue! You might have to take a lot of it to make that last thing happen.
Hmm, looks like a dead cat. Well, that's the mystery of the loot box for you! Could have just as easily been a live one, but it wasn't.
Whoa! Damn, that cat scared the poop out of me! How did it even survive in there? Well, that's the mystery of the loot box. Could have just as easily been a dead cat, but it wasn't.
BANG! He-he, made you jump! I'm sure you'll have a blast with those.
Well, I guess you'll get some use out of those. Me, I don't like guns. I prefer loot boxes! Care to try again?
Well, that's... You know, I'm not sure how that even fit in there. Well, that's the mystery of the loot box for you!
He-he, my favorite toy. I will call it "Legion Surprise"!
Now that's what I call a good deal!
Oh, a comic book collection! Good quality paper, too. Good for reading, that is, not for wiping. Too much ink.
I love it, man!
I love it, man!
Oh, hey! Neat!
Now THIS is a treasure!
Oh, that's... You know, I have no idea what that is. Behold, the mystery of the loot box! Care to try again?
Hmm, this came as a shipment from Ille Morat. There is this weird mechanic lives down around there...
Sell us a loot box
Oh, this seems to be our promotional package, my friends! You pay one diamond, and you get back two!
Be careful about your nose
Ya know what's bad about your good nose? Someone may break it for smelling too much.
You want that nose of yours smashed?
Non-non...
Then don't play the smart guy.
That's funny. I don't like so much you being funny.
No need to get worked up, my friends. I can't help myself. My nose is specially designed for smelling useful information.
Don't worry, lad, I can fix it.
It would be a shame to damage such an exquisite tool!
Remind us about the twelve chairs
This is the story: some years ago twelve special chairs from the mansion of the late Madam Lecoq in Pantagruel were sold right here in this very market.
We don't deal in stolen goods.
They weren't stolen! It was an estate sale. Now listen:
Special how? Were they constructed out of the bones of her ancestors?
What?! No! Why would you even think that? Nevermind. I don't want to know. Just listen:
He-he... Madam Lecock?
It's pronounced "Lecoq." Now listen:

Rumor has it that good old Madam Lecoq sewed her priceless brilliant diamond necklace into one of those chairs! In a journal an associate of mine just recovered, she admitted doing this because she feared Pantagruel commies would rob her. Sadly, she left no clue as to which chair she used!
Why you be telling us that, mon?
Sounds to me like you need a personal shopper, not a merc.
Now comes the part where you tell us the chairs were bought by a bloodthirsty warlord.

Look, I'd track them down myself, but I'm no treasure hunter. You, on the other hand, I bet you've got what it takes to get that necklace. Bring it to me and you'll get both a good price and the undying gratitude of me - trusty Lalee!
But this necklace was property of the old woman. Does her family not search for it?
Don't worry, she's got no living heirs.
You... You think I've got what it takes? I mean, of course! Of course, I do!
Where do we find those chairs?
I know for sure that two of the chairs were given as "good will" gifts to Boss Blaubert. You're lucky, because one of them is right here in his villa! The other one is probably in Rimville.
Speaking for myself, I wouldn't touch something that belongs to the guy who practically owns Fleatown, but you... well, I'm betting the boss doesn't scare someone like you, he-he!
Fear is a commodity bought and sold at auction, where the loudest voice gets the most.
I like that! I'm not sure what it means, but I like it!
I haven't been scared since I was a little girl. Mommy forgot it was class picture day and dressed me in overalls. I don't like to talk about it.
I'll make a note never to bring it up.
I eat fear for breakfast and crap bullets in the afternoon.
You may want to see a doctor about that.
Gained information about some of the chairs
Goodbye, my friends!
Get out! GET OUT! GET OUUUUUUUUUUUUUT!!!
Zoinks! Like, it's a ghost, man!
Uh-oh! Time to leave this place!
Damn, that's one angry spirit, but I bet it bleeds like a man.
We are trapped! They have finally come for me! Maybe this is the end already?
Still haunting around?
Leave me alone already, you meddling kids!
Youre not a ghost
Not much of a ghost. Your costume could use a little work.
I know this sounds weird, but would you mind if I pulled your hair?
But I am a restless spirit. Go! Get away from these cursed grounds while you still can!
Are you a restless spirit?
I am the ghost of the man who had been the butler of the mansion!
Did you die a violent death?
Did you blow yourself up?
I haunt these grounds because I died a horrible death, just like all the... others... Oh god, spare their poor souls...
Context: Conversation Butler_1 Text starts sobbing in the end

Text: Hey, man... You mean, like, there are more ghosts?
The sadness of this spirit washes over this place. It is in the walls... and in the ground.
Gained a clue about the Ghost
What happened to the others?
Dead. All dead... I'm the only one left alive. I wish I had been there so... um... that is to say...
Wait... you are alive AND dead? Oh! Are you UNDEAD!?
Hey, now wait a second, man. Just hang on a minute... Like, what?
I thought you said you suffered a horrible death.
Well, that's no fun! I was looking forward to pulling your mask off!
Oh, just leave me alone, you... You meddling kids!
Gained a clue about the Ghost
Non! Leave me alone!
Your home?
I have lived and worked here for thirty-five years. Ten years ago they came here and killed everyone and looted the house. I was away, shopping for supplies when it happened.
When I returned, I had no choice but to bury the bodies, repair what I could and wait for the master to return. He never did.
Who are they?
I do not know. Maybe they were just thieves or maybe they were from the army or deserters of the army... In Grand Chien, they are all the same.
They never returned, but a short time ago these Legion thugs moved in and started searching the place, looking for treasure. That is when I decided they would find only death.
Is there a treasure?
Non. No treasure. Anything of value was taken from the house long ago.
Except a minefield's worth of explosives, apparently.
I don't know. I quite liked the hippopotamus.
You are the one planting those mines!
And I would have gotten away with it, if it weren't for you meddling kids...
Ehehehehee...
Right up until the Legion finally catches you. Then you WILL be a ghost.
I never medaled. I was disqualified for PEDs.
This is my home and I will defend it as I see fit! Now, leave! Leave!
We can protect you
Can you? There are still some of those murderers outside. I can smell them! They smell of grease and piss. Non, I will not leave my refuge.
We have eliminated the intruders
Have you?... Maybe I should consider... Wait. Do you hear that?
Die, ghost!
Let's see if a ghost can bleed.
Go ahead. I should have died ten years ago.
Leave! Leave this cursed place and never return!
There are more of them!
They have finally found me.
It is over. They are gone. All of them!
And we didn't even have to dress up like ghosts to do it.
Your methods are definitely more effective than mine.
Don't feel bad. We are professionals.
That's because we train hard and fight like a team!
If you're interested, I can give you a ten point plan to unlock your maximum potential.
Maybe with people like you around, those bandits won't bother with an old man in a haunted house... And I can turn it into a home again. Here, I won't be needing these anymore.
Welcome to Butler's Haunt. You like it? It seems a fitting name for the place these days.
What will you do now?
I will try to fix this place up. I still hope the master of the house, Mr. Ditch, will return one day. It is silly, I know, but it would be nice to see him again.
That isn't silly at all! I believe hope is the most powerful magic in the world.
Not silly at all, my friend! The power of hope is crucial in focusing your mind and manifesting a better tomorrow.
I'm sure you'll see him again! I mean, probably.
What about the treasure they mentioned?
It is not mine to give!...
Man, I knew it! There IS a treasure!
Well, then it ain't yours to keep, either. Got it?
There's treasure?! How exciting! Is it guarded by a gnome with a bunch of riddles?
...That is, there is some money hidden in the mansion. But it belongs to Mr. Ditch and as long as there is a chance he is still alive, I would rather die than betray his trust.
Oh come on. If the scuzzball doesn't give a shit about his bloody colonizer money, then why should you care?
That can be arranged.
Such loyalty is admirable.
Since he didn't come to take back his money, I fear he may be in trouble. Please help me find him! I'm sure he will reward you, he is a generous man.
What about the treasure?
I guess you should ask Mr. Ditch about it. I have kept his money safe for so long - now that I know he's alive, I can't just give it away without his permission.
Tell us about Mr. Ditch
He was a director in some big foreign corporation. I think they had some interest in mining, but that's all I know. He never talked of his job. I think he hated it.
A corporation with some interest in mining? I wonder...
Something about all that sounds very familiar.
Ten years ago? Hmmm...
