He was away from home when the civil war broke out... Maybe for the best. They would have tortured and killed him for his money, as they did with the servants.
It's all clear - when the shit hit the fan, your man just ran away and left you guys to deal with it.
Sounds like Death was very busy that day.
Dreadful tragedy. Dreadful.
It has been ten years since. He may be dead, but I wish I could find him, or at least learn where he is buried.
Maquis Manifesto
Oh, thanks. I'll put this to work kindling the fire in the stove. Got any more?
Give a propaganda pamphlet
Mr. Ditch is dead
Is he? You... you are sure?
That's our job, man. We have a list - just like Santa. Your Mr. Ditch was one of the nice boys, but we were there a bit too late to help him.
You... you saw him die? Did he say something about the mansion? Or... about me?
Oh, yeah. He said: "I wonder if Mister Luthando is still kickin' it? That dude was like my brother! I miss him!" And then he, like... He died.
He remembered me! Poor Mr. Ditch!
Ooo... Yes. Certain. Absolutely. You know, I saw those thugs kill him before they came here.
They killed him?!
You've got to believe me, especially considering that they are permanently incapable of arguing against the truth of what I am saying.
I trust you - after all, you saved me.
I'm sorry. Ummm, yes, he's definitely dead. Stiff as a board. Those cutthroats got him earlier. Actually, that's why we came here - to avenge him.
Oh... Thank you!
I guess I don't need to guard this treasure anymore. You helped me and you were with Mr. Ditch on his deathbed. I suppose he would like you to have the money.
Lie
Mr. Ditch is alive!
Is he? That is the best news I have heard in ten years! Please, tell me his address. I will go see him at once!
Not much of an address - he is living in solitude as a hermit.
Okay... Better write this down. He is at One Mushroom Place on One Jungle Way.
Better pack a lunch. Got hiking boots?
Mr. Ditch is alive... We lied to you
But... You told me... Oh, I understand, it was all about the money, wasn't it? I hope he won't be angry at me for losing his fortune.
I don't think he cares about money anymore.
Trust me, brother man, your friend ain't got no need for cheddar.
He spends his days tripping balls in the jungle. I don't think he's worried about cash.
Anyway, I'm glad he is alive. This is the best news I've heard in ten years.
Goodbye. Don't let the past haunt you.
I'm going to see Mr. Ditch. I hope he will accept me back as a servant or... just as a friend. Farewell, mercenaires.
Grand Chien has changed. I see it in the intel reports. I feel it in my bones. I smell it on the wind.
Sorry lad, that's just me. Gassy as all hell today.
Yes, Grand Chien is changing. But to what... I am no longer sure.
You must have a very sensitive soul. It's reaching out. That's great!
There is no one that lives who still remembers the old Resistance. No one but me. And I'm tired of fighting. I'm thinking that the time has come for the Savanna Lion to step down.
Yeah, I know what you mean. I'm also not as young as I used to be.
It's no use, Woodrow. They'll just pull you right back.
There's no bloody point. You stop moving, you die. Of course, if you move forward, you die that way, too. Either way, yer fucked!
What about your Maquis?

My Maquis are nice boys and girls. They are good at following orders, but there is not one visionary among them. The Revolution needs a leader with vision, otherwise it becomes a monster that eats its own children.
Revolutions have a nasty habit of burning out or burning up. The flames rarely are concerned about who is consumed.
Leader with vision  even bigger .
Child-eating monsters? Yuck! Those are the worst.
Indeed. Revolution simply means change. Change without vision is chaos.

I do not know about vision, but I know about revolution. It is best done when there is a common problem to solve, like trying to depose a deranged psychopath who likes to run over babies with her tanks.
You guys should really consider democracy. You get to have mini-revolutions every few years and hardly anybody dies.
Who will succeed you?
You. I have watched you closely. I see what you are doing and I already know it: you will bring the change that Grand Chien needs.
What? We are no Commies.
Ya'll trust us with that, Woody?!
You're pulling my leg, Chimichanga. I'd rather be dead than red.

You have proven to me that you care about our life, our struggle, our pride. You know about our problems and you have the strength to solve them. Whatever power I have, I give it to you, to help you. Do not disappoint me.
A Commie giving instead of taking... This world must be going crazy.
I've never met a reasonable Commie in my life. You're the first and probably the only one.
I'm certainly impressed.
Let's make ourselves a revolution!
This is great honor.
You no fooling around? You serious? Aieee... All right, mon. We do our best.
I ain't wearing no damn beret.
I give you Fosse Noire and the command over my Maquis. As for me... I guess it is time to go and see the world.
Don't you have a family?
No. The Revolution was always my bride and the Maquis were my children.
How about Maman Liliane?

Hmmm... She's been trying to get me to retire for years. Liliane is a good woman and I... Well, as the Maquis leader I needed to remain devoted to the cause. I do not object to her profession, but I could never risk the distraction.
All work and no play makes for a very dull revolution if you ask me.
That is... very noble of you. I did not expect that.
Yeah, mate, I gotta tell you - I heard all the words you just said, but they didn't make a lick of sense to me.
Hey man, I get it. You have to stay away from enablers.
But now that I have found fresh leadership for the Maquis, perhaps I can allow myself a bit of personal happiness. So, what do you think? Will she have me?
You will make her happy!
You bet! You're a nice looking man and a real gentleman on top of that. If I was her, I'd say "yes" before you even started!
Don't worry, love. She's all yours, you just have to ask her.
You're both fierce. You're both leaders. I think we're looking at a power couple here.
She needs a man like you
Somewhere deep inside every woman is a scared little girl. Trust me - having the Savanna Lion by her side is going to make that little girl jump for joy.
That's utter bullshit and if you ever say that again I will beat you until there is nothing left but a scared little girl.
See? That's the scared little girl talking.
Shut. Up.
You'll do alright. She needs a real man who's not afraid to take charge when she needs to take a break from being strong all the time.
You'll do alright. She needs a real man who's not afraid to take charge when she needs to take a break from being strong all the time.
Ron, you better shut that pretty mouth of yours or I'm going to start kissing it.
Well, now I'm feeling conflicted.
Don't let a good woman slip through your hands just because you're afraid of what comes next, chief. You get your ass over there and grab her.
She is not the type of woman who needs a man to take care of her. Yet, she needs you. That should tell you something.
I have seen so many battles in my life, and I was never as nervous before a fight as I am now. But I will trust you and I will talk to Liliane.
My man!
It is never too late to talk to the woman you like. You will start a new life. You'll see.
Show her the beast, Ace! You're the freakin' Savanna Lion!
You'll do fine! She likes you a lot.
Just make sure you have adequate foot powder. If you are like me, sweaty feet have been a problem on dates.
This best part of script. Hero accepts challenge!
I'll ask her. And you know what? I won't need the Lion's Roar where I'm heading. Here, take it. Let its voice terrify the enemies of the People. Now, wish me luck, comrade!
Good luck, love, but you really don't need it. You'll see.
Good luck! Stay clean! I mean... oh gosh. Best wishes!
She will not know what hit her. Wait... Do not hit her!
Safe travels!
Good luck to you. Farewell!
good impression on Chimurenga
Thank you, comrade Mercenaires, for liberating my brave Maquis! Let me hug you and kiss you for that!
Oh, um... Sorry. Cold sore. Really bad one.
French kiss or a normal kiss?
Communists kiss on both cheeks and the mouth.
Oh, okay! So, where are the other two guys?
Er... Maybe I just kiss you on the cheek for now.
Nah, I'm good.
Sorry, Chimichanga. You gotta buy me dinner first if you want that kind of action.
Ah! Your breath smells of vodka. Let me kiss you again.
Context: Conversation Chimurenga_1 Text Sound of a noisy kiss

Text: As a reward, I offer you the greatest gift of them all - the friendship between our people!
Well, if that isn't everything I ever wanted. I feel all warm and fuzzy-like.
Friendship is indeed the most precious gift one can give... except possibly a rocket launcher.
This... This is so wonderful!
That's right, man! This is lit! Friendship is MAGIC!!!
We almost died because of your bullshit, man. And all you have to offer is "friendship".
Got to tell ya, Woody, I kinda prefer the Capitalist way of expressing gratitude.
Thank you for helping us, and please forgive me for this little deceit. I am aware you are not the same group as les Mercenaires of Biff Apscott, but my people needed some reassurance.
We dont mind, comrade
. People need faith in command.
Context: Conversation Chimurenga_1 Text It is okay...

Text: We are all brothers in one great family!
I've been known to use a little deception myself.
I see we have much in common.
You don't see much.
You should maybe get your eyes checked, lad.
Yes. Mainly enemies, but it is enough.
You are deceiving your troops
It is the unfortunate necessity of any government. People want to hear something that makes sense to them. The truth is not for everyone.
Yeah, you Commies just love this shit.
You Americans are not much different.
It's true! Most people just want a good story. The problem with the truth is there isn't any end to it. It just keeps going. A story has a nice neat ending, usually a happy one.
You have uncommon wisdom for one so young.
I read a lot.
We would have attacked the Legion anyway
Yes, but now the friends of the Revolution will see you as heroes for doing that!
Fidel does not just kill people and have fun! Fidel is a hero! When will they go and make Fidel a statue?
If I see even one poster with my face on it looking bravely into the middle distance, you and I are gonna have words.
Uh... Of course, my friend, of course! I would never allow that to happen.
Maybe you put me on poster? Look, I make hero pose.
I heard about what you did at the Refugee Camp, comrades. I'm sure you had your reasons. We Maquis will support you, even if others have betrayed you.
good impression on Chimurenga
Don't believe everything you hear, mate.
It's fake news, Woodward. We're being set up.
We're innocent until proven guilty, and there is zero evidence. We didn't do it.
We got stabbed in the back - multiple times, in fact. Whoever did that, it wasn't us.
Someone is making you out to be the villain, is that it? I've been a victim of that myself in the past. Regardless, I know your worth and we will remain by your side.
bad impression on Chimurenga
We didnt do it!
If I had been there, I would have left my mark.
We would never have done such a horrible thing!
We're being set up, man! You gotta believe me!
If you say so. You don't have to explain your operations to me, comrades.
Thank you, comrade
I'm sure you have a plan for how to handle the situation. I don't expect you to share it with me. The less I know, the better.
good impression on Chimurenga
It is all part of our plan
I have seen you operate. You are as cunning as a fox, comrades. I'll be watching to see your next move.
We're as foxy as it gets.
Honestly, you should not watch too closely. Maintaining plausible deniability might be better for you.
I'm thinking we need to pull a rabbit out of a hat - a rabbit riding a main battle tank.
Ha! Now that is a trick you will have to teach me.
Greetings, comrade Mercenaires!
Good day, Mercenaires.

They call me Chimurenga, the Savanna Lion. I am the leader of the People's Provisional Revolutionary Government. We are struggling to bring down the heartless capitalist government and lead the people of Grand Chien into a bright communist future!
This is the plan  .
Cheburashka, hahaha. Good name.
It is pronounced Chimurenga.
Chunga-Changa, whatever.
Communist dumb speaking!
I've heard it all before Chimichanga. There's no bright future under communism. It's just a big lie.
Chimurenga. It is pronounced Chimurenga.
Doesn't matter how you pronounce it or what you call it - socialism, collectivism, welfare - it's all the same system of control.
No, I meant... Never mind.
And I thought I was the one who believed in fairy tales.
This kind of talk give me stomach ache.

But the truth is, our Revolution falters. The USSR fell and everyone says "why do it again"? To the young fighters, the Legion capitalists with their policy of free looting and pillaging are more attractive than communism.
They are more real Commies than your Commies, ha-ha.
You can always say "but it wasn't real communism" and call it a day, heh.
You think I haven't tried to explain how the USSR was built on Stalin's paranoia and not actually on the theories of Marx or Engels? The youth have no patience for nuanced debate.
Sounds like you're just not as good at redistributing wealth as the Legion.
You should be the Fun Communist Party. Organize things like Workers' Karaoke Nights and ice cream socials. Wear festive hats. That sort of thing.
You should remind them that joining the Legion will only result in their tragic and premature death.
Damn kids with their looting and pillaging...
Why are you fighting the Legion?
Before we can take over the corrupt government, we need to seize the means of production - namely, the diamond mines. Those capitalists dig diamonds that belong to the People of Grand Chien!

Context: Conversation Chimurenga_1 Text "They are also goddamn capitalists."

Text: And the People need you to take care of the diamonds, no?
The People rarely know what is good for them.
So, your plan is to distribute diamonds to all the people in Grand Chien?
My plan is to keep the diamonds out of the hands of fascists and capitalists!
Good luck with that one, mon. Capitalists really love their diamonds.
We also want those mines
But of course I understand this. You are the enemy of my enemy and you will have need of diamonds. As long as you do not take Fosse Noire away from me, I will have no problem with you.
Our Mercenaires comrades made a spectacular appearance during the Carnival celebrations, just before we attacked Diamond Red together.
They were "your" comrades?!
Mercenary comrades, huh? What the hell is Biff up to?
Sound like story time. I get snack.
Tell us about M.E.R.C.
Carnival celebrations?
Yes. There is a great Carnival celebration in town each year organized by Maman Liliane and her working girls.
Greatest working class heroes, eh, Woody?
That sounds like a wild party, man. Good thing I missed it, otherwise I'd have been... Oh, wait. Damn.
I suppose there is too much hope I have for such girls giving up lives of sin for Lent?
Such a wonderful night!

Les Mercenaires comrades appeared that night under cover, trying to move through the crowd unnoticed. But it was a party and they were stumbling around like clowns, so I knew they were doing it just to entertain us. We had a good laugh.
I wouldn't be so sure, mon.
Clowns? What type of clowns? Did they have big shoes?
I... I don't think so.
Hmmm. This is very interesting.
Probably just trying to blend in. Doesn't sound like they succeeded.
I do remember a lot of laughing, but I think it was mostly me.
Seor Apscott instructed us to blend in with our surroundings. I guess it worked?
What happened in Diamond Red?
Our Mercenaires comrades agreed to join our struggle against the enemies of Grand Chien!
Which enemies exactly, I wonder?
They did what now, Woodstock?
Yeah, I kinda remember that.
Together with my Maquis, they used the Carnival celebrations as a distraction while they went to attack Diamond Red. Alas, something went wrong and they failed.
Your idiot Maquis lead us right into a trap, man, that's what happened! We thought we had the damn Legion in front of us!
Yeah! They had laser raptors and we did not! It just wasn't fair.
What a surprise.
Yeah. The thing that went wrong was Biff Fucking Apscott.
Where is M.E.R.C. now?

I have reason to believe that les Mercenaires and some of my fighters were captured alive. But I can't spare the force needed to liberate them - you saw how ferocious the counterattack of the Legion was.
It is preferable to be captured alive. I'd be really pissed if they captured me dead.
Yeah... I got captured, all right. Good thing I was tripping balls or I'd be pissed, man.
Don't worry, Cheburashka, we will save everyone and you will give us a medal.
Chimurenga.
Don't you worry, Chimichanga. We'll get your people out of there.
It's Chimurenga.
Sorry, but I don't really care what you natives call it. We'll get your guys back safe and sound.
What exactly happened in Diamond Red?

My Maquis and your M.E.R.C. comrades joined their effort against the rotten capitalist forces in Diamond Red. But the capitalists from la Legion had the very same idea and treacherously attacked our forces from behind.
"Capitalist forces", Woody?
I don't know, man. Maybe if your idiot Maquis didn't lie to us...?
They appeared in our back riding laser raptors! It all happened so fast!
Treacherous. Such an interesting word.
That was impressively well-timed on their part. Very curious.
The Legion being able to orchestrate such a maneuver is a very worrying thought.

However, while my Maquis fell into captivity as the Legion conquered the mine, your mercenary friends did better. Thanks to their superior commander and utter professionalism, they managed to retreat.
They surely are very professional when it comes to retreating.
Except for me! I continued fighting and I shot no less than three laser raptors!
It's so easy to get turned around when everything is spinning.
That's a hell of an after-action report, sir. Thank you.
Superior commander? I know this place is a bit backwards, Woody, but I didn't expect it to be upside down.
You sure you ain't kissing Apscott's ass too much?
Biff Apscott is a hero who wants to leave a kind and generous mark upon the world!
Kind and generous skid mark, maybe.
Wasn't the mine held by the Legion?
Well, back at the time it was held by Grand Chien troops. We had to... deceive your comrades a little bit. I believe you will understand - we needed their military support to take Diamond Red.
You told Biff they will be fighting the Legion, then the real Legion hit them from behind?
You just wanted that big diamond, man - and all the diamonds everywhere... probably. Anyway, I'm happy you won't get it.
This is a most terrible thing. You should have shame.
You didn't fool me! I saw right through your machinations as clear as I see this green rabbit on your shoulder.
You lying Commies!
Mother taught me that lying is very bad, unless it is to an enemy. Did you think M.E.R.C. was an enemy?
No! They are heroes! I used them as expendable assets to accomplish my goal, yes, but they are still heroes.
Hmmm. Yes, that is the one exception to Mother's rule.
Seor Apscott trusted you!
Never trust a Commie.
That was a low-down, dirty trick!
Sometimes the Revolution requires sacrificing a small portion of the truth.
Your revolution is horsecrap.
So much for high ideals, huh?
We didnt find M.E.R.C. in Diamond Red
I am sorry to hear that. I need to see one of your comrades as well... It seems they took something from us.
Ah, now they are "our" comrades, huh?
I hope they did. Seems to me like you owe them.
They tried to help you out. Maybe you should call it even?
During the battle for Diamond Red, one of my elite fighters was able to retrieve an exquisite green diamond from the mine.
Elite fighter? Sound more like idiot fighter.
Oh, I remember! When they pinned us down, I saw this guy leave his position and instead of covering us, he ran over to the main building. And I thought to myself - ah, what an elite fighter!
Let me get this straight. Instead of fighting, your man was looting?
I prefer to see it as making the best of a bad situation.
And I hope the damned fool got a bullet in his arse!
He did. He died.
Well... Good!
I am told he trusted it to your comrades and made them swear as he died in their arms to bring the diamond to me. I hope they have a good reason for not doing so.
Yeah, man, it's outrageous. What about me?! I got a bunch of cheap drugs and no diamond at all.
We'll help you retrieve it, man. You have my gun! And my crowbar! And my booby-trapped teddy bear!
Where do you think M.E.R.C. went?
One of them was taken prisoner - they transferred him to Camp Savane. I don't know about the main group, but if were in their shoes, I would retreat to the Highlands.
Hello! Is it me you're looking for?
Glad to see you survived, my friend.
I have a name, man! Now that I can remember it.
Glad to see you survived, my friend.
I hope you're not bamboozling us this time, Woody.
I trust you to find them, and I want the green diamond back. It belongs to the People.
Yeah... I even know the People by name.
How can we help the Revolution?
We can lend hand, .
Maybe you give commendation for help growing Revolution?
I think you are some of the nicest people I have met so far. Do you need anything stolen, er, procured?
I suppose you blokes aren't all bad. You need any help with your little Revolution?

I know you have your own mission. But if you want to be comrades of the Revolution, there is another thing you can do for us. Take these pamphlets with the Maquis Manifesto and let them reach everyone you talk to. The People must learn of our struggle!
Especially about your struggle with grammar, as I happen to notice while I'm reading it.
Sounds like a great way to meet new people.
This is very unapproving!
Alright, why not
Spread the word and let the world know we stand united as comrades!
Whoa, whoa, whoa, let's not overdo it, Woody.
I didn't never not approve of this!...
May I illustrate them? I've got my crayons!
Um... No.
This is a good idea. I will make sure this is put in the hands of every girl in town!
I wouldn't go that far, Chimichanga, but I guess there's no harm in letting people make up their own minds about your little Revolution.
Whoa... Did I just join a gang?
Rather not
I see I cannot consider you as my comrades. This is fine.
I am in deep pity for that!
Cry me a river, Woody.
Sorry, Chimichanga. Uncle Sam would never forgive me.
Maman has this idea
You want to do... WHAT?! Out of the question. The Maquis Manifesto can't be associated with some brothel!
Maman wants Chimurenga to include a Lys Rouge advertisement in his pamphlets
This is how you reach the masses
People will see that the Revolution cares about their... needs.
Your manifesto is a little dry. It could use some... uh, juice.
Pretty pictures are a great way to keep people distracted!
Like sheep to the shepherd, they will come... That may have been an awkward metaphor for this situation.
You think? I guess the masses need their opium in one form or another.
Well, both the Commies and the whores will screw them. At least the girls know their business.
The Revolution is no business! We shall unite the Proletariat and lead them to a bright future!
They are dubbed "working girls", hence they are part of the Proletariat and the masses.
It is either that, or we add pictures of Gena the Crocodile.
Alright, I agree to this historic compromise.
Dress the girls like Maquis!
You could ask the girls to wear cute little berets!
You could ask the ladies to pose with hammers and sickles.
I bet those girls got some real nice communist-red lingerie they could wear.
You think that would look appropriate? Hmm. Well, I suppose if they behave for the photo and we dress them properly...
You better undress them properly.
Alright, I agree. Just make sure you deliver the pamphlets.
Whatever
Now stop joking around and do what you promised. Let those pamphlets get to the People!
About the Clinic
We sorely need that clinic, but my answer remains "no." Healthcare should be free for everyone, especially for my freedom fighters.
bad impression on Chimurenga
You need to reconsider comrade
Come on, comrade Cheburashka!
You are starting to get on my nerves.
Come on, Chimichanga, quit being an old grump.
What better way to make new comrades than to share the same healthcare everyone else uses?
Alright, I owe you a favor. Let it be as he requires. My Maquis will have to pay for medical service.
Seems like the taint of Capitalism is all over you, Woody! Will you ever wash the stain, eh? He-he.
You're all right in my book, Chimichanga!
Please... Just call me "comrade".
Nonsense! We're on a first name basis here!
Yes! You WILL pay!
Ask them to pay for protection!
Easy-peasy, grandpa! Ask them for payment for protection or something and then subtract - and boom! Free healthcare!
You just stroll down there and say: "Real nice clinic you got here. Be a shame if something were to happen to it." Ya dig?
I'm sure they'd be happy to pay a big, strong man like you to protect them.
What do you mean? We pay them for medical service and... then they pay us back for protecting them? Hmm, this may work. It helps me to save face.
Welcome to Capitalism, Woody! Hope it doesn't hurt much.
What do you think of Maman Liliane?
She is a very brave and beautiful woman. Perhaps in another life... Alas, the Revolution is my bride and the Maquis are my children.
You like her, you naughty old man!
I thought I was better at keeping secrets.
You can't fool a woman about such things.
It doesn't have to always be like that.
Crikey... And here I thought I had a lot of kids.
Maybe one day, if I ever retire... But let's not talk of that. My feelings for Liliane and the Revolution are two separate things.
Good luck in your struggle!
Biff! You were a comrade to us, and yet you stole from us! The green diamond you have taken belongs to the People of Grand Chien. Give it back!
No.
Biff Apscott!
It is mine, I tell you. My own. My precious. Yes, my precious.
This very familiar. I audition for part once with lines like this. Hmmm... What movie?
This is fun. I want popcorn.
Oh, the diamond has control of him! Watch. He'll try to hide it.
I will never let the pride of Grand Chien fall into the hands of foreigners! My brave Maquis warriors, attack!
Now is the time for Alejandro Diaz to prove his worth!
given the Green Diamond to Chimurenga
Hand over the dang diamond, Apscott!
Let it go, Biff. Just let it go.
That thing is only going to way weigh you down, mate. Time to give it up.
Biff. The diamond. Now.
Biff, that doesn't belong to you. Do the right thing.
I say, Biff old chap, don't you think that stone has caused you enough trouble? Why not hand it over and let it be someone else's problem?
Wow, you got a really good grip on that thing. It's like we'd need to cut your fingers off to get you to let go. Ha-ha... That was just a joke.
You are right. It's precious, but it only brought me bad luck. Alright, I'll give it to Chimurenga.
Very noble of you to give back what belongs to the People of Grand Chien. We shall forever remember that, comrade.
Just take it and go away before I change my mind.
Yes. Just one minor detail though - it is still in your pocket.
Ah! Er, he-he. I forgot. How silly of me. Um, okay. Here, take it.
Thank you, comrade.
What? Well, that was disappointing. I was hoping we'd need to find a wizard to figure out the diamond's curse.
For a second there, I thought we were going to have to toss Biff into a volcano to get him to give up that diamond.
So familiar... Name of movie is on tip of my tongue! "Bored of the Things?" No, no...
Biff, give him the green diamond
Never! He wants it for himself! And besides, he has deceived us, he lied to us. Yes, he lied to us! I shall never give you the diamond, Chimurenga!
Very well then. You have sealed your fate. My brave Maquis warriors, attack!
Biff, you jackass!
Time to hunt the Savanna Lion!
I have concluded that diamonds are very overrated. They only seem to make people irritable.
Finders keepers
You cannot have it, Cheburashka!
Finders keepers, Chimichanga.
I hate you so much.
And how much blood will you sacrifice for it?
You want it? Come and take it.
It is precious to usssss... That from "Lord of the Bling"! No, wait... that was different film.
I will never let the pride of Grand Chien fall into the hands of foreigners! My brave Maquis warriors, attack!
Now is the time for Alejandro Diaz to prove his worth!
You may have defeated me... But you will never defeat the Revolution!
You just watch!
Let go.   .
That's all right, pops. Ain't my country anyway.
We do not have to defeat the Revolution. It will surely defeat itself.
Cut the head off the snake, the body will die.
I don't care about the Revolution. I defeated the Savannah Lion! Someone take a picture.
The Revolution needed those diamond mines... I knew it was getting time to strike, but you... struck first.
A-ha! So you admit you were planning to betray us?
We knew you were planning to double cross us, Woody. Ain't gonna happen.
I guess we just got bored of waiting for you to make the first move.
Why have you betrayed me! I wasn't ready yet...
You leave me with no real choice - retire or die. Alright then. I choose to live for the Revolution, instead of foolishly die for it.
Ha-ha, you coward!
If you say so.
But you'll miss your big chance to be a martyr!
Fitting. At my lowest, I am mocked by a little mouse.
Good for you! You can retire and write your book.
Are you certain? Your head would look very nice on my wall.
This action may have major consequences!
Dont try to fool us
Nu pogodi, Cheburashka! You cannot deceive me.
I don't trust ya, Woodman. You seem too easy to convince.
I can see you are hiding something. Don't be afraid to let the truth out. That's when the healing begins.
I know a faker when I see one. What were you really going to do?
Forced retirement is a bitter pill to swallow. You seem to be swallowing it too easily.
Yes, I intended to deceive you and continue the good fight... But what do you want from me, just give up everything I fought for?! Isn't there any chance for my Revolution?
Time for you to leave
Farewell... Until we meet again.
Don't think so, at least not if you know what's good for you, Woodshed.
I don't trust this guy!
The hairs on the back of my neck just stood up. That's a bad sign.
I'm all for showing a bit of mercy, but I think we just released a wounded lion into our own backyard.
I think he will come back and make trouble. We should get something to eat.
I got a feeling that guy's gonna be a problem, chief.
Time to retire
Retire? What am I going to do with my life, start knitting? I am a warrior, I am the Savanna Lion!
This action may have major consequences!
Make Maman happy
What?... Liliane is a very nice woman, but... I never thought about that. Do you think that... she would have me?
Oh, but of course, love. Trust me, she likes you a lot.
You old fool. She loves you. And you never noticed that because of your stupid revolution.
She can be your Crocodile Gena.
Sorry. Stupid joke.
That woman cares for you. I think she should not, but it is her heart. You should go to her.
There be only one way to find out, mon.
I would nae be wasting my breath on this if I thought otherwise, now would I?
You have crushed my Maquis and my Revolution, and now you want me to trust you with something so... personal?
This action may have major consequences!
You deserve a normal life
Time to pound that sword into a ploughshare, mate. That's what the fancy lads call a double entendre.
Now is the time for you to realize that what you have always wanted has been right there in front of you the whole time.
What is the point in struggling your whole life if you cannot get to a place where you can rest?
You have fought too long. Now is time for love.
I think it is clear you are very bad at leading a revolution. Maybe this you will be good at?
War has not worked for you. Perhaps peace and love would be better.
Everyone deserves a shot at being happy. Even you, Woodhead.
A man your age and in your condition should really slow down and try to relax.
Leave that revolution stuff alone. Be done with it and let your body rest.
Perhaps you are right. Perhaps I needed a wake-up call.
Together you can rebuild this town
A failed revolutionary and an ex-whore rebuilding a town in a third world country? Sounds like a bad joke.
It is a jagged alliance, isn't it?
It is some kind of a jagged alliance.
It is quite a jagged alliance, isn't it?
No joke. Fighting is easy, for peace...   . More needed.
I guess you mean well. Maybe I will run for Mayor, who knows?
Mayor Chimichanga? Sounds a little silly, but I suppose a funny sounding name doesn't hurt in politics.
It's Chimurenga.
Well, it's called politics where I come from, but I wouldn't expect you to understand that.
Why not?
Why not? Why not indeed?! This is ridiculous. Kill me or let me go, but I won't tolerate you mocking me.
I guess I should put the gun down and take the chance to start a new life. Alright, I'll talk to Liliane.
My man!
It is never too late to talk to the woman you like. You will start a new life, you'll see.
Show her the beast, Ace! You're the freakin' Savanna Lion!
You'll do fine! She likes you a lot.
Just make sure you have adequate foot powder. If you are like me, sweaty feet have been a problem on dates.
This best part of script. Hero accepts challenge!
Your revolution ends here
So you are sending the Savanna Lion into exile. Alright, I shall comply.
Go to Cuba! Best place for a revolution!
Can't have you hanging around here causing trouble. Go find a beach and sit on it.
Time for you to hit the road and see the world, Scooter.
You... You have wounded me more deeply than this injury means, for you have wounded the Revolution itself. But it will continue without me!
This is watchful thinking!
I sorry we must do that. , .
We shouldn't have done that. Poor old girl will be heartbroken...
Oh, quit your yapping and just die already!
And so the hunt ends for the great Savanna Lion. I will take this head for my trophy room.
Be a good little revolutionary and just die now, okay?
Now Fidel is confused. Do I keep wounding you or kill you? Meh. I just kill you.
This action may have major consequences!
Please, just listen! I am not responsible for that mess Emma and Faucheux have dragged you into.
And me! Don't forget about me!
Clearly, they are using you in their dirty little game. I will help you get out of it... Money, passports - anything! There is no need for any more violence.
There is always need for more violence!
You cannot bribe my team, miss.
Keep talking. I'll let you know if I like what I hear.
Faucheux is dead
Is he?... Very well!
Faucheux escaped
Ah... what a pity!
FaucheuxRedirect

This is all his fault. He gassed all those innocent people just to frame you! This country is too wicked and chaotic to do business. If you let me leave, I will do everything in my power to help you clear your name.
Your type of business is not anything the people of Grand Chien need.
I do not mean to offend, but "your power" does not seem very impressive right now.
Look around, lady. You don't even have the power to make me a ham sandwich.
The news didnt mention gas

No? Well... of course not! That would just frighten people in nearby towns, wouldn't it? I merely assumed it must have been gas. That would be the most practical way to eliminate a lot of people at once.
Miss, sometimes I do not know when is the right time to stop talking. I can see that you have the same problem.
I am disappointed. I expected you to be a better liar.
Honey, that rouge is killer, but it can't hide your blush from telling a lie that big.
Smooth. A good lie works on most folks, but I always know when someone is trying to pull a trick on me.
Woodnose, you're about as convincing as a snake oil salesman.
Flushed skin around the throat and cheeks, averted gaze, altered speech pattern... Yep. She's lying.
I can tell you are lying. Your aura is blushing.
Faucheux is next
I would advise against any further involvement with this cursed country's internal affairs, but it is your own business.
What about me?
You! You have no right to come here and threaten me. I dissolved our contract and then you had to go and make yourself into some sort of bandit king!
I like that one!
These mercenaries should not have taken you here, they should have brought you to jail!
They brought me here because we have the same score to settle. You screwed me over and then you went ahead and did it to them too.
No, this is not at all...
Thanks, by the way. I think they needed to hear you admit that you hired me in the first place.
I... You... I'm finished talking to you.
Is this your signature on this contract?
What is this? A mercenary contract with Spike Scallion? No, this is not my signature. I never signed a contract with the Major.
Show the Major's contract with Adonis
We never mentioned the Major
Um, it is a well known fact that the Major's real name is Spike Scallion.
Actually, it is not. The Major's identity is a well kept secret.

Actually, no. After several hours of database hacking, I did not find any connection between the former A.I.M. mercenary and the so-called "Major." Only his most recent employer would know - I guess that's you!
This is not true. That fact is well known only to us, and unsurprisingly, to you.
While trying to confuse the hunter, the fox led him to her lair.
Well known only to you, Woodhead. Now I wonder how that could be?
Terribly sorry, but I do think you may be mistaken in that regard. The only person who knows that Spike Scallion is the Major is... well, the person that hired him to be the Major.
What about the Major?

I have nothing to do with that psycho. He has been trying to extort me for money ever since I was appointed as the executive director of Adonis in this region. It is a very common professional risk I have to deal with all the time.
I don't know what the Major really cared about, but I am certain it was not your filthy money.
What was that, lass? Sorry, I cannae hear ye on account of the all the SAD VIOLINS!
That sounds awful. I have been shot, exploded, punched, kicked, cut, and cursed, but never extorted.
This is not about the money
Of course it is. You are mercenaries, right? You work for money! Look, I can pay you all enough to take a nice long vacation until I straighten things out here. You fully deserve it, don't you think?
Fidel does not work for money. Fidel works for the blood and screams and body parts.
That's the first thing you're saying that appears to be true.
It'll be a cold day in hell before I take any vacation package you're offering.
You can lay low for some time and when this unfortunate business is forgotten, you will have lots of other contracts. I know a certain company that would want to hire a team with your talents.
You have all that Fidel needs. Body parts.
...And here we go again with the lies.
Any company recommended by you is one I plan on staying very far away from.
You are not talking your way out of this
Fidel came here to collect.
Cut the bullshit, lady, or I'll start cutting you.
Listen up, bitch. In case you hadn't noticed, I ain't here to negotiate. Just ask your guards. Oh, wait. You can't, because they're all dead.
Okay, okay, no need to threaten me!... I will provide any details you need to know.
You are involved in all this

I am simply a victim of circumstance. I came here to do business, not to be shot at. But I can understand your frustration at how events have unfolded and I am willing to cooperate. Let us start over, shall we? How can I compensate you?
Body parts
Fidel wants body parts.
Excuse me?...
Ma'am, you have a lot to answer for and you're going to do it in a court of law.
You will face justice. It can be here or it can be someplace else.
Time to face the music, Woodwind!
Ms. Santiago, war crimes have been committed here. The Hague has some questions for you.
I think you're going to need a lawyer. I know several, but I can't recommend any of them.
It is time for you to cleanse your aura... in front of a judge.
I acknowledge that there may be some... irregularities pertaining to my conduct, but I am sure we can reach an agreement that is beneficial to us both.
You will answer in court

But what for? I haven't done anything! All of this is Faucheux's fault, and your hostile actions against me are without provocation. However, I am willing to forget all of this and come to some sort of arrangement with you.
You promised to explain everything
Start talking. Now!
Money
Of course, I will see that you are properly reimbursed once you let me go.
And commendation. Do not forget commendation. Is very important.
Do not forget to include bonus rations. I prefer elk jerky.
Make sure you include a bonus for Stella... for emotional distress.
Information

All this mess is the fault of Colonel Faucheux. He planned a coup against his own president, the father of your friend Emma LaFontaine. He tried to get financial support from me, but I refused to be involved in such a thing.
Yeah right, of course you did.
At least not publicly anyway, right?
Yeah, I bet. You were too busy trying to get mercs to kill other mercs.
Please let me go and I will send you all that I know, so that you can eliminate him... If that is your current contract. I don't need to know the details.
The truth
Of course, I will share all the details I know. I trust you will find this information useful enough to let me go unharmed.
You better be convincing. You know you can't fool me.
Don't worry about that right now. Please just concentrate on swearing out a full and accurate confession.
I guess we'll burn that bridge when we come to it.
I have been in contact with Colonel Faucheux, who planned a coup against his own president, the father of your friend Emma LaFontaine.

Context: Conversation Corazon_Defeated Text reference to The Little Golden Calf/The Twelve Chairs - meaning "The ice is breaking"

Text: That's a good appetizer, now give us the main dish.
And he wanted money... or maybe mercenaries?

He promised to grant me exclusive access to diamond mining in the valley in exchange for financial support, but I swear I didn't know he was planning to kill those people in order to frame you. Here is my copy of the contract I signed with him. Please let me go.
Now that's something!
This is first time I have seen a real contract with the devil.
I admit that I am surprised it is not signed in blood.
Die, bitch!
These are your final moments. I ache to know the thoughts that must be racing through your mind right now.
I will make this quick... but also painful.
Ol' Spike has come to collect his pound of flesh... and then some.
No, no, don't do this, this is murder...
Stay here. You are under arrest
Alright, there is no need of any more violence. I said I am willing to cooperate. What do you want of me?
Leave this country
Yes, I will. I don't want to be involved in any of this.
We will see each other in court. Don't make me come find you.
You best get while getting is good. And don't show face in town again!
You will still need to testify. Don't make us come looking for you.
It worked! See? It worked! Oh, hi. I'm Deedee Bombastic! You here to pick up some boom-toys? I just sort of blew up the last batch, but I can make some more!
Is very bad to make big explosion in small space. Are you hurt?
Are you hurt? Any dizziness, ringing in the ears?
Are you on fire a little bit or is that just your aura?
Oh, don't worry about me! Explosions are common around here. I put a blast shield under the workbench and I've gotten really good at vaulting over it.
Nice house...
Interesting place you got here. The furnishings say "take cover" while the scorch marks on the wall say "it probably won't matter".
Though I have to point out there isn't much left of it.
This place has seen more backfires than my garage. I like it!
Thanks! Flame retardant paint! I make my own. I have to. The off-the-shelf stuff isn't strong enough.
Watch out with that!
Careful with that, dumbass!
Explosives are not boom-toys! Explosives are just... boom!
You trying to get yourself killed?
What are you so angry about? No one got hurt. When something explodes, people are usually only angry at me because they lost their favorite hand. You didn't even lose a finger!
Fidel lose finger, you lose foot. Both of them.
And let's keep it that way, lass!
True, but I might have gained a few gray hairs.
Oh hi! Bombastic's the name, boombastic's the game! Get it?
Do you sell explosives?
Yeah, but I'm low on supplies. Bring me parts, so I can create some boom-toys! I can make the boring types, but also some novel designs!
Oh, oh! Fidel wants to see!
Imma stick with the boring ones. Plannin' to keep my arms and legs where they are.
Oh! A quest! I will gather up all the parts on the island!
We can improve the design
This is cute design, but Uncle Fidel show you how save parts. See this safety wire? Only needed for defusing and who wants that? Make room for more boom!
Wow, that sounds super dangerous! I can't believe I didn't think of it. Thanks!
This advice seems of profoundly dubious merit.
There's a little voice in my head that screams "bad idea"...
I just got a sinking feeling. Did anyone else just get a sinking feeling?
Where do we find parts?
Have you tried the Rust? That bunker is full of useful stuff just waiting to be conjured into beautiful explosions!
It's also full of your Legion friends, I presume.
This bunker would nae be occupied by soldiers, would it?
Bunker? Maybe food in there, yes? Maybe bad guys, too.
There may be some Legion boys around, but they're not that bad when you get to know them. Wait, I'll draw you a map!
<color EmStyle>25 Parts</color> required
Gladly! But I must have something to work with. I can't make explosives out of thin air.
Ha! Amateur.
<color EmStyle>15 Parts</color> required
Aww, is it Christmas already? Thank you! Here, let's trade - parts for boom-toys!
Then I say we should be goin' already.
I confess, I am curious. I usually order out of catalogue.
Know a guy back home that runs the same kind of operation out of the back of his pick-up.
Make us some explosives
Aww, is it Christmas already? Thank you! Here, this is my present for Uncle Fidel and his friends!
Oh my god, Fidel is totally the "fun uncle" who sets fire to the backyard at family get-togethers.
"Uncle Fidel"?! Is this how their kind reproduces?
Fidel is uncle? Okay. Let us toast to our uncles!
Talk fast, I just set the timer! Hehehe, I'm joking! I don't even use timers! Hehehe. Explosives are so much fun!
Why "Boombastic"?

That's what they call me! Well, at least that's what I call myself. That grumpy old guy Basil calls me a bunch of other names, but half of them I don't even understand. What does "whack job" mean anyway?
Whack job means you do good job wrecking stuff. Whack job is best job!
At least those Legion boys respect my work! They are very careful and polite around my workshop, and they bring me useful parts for explosives!
Sorry to disappoint ya, lassie, but yar chums willnae be able to show up after we're done with 'em.
Hate to break it to you, but your clientele on this island is about to get a whole lot smaller.
Honestly - and I do not mean to judge - I think you should consider looking for better clientele.
convinced Deedee to stop helping the Legion
They lie to you, girl, just like all men do. They keep the best parts for themselves!
These parts? Very low quality.
Oh come on, lass! They dinnae give ye the good stuff!
However, they don't allow me to go near their Fort which is full of wonderful stuff... If you can convince them to let me inside, I'll have enough parts to make boom toys just for myself!
Uncle Fidel will beat their ass and let you get the best stuff.
You bet! Pinky promise!
Stop helping the Legion
But... but... they are nice! They bring me parts to make boom-toys!
This is wrong! They use your explosives to terrorize people.
Well, if those people brought me parts, I could give them boom toys to terrorize them right back!
And... Once a boom-toy is made, I don't care where it goes off. I just want it to make a beautiful explosion!
What do you think of Basil?
He's not a bad person, he just doesn't see things my way. He likes putting things together. I like blowing them up.
Why explosives?

Well, it started as a hobby. There's a bunch of old war stuff all along the coast - land mines, artillery shells, mortar rounds. I used to play real life minesweeper with my friends until I ran out of friends.
Ah, much like Fidel's childhood. We used to play dodgeball with grenades. Good times.
Know anything about President LaFontaine?
Uh, President who? Sorry, no idea who that is. I hope I haven't blown him up or something. People are so careless in minefields, as if they don't have one at home!
Yeah! Fidel always wonders the same.
Nah, you can always make one when you need one. Home is where the minefield is.
I have cow pasture near home. Very similar to minefield.
Explosives are sooo exciting! They can just blow your mind.
...What?
...What?
Hahahahahahaha! Yes! Good one!
A sapper walks into a mine... Boom, the mine is disarmed! So is the sapper! Hehe, get it?
Hehe... Not bad, lass. Not bad.
I do... unfortunately.
Uh... no.
You know where sappers go when they die? Everywhere.
Heheheee... I like this little girl. She's funny!
Oh by the way, what do you think about this design? Please try it out and tell me if it works... if you still can.
Context: Conversation Deedee Text says the second sentence quietly

Text: Joke
Knock-knock... What's ticking? Oh shit...
Joke explosion
Hehehe... Good joke, but would be better with screaming.
Drop the grenade! I mean, don't drop the grenade! Ah, shoot! I mean, don't shoot!
Reach for the sky, little lady!
I wanna see those hands!
No-no-no-no, put that gun down and get out of my workshop! Are you nuts? You trying to blow us all up?
Ehehehee...
We're ending your little bomb-making operation right here and now!
Die, little bomb demon!
Time to let some lead fly!
Wanna play rough, huh? Well, I got a pocket full of boom-toys just for you!
Die Explosion
Take that!
Sorry...
Huh. Apology accepted. But don't you ever threaten a boom-toy expert again!
Yeah! That right!
You have a death wish, do you?! Oh well, then I'll be the genie for you! Wish granted.
Have a boom-boombastic day!
These slaves, I was doing them a favor! They are unfit to live free. They can only work or die!
I am here to return the favor.
P-p-pierre? You escaped from the camp...
Only so I could return and thank you in person for sending me there.
Why do you hate the slaves so much?

They are weak! I was in their position once, but I proved I was strong. The Major himself noticed me! Made me their master. Oh how they whined and cried, but I made them work harder than they ever knew they could!
Am I weak?
Non, Pierre... You tried to escape.
I would have succeeded, if it wasn't for you.
I am sorry, Pierre.
No one deserves to be a slave
You don't choose the slave life, the slave life chooses you!
I was so much more! I told my overseers everything about the other slaves - their hopes, their silly plans to escape, their fears. No wonder the Major noticed my zeal and made me an overseer!
Oh yes. I remember well why you got promoted. You snitched on me.
I have always been against hurting prisoners of war... But this time, my finger's itching.
You turn my stomach, and I HATE when my stomach turns.
I would call you a disgusting slug, but I am quite fond of slugs and do not wish to insult them.
So you were a slave?
I was so much more! I told my overseers everything about the other slaves - their hopes, their silly plans to escape, their fears.
. This man is worse of fascist.
But when I prevented the escape of that asshole Pierre, the Major noticed my zeal and made me an overseer!
I have always been against hurting prisoners of war... But this time, my finger's itching.
You turn my stomach, and I HATE when my stomach turns.
I would call you a disgusting slug, but I am quite fond of slugs and do not wish to insult them.
Pierre was here?
He failed as a commander on Ernie and the Major sent him here for punishment.
Tough break, I guess.
Would have been kinder to just kill him.
Not a forgiving sort, this Major.
He thought he was better than all of us, but I showed him he was wrong. He had the nerve to try to escape, but I caught him! They will teach him good manners in Camp Bien Chien.
These people will do much better without you
Non, they will not! You will pay them to work and give them clean uniforms, but they will slack and complain and steal from you. You need someone like me in charge.
No. My father    shot . Scumbags like you.
Context: Conversation DiamondRed_Boss_1 Text "Great Patriotic War" - meaning WW2

Text: We need someone like you in a deep hole covered with dirt.
You're an even bigger asshole than my first boss. Him I shot in the nuts. You... I haven't decided where I'm gonna shoot you yet.
I wouldn't even put you in charge of cleaning dog shit off sidewalks.
You're disgusting. I know Hollywood producers less creepy than you.

I could oversee this mine for you! I mean, be a normal foreman, like with hardly any beatings. I won't kill anyone unless you say so. I know where the best diamonds are! I'll even give you my secret stash.

Context: Conversation DiamondRed_Boss_1 Text "Nope. Ain't gonna happen."

Text: How about you become a slave again? You're so good at it.
hired Slave Master Graaf as a Foreman
hired Slave Master Graaf as a Foreman
You won't regret this! I'll squeeze these maggots hard and they'll produce even more diamonds than before!
Any one of them steals so much as a plastic fork, you know what to do.
Tell me when you squeeze! I like to watch.
If you catch any thieves, release them and I will hunt them myself.
Here. As promised, this is my stash. Look at them sparkle!
Become a Foreman for us
You will not regret this... Hey, what are you doing? I thought you said... Wait! Don't shoot! Non-non...
Please don't kill me, I... I have a great diamond collection. Please, spare me and it's all yours!
Any diamonds from you are blood diamonds.
Kept a little hidden away for yourself, huh? Guess you're not a complete idiot.
I always think it's kind of funny how people suddenly become wealthy when begging for their lives.
Well, that sounds very reasonable to me.
Let me go, and I'll give you my secret stash.
Please don't kill me, I...
Time for you to die
Non, non, I can help you run this place! You need me! Please...
banished Slave Master Graaf
Leave and never come back
Alright, alright. You won't see me again. But you will regret this.

Context: Conversation DiamondRed_Boss_1 Text "Our commander is an idiot."

Text: I already regret not shooting you. Now scram!
If I never see you again, then I regret nothing!
Good riddance! I thought he'd never leave.
Give us the diamonds and leave
Alright! Alright. Sparkling little diamonds, all the blood and the sweat washed off them. Here they are!

Context: Conversation DiamondRed_Boss_1 Text "Our commander is a greedy bastard."

Text: Really? We are going to let this snake get away with what he has done?!
I already regret not shooting you. Now scram!
Something tells me he won't run fast enough to escape all the people he's wronged. I won't lose sleep over it.
Yuck. I do not want to think about where he hid these when the Major came to visit.

Well, it looks like the cavalry's arrived! Come to check up on what's happening here? The name's "Painless" Doc Robert. Don't let the name fool ya. I can be a plenty big pain in the ass when I want to be, it's just not my specialty. HA!
I too try to engage the matters at hand in the most painless way possible. But sometimes to relieve pain at one location, pain must be inflicted at another.
Let me guess: Acupuncturist?
Among other things.
Pain is nothing but a sign post pointing toward the final destination.
Charming. You must be a hit at parties.
I've got a pain that needs a little treatment. A little voyage dans la lune if you catch my drift. You think you can help me out, doc?
I know the perfect bullet for you, my boy. But sadly I'm all out of stock.
Anyways. What can I do for you, fellas?
Well, well, if it isn't the wild bunch. What is it this time? Looking for meds or looking for trouble? What can Painless Doc Robert do for you?
We much better than Wild Bunch, partner. You see when I make movie about us!
I'm always looking for meds, but what I usually find is trouble.
We're always looking for trouble, love. It's in the job description.
Hey, hey... the wild bunch is back in the game. I didn't expect to see you again.
Well, I didn't expect you'd see anything at all with those glasses. So I guess we were both fooled.
Not my first choice, either.
What can I say? I guess we just can't quit you, Doc.
What happened here? Why is everybody dead?
Who are all these armed men?
You're behind this, aren't you?
I'm afraid things took a different turn while you were gone. These fine gentlemen came here all the way from Landsbach to be our new hosts.
If those guys are gentlemen, then I'm a goddamn princess.
New hosts? Like... dinner hosts?
I don't think "gentlemen" is the right word for them. I would describe them as "scuzzballs" or "people I may have to kill soon."
...And my new disease hosts, though they don't know it yet. But as Dr. Kronenberg says - if you interfere with an experiment, you become the experiment!
That's sick, Doc.
That's... awful! What is wrong with you!?
That is horrible! Does your mother know what you do?
Speaking of interfering, I'm afraid your days of sticking your noses where they don't belong are over. Time for the wild bunch to meet their inevitable, bloody end. Guards!
What's happening in this town?
Oh, you know, the usual drill. Small fishing village where people's attitudes towards personal hygiene range from ambivalent to hostile. And now they are dying, surprise-surprise.
A filthy mind is one thing, but a filthy body is disgusting... Unless it's sweat - a nice, glistening sheen of sweat...
Unsanitary conditions can easily lead to the rapid spread of disease. Do you suspect it's an epidemic?
An epidemic of filth and carelessness is about all I'm sure of right now.
I have field manual on hygiene if you need.
If it would help, I can arrange an emergency delivery of soap and foot powder.
I made an instructional video on the importance of personal hygiene. It's called "Clean and Fresh for Success." I shall send you a copy.
I'll be counting the days until it gets here.
It sounds to me like these people need to reinvigorate their auras with a good colon cleanse. Here's what I like to do...
Please. Stop. Just write it down for me and I'll look it over later. Okay, Dr. Moonbeam?
What is the cause of all these deaths?
Natural causes not good enough for you, eh?
Dying is as natural as living. The two of them are inseparable. Like two lovers swirling in an endless dance.
Dang, Woodstock, can't you talk straight?
We would like answers, not jokes, Doctor. Give us your expert medical opinion.

Just kidding. Well, if it's a disease it's not any one I'm aware of. No traces of poisoning, either. No contamination in the water. Now, you may have noticed that the locals are a little superstitious around here. They're simple-minded country folk.
Hey, man. I'm a little bit country myself.
If you saw the shit that I've seen you'd be superstitious too, man!
A little superstition is good protection against calamity.
I, on the other hand, am a man of science. But God, or whoever is in his place, as my witness: I can't find a single scientific explanation for this carnival of death.
That is because science moves us away from nature. It is only by moving towards nature that we achieve enlightenment.
Ooh! Dia de Los Muertos! This is Fidel's favorite holiday. I bring many gifts of death!
I went to a carnival once and found out the strongman game was rigged. It did not start out as a carnival of death, but I made sure it ended that way!
Sure, why not. I'm sure your mission is more important than mine. All these dying people can wait while I kiss your boo-boos.
What can you tell us about Voodoo?

Bunch of baloney, if you ask me, but don't take those crazy-ass pagans lightly. Those people are dangerous. You know, there's something fishy about that old witch Wanda. And I'm not just talking about her steady catch-of-the-day diet!
This is good idea. We should investigate her food.
Ooh. A fish called Wanda. We should get autograph!
Fishing is to hunting as checkers is to chess.
Pagan Voodoo fishy witch lady? Okay. I'll just add her name to our list of bizarre and suspicious people... if there's room.
Perhaps we should throw water on her and see if she turns into a fish!
My old man used to go fishing with a gun, some twine, and a tarp. I never knew what he caught. He invited me along once. I didn't go.
Tell us about the dead writer
My friend Roger Wilcox, right there on the autopsy table. Go ahead and ask him anything you like. You'll find he's very open.
That is a very good joke. I will have to remember it.
Why do coroners always have such a sick sense of humor?
You're not capable of any humility, are you doctor?
How did he die? Was it the disease?
Have you been able to establish a link to the other recent deaths?
Hello? Dead person? Can you hear me? Hmmm. I think he is asleep.
He came here to write a book that I was sure no one would ever read. And now it has turned out to be a scientific fact! He died just as elegantly as the other ones.
Any more details about the dead writer?

Well, aren't you the nosey type? Can't tell you much. I don't have time for reading, apart from medical journals, so writers don't really interest me. I know he spent his days mostly hanging out with that weirdo Xavier, and scribbling notes in his cabin right behind this one.
Isn't the whole Sanatorium infected with a deadly disease?
Could be. I know they had their hands full trying to treat it, that's for sure. I haven't been back there in months and haven't heard any news, either. Who knows? Maybe they're all dead by now.
There are some missing pages in Wilcoxs diary
Beats me. If I'm certain of one thing in this village, it is that everyone around here is funny in the head. Have you met the Hog Lady?
Excuse me! That is no way to refer to a lady.
Women generally like to be called by their names, mate. That's a lesson I had to be taught a few times before I remembered it.
Oh, there's plenty of cuckoos in this town, Doc. I don't even have to look out the window to see one.
There is very definitely a bit of looniness in the air here, Doctor. You may want to test yourself to be certain you haven't caught it.
Just remember, when you point your finger there's four more pointing right back at ya, Doc.
The only hog I know that's also a lady is my Harley-Davidson FL Hydra-Glide. Now, she's what I call an easy ride!
What are you doing here?

I've been sent to investigate why these poor wretches are dropping faster than the dot-com stock market. I usually work as the coroner at the Sanatorium not far from here. That's how I introduced myself, but the fools started calling me "the colonel." Don't mind them... Language barrier.
Context: Conversation DocRobert_1 Text "Language barrier" is whispered with a grin

Text: They think you are a colonel? I guess that make you new sheriff in town!
God, I hope not! I'm more of a "have scalpel, will travel" kind of guy.
Sanitarium? You worked with those creepy cadavers? That's wild, man. Couldn't pay me enough for that.
That's what I keep telling 'em!
Ye did autopsies on those zombies!? It's a wonder you're still alive.
We don't like to use the Z-word.
That Sanitarium place be creepy, mon!
Well, creepy is a relative term in my line of work, but... yes.
What is your opinion of Dr. Kronenberg?
One hell of a smart lady, but I try to stay away from her. I recommend you do the same.
I saw that market dip coming, man! Dot-coms are a scam. I'm invested in big pharma.
And I can tell by the tracks on your arms that big pharma has invested a lot into you.
Anyway, I stopped correcting them, so now I guess I'm promoted, huh? Haha!
Military rank is not a joke, Doctor.
Impossible. You cannot be colonel without many commendations.
Congrats, Colonel! My advice? Retire.
We found Wilcoxs diary

Well, here's your proof, wild bunch. Our deceased friend here might be a crazy fool, but he's nothing compared to that old bat Wanda and her pet chicken-heads. They are killing off their own. And they surely won't stop. Just say the word and I guarantee the witch will get what she deserves.
You are right, doc. Wanda needs to die.
Time for the Voodoo lady to take a dirt nap.
It is a thing of regret, but thou shalt not suffer a witch to live.
She's gotta die, man! I mean, think of the chickens!
Now, that's what I'm talking about. Glad to see you got a good head on those shoulders and a large enough set of balls to do the right thing. Let's put an end to that freak show.
This choice will have consequences.
Hang on, mate. We gotta think this through first.
Sorry, but before we start our own Spanish Inquisition perhaps we should take a moment to consider our options.
Let us take a moment to step back and look at this from range first.
Greater deeds need a greater amount of time and focus. We should never underestimate the forces of nature.
The time is not yet ideal.
Let's snoop around and see if we can dig up that lost page first.
Yeah, yeah. Take your time, no need to hurry. It's not like people are dying left and right or anything.

That is a bit far-fetched. I have thrown a spark, but the fire burns on its own. And this strain of the Red Rabies is hot as hell! The patients enter the catatonic phase before the personality loss phase, which may be the solution to Dr. Kronenberg's main issue!
Jesus! How can you call yourself a doctor?
I feel bodily urges to squash you like a puny bug.
You are a servant of Shaitan! Prepare to be sent back to him... with my regards.
I do not know what any of these medical words mean, but I will be sure to ask someone after I kill you.
You are easily in the top five of the most disgusting people I have ever met!
I'll be sure to pass your notes along to someone who cares right after I finish carving you up like a dinner roast.
Now, before you become too emotional for me to handle, please meet my friends from Landsbach who needed this village as much as I needed their cooperation.
This choice will have consequences.
We know you infected the whole village

That is a bit far-fetched. I have thrown a spark, but the fire burns on its own. And this strain of the Red Rabies is hot as hell! The patients enter the catatonic phase before the personality loss phase, which may be the solution to Dr. Kronenberg's main issue!

I'll be sure to pass your notes along to someone who cares right after I finish carving you up like a dinner roast.
This choice will have consequences.
And let's not forget about social distancing. Whatever we've got here is probably very infectious.
Hallo? Are you agents of the Allies?
More like a jagged alliance
InitialRedirect
Ach, my memory is playing tricks on me once again. There are no Allies anymore! Are you here to capture me?
Hallo! So happy that you're still alive! I am a bit concerned. There has been a significant movement of troops here!
Are you coming close to my Cryolabor?
Ach, the Allied agents! Are you getting closer to my lab?
My name is Dr. Rudolph Gruselheim. I have personally designed this complex, and sadly, I am both its director and prisoner.
Die Gestapo appointed Siegfried as my, hmm, assistant. He was supposed to contribute as administrative director for the completion of Projekt Eisdrache.
There are some inconsistencies in your story
Ach, so... I was in the Cryo camera multiple times already and I keep losing track of the time. The vitrification technology was not meant to be used repeatedly on the same person, you see.
Capture you?

Ach, I admit ! I'm looking forward to it. 
I am well aware how Von Braun capitulated to the Americans and got to play with his toy rockets again! I hope that the same could be arranged for me.
I don't want to spend the rest of my life working for Nazis. Please come and meet me at the Cryo Lab and I will gladly capitulate. Where are you now?
We are at the Weapons Lab
Ach, that brings me back... fifteen years. Siegfried devitrified me for the first time with his silly request for making "indestructible armor".
Of course, nothing is indestructible, but one must admit, Kompositum 58 comes very close when applied to various polymers.
We are at the Bio Lab
Seven years ago, Siegfried ordered me to create "the perfect virus" that could be delivered behind enemy lines and cause chaos and mayhem.

I started with the common Rabies genome and developed the much more aggressive Red Rabies variant... And of course, I only agreed because he promised he won't use the virus unless the very existence of my fatherland was threatened.
You can imagine my annoyance when I learned Siegfried tried to sell it to North Korea! For better or worse, the plane crashed in the jungle above us.
We are at the Diesel Clinic
Hmm, Diesel. Some ten or twelve years ago, the original troops who guarded us were starting to get old, and Siegfried himself wasn't the boy I remembered anymore.
So, he devitrified me and asked me to create a "serum" that can make the old young again. Ha! That is not possible! Not within the time frame we had!
I developed the Super Soldat program instead. Siegfried was happy with it and ever since has been using it to turning local boys into relentless war machines.
We are near the Drop
The last time he put me out of the glass, Siegfried ordered me to enhance the Diesel formula.
When the Legion appeared they attacked The Drop. Gott bless their savage little minds! They used explosives so extensively they severed the railway to Landsbach.
I had a good laugh when I heard Siegfried lost a whole shipment of Altered Diesel while trying to send it by truck to his troops here.
We are at the U-Bahn
Take your time, I'm not going anywhere.
I have to hang up anyway. The guards may overhear me talking on the telephone.
I can officially capitulate. Take me to your government as an honored prisoner!
So, what are you going to do with me?
My name is Dr. Rudolph Gruselheim. I have personally designed this complex, and sadly, I am both its director and prisoner.
What is the role of Siegfried in all this?
Die Gestapo appointed Siegfried as my, hmm, assistant. He was supposed to contribute as administrative director for the completion of Projekt Eisdrache.
Tell us about your research
Ach, natrlich! What are you interested in?
Weapons Lab
Ach, that brings me back... fifteen years. Siegfried devitrified me for the first time with his silly request for making "indestructible armor".
Of course, nothing is indestructible, but one must admit, Kompositum 58 comes very close when applied to various polymers.
Bio Lab

I started with the common Rabies genome and developed the much more aggressive Red Rabies variant... And of course, I only agreed because he promised he won't use the virus unless the very existence of my fatherland was threatened.
You can imagine my annoyance when I learned Siegfried tried to sell it to North Korea! For better or worse, the plane crashed in the jungle above us.
Cryo Lab
It was before the war when I discovered the Wunderfrostschutzmittel, as I call it, in the Drachenberg mountains north from here.
The Wunderfrostschutzmittel is a wonderful cryo-protective regenerative agent. It makes the vitrification procedure possible with negligible intra-cell ice formation.
Die Wehrmacht was very interested in the possibilities. They built the whole U-Bahn from the coast to the mountains, and Projekt Eisdrache was born.
Diesel Clinic
Hmm, Diesel. Some ten or twelve years ago, the original troops who guarded us were starting to get old, and Siegfried himself wasn't the boy I remembered anymore.
So, he devitrified me and asked me to create a "serum" that can make the old young again. Ha! That is not possible! Not within the time frame we had!
I developed the Super Soldat program instead. Siegfried was happy with it and ever since has been using it to turning local boys into relentless war machines.
What happened at the Drop?
The last time he put me out of the glass, Siegfried ordered me to enhance the Diesel formula.
When the Legion appeared they attacked The Drop. Gott bless their savage little minds! They used explosives so extensively they severed the railway to Landsbach.
I had a good laugh when I heard Siegfried lost a whole shipment of Altered Diesel while trying to send it by truck to his troops here.
These are the people vitrified as part of Projekt Eisdrache.
Not enough clues
Who are these people in the cryo chambers?
When they realized they were losing the war, some of the top Wehrmacht und Gestapo officers were vitrified here, biding their time until Siegfried prepares their "grand return".
What do you want me do with them?
Have enough clues
Seal them here forever
"Forever" is such a demanding word, but this complex was built to last. So, I will let them sleep until the temperature control fails or water finally makes its way into the bunker.
It won't be a great loss to humanity either way.
Cut their bio support
Technically, the is no bio support - only temperature control. You see, they are effectively turned to glass. But if I take this hammer here...
Send them to court
Devitrification is not a simple process. It will take time, but once it is done, I will be happy if they face justice for their crimes.
I am looking forward to it!
You are free to leave

Really? Danke! I hope I will be able to fit in this world of the seventies. Or was it the eighties?
Never mind! I am ready!
This action may have major consequences!
sent Dr. Gruselheim to jail
You will go to jail as Nazi collaborator
Yes, that was what I have been asking for... Wait, you mean actual prison?...
Well, it is what it is. It cannot be worse than spending my life underground and being frozen to glass every ten years.
This action may have major consequences!
You will work for us in the Weapons Lab

Ach. Schade. I was hoping I will see the sun once again.
Well, at least I'm not working for the Nazi anymore, right? Right?...
This action may have major consequences!
You will run the Sanatorium and find a cure for Red Rabies
Ach, natrlich. It's hard to contain a bio weapon once it has been released, but I guess I am the most qualified person for this task.
Don't you want me to improve the formula instead? Nein? Never mind, I'll create a robust inoculation agent for you.
This action may have major consequences!
You will run the Diesel Clinic and help people
That sounds interesting! I have some new ideas how to improve the Super Soldat formula by introducing females to the program.
No? Fine, fine... I will concentrate on fixing young Siegfried's mistakes.
This action may have major consequences!
I will remain right here.
Take your time.
Who are you? Why have you murdered my patients?!
Who are you? Why have you shot the clinic guards and murdered my patients?!
Now what do you want? Haven't you caused enough trouble by murdering my patients?!
What now?
Hi, Doc! I'm here for more of your sweet, sweet treatment.
