Mr. Roachburn, I do not have time for you right now. Please see one of the nurses.
I... have not made much progress. I need more samples. Do I need to go and gather them myself?!
I'll do anything to help you, Doc! Come on. Where's the table? Strap me down and give me the electric blasts of your maternal love.
But you told me we were making progress, Doctor. You told me that every time you flipped the switch!
Mr. Roachburn, control yourself.
Where are my samples? I don't have much time! AND STOP MAKING SO MUCH NOISE WITH YOUR SHOES!
Yes, Doc, I'm ready! I'm taking them off right away, Doc! Please strap me down and unleash your electric love upon me!
I'm taking them off right away! I'll be good, I swear. There is no need of any more electrical treatment!
Thank you, Mr. Roachburn, that won't be necessary. Now LEAVE before I change my mind.
It is... it is too late... WHERE HAVE YOU BEEN?!
Um...
Well...
See, what had happened was...
I DON'T NEED YOUR EXCUSES! I need a transfusion... Arrrgh, I can't... This is all your fault!
I cannot help but point out that I am certainly not completely to blame here.
Time to reap the whirlwind, Doctor.
helped discover a cure for the Red Rabies
helped discover a cure for the Red Rabies
You have the samples! Good. Now, the moment of truth. I should be able to extract a serum that kills all forms of the virus. With a little bit of luck, it may even work on me.
Um, I see the visual markers of progressing inflammation, as well as some increased salivation...
I would advise you to be careful, as your illness has obviously progressed.
It may be too late for the Queen Bee to be saved, but there is still a chance for the hive to survive.
YES! I can confirm it is working well on the cellular level, and a healthy immune response is observed... STEP ASIDE YOU MORONS!
Gladly. I don't even want to be in the same room with you.
I guess it's true what they say - doctors make the worst patients.
What is... NO, NO, NO! The infection has spread too far! I... not enough... healthy tissue... Need more... ARGH!
Your patients are monsters
They are people in dire need of medical aid and I refuse to let them die without receiving it.
You give them medicine, but still they die? What is the point of this?
So it is okay when they die WITH medical aid?
You almost make it sound as if YOU are the one receiving the aid.
I am doing what I can... I am doing what I HAVE to do. At the very least, I am relieving their pain and not shooting my patients.
Your guards did shoot your patients
It is up to the hospital guards' discretion to stop an outbreak by any means necessary.
Fidel has means to stop all the outbreak!
So you're saying it is alright if your goons are doing the atrocities, ma'am?
They call that plausible deniability, Dr. Woodworm.
My name is Dr. Kronenberg.
I'll make a note of it.
Gained a clue about the Sanatorium
Not much medical aid
The medical procedures I observed on my way here are in the best case, um, unsanitary.
This place looks more like a butcher shop than a hospital!
This place seems to do little to heal the body and even less to tend to the soul.
And who are you to tell me how I am to handle my patients?! If they need to die for the sake of science, then they will die and no half-baked field nurse can tell me what to do with them!
And I suppose the sloppy hospital management and filthy conditions here are supposed to prove your superior medical skills?
The term is "combat medic"! I only dressed up as a field nurse that one time.
Excuse me! I am fully baked! No, wait, that came out wrong.
And I can order YOU to be infected as well!
Medical check successful Gained a clue about the Sanatorium
Doc Robert infected a village for you
Doc Robert was a real psychotic scuzzwad, but he's fish food now.
Doc Robert was doing nightmarish experiments with the Red Rabies virus. Did you know about that?
Many people died at Chalet de la Paix because your coroner decided to play mad scientist.

That moron. Yes, I did send him to the village, but that doesn't mean I am accountable for his mistakes. However, working on a cure for a disease of this scale is a complex process and collateral damage is inevitable.
The damage was not collateral. Those people were targeted.
I would not call the deliberate infecting of half a town's population "collateral damage"... Doctor.
Collateral damage? He was using those people like lab rats! They didn't even have a choice!
As I said - I cannot be held responsible for his... carelessness.
Gained a clue about the Sanatorium
People are dying in here
Of course they are dying here! People don't go to the beach to die, they come to the hospital!
Ah, Fidel see you have never been to Havana beach.
Um... That may be statistically true, but... It is not the actual reason why people go to the hospital.
Your logic is inescapable... but strangely, I am not comforted.
There is something wrong going on here
Yes, there is. A group of armed thugs appeared and started murdering my patients!
Not enough clues
YOU are the one murdering your patients!

Why are you not laughing?
What?!
You should be laughing maniacally when you say something like that.
Ah, I see, you're doing it for science! Did you promise them cake?
I hope you're making some sort of sick joke, Doctor. Murder is murder.
The Red Rabies is no joke. It is virulent and deadly, and the hosts spread it through acts of brutal violence. I was so close to breaking its genome when I became infected...
The work consumed your soul, now it consumes your body.
Oh, gross! Nope. Uh-uh. I think I need to be going now.
And I'll be taking just a step or two back now.

I soon discovered that a blood transfusion from a newly infected host can temporarily halt the disease progression. In the interest of expediency, it was necessary to infect volunteers to insure a steady supply of recently exposed blood and tissue.
Somehow, I doubt these volunteers knew exactly what they were volunteering for.
This... This is too much. I think I'm going to be sick.
Are ye daft, woman?! You cannae play God with people like that.
I am so close to discovering a cure! Who will be helped if I die before I complete my research?
Dr. Kronenberg exposed
You cant go around infecting people!
Why? Hundreds have died already, but if I do not finish my research the disease will spread and it will claim the lives of millions more. It is simple math.
. Hundreds may die to save millions.
I hate to admit it, but she does have a point.
If this is their fate, then millions must die. It is not her choice to make.
This is not the only way to do medical research. As doctors, our job is to alleviate suffering, not make use of it.
Ha! Tell that to the doctors of both World Wars. Nothing has contributed to medical science more than using human test subjects.
Meh. The herd will be thinned. The strong will survive and the weak will perish. This is Nature.
That kind of math don't add up to nothing for me.
I need to continue with my experiments, or the Red Rabies will kill me and my research will die with me.
That is reasonable
I am pleased to see that someone can see reason. I will make sure my... condition remains stable, and I will continue with my experiments. However, some help with my research would be appreciated.
Wait, are we going to become accomplices to her hideous crimes?
It is regrettable, but it is for the greater good.

Text: This is horrible. I don't want to be part of this.

Dr. Kronenberg will keep her condition stable
Dr. Kronenberg will continue to infect people in order to finish her research
stopped human experiments in the Sanatorium

. We make mistake.

Greaaaat. Virus hunting. This will be... not even remotely fun.

I was feeling bad about this, but now you just sound like every one of my ex-wives.
Die, murderer!

You gonna pay now for these things you been doing!

You psychopaths!...
You sound like Fidel's own mam!

Leave! Leave!
The hospital is at your disposal, but please, stop killing my patients.
Yes. Apparently, that is your job.
Now that'd be a real shame, wouldn't it missy.
Awww... And here I was thinking you didn't care about them.
I need them alive as long as possible for... Well, you know why I need them.
Alright, hurry up and find me those samples. The clock is ticking.
We will do our best.
We promise to be back before high noon!

Same to you, love.
I encourage you to do the same, Frau Doctor.
We will if you will. Let's make a pinky promise!
Alright, back to work. You know where the door is.
We sure do, Doc. Okay if we grab some Jell-O on the way out?
Of course, Dr. Kronenberg. We'll be good, we promise. You look, um, lovely as always.
Mr. Roachburn... Just leave.
The name's Dr. L'Enfer. Who the hell are you? Are you the constables I heard about? You here to investigate the murders in the area?
We are here to investigate

Oh, really? May I look at your IDs? Badges? No? Of course not. As I see it, you are either some new breed of inventive bandits, or the government is so desperate they started delegating law enforcement to random amateurs.
Hey! Quit it with the name-calling, mister!
The Hippocratic Oath doesn't prevent me from hurting your feelings, little missy.
"Inventive bandit"! Love that, man! I'd put that on my business card if I had one.

Think of us as private dicks.
You may rest assured that I most certainly will.
We are just mercenaries
So you have no legal reason to be here. You are just meddling in other peoples' affairs in the hope that someone will pay you to kill someone else?
I wouldn't put it quite that way.
Wow. That pretty much sums it up. Yes.
Gimme a break, Doc, you're reading me my job description.
We are harbingers of death serving a purpose in life.

You're a sight for sore eyes. So much I wish I was blind.
Nice day for grave disturbing, isn't it? Hu-ha.
What is going on here?
Right now, a bunch of gun-toting kids are disrupting the work of a medical professional.

I h'aint been called a kid since I was a wee bairn! Do I look like a wee bairn to ye?!

You need to know more? Please do not hesitate to go outside and ask someone who cares.
What do you need to know? As far as I'm concerned, they have been very successful as such. The patients are surely one hundred percent dead.
We have been asked to investigate the murders
Tell us about the murders
Tell us everything you know
Hmmm... You want me to tell you the story about the gorgeous nurse who helped me with my study of Gross Anatomy?
Yes, please!
Mmm, that might be interesting.
I'm listening.
You have my undivided attention.
No, now that I think of it, I'll keep it to myself. You would not have the stomach for it.

You're talking to a man who's watched every piece of pornography ever recorded. Hit me, Doc.

Where were you at the time of the murder?
Working alone in my clinic, looking over the results of the previous murder. Are you asking me if I have an alibi?

If you don't have one, that's okay, too. I've already thought up a couple for you.
Might be a good idea to get one, mon.
No, I don't have an alibi - which is equally true for you as well, "constable".
What do you think of the vengeful spirits?
Do YOU believe in Santa Claus? No, actually - don't tell me. I'm afraid to hear the answer I'd get.
What is problem with Santa Claus?!
is like God - people need to believe lies.
Amen to that. It's the basic truth of the human condition.
Santa Claus is a great role model for me. I too wish to bring gifts to all the good girls of the world.
What are the autopsy results?
Some were shot, others were poisoned. All died with great success.
You don't say.
Success being a relative term.
Indeed.
Nobody blew up? BORING!
However, there was never one who was poisoned and shot at the same time. That probably means the murderer is a responsible person who does not waste resources.
Good work, Doctor!
Perhaps, but a simple method of murder does not imply an elegant one.
Got it. So, our suspect is someone who thinks wasting lives is okay, but not resources.
Well, as the great detective once said, "There is nothing more deceptive than an obvious fact."
We found cyanide in your cabinet
Good job! And if I was a miner, you would have found a sharp pickaxe in my shed, right? Hmm, now that I think of it, I'm quite certain I actually have one somewhere around here.
He has a point, cyanide has some medical uses in clinical chemistry.
Oh, a colleague? And where do you see a chemical lab in here, young man?
Umm, it can also be applied in emergency situations to produce a rapid decrease in blood pressure?
Correct. You get an A minus, where the minus stands for one dead patient because you're too smart to be practical.
So sorry, my good man! But, erm, you see, my method of investigation is founded upon the observation of trifles.
You use a pickaxe for autopsies?
I'm guessing you used to suck on paint chips as a child.
Sure! Got any?
Can you provide medical aid?
Can shit fly? Regrettably for those on the receiving end, it can. But, to be perfectly honest, neither activity gives me great joy these days.
Are there cases of Red Rabies here?

You could say so, but not in the literal sense. What now, is that old hag Kronenberg sending you after me? I told her I'm not helping her and I meant it. Please go and advise her to apply both the superius and inferius labia oris to my gluteus maximus.
Do what now?
No, don't ask about that...
Erm... I think he wants her to...
I believe what the doctor is suggesting is...
In short, you can tell her to kiss my ass.
She got the Red Rabies
Did she? If this isn't some karmic justice! When is the funeral?
It's about saving human lives!
If I subscribed to Dr. Kronenberg's approach to saving human lives, I would go around putting calculators in first aid kits. Now stop wasting my time.
Her research keeps her alive
She thinks she's close to a cure, but from what I've seen... it's worse than the disease.
She's mad as a hatter, that one is. Finishing her research will finish her!
Well, she looks awful. I think her "research" is only making her worse.
Man, I think she's gone crazy. She thinks her research is helping, but it's just making her sicker.
I may not be a doctor, but in my opinion, the research is the only thing keeping her alive.
So basically you're telling me that the sooner I help her with her research, the sooner we'll get rid of her? That's very cynical of you. I'll help any way I can.
Help us and we'll leave you alone
You help us with this and we will never cross paths again.
This is painful for both of us, Dr. Woodchipper. Give us what we want and we'll get out of your hair.
Hey, man, it's cool. You just give us the stuff and we go away and forget your name, y'know? Oh, wait... What was your name?
If you help us out, I swear we will leave and never, ever get anywhere near your medicine cabinet.
I offer a simple deal, doctor. Give us what we want, and you will never be in my crosshairs again.
This is uncomfortable for both of us. Give us what we want and you'll never see us again... not even our shadows.
Give us what we want and we promise to leave you alone... in this rather sad and filthy place.
Doctor, if you give us that sample, you'll be off our person-of-interest list. Sound good?
Do be a good doctor and give us that sample. Good doctors are far less interesting to me than bad ones... if you take my meaning.
You promise? I'll hold you to your word, so don't expect me to answer any pesky questions about any murders. You can go play detective somewhere else.
Just help us with the virus
Okay, I'll share with you my own research. Now go give it to Kronenberg and get off my back!
We have a suspect for the murders
Good for you! Do you want me to gather those annoying Van Tassels and Le Domas so you can tell them about it, or do you need more time sniffing around and asking repetitive questions?
Seriously. I feel like a cop. Eugh.
I hear that. I didn't sign on to this gig to walk around and act like five-oh.
I must admit, I am rather enjoying myself!
Gather them
Alright. Let's get this over with.
Not yet
I wonder if you'll ever leave... No, no, don't tell me - I like the suspense.
We found the will of the LEnfer brothers
Hm. Is grave robbing your occupation, or just a hobby?
Hobby!
Occupation.
Actually, we're more into the grave filling business.
Well, this is really more like grave borrowing... Except, that sounds weird, doesn't it?
Before you decide to start digging out my other L'Enfer relatives, I will tell you what you need to know.
But we did put them back!
Might have done that from the start, Woodman, and spared us some digging.
Maybe next time start with that.
Yes, I'm the last living heir of the L'Enfer family and I own this land. However, decades ago the Manors were sold separately to the horrible Van Tassel and Le Domas families.
How did the LEnfer brothers die?
That shameful incident is a family secret.
A-ha! So they did kill each other after all!
Is it scary?...
We promise not to tell!
Okay, here is the story: one hundred years ago, the servants were cleaning a cesspool. One of them succumbed to the toxic fumes coming out of it, fell inside and started drowning...
Huey L'Enfer tried to help him, but also fell down the shit hole. Then Dewey came to help, with the same result...
Eeew...
Damn, that's ugly.
Let me guess - there was a third brother named Louie?
Oui. He is my grandfather. He died in France, away from this shithole.
I suppose there are worse ways to go, but I'm having difficulty thinking of any at the moment.
Come on, man. You're puttin' me on.
Important reminder to double check your safety equipment, people! All right. Continue.
A total of five people died that fateful day drowning in shit, and it's definitely not written on their gravestones.
That explains the speculations about their deaths.
Man, your family is full of shit.
Man, your family is full of shit.
Ha. Ha.
More like smeared! Ha, ha! ...What? Nothing?
It's never too early to stop wasting my time.
What is it, "officers"? I'm dying to learn who your suspect is. Or shall we resort to exorcism?
Now, have you made up your mind already? Who is your murderer, "constables"?
You did it
Oh really? If I was as bad at doctoring as you are at investigating, I'd be running a morgue instead of a clinic.
It would be a better match for your bedside manner, that's for certain!
It would certainly be a better match for your personality.
Sorry, old-timer. Time for frontier justice!
I hardly even need to ask, but what do my good neighbors think?
Van Tassels did it
Le Domas did it
I think you're not entirely wrong, but you could be multiplying the wrongs instead of subtracting.
Math is hard!
I swear, this guy's got a riddle for everything.
Philosophy of Fidel is that many wrongs make right.
Well, what do my good neighbors have to say to these accusations?
Fidel is confused. You making fun of Fidel?
That's what you get for misunderestimating us.
I had my shortsightedness corrected when I was in high school.
All Dolviches have superior shortsight. It is genetics.
Oh yes, we nailed them.
Plenty - and it's all been properly bagged, labeled, and color-coded.
My dear Dr. L'Enfer, of course I have evidence. I never guess. It is a shocking habit, destructive to the logical faculty.
Alright, Sherlock, keep your deerstalker hat on.
Doc, we got more evidence than the OJ trial. Wait, bad example.
Have enough clues
The Families were killing each other
As a notorious pessimist, I confess to feeling a little disappointed. I expected you to be as shortsighted as my half-wit neighbors.
Oh, but we are at least twice as shortsighted as your neighbors! Perhaps even three times.
They are pathetic and beneath my contempt. It would be a mercy to kill them.
They do not lift. It is no wonder they are so small and unhappy.
No one has better shortsight than Tex Colburn! Sharpest shortsight in whole world.
I just hope you have enough evidence.
Erm, yeah, sort of.
I need no evidence, for the spirits of the dead speak tales of horror to my ear.
Evidence? Who needs evidence when you got grenades?!
Yes! I even drew a detailed evidence map!
I see. The pink unicorn in the corner looks very suspicious. So...
Well, what do my good neighbors have to say to these accusations?
Not enough clues

Really. For the sake of what little faith in humanity I have left, I will assume you are joking.
We need more time to investigate
How much more time? Good thing I already have my will written out - I'm starting to think I won't live to see the end of your "investigation".
You?!... What are YOU doing here?! No-no-no, this can't be happening... Wait. Whatever it is you think I am, let me assure you that I am... not.
Heeey... I know you! Everybody in Arulco knows who you are!
I swear I have seen you before, only last time you had many more bruises.
Please don't shoot me, Your Highn-... I mean, Your Mercenary-ness. If you've come here for me, you should know that I'm not me. I mean, I'm not who you think I am! I'm the Major!
Heeey... I know you! Everybody in Arulco knows who you are!
The hell ya doin' here, Woody?
I swear I have seen you before, only last time you had many more bruises.
Hello, boy.
What? How?! W-w-why are you here, Your Highn-... um, Your Major-ness?
I let you keep that rank you bought off a Grand Chien officer because I thought it was funny. Come to find out you been using it to impersonate me. Now I don't think it's funny anymore.
B-but I didn't mean to do it! I just never corrected people who got the wrong idea... Oh, god, why did you bring THEM here with you?! No-no-no, not again!
Please don't shoot me! I'm an idiot!
No, no, no, don't shoot me please... I surrender!
Don't kill me, Your Highness! I mean... I'm an idiot! I don't want to be a Major anymore!
You are Elliot from Arulco
Ladies and gentlemen, I present to you a dear old friend, the runner up in every competition with two participants, the one and only - "Major" Elliot from Arulco!
I have a perfect memory of faces and yours is one I recall being very close to Deidranna.
Come on, stop playing games. We both know who you are.
You're that little guy with all the head wounds in the Meduna Palace, right?
Guess you didn't fly away far enough, Woodfinch. I recognize you.
You were the one to whom Deidranna administered many beatings. Your face looks much better.
Alright, I confess. I am Elliot. I just... I had to go somewhere after you mercenaries killed Deidranna and ruined Arulco.
We didn't ruin it, we liberated it.
Po-TAY-to, Po-TAH-to...
The glorious and noble mercenaries saved it! It was Deidranna who was ruining it.
She was just misunderstood.
I seem to recall her using tanks to flatten whole villages. What was that?
That was just... land re-development.

Grand Chien isn't a bad place if you have some connections... As a Major, I have the chance to get the respect I deserve! I mean, I'm still waiting for the respect, but... But now you mercs have to come along and ruin everything... again!
So you are from Arulco
Did big bad mercenaries blow up your country and give you a boo-boo? Awww. Want me to kiss it and make it better?
Why are you so mad about what happened in Arulco? Did you have a lot invested in Deidranna's plans?
That Arulco business got you all worked up. Did you have some kind of gig with the old lady's regime?
Yes, but... No! I just know about Arulco because I watched the news on TV. I was horrified to see how viciously you defeated Her Highness Deidranna and her noble advisor Elliot.
Her noble advisor... who?
Elliot!
I don't remember any advisor. I do remember a little rat-faced man she used to kick around... What was his name?
Elliot! And I... HE doesn't have a rat face, he just has very sharp facial features.
Never heard of no Elliot. Oh, wait. Was he the dude in the Palace with all them bitch-slap bruises on his face?
Those were... just a misunderstanding.
Your soldiers dont respect you?
No, not really... But at least they fear me! And that's the same as respect, isn't it?
Nyet. If I respect someone, I protect them. If I fear someone, I kill them.
Having a soldier's respect means they'll die for you. Making them fear you means one day you'll get out of bed and step on a land mine.
You are an idiot.
They know I can always throw them to the crocs! Just like I did with... oh, poor Stony.
What happened to Stony?
During the opening ceremony of this Croc Plank I wanted to show them what happens if they don't listen to me... It wasn't my fault... I told him, "STONY, YOU IDIOT! Don't stand so close to the edge!"
I think I know what's coming. Covering my ears.
Not sure I want to hear the rest.
Hey man, the edge is where LIFE is!
I was just going to push him a little, just to make a show, but when I did, he... he slipped and... the crocs ate him. He was my only friend...
Man, you are an idiot.
Wonderful! I am sad that I missed it.
Apologies if this has been mentioned before, but... you truly are an idiot.
I know. I'm an idiot. I told everyone I did it on purpose, because... he was plotting against me. I feel awful, but what could I do? My soldiers would never respect me if they knew the truth!
Elliot, you idiot!
Elliot, you idiot!
I've known some idiots in my time, Elliot, but you take the cake.
Elliot, has anyone ever told you you're an idiot?
I know, I know! I'm an idiot, Your Highn... I mean, um, yes.
Who do you think WE are?
You are those darn mercenaries who devastated Arulco!
It makes Fidel very happy to know his work is appreciated!
Well, we can't take all the credit. Deidranna's tanks did most of the work.
This is not true! I only exploded what needed to be exploded.

A-and are devastating Grand Chien, too, of course! That's more important to me, because I'm not from Arulco or anything. Nope. I am a Major of the Grand Chien army... and you'll show me some respect - even if my own soldiers don't.

You may be a major weenie, but... you're not THE Major.
If you are the Major, Shaitan must be having trouble finding good help.
He is not Le Major. I do not even think he is "a" major.
I reviewed my notes. Your story doesn't add up. I don't believe you're the Major.
If you're the Major, I'm a monkey's uncle. Actually... I might be a monkey's uncle, but that still doesn't make you the Major.
I do not think you are the Major. I would imagine his aura to be very dark. Yours is the color of... urine.
True... But the real Major is far away from here, up there in Eagle's Nest in the Highlands. So what if people think I am the big, scary Major? It's not hurting anyone.
I don't think you really thought that one through, chief.
Wisdom is a gift that is given to precious few people. I hope you one day receive it.
You know there be people trying to kill the Major, right mon?
Time to decide what to do with you
No! No! Please, your Highn-...  uh, Your Mercenary-ness. Don't shoot me! I never wanted to be bad, I just wanted some respect...
Are you...? No! Not again!...
We are here to kill the Major
The Major must die. I will allow you a moment to pray, but please refrain from begging or blubbering.
The Major has been targeted for... termination.
No! No! Please!... I'm not the real Major... Please let me go! I haven't done anything wrong!
You did something horrible to your friend
Mama... I killed a man... Placed this Plank where he should tread, pushed too hard and now he's dead...
Context: Conversation Elliot_1 Text Singing softly to the tune of "Bohemian Rhapsody" as he starts to lose grip on reality

Text: Got any of Arulco's money with you?
What? Why would you... Oh. Right. Yes! I've got it right here, all that I have left. Take it. Just let me go!
Give us the money and scram
Yes! I will! Thank you, your Highness! Here, this is all the money I have. I'll leave right away!
sent Elliot to jail
You must go to jail
Yes... Of course... Goodbye, everybody, I've got to go. Gotta leave my Plank behind and face the truth!

Text: Just leave
Yes! I will! Thank you, Your Highness! I mean... Thank you! I'll leave right away!
executed "the Major"
Time for the "Major" to die
The mission is to kill the Major, boy. I'm not the Major anymore, so I guess that just leaves you...
But I'm not... Oh, no. Not again!
executed Elliot
Time to join Stony
Mama... oooh, I don't want to die...
Context: Conversation Elliot_1 Text Singing softly to the tune of "Bohemian Rhapsody" as he starts to lose grip on reality

Text: Alert! Intruder alert! Soldiers, your Major commands you! Come to my side, you idiots!
Please, don't kill me... I can't stop my troops from fighting you, but I won't be any trouble, I swear. I'll just find somewhere to hide.
Very well, Your Highn-... Your Mercenary-ness. I'll just wait here.
Thank you, friends!... May I call you that? I am so sorry for being too informal, but... I'm so happy to see you again.

I am also glad that this time it was you, not Corazon's bodyguards, who rescued me. You have helped preserve our heritage - something I doubt they care about. And I am positive that with the information I found, you will be able to save my father as well.
Did you learn anything about my father?
I am sorry that I was so naive as to trust Corazon Santiago. It should have occurred to me that she would prioritize her financial interests, even at the cost of involving her in a coup.
You are my last hope to save my father.
What heritage?
This very building those Legion barbarians damaged is an important part of Grand Chien's past. This is where the independence of our country was proclaimed by Gnralissime Chien himself!
Is that the fat guy with the fat dog outside?
I admit that the statue isn't the finest example of contemporary plastic art.
We saw the statue. It's quite... eye-catching.
I admit that the statue isn't the finest example of contemporary plastic art.
We saw the statue. Did he proclaim independence while he was feeding his dog or something?
I admit that the statue isn't the finest example of contemporary plastic art.
Back before the Legion kidnapped my father, I was trying to convince Gouverneur Le Pingouin to turn it into a Museum of the Adjani.
Poor Monsieur Le Pingouin. He didn't deserve such a fate.
Can we trust Gouverneur Le Pingouin?
He is... a good and honest person. Or at least his heart is in the right place. I know I can count on him. After all, he supported my father and he helped me find money to hire you!
Museum of the Adjani?

This region is not only rich in resources, it is also the cradle of civilization in this part of the world. It saddens me to see our heritage being smuggled out of the country or destroyed in pursuit of diamonds.
Bloody colonizers suck your country dry.
It saddens me, too. If you need a hug, I'm your man.
It is a lamentable fact that culture is very often sacrificed for profit.
If you happen to find any archeological treasures, would you please bring them here?
The gouverneur agreed to fund the Museum
Really?! But I thought he would never... Oh, thank you! Not only are you expert warriors, but skilled diplomats. I cannot praise you enough!
Fidel is full of diplomatics! And TNT.
Oh, well, it's all just a matter of putting the right tongue in the right ear.
Pish-posh! The old boy was positively squirming with eagerness to help.
How much can you pay for treasures?
Oh, I cannot exactly pay for them. Since the museum doesn't technically exist just yet, I cannot get any funding for acquiring artifacts. I am counting on your good will...
Good will doesn't pay the bills, lassie.
You can count on my good will! It is best will this side of the Pecos.
Je suis dsol, ma chre. I have a medical condition - I was born without good will.
But as the President's daughter - and PR representative, as well as secretary - I have a certain amount of influence.
If I can show my people that you are helping our country to restore its pride and dignity, I could convince them to join the Militia. You could then assign them to where they are needed.
Recruits for relics, huh? That's not a bad deal.
I can only imagine what the Legion could have been if the Major had chosen just such an approach.
Hearts and minds, huh? Not a bad idea.
We brought treasures
Oh, nice! What have you found?
Donate <color EmStyle>Ancient Figurine</color>
A figurine
This is very, very old and precious.
Donate <color EmStyle>Ancient Figurine</color>
Donate <color EmStyle>Ancient Golden Dog</color>
A golden dog
Did you know that in ancient times, the dog was the symbol of wealth in this region?
Yeah, especially the ones made outta gold, right?
If you knew the vet bill one of my ex-wives just stuck me with, you'd know they still are.
I really wanted to keep that one.
Donate <color EmStyle>Ancient Golden Dog</color>
Donate <color EmStyle>Ancient Idol</color>
An idol
It is beautiful... in its own way.
Donate <color EmStyle>Ancient Idol</color>
Donate <color EmStyle>Ancient Bronze Mask</color>
A mask
Oh, a ritual mask! It is a miracle that some of these are still preserved to this day.
Donate <color EmStyle>Ancient Bronze Mask</color>
Donate <color EmStyle>Ancient Clay Tablet</color>
A tablet
A tablet with an ancient form of writing! Why, these hieroglyphs must date back to at least 2,000 BCE! Can you imagine what my ancestors' lives must have been like back then?
I can't even imagine life before the invention of the combustion engine!
Yes, I can! It was a time of great danger and wonder, when gods and demons played games with the lives of mortals. In the middle of one of these games, a simple farmer decided to play a trick on...
Context: Conversation Emma_2 Text excitedly begins inventing a folk tale

Text: Oh, I'm sorry. That was a rhetorical question.
Yes. They hunted. They ate. They slept. Life was good.
Donate <color EmStyle>Ancient Clay Tablet</color>
treasure for the Museum
A rare green diamond

Wow, is this... Can it be? I need to double check, but I'm pretty sure this can be no other but the long lost "Pride of the Adjani"! It is a priceless jewel, but it is also much more than that - it is an important piece of my country's history. I cannot thank you enough for this donation.
Gosh, this sure feels right, doesn't it?
The servants of Shaitan will stop at nothing to take it from you. Prepare yourself.
We're giving it away?!... We're giving it away. Okay. That's completely fine... I think I need to lie down.

We want to dispatch Militia
Great! Where do you want me to send help?

Reinforce militia in Old Diamond
Of course, we need to protect our oldest mine.

Militia squads available:
Reinforce militia in Ernie
Of course. I'll put them on the first boat available.

Hopefully, we will have no problems with the Fleatown mafia.

I hope there will be no problems with those Maquis.

Reinforce militia in the Refugee Camp
Please send my regards to Sangoma the Shaman.

Reinforce militia in Landsbach
Okay! I hope you handled those thugs.

Reinforce militia in Ille Morat
One does not simply walk into the Cursed Forest where the Beast lurks... But I guess I can assemble a fellowship of brave volunteers.

Reinforce militia in Wassergrab
Restoring the infrastructure in that town will be a challenge, but first things first.

Yes, we need to make sure that the Legion will never again enslave the workers there.

Dangerous place. Some idiot has littered it with improvised mines, but I'll send people with basic explosives discipline.

Yes... I guess it is important to guard the crossroads.

That barrier sure looks strategically important.

You sure you want me to send people to that... bestiary? Okay.

Okay! I hope no one else gets eaten by crocodiles.

Militia squads available:
We need information
Pierre
I think that unlike most other Legion warlords, Pierre actually believed he was helping his country. I heard that the Major punished him and sent him to Diamond Red as a slave miner. Poor boy.
This is what happens to those who do not lift. They become poor slave miner boys.
Don't feel too sorry for him. The guy's an asshole.
If it saddens you to know he is there, then I will make it my mission to free him - if only to see you smile again.
Oh, um... Thanks.
The Good Place

It is an horrible place, actually. According to my sources, it is actually run by a former prisoner, a Legion warlord who uses the prison as a slave trade hub... Do you... Do you think they could be keeping my father there?
Try not to think about it, Ms. LaFontaine. We'll find your father no matter where he might be.
Your dad's kinda old, right? They'd probably have to give him lots of drugs to make him work hard... We should probably check it out.
It is not known, but your father has the spirit of a warrior. He will survive any torment to achieve victory over his enemy.
Asking specifically about the prison, hehe.
I... don't follow you.
Um... never mind.

I know it used to be a military facility. At some point, it was converted into a prison. I'm sure that Monsieur Le Pingouin has the plans for it somewhere, but I doubt that he would be willing to share that information with you.
How can we break into the Good Place?

I know it used to be a military facility. At some point, it was converted into a prison. I'm sure I have the plans for the base somewhere... Yes! Here they are. See this entrance? It looks to be difficult for anyone to defend. It could be locked, I guess.
No sweat. I get along just fine with locks.
Sounds like it's quiet and secluded. Just the kind of entrance I like.
It will not be a problem. I have special key that explodes any lock.
Anything concerning us?
There was another group of mercenaries that operated in the region shortly before you arrived. I think they called their organization M.E.R.C.
Not my favorite. I wanted to call it "People In Loud Leisure Suits"... or P.I.L.L.S. for short. I had awesome ideas for our uniforms!
That's what we call it. Other people have other names for it. Not nice names.
I see the tales of my exploits are already starting to spread!
Biff and M.E.R.C.

They were hired by Corazon Santiago with pretty much the same mission she gave you - to regain control of the diamond mines. From what I heard, they were last seen at the Carnival celebrations in Pantagruel.
Carnival! Oh, man, all those pretty colors...
Yeah, it was right around that time that things started to get... fuzzy.
It is a very painful memory for me. I do not wish to speak of it.
He appeared out of thin air only recently and created the "Patriotic Legion". From what few details I've gathered about him, it doesn't seem like he's a native of Grand Chien.
Are you suggesting he is some sort of foreign agent? Perhaps I should telephone the chaps down at MI6.
If he's a spy, he's sure drawing an awful lot of attention to himself.
Another buckhead passing himself off as a hunter.
Before he kidnapped my father, he took the diamond mines from Adonis, but he doesn't seem to care about the money. He lets his warlords spend it and do as they please.
He doesn't sound like such a bad guy to work for.
He sounds like a real enigma. I can't wait to get a look at his aura!
My blood's already boiling just thinking about this guy.
I don't even know for sure where he can be found - some say the highlands, others point to Camp du Crocodile in the swamps.
That's funny. Camp Crocodile was the name of the summer camp I went to as a kid. The swimming was great!
Camp du Crocodile? Is it some sort of petting zoo?
Charming name. Sounds like a delightful place to picnic.
The Major
The Major is still a mystery. It seems like everyone has heard of him, but no one has any idea who he is or what he hopes to accomplish by kidnapping my father.
I know him, but I do not know what he wants. He used to care about the people, but I doubt he cares about anything anymore.
You know him? Were you a part of his so-called Patriotic Legion?
I was. I do not regret my choice to join, but I regret nearly every choice I made after that.
What does he want with my father? Do you know where he is being kept?

He wanted to force the President to give the Adjani to the Legion, but I think even he knew that was insane. As for your father, he was in Le Major's camp in the highlands last I saw him, but that was some time ago.

Yes, I've heard he might be in the highlands. I've also heard Camp du Crocodile in the swamps is another possible location. I'm glad you left the Legion. What the Major is doing isn't right. He must be stopped.
I know. In fact, I think even the Major knows he must be stopped.
Col. Faucheux and Corazon

Le Colonel is plotting something with Adonis? This seems a bit far-fetched... I really hope you are wrong, but I remember well when I asked him for help rescuing my father and he just... patronized me.
Honey, he's dirtier than a swamp rat and twice as ugly.
I hate that! Don't you hate that?... Do you want to get a coffee or... Maybe now's not the right time.
We had guys like that on the force. I'd put laxatives in their coffee. Kept them on desk duty. I figured that was best for everyone.
Col. Faucheux
I knew that he was plotting something the moment I asked him for help saving my father. He was just so... damn patronizing!
Men like him are all the same: They think they are entitled to whatever they want, yet all they do is treat the entire world as one treats a toilet bowl.
Do not worry yourself one bit about it, sister. We gonna get him right sorted out.
ColonelRedirect
In case you need to take action against him at some point in the future, I know something that might help. When I visited his base, they led me through the underground escape tunnel.
Here, I'll mark it on your map... just in case you need it.
Emma, if I didn't already have eight ex-wives, I'd marry you.
A secret tunnel, eh? That's one of my favorite kinds of secrets.
Now we know that buckhead's bolt hole. I cannot wait for the hunt to begin.

I... don't really trust her. Neither did my father. He wanted to revise the contracts with foreign corporations like Adonis. But did I really have a choice? It is ironic that she offered me help when almost no one else did.
Timeo Danaos et dona ferentes.
Context: Conversation Emma_2 Text Latin, ref to the Trojan Horse - "Fear the Greeks (even) when they bear gifts."

Text: Trust those instincts, kid. She's up to something.
That's how the backstabbers work, lassie! Dinnae turn your back on any woman, er... present company excluded, of course.
Corazon Santiago
Apparently, she planned all this. I have information about major construction projects completed by her order at the old Ernie Fort. She had it all done while you were searching for my father.
I believe she may be using it as her headquarters now. If you want her, that's where you'll need to go, but be careful... Who knows what kind of trap she may spring on you.
It better be a good one if she means to trap a Grizzly.
To trap a Dolvich, one must BE a Dolvich!
Don't worry, love. We'll keep a sharp eye out.
Coup?

As part of his election campaign, my father pledged he would revise the concessions to foreign corporations... Such as Adonis. I was so desperate to save my father that I fooled myself into believing that Corazon Santiago would honestly be willing to help us!
Anyone can get taken in a con, ma'am. Don't be too hard on yourself.
You cannot trust women! I mean... some of them. The bad ones.
It is not your fault! She enchanted you. You need to brew a tea of frog eggs, toadstools, and cinnamon. That should break her spell.
Now it seems that she was just using both me and you to regain control of the diamond mines, all the while plotting with reactionary forces in the military to overthrow my father's administration.
The only thing I can't really understand is how the Major fits in to all this.

If what Biff Apscott told you is true, it seems the Major was employed by Corazon to seize the diamond mines and create turmoil so the government would think they still needed Adonis' help. Unfortunately for her, the Major had other ideas.
Find my father before it's too late. And... Please be safe.
Who are you? You are soldiers, but not with the Legion. Who sent you?
Emma LaFontaine sent us
Emma? The President's daughter? She's alive? I am so glad! I tried to leave the village to warn her about the Legion troops trying to capture her, but my... My son Pierre didn't like that.
Prefer not to say

But... Well, of course. I just hope that if you are fighting the Legion you are helping Emma LaFontaine. I tried to leave the village to warn her about the Legion troops trying to capture her, but my... My son Pierre didn't like that.

He commands the Legion forces here on the island, but he's not really one of them. I mean, he is not like them. He's a good boy. Please, if you are here to fight the Legion, please try to spare my boy.
promised Luc to spare Pierre
We'll do our best to spare Pierre
Thank you! You have a heart of gold! Now I have some hope for the future.
Pierre is a criminal!
Fidel no like this Pierre. You feel better after I kill him, don't worry.
I... I suppose I deserved that. Still, there is no need to be cruel to an old man.
I beg you, mercenary. I know you are not here to help an old man save his son, but if you see him again, please spare my Pierre.
Thank you, my friends! My boy is alive, thanks to you. If I die today, I die a happy man. Here, I was keeping these for Pierre. Take them, I insist!
I wish it had not needed to come to this. Now that we have raised a hand against our own, things can never be the same again.
I'm so glad you talked Basil out of hanging Herman. The village would never be the same if we raised a hand against our own.
We came here to escape violence, and now we need violence to protect ourselves. Peace is forsaken in this wicked country.
Do you bring any news about Pierre?
Greetings! Always nice to see good friends.
I have heard that you fought Pierre! He is dead, isn't he? And you, you promised to spare him! Why would you give hope to an old man and then break his heart?
I have heard that you fought Pierre! He is dead, isn't he? No! No, my little boy!...
Leave me to my grief!
What's the story with Pierre?

He... he doesn't understand the choices I've had to make. He doesn't respect me, so he won't listen. But he might listen to you. He's just misguided. Make him see that what he is doing can only end in his death.
Wisdom only comes to the willing, never to the willful.
What choices?

After my wife was killed by a band of river pirates, I convinced a group of friends to move with me and my son to Ernie Island, away from all the fighting. But Pierre... Well, he doesn't understand why I did not seek vengeance. So, he ran away and joined the Legion.
Pierre is just "misguided"?
Pierre always had a sense of honor. But the Legion corrupted him, made him do bad things in the name of discipline and strength. Now, he can't tell the difference between justice and cruelty.
Pierre hates this place, but he also wants to protect it. When my friends and I came here, we dreamed of building a safe haven. In his own way, so does Pierre.
What happened to Tinhay?

He was my oldest and dearest friend. He used to take care of my son when he was little, but when Pierre came back with his new Legion friends, they slaughtered old Tinhay like a dog in the street. And Pierre just watched and did nothing to stop them.
Fidel also enjoys watching such things.
Have you seen some other mercenaries?
Oh, those people. One of them - what was his name? Beef? Bev? ...can't remember. Anyway, he was planning to dock at the abandoned resort, Cte d'Azur. I warned him to avoid it...
The underwater rocks there are treacherous - that's why they canceled construction. He laughed at me - said his fancy new boat with the modern fiberglass hull could handle it.
Farewell.
My name is Colonel Jules Faucheux.
Ah! Here are the colorful mercenaires again. It is nice to see that you know how to obey when your master pulls your leash.
As a commander of Grand Chien's military forces in the Adjani region, it is my responsibility to deal with the war atrocities that took place here.
Hundreds of innocent refugees and other civilians have been killed by a chemical weapon.
That is a nasty way to go.
The spirits of the underworld had a feast this day.
Mein Gott... So many bodies...
This vile and craven attack on the people of Grand Chien is to be considered a war crime because it was committed by an unsanctioned paramilitary group.
The goddamn Legion again!
This was surely the work of the Legion.
The Legion is certainly callous enough to do something like this, but I wonder how they got their hands on a chemical weapon...
Where is Corazon Santiago?
She won't be coming, but she sends you her regards.
That's a bit odd, mate. When a woman says she needs to meet me to explain something, she's usually waiting with a baseball bat in one hand and divorce papers in the other.
That is... very curious.
Something smells fishy here, Woody.
What about your President?
LaFontaine is a fool. He thought he could run a government in which the fox and the chicken can work together in harmony. It was only a matter of time before he paid for his childish idealism.
The Major used to say "How does a chicken stop being prey for a fox? ...By killing it." I am guessing the President did not possess such wisdom.
C'est vrai. The natural order cannot be changed, Predators hunt. Prey runs... or dies.
Hey, man, don't blame the victim. That's not cool.
The Major's little kidnapping actually saved Alphonse's life for a while - but it doesn't really matter. The coup was already in motion. All we needed was some time and money.
Youre working for Corazon Santiago!
It appears Ms. Santiago has been manipulating us from the start. You're working for her, aren't you?
It looks like our friend Corazon might be a wolf in sheep's clothing. Does she have you working for her, too?
I am beginning to believe Frau Santiago is up to something naughty. You are working for her, are you not?
Not for, but with. She is useful... for now. There is much that can be achieved with my soldiers and her money.
Yeah, like screwing us over, apparently.
I am certain you are right. I'm also certain none of it will be good.
Not anything good, I wager.
Did the Legion kill everyone?
No, they do not possess that kind of capability. The only chemical weapons in Grand Chien are closely guarded by the Army. However, that is unimportant because I already know that...
Not enough clues
Your soldiers killed those civilians!
You can't fool uncle Fidel! There is chemical canisters everywhere. This is wrong. You had fun without Fidel!
. I saw old Soviet chemical canisters on ground.
I have made notice of thermal dissemination chemical canisters utilized by your soldiers. If what I'm thinking is true, you have done a terrible sin.
You are very observant. Unfortunately for you, it doesn't matter because I already know that...
Have enough clues
Who did this?
...You did this. You and your M.E.R.C. friends attacked diamond mines that are the property of the Republic of Grand Chien.
Sorry, but I think you may be just a tad misinformed...
No, no, no, mon, there is some misunderstanding...
You got the wrong cowboys, partner!

Then you used slave labor to operate them, and when the local population rebelled against you, you killed innocent civilians in a show of force. And now you have the audacity to return to the scene of the crime.
None of that is true!
I don't know how to tell you this, chief, but not one word of that is true.
Are ye daft!? That is a complete and utter fabrication.
No one will believe you!

You think? Let's examine the facts. You are foreign mercenaires, paid by Adonis, a foreign corporation, to capture our diamond mines. One of those - Diamond Red - was guarded by Grand Chien troops when some of your people attacked it.
Those were the idiots from M.E.R.C. who attacked it by mistake!
Wasn't us, Colonel Fuckshow! It was that moron Biff Apscott and his gang of dumbasses.
That was Biff and his crew, mon! Get your facts straight in your head.
But Chimurenga told us it was held by the Legion! How could we know?...
But we had information there was a chemical plant inside that was producing evil laser raptors!
That was the fault of the Maquis! Seor Apscott would never knowingly do such a thing!

I know perfectly well that it was done by the people from M.E.R.C. but the general public doesn't care about such nuances. You will take the blame for it, as well as this massacre, and I will have the perfect reason to intervene and restore order.
Your enemy is the Major!

No. His Legion is a collection of criminals, able to terrorize citizens of the Adjani, but not much more. I'm surprised you haven't finished them off by now. Apparently, you're far less capable than I presumed - and I presumed very little.
I guess you don't care that he's a monster, what with you being one yourself.
Mm-mm. That mouth of yours be writing a hell of a lot of checks!
The Major is EVIL! Don't you care about that sort of thing?

We wanted to use the Major as a scapegoat, but too many people believe his patriotic babble. You, however, a group of corporate-sponsored mercenaires, are the very symbol of foreign oppression. You fit marvelously.
I do not know if the Major's patriotism is truly fake, but I DO know yours is.
I don't think that's going to work for me. I don't really like how I look in a frame.
You almost good movie villain. Just need to work on being scary. You more like sad, kinda boring villain who talk too much.
Not so fast, mercenaires. We have something to discuss.
You will pay for this!
Negative. Someone else will pay the bill. As for you - you have been bought and sold already. You have been useful pawns, but like all good pawns, you will be sacrificed.
I got a bad feeling about this...
I do not play chess, but I am thinking his metaphor is maybe bad for us.
I am not prawn! I am... I am a shark! No, that's not right, sharks have tiny arms.
Oh, that's great! Just great. Well, it's been nice knowin' ye.
While I choose to believe he did not mean that in a literal way, it may be prudent to start thinking of exit strategies.
Chien soldiers, at attention! Les mercenaires have committed war crimes against our country. I proclaim them to be enemies of the state.

Greetings. I am Colonel Jules Faucheux. I expected to meet the mercenaire unit the President's daughter managed to hire, but judging by the quality of your equipment and clothing, I suppose you are the salesmen or accountants for that group.
Yes, we are the mercenaries
Are you? I expected something more impressive, but I suppose I should not be surprised.
Sir, I assure you that we are professionals and a lot of us have a solid military background.
We don't like to draw a lot of attention to ourselves.
That is because I am not flexing. I did not want to scare you.
Do they? At least they look like professional soldiers, unlike you.
Hey, that really hurts, man. Look what you did, you made Ted cry!
We're what you might call "irregulars", man. And I'm VERY irregular, because I'm not allowed to have caffeine.
Well, it's laundry day. You know how it is.
Sorry about that, Woodchuck. Our dress blues are still at the dry cleaner.
Your troops look worse
If this group of misfits are what you call "soldiers", I would prefer to be compared to an accountant, thank you very much.
Sir, my team is outfitted to execute the variety of roles we need to perform. As for your own troops, I must say that back in LA I saw gangs that were better organized and equipped.

I do appreciate your analogy, sir, but if you allow me to extend it just a tad - we are indeed wholesale dealers of carefully measured violence, while your soldiers seem more akin to... street peddlers.
Is that so?... I suppose, in time, we shall see who are the better soldiers.
The hell do you mean by that, Scooter?
I feel the shadow of Death has entered the conversation. Intoxicating.
If that's some kind of subtle threat, you should know something: Norma don't do subtle.
Stick it where the sun don't shine, Colonel Fancy Pants!
You can suck on an exhaust pipe, Colonel Fuckface.
You can eat the corn from mi mierda, Colonel Cabrn.
I invite you to kiss my derrire, Colonel Faux Pas.
So that's the level of "professionalism" that can be expected from a group of mercenaires. You are lucky I am a soldier and not an amateur like you.
GreetingRedirect
But let us not get carried away. Why are you here?
What may I help you with? If you need instructions on how to reload your gun or buckle up your tactical vest, I can send a private to assist you.
You do that and I'll kick your private in the privates.
Oh, gee... Um, that'd actually be swell!

Context: Conversation Faucheux_1 Text "And I will send him back to you as Cargo 200."

Text: Right now I have no time for you. I have work to do, but I promise to give you my full attention soon enough. Dismissed.
Yes? Speak and be quick about it.
We are here to save your President
I don't see him with you. I guess you tried to play at being soldiers and failed, didn't you? Do you even know where he is being kept?
Then go ahead and save him. I am sure elite commandos like you can handle it. You probably already know where he is being kept, right?
Well, then all that remains is to go ahead and free him. Good luck!
Your well-wishes are as hollow as a dead tree.
Your voice is missing something. I am thinking it is... sincerity.
You maybe give commendation for success?
Oh, absolument!

Oh really? If great commandos such as yourselves can't locate him, how can a humble soldier like me have any hope? And yet... it just so happens that I have extensive reconnaissance data about the president's whereabouts, and you... have none.
Ye dinnae have to be a jackass about it!
Hey, we're just a bunch of mercs here, okay? It's not like we have a link to a satellite or... Um, never mind.
Yeah, I get it. You good, we bad. Now, just give us the damn intel... please.
Here, take it. I insist. I am honored to be able to help such an elite team.
Oh really? If great commandos such as yourselves can't locate him, how can a humble soldier like me have any hope?
Sarcasm is a "can't do" tone. Instead, why not fill up your voice with "can do"?
I can't possibly be the only person who has difficulty taking you seriously.
It is true that we are amazing, but you should not be discouraged by that.
I think you are right, Herr Colonel. You should consider withdrawing your forces and going home.
Perhaps
You mean that you don't know, but you won't admit it. Amateurs.
Stuffed shirt.
Snapperhead.
Noodle dick.
Bagga mouth.
Neanderthal.
Oh yeah? Well, you are a... a very mean man!
What do you know about us?

I know Emma LaFontaine hired you to find her father instead of trusting that the government - HIS government - would do it. I also know that you A.I.M. mercenaries are notorious for being, shall we say... colorful? You fit the profile. I was curious to see you up close.
Well, I certainly hope we can give you an eyeful of color - black and blue, preferably.
You only see us because we decided to show ourselves.
Wha-? If that is some kind of crack at gingers, ye can stuff it!
What can I say? We like to bring a bit of showmanship to the job.
That is because our auras are healthy and vibrant. Yours, however... Hmmm, have you considered yoga?
And now that I've met you, I see the word "colorful" doesn't do you justice. I think "unbalanced" or "delusional" might be more appropriate.
Where do you know Corazon Santiago from?
She has the resources to help us stabilize the region - and by "resources" I don't mean you. That being said, you may still prove to be of some use to me.
Our contract is with Ms. Lafontaine and Ms. Santiago. If your mission objectives overlap with ours, so be it. But, sir... Respectfully, we don't take orders from you.
I wouldn't dream of it... corporal.
You got something cooking in that bean of yours, Woodstove, I can smell it.
A good commander always has... contingency plans.
The hairs on the back of my neck just stood up. What kind of use do you mean, exactly?
The kind that will guarantee a bright future for Grand Chien, of course.
You seem to be an art connoisseur

That's true, but what you see here are just cheap reproductions that my loyal yet unsophisticated soldiers brought from the nearby villages. They mean well, but they couldn't tell the difference between a Monet and a child's finger painting.
You surely have something more impressive to show off!
I can see you got some style. I bet you have some museum quality pieces!
The pattern that you used to decorate this room suggests that there are a few pieces missing that are much more valuable.

Of course, there are some good finds - all of which I spotted personally. But I wouldn't hang those precious pieces here in this filth. Works of art belong inside a work of art, nothing less. But this is none of your business.
Your art collection sucks

THIS!? This is not my art collection! These are cheap reproductions my dimwit soldiers brought me from the nearby villages. I found several good pieces on my own, but I would not hang them here. Works of art belong inside a work of art...
I'm all ears!
Totally know what you mean, mon! Like a Cadillac in a Dali painting.
Ah, you mean like Matryoshka dolls.
Like a mime inside an invisible box!
But I see no reason to explain this concept to you. You are even more uncouth than my idiot soldiers. They, at least, can dress themselves properly.
Why are YOU here?

I have come from the capital with orders to resolve the Adjani crisis. After the President was kidnapped, I told Emma not to worry her pretty little head - I would extract her father once I made a few important tactical arrangements.
What could be more important than rescuing the President?
Wouldn't want to rush. Might make a real mess of those pretty uniforms.
I never understand why cavalry always like to wait for nick of time.
...But no, instead of waiting for me to put things back in order, she ran to Santiago and hired you. Just like her father, she has no idea what is going on in her country.
What other arrangements?

I had important work securing the capital after LaFontaine's abduction. It was not something that could be abandoned - the seat of government is more important than one man. Nevertheless, here I am, ready to wipe his ass and clean up his mess.
I'm guessing you didn't vote for him.
Seor Apscott made me do the same. I mean, he made me clean up his mess... not the other thing.
I often wonder if seat of government is comfortable chair.
What is going on?

Nothing that concerns a group of half-baked foreign mercenaries. This is my advice: leave now and let the real soldiers deal with the Legion and poor old Alphonse. I promise that I will return him alive and well to his daughter.
Hey, man, I will have you know that I am FULLY BAKED!
I am totally not baked, man!
Who is it that holds a promise in one hand and a gun in the other? It is only Death.
You are correct that the real soldiers will do this. The fake soldiers will clean their pretty uniforms.
Dismissed.
Hello again. What would you like to know?
Tell us about the Legion

Led by a man calling himself the Major, it is the largest paramilitary group in the region. They seized all our diamond mines before my security teams could respond. They are brutal bullies, but not smart or well-trained. They should be no match for professional soldiers.

Little is known about the Major himself, but we do know he's as dependent on the diamond mines as we are. Securing the mines will no doubt force him into the open, where we'll stand a good chance to eliminate him.
Just give me a nice clean shot and I'll make him part of this country's history.
The big, scary monster doesn't like his doggie bowl taken away, huh? Good to know.
Out in open is best place to have showdown!
There were some other mercenaries
Yes, we hired a team from M.E.R.C. I assume you're familiar with them.
What the hell you go and do a dumbass thing like that for?
Yeah, I used to run with them. Got out before they got me killed.
Only by reputation.
Yes, they are the low-calorie version of A.I.M. - tasteless and unsatisfying.
Bunch of clowns without a circus, you ask me.
Their primary objective was to eliminate The Major himself. At the time, we thought he was a more manageable threat than he's proven to be.
Needless to say, it appears they weren't successful. They went missing and by all accounts the Major is still very much alive.
Gonna have to thank Magic again for pulling me out of that sketchy-ass group.
I ain't one goddamn bit surprised.
It is as they say - you get what you pay for.

I don't want to distract you from securing the diamond mines and rescuing the president, but if you happen to find out what happened to the M.E.R.C. team, I would appreciate it if you notified me immediately.
M.E.R.C.?
We haven't heard from Biff Apscott, the M.E.R.C. team's leader, since they left Ernie Island.
Biff! That guy's five cans short of a six pack.
I had a lot of reasons for leaving M.E.R.C. Biff's about half of them.
Biff couldn't lead a dog to a tennis ball factory carrying a pocket full of jerky!

I know they only spent a little time here before heading to the mainland. I lost contact with them shortly after they landed. I'm sure the locals there can tell you more, Biff and his team were not exactly... low profile, shall we say?
Eliminate the Major?
Yes, this was before he kidnapped the President. He was seizing our diamond mines and couldn't be bargained with, so I took the only course open to me.
Obviously, it didn't work. I encourage you to learn from my mistake. Do not underestimate the Major.
Where others have failed, Igor Dolvich will succeed!
I always learn from mistakes of others. It is how I still retain full number of fingers.
Oh, jeez, this guy sounds really dangerous!
The diamond mines
There are two mines that are perhaps the easiest to reach from here - Diamond Red and Mfumu's Mine.
Diamond Red?
Diamond Red is a strip mine located almost due north from here on the Savanna Coast. It is rumored the Major is using slave labor to mine the diamonds there.
I look forward to making him regret that decision.
Anyone who employs such methods needs to become a part of the past... and stay there.
That kind of thing makes me very angry... and I am not an angry person.
Mfumu's Mine?

The excavation of Mfumu's Palace began as part of an initiative by Alphonse LaFontaine to recover artifacts from the past and raise national pride after the revolution. After digging started, diamond deposits were found. They now call the place Mfumu's Mine.
Where profit trumps culture, there is where humanity is lost.
That is very sad. So many stories lost...
This type of thing happens so often that I'm not even angry about it anymore, just disappointed.
Good luck. I'll be keeping in touch via radio but feel free to return to me if you need to.
Goodbye.

Thank God, you made it! I wanted to warn you, but you were already enroute. Legion forces have landed on Ernie! They even tried to attack us here at the villa. I can't imagine what they want with this tiny island.
It is neither Ernie Island nor my villa they want. It is you. Perhaps they think capturing you would make your father more cooperative.
Then I'm sorry I came. I didn't mean to put anyone else in jeopardy.
I know how you feel. That's why I prefer bandages over bullets.
Don't you worry, little lady. Jeopardy is my business!
Have faith. Barry is here.
Don't sweat it. You got yourself a Grizzly now.
Don't worry, mon! We gonna sort it all out. Everything gonna be all right.
Soon, the only people in jeopardy will be the scuzzwads who took your father.
I really think you should place the blame on the enemy and not on yourself.
Hello again. What would you like to know?
Did you need something?
We can handle them
I am so grateful to hear you say that. Grand Chien's own government can't do a thing to help. I'm reassured by your confidence. Here, please take this as a gesture of my appreciation.
Thank you
Thank you so much! This is the nicest gift I have ever received for shooting at someone.
Ain't nothin' wrong with a little extra dough. Thanks!
I dunnae think I've ever been appreciated by a woman before... er, thank you, lassie.
You're quite welcome.
Accept $2000
Refuse $2000
We've had warmer welcomes
Yes. Again, you have my apologies. Please, accept this as recompense for having to fight your way to our rendezvous.
Not to sound bitchy, but I got my hair done because I thought we'd be meeting in front of cameras. Thankfully, we're not, because now my hair is a complete disaster...
That is a nice gesture, but technically you are in breach of contract, so I truly feel a little more compensation is warranted.
Y-yes, of course. I have some extra cash I was saving for... never mind. Please, take it.
Accept $2000 and request more
You can do better than that
This is nice, but Omryn is hungry from exertion. Maybe you give snacks, too?
That's nice and all, but I got sand in my crotch from that damn beach. Maybe you can put a little more on the table.
That all you got? Doesn't exactly fill me with confidence about your ability to bankroll us.
I'm sorry, it's all I have to spare. Please, take it.
Accept $2000 and request more
good impression on Emma
That's not necessary
Oh, well that's mighty nice of you, but you go ahead and keep it. We're just here to put a smile back on that pretty face of yours.
Your gift would be better donated to help your people rise up and realize their potential!
Oh, you don't have to do that... Right, guys?
Your professionalism is admirable and I'll make sure everyone knows it.
Refuse $2000
Now, as to beginning your search, I suppose questioning the Legion soldiers on Ernie about my father would be a good way for you to start.

This is Corazon Santiago. She's the Director of Operations in Grand Chien for the Adonis Corporation. Her people encountered the Legion face to face. She will manage additional funding while you are in the field.
Doesn't matter to me who writes the checks, chief - just so long as they don't bounce.
Additional funds are good. Snacks are also good.
Good! I also wish to encounter enemy faces.
That's fine by me. Something tells me we're going to need significant operational support.
Oh, how nice! This is like having two fairy godmothers!
Yeah, but there's a catch, right?
Hello. It is good to meet you. As Emma said, I will provide you with a cut of the proceeds from the Adonis diamond mines to help fund your mission as you liberate each one from Legion control.
Just so you know, I like my cut nice and thick.
As long as I don't have to do any cavity searches for loose diamonds, I'm in.
Fidel love mining! Lots of explosives, lots of fun!
Whole mines full of diamonds!? Well, now you've got this girl's attention.
Oh, I like mines! Lots of little holes to hide in.
If I am being completely honest, this would not be the first time I have liberated diamonds.

But first things first. The Legion has overrun the island, capturing the town and the old fortress. Liberating the town is essential to securing transport to the mainland, but securing the whole island will ensure you have a good base of operations. Additionally, the locals may be appreciative and give useful intel.
I am feeling confident and optimistic, like I just had a good bowel movement.
The hell we waitin' for? Let's start crackin' skulls!
Sounds like this little island could serve as a good HQ, chief.
Any more details about the Legion?

Led by a man calling himself the Major, it is the largest paramilitary group in the region. They seized all our diamond mines before my security teams could respond. They are brutal bullies, but not smart or well-trained. They should be no match for professional soldiers.
My dear, I have yet to meet my match.
Beating up dumb bullies happens to be my favorite type of mission. This will be fun.
Our training is of exceeding professional. We will be victorious.
I will show them the force of my incredible biceps and they will run or I will smash them! HAHAHAHAHA!
It is always satisfying to discover how a bully will react when they are themselves bullied.
My mother taught me to shoot a gun when she found out I was being bullied at school. The next thing she taught me was how to hide a body.
Who is the Major?

Perhaps the biggest warlord in Grand Chien. Not much is known about him except that he runs the Legion like a cult of personality. He is both worshipped and feared. It's likely you'll have to deal with him directly in order to rescue my father.
Sounds like this dude needs an attitude adjustment.
Dinnae fear, lassie. I've dealt with plenty of Majors in my day.
Sounds like a real bozo. Can't wait to meet him.
Oh, we'll deal with him directly, all right. My boot is going to go directly in his ass!
It is every warlord's fate to die violently. I see no reason why this one would be an exception.
If he's dreaming of being a god, he's about to get a real wake-up call.
Tell us about Ernie Island
This island is isolated and defensible and will serve as a good launch point for missions into the Adjani River Valley. The people here are docile, but resourceful. Help them and they'll help you.
They will all soon know the love of a Dolvich!
Resourceful is okay, but docile is for the birds. Sounds like they need someone to show them how to throw a punch... or a grenade.
Oh, that's swell! They sound nice.
I like this. It is the Christian thing to do.
Some may prove more helpful than others, I'm sure, but you should talk with as many of them as you can. They may have information that could be of use to...
Please excuse me. I must take this.
Yes?... No!... Just tell them to wait.... Just tell them to wait, goddammit!
My apologies. Where were we?
That did not sound good.
That your mom? Mine's always calling me at a bad time.
Let me guess - cable guys?
What was that about?
Who was that?
Problem?
What was that about?
That conversation sounded... distressing.
Did you get some bad news?
Was that something we need to be worried about?

It was... Well, it was nothing that concerns your mission. It was simply, er... certain logistical issues that require my attention from time to time. Again, I apologize. Do you have any further questions for us?
Good luck. Corazon and I will be keeping in touch via radio.
What a surprise! Someone has managed to track me after all! I didn't know there were any capable hunters around here. Who are you?
We're mercenaries
Mercenaries, huh? Not working for those buckheads at the poacher camp are you?
Now why would you ask a question like that, I wonder?
And why would poachers want to hire mercenaries?
You sound like a little boy asking if he is in trouble after he hurt the neighbor's dog.
You are, aren't you? No wonder they'd hire someone to find me. They can't track their own footsteps in cow shit.
Did YOU kill those poachers?
But, of course! Do you like the trophy horns I nail on their heads? Fitting, don't you think?
I got to admit, I admire your style.
Meh. Would be better if you rigged the bodies to explode.
Ugh... disgusting.
Yes, very poetic. Dark, disturbing and gruesome, but very poetic.
Why are you doing this?

I have killed every sort of animal you can think of. When I heard the hunting along the Adjani was the most dangerous in the world, I joined some poachers out of Pantagruel to see if the rumors were true.
I am guessing it is not the animals that make the hunting dangerous.
Only thing dangerous about the hunting was the Legion patrols. The poachers I was with - led by that old wind bag, Hyena - celebrated for a week after killing a sick old rhino. Pathetic.
Sounds like their speed.
I told them they could hunt better if they just killed off those Legion patrols, but they nearly shit their pants when I suggested it. So... I decided I would teach them a lesson. Hunt or be hunted.
Maquis Manifesto
What is this? A half-naked girl with a gun? Something to curl up with at night, eh? Merci beaucoup.
This guy creeps me out.
What is this? "Workers of the world unite?" You passing out communist propaganda? Give it to those buckheads at the camp. You think I am a fool?
Give a propaganda pamphlet
Not at all! Hey, forget the pamphlets. Let's relax and find our chakras.
Of course not! Now just calm down a dang minute!
N-n-no! Sorry! Sorry, sorry, sorry!
Hey, settle down, mate! No worries. Just a simple misunderstanding.
Good. Then save your pamphlets for the foolish.
Putain! You think you can come out here and mock me?
Youre a psychopath
Paris? Oui. In New York? Yes. In Grand Chien? Hahaha... I think not. Out here only the strong survive. I am teaching those poachers how to be strong. They should thank me.
You sound like the Major.
I have heard of this man. I should like to meet him one day... or perhaps hunt him.
Typical psychotic narcissist. You can rationalize anything.
If I have to. Usually, I do not bother with reasons, but I like your face, so for you I make an exception.
You deserve to die
You think so? Then let the hunt begin!
I suppose I should - I am bored. I killed plenty of poachers and instead of fighting back, all they did was hire you. They'll never learn. Anyway, what else would I do?
Want to hunt for us?
We may have an opening for a good hunter.
What do you think about putting your skills to work for us?

Instead of hunting poachers, you want me to join you and hunt... what? Nevermind. I don't care. Just by looking at you, I already know it will be something worth my time. One question - do I get to flay them and take trophies?
I certainly won't stop you.
Not a chance in hell, pal.
I would not rule it out.
Ew. No.
Out of the question.
Let us agree to leave it an open question. All right! Count me in.
Oh yeah, we'll make a great team!
Wait, what? This man can't be a soldier, he's Section 8!
He is somewhat repulsive, but I have to admit he could be an effective fighter.
I do not want to work with this maniac.
Youre hired
Let the hunt begin!
Why not hunt the Legion instead?
Forget those pussies and go hunt the Legion instead.
Why not kill the Legion guys? Always fun for Fidel!
I would be lying to you if I said I have not thought about it. You have some experience with them? Are they a good hunt?
Hell, yeah! They scream like they did not expect to die!
Eh. Dunno. Fidel no hunt. Fidel just blow things up.
Five out of seven.
Ah, well. Time to move on and see what kind of trophies I can find in these Legion camps!
Just stop this madness
Flay, listen to me. This is insane. You need to stop.
Where you see madness, I see natural selection. But you're right. It's time for me to move on and find some better game.
You have to stop
In fact, I do not. If you have come to stop me, you will need more than words.
Don't you worry about that. I got a whole bag full of things that ain't words.
Persuasion failed
I like the way you handled that little piece of business with Smiley. I am glad I did not have to kill him. Killing is a messy business and I don't care for messy.
There are clean ways to do it, but it's not as satisfying.
The kid's all right. Just needs to grow up a little.
In appreciation for your help in avoiding a mess, please accept these diamonds.
Oh, shiny!
Might be the first time I ever got paid to NOT kill somebody.
We didn't do it for the diamonds

I know, and I appreciate that. But you helped me resolve that matter and a reward is due. Take the diamonds or throw them away - I don't care, but let no one say that Boss Blaubert doesn't pay his debts.
Now that I've seen what you can do, I would like to ask a small favor of you. It's a task for which I think you might be well-suited.
However, I still have a favor to ask.
You are welcome, my friends.
Gee, that's swell! Thanks, mister!
I was not expecting such generosity! Danke!
With that settled, I can finally give my full attention to the matter of the return of my good friend Luigi!
I'm touched you finally noticed me, Boss! I didn't mind waiting. I understand that you needed to deal with one of your wife's jealous customers, eh?
Well, thanks
