Your prison guards are Legion soldiers

Context: Conversation Jackhammer_1 Text "It looks more like GULAG."

Text: Using Legion soldiers to guard your prison hardly lends it an air of legitimacy.
A prison that employs Legion soldiers as guards is not one which houses legitimate prisoners.
The trouble in the region has forced certain... budget cuts. Some of the guards may have taken side jobs to compensate. I don't control what they do outside these walls.
We want you to release Luigi
Is that why you are here? You just want that little Italian asshole? ...Fine. I'll release him if you let me go. I don't want to hang around if releasing prisoners is what you want to do.
Really? Are we going to make a deal with one criminal in order to release another?!
What's the matter, love? Is it possible some of them have grievances they might wish to air?
I think you already know the answer to that question.
That sounds fine to me... Just don't try any tricks - I know every single one of them, ya dig?
How did you become a prison director?
The Major took this place because he needed recruits. I was not just an inmate, I was the leader of its most powerful gang. The Major recognized that fact and made me the new director of this place.
Prisoners running the prison... my worst nightmare come true.
No offense, but you stink at your job. This place is falling apart!
Only the parts we don't need. See? Direction.
I don't even want to ask what happened to the old prison director.
Don't worry your pretty little head. He's just resting... in peace.

This good place turns criminals into soldiers for the Legion... or laborers. Inmates here either submit to my will and pay off their debts with service, or they never leave. That's why they call me Jackhammer the Breaker!
An appropriate, if redundant, moniker to be sure.
Oh man, that's a cool name! They call me Larry the Roach. This is my friend, Ted.
That's a cool name, man. I was Larry the Breaker for a while, but it was only because of the number of sobriety oaths I broke.
They call me Reaper. I look forward to showing you why.
Mmm... Name needs work. Too long. Would not look good on movie poster.
That is so weak! You should get that name only by breaking stones or something.
When I was an inmate, I broke plenty of stones. Now, I break wills.
It sounds to me like you are scaling down your workouts. Soon you will be soft and flabby.
You are a criminal
And who says that? I am a director of a respected institution that you unlawfully attacked!
I say that, Jack.
I saw you there, Major. I did not say anything, because I thought you were testing me. Is that what this is, a test?
Afraid not, Jack. The Legion needed soldiers and miners, and you provided them, but now the Legion is gone. I'm out. Just got a few loose ends to tie up.
You're... out? Just like that? But what about... Wait! Take me with you. I can fight, you know I can!
I do. That's why I'm going to make this quick. Goodbye, Jack.
Spike, what are you... No!
I say that
Hello, Jacques. Remember me?
Pierre, I thought that was you, but you have less shit on your face than the last time I saw you so I couldn't be sure. Escaped from Diamond Red, or did your new masters here rescue you?
Your insults mean nothing to me. You are beneath my contempt. Even so, I must thank you. You were the first to open my eyes and show me what the Legion really is by sending me to that hell hole.
I did my job, Pierre. It was never anything personal.
Let me tell you something, Jacques. When you make someone a slave, it is very personal.
You imprisoned innocent people
And who says they are innocent? Or did they just TELL you they are innocent? How naive can you be? EVERYONE in prison claims to be innocent.
True, but to be fair, some of them actually are.
I can smell guilt a mile away. The only thing I smelled in some people down there was sadness, shame... and excessive body odor.
Boss Blaubert says that
Well, if your "information" comes from a mob boss, it isn't worth much, is it? People like Boss Blaubert do not get to say who is a criminal and who's not.
It seems to me that people like Boss Blaubert can say whatever they wish, but I will let him know you disagree.
Or whose girlfriend he can steal or not!
What?
Nothing...
You cant fool us
I don't buy your shit, dweeb. You're the worst kind of crook - one that pretends to work for the fucking cops.
You just a thug that thinks he's a playah. You ain't foolin' me. Quit frontin'.
You're not being straight with me, man. You're just a crook with a badge. Worst type of snapperhead.
Back in LA, we did use petty criminals like you as informants. We didn't promote them to prison directors though.
I've heard enough. You're so crooked it's a wonder you can stand up straight.

I once pretended to be a mountain climber, something I know nothing about, in order to meet a very cute boy I liked. I did a much better job at it than you are doing pretending to be a prison director.
Honey, I've dated my fair share of bad boys, so I've gotten pretty good at recognizing one.
I know you are lying to us, but you are also lying to yourself. Come, unblock your spleen and let the truth out.
People from Port Cacao say that
Well, if your "information" comes from some worthless beggar who can't pay their debts, it can't be very reliable, can it?
Well, that raises the question of what sort of person would loan money to a beggar, doesn't it?
Only a monster who trafficks in human suffering would expect a beggar to pay him back.
You're a loan shark
I'm just trying to help people. It's not my fault they are lazy and won't pay back their debts.
A prison director whose prisoners owe him money is not a person whose judgement is to be trusted.
Speaking of lazy - that be one real lazy excuse.
Then it's a real shitty law and it should be ignored, same as all the other shitty laws.
Oh yeah? Does the law say anything about the legality of owing money to your own prison director?
Eh... it does not specify.
Owing money is not a crime
I am sorry, but being unable to pay your debts is a crime here in Grand Chien. What can I do? Such is the law.
You can't give loans with one hand and imprison people for debts with the other.
Law cannot be an excuse for injustice.
Then that law is full of crap, Woodrot! Same as you.
If that law allows a prisoner to owe money to a prison director, it's the same as legalized slavery. That's... not acceptable.
There is a higher law, one that I'm sure punishes those who profit from others' misfortune.
Perhaps my lending practices have landed some people in prison. My judgement is not perfect, oui? But whose is? Let they who are without sin be the first to throw a stone.
Alright, I guess I'll wait to go second.
I don't think I've sinned... But I am not very good at throwing. Someone else should go first.
Oh, I've got a magazine full of stones I'm thinking about throwing...
Fidel will throw much more than stone.
I will not be standing for blasphemy. I am tempted to throw first stone... a shaped stone.
You are involved in slave trade

Alright, alright. Yes, I am doing a little bit of involuntary workforce distribution, and in return I get a little something for myself. It's not as bad as it sounds, the prisoners work off their loans and get some exercise as well!
Context: Conversation Jackhammer_1 Text in the end his voice trails off a bit

Text: Forced labor is no kind of exercise, ya daft idiot!
My mother told me exactly what to do if I ever met someone like you. I warn you, it will involve the removal of your toe nails.
It's okay to shoot him now, right, Ace?
Let us be reasonable. If you want to have one of those wretches down below, just name him! We don't have to fight over some goddamned prisoner, do we?
What if we just shoot you?
I don't believe you would do this. You don't look like the kind of people who would just kill an innocent public servant.
I don't trust him, but we don't really know if he's guilty or not.
Innocent, my ass. But he's got a point. We have no proof.
Everyone is innocent of some things and guilty of others. Death does not care.
...But I can see you mean business! Why don't you just let me go? I will tell the rest of the guards to go home for the day. I've also got some money here. You can have it.
Are you trying to bribe us? We only take bribes from people we like.
Look at the buckhead squirm!
This is blood money.
This isn't blood money - it's a... a fee. Nothing more. Take it as mercenary work - only, you don't have to work! Just let me go and you'll be rewarded immediately. It is a good deal, n'est-ce pas?
Context: Conversation Jackhammer_1 Text reference to "Jesus Christ Superstar"

Text: You cannot do this! I am an officer of the law! The authorities will hear of this...
That only makes this more fun for me!
Shut your cock holster, ass face!
Yes, Fidel wants everyone to hear! Scream very loud, please.
No! I can give you money! I can give you slaves! Please, whatever you want...
I want you to tell my brother what a piece of shit you are.
There is only one thing I want, and it is mine to take, not yours to give.
The world is going to be a better place without a scuzzwad like you in it.
You will go to prison
Eh... Do I have any other choice?
Maybe you get to choose which cell to be in... if you're lucky.
I'm afraid not. It's either that or hanging by the neck until you're dead.
The only other choice involves the removal of your toe nails... followed by incarceration.
Okay, okay. I'm not resisting arrest. Back to prison it is, then.
Right away! It is your prison now.
Get out of here
Thank you! You are true saviors. I will restart my life - a good life! Very far from here!
Get Out Redirect
I can't believe this is happening. We are releasing this criminal and slaver just like that?!

Context: Conversation Jackhammer_1 Text "Our commander is an idiot."

Text: We own prison now, glavny? I have heard prison food is bad. I will investigate.
I'll make sure they release Luigi immediately.
Oh, and here's that money I promised. I hope it does more for you than it did for me!
I'm sure you will find out this is a big mistake.
Oh la la! Don't shoot! I'm just a bystander here. An innocent civilian! I heard some shots fired up the hill. I came to take a look and I saw the Legion getting their asses kicked.
Exactly what an innocent civilian would do.
Makes sense to me. Better to watch a fight than be in one.
I want you to know that I completely believe you, but I really don't think anyone else does.
But I'm not with them! I was just... umm... doing a bit of scavenging on the beach. Yeah, that's how I provide for my family!
Don't worry
Take it easy, mister. We don't shoot civilians... generally.
That's all right, dear. We don't shoot civilians... generally.
Oh, we don't shoot civilians! I mean, sometimes we do. I do. By accident, though. Not on purpose.
Oh, thank you! Maybe you just let me go on my way now, eh?
Civilian? Oh really?
Yeah, and I'm the fucking tooth fairy.
A well armed civilian, I see.
That gun just for shooting squirrels then?
Oh, you mean this gun here? It's just, eh, heh-heh... iiiit's just for protection, boss. These are dangerous times on the island.
Why not just shoot you
One thing Fidel always say: no such thing as innocent bystander. When shooting start, you run and hide or stay and shoot.
Don't bullshit me, boy. I shot the kneecaps off the last dumbass who tried that.
Innocent bystanders are just people who haven't gotten a chance to shoot at me yet.
Please, boss, I... I don't want any trouble! I have a family. You won't snuff out a family man, right?
This is good point. I like it better when family is here to watch.
Depends on how cranky I am. And just so you know, I ain't pooped yet today.
Hell, everybody's got a family. That don't bother me one bit.
Tell us about that "Legion"
Well, that's the Patriotic Legion of Grand Chien! Quite a gang, they are. I think some of them were trying to snatch that Emma girl, the President's daughter, but I guess it didn't work out.
What do you know about Emma?
Don't know nothing, boss! I've just heard that the Major wants the girl. I guess he wishes to complete the set with her father, he-he.
That dude got kidnapped and that's his daughter you're talkin' about. Put some respect in your mouth.
I can tell how upset you are about it.
What is wrong with you? Where is your compassion?
Oh, sorry, boss. I guess I dropped it.
Oh, well, he's the leader of the Legion, of course! No one really seems to know him at all. They say he operates from a secret base up there in the Highlands...
Sounds like he got a real hole-in-the-wall gang. How we get there?
Speakin' as a Highlander, can ye be more specific? Highlands can be damn tricky terrain.
I love secrets! Can you tell me? I'm a mime, so you know I won't tell anyone.
Well I don't know for sure. It wouldn't be much of a secret if I knew it, right?
Who's the Major?
Oh, well, he's the leader of the Legion, of course! No one really seems to know him at all. Very mysterious figure. Very dangerous. May I go now? Please?
Emma's father - you mean the President?
You know, you're right. I think I heard something about that. But I don't know anything! I don't want to be involved in any of this, you know. Can I just go back to my family?
You seem to know a lot for someone who's not involved, don't you?
Don't know what you're talking about, boss.
Jeez, you're shadier than my ass crack.
Something stinks here, and I'm not talking about my armpits.
So you have a family?
Oh yes, boss. A big family over in the Rust! That's what we call the area just east of town. It's not a nice place. My boys cannot play football without tripping on old war equipment, hehe.
Family is best important. Dolviches understand.
Old war equipment? Could be worth checking out.
They depend on me, you see. If I don't bring home the bacon, they don't eat! My poor family.
Is this a soccer shirt?
Oui! Chiens Sauvages, the best team in Grand Chien! Their merchandise is shit though. I asked for a 13, and they printed 31...
You're with the Legion!
No, no, no! This is not true! Don't shoot me, boss! I mean... Maybe I had some dealings with the Legion in the past, but who doesn't? It is a small island.
Yet I am rather convinced you are part of the Legion "family".
It is difficult to hide one's true self on such a small island.
My friend, you are hiding mostly from yourself. Let the truth set you free.
Look, just let me go to my family and I... I will give you diamonds from my secret stash, I swear!
It has been too long since the last time I killed someone! I'm getting itchy.
I got a hair trigger and a nasty rash on my finger. Got it?
I can't help wondering what you'd look like dead.
No, boss! Please, don't shoot! Look, just let me go to my family and I... I will give you diamonds from my secret stash, I swear!
Non-non, no need for violence, boss! I've done nothing wrong! See? I'm cooperating.
Hand over the diamonds
Bien sur! Please, take these. I just found them on the beach, I swear... All yours now. I... I can go? And... You won't shoot me in the back?
No. Fidel like to aim for belly. More screaming that way.
I only shoot people for money... and for food.
Just drop your lunch money and run, little man!
Life be full of mystery, mon. Only one way to find out.
This action may have major consequences!
Merde!
Hehehehee... Bad news for you. Good news for Fidel!
Context: Conversation Jose_1 Text Laughing as if he just figured it's a great idea

Text: Time to make some fur fly!
This action may have major consequences!
Thank you, boss, I knew you were kind and gentle people! I go now. Please... um... Please, don't shoot me in the back.
No. Fidel like to aim for belly. More screaming that way.
I'll consider it.
This action may have major consequences!

Very kind of you to let me be on my way. Thank you! If your travels take you through the Rust any time soon, you're welcome to visit my family. We'll give you all the hospitality you deserve. I'll give it to you good, I promise!
Is it just me, or did that sound like a threat?!
Could have phrased that a little better.
If I had a dime for every man who promised me that, I could buy my own island.
This action may have major consequences!
Thank you for sparing me, boss! Heavens bless you! I'm getting out of sight, right away! Thank you! Have a nice day! Au revoir!
But why let go? Fidel no understand. Maybe we shoot him later?
This action may have major consequences!
Eh bien! My friends from the beach! I was just talking about you, wasn't I?
C'est vrai.
And now you have come to meet my big family, eh?
Yes, big family. Many mouths.

So true! But I'm sure our friends here are willing to help pay for our hospitality. After all, they saw little miss Emma and her rich friend. I'm thinking they gave you money, non? You don't want to be selfish and let my poor family starve!
Hospitality does not fill stomachs. Your money... Now.
Eh bien! My friends from the beach! I was just talking about you, wasn't I?
How about me, my dear Bastien? Don't you consider me a friend?
But of course, Pierre! I just didn't expect to see you here... And I was unaware these people are part of the family, boss.
They are now. What are you doing here, Bastien?
Well, um, me and my frrots happened to get the diamond shipment from the Major. I was trying to call you and report, boss, I swear!
Give up the diamonds
Of course, Pierre, I was just about to suggest you take them! In fact, I was searching for you, but I couldn't find you anywhere. Here, that's all I've got. May I go now, boss?
Yes, get lost. You and your boys, I don't want to see you again.
Yes, Pierre! We were just leaving, boss!
Weren't you just searching for me to give me the diamonds? No, don't answer. Get out before I change my mind.
We kill them now, right? Why not? We have the diamonds, yes?
What hospitality?
That's right. I showed you hospitality by letting you visit my shack, now you have to pay for accommodation, plus interest.
Wait, what shack?
Oh, it's actually just a lean-to, not like I stash things there or something...
Uh, stash? Hey! You been holding out on us?
No! I would never!
He's been holding out on you
Oh, perhaps you have forgotten all the diamonds you showed us?
I must point out that you're not very good at lying.
Back in my day, in the L.A.P.D. I dealt with some good swindlers. You're nowhere near their level. You're not convincing at all.
But, Bastien! You were so proud when you told us about how you've been stealing from your friends for so long without them noticing! Don't be shy about it now.
I thought so! I knew he's been stealing from us! Get him, boys!
Here is $1000
Well, that seemed a reasonable fee to pay.
It's good to find other ways besides violence to solve our problems.
Choke on it, ya wee dobber.
Here is $500
Heheheee... Come on, boys, drinks are on me.
Or rather not
Putain merde, you think I'm joking?!
We'll pay
Nice doing business with you, boss! Now give me the money.
The fuck I'll give you the money! Take this, you piece of shit!
How about I give you your teeth after I knock 'em out of our skull?
Fidel does not pay in money. Fidel pays in bullets!
<color EmStyle>Psycho</color> perk activated
I think we could reach an agreement for a discount. Imagine if we end up shooting each other - it would be terribly unhealthy to bleed in this mud.
We'll give you half. Not a penny more.
Oh yeah, boss, but of course I'll make a discount for you! After all, you're our first client of the day! Half price for you, eh?
In terms of highway robbery, this is reasonable.
This is some bullshit.
We don't have much
No way, boss. These are trying times. Everyone has to contribute. Your money. Now.
Maybe Fidel fill your stomachs. Fill your stomachs with lead!
Got a counter offer. How about we just kill every last one of you fuckheads?
Uhhh... heh-heh... We're just kidding, my friend! My associates, they, uh... they watch too many gangster movies, oui?
Hehe, you hear that, boys? Is it just me, or is le petit chien trying to bark?
You pay us
Okay, okay, let us be reasonable. We're just poor scavengers, aren't we, boys? We don't have much! Look at my wallet. It's all yours. There is no need for violence, yeah?
You have a wallet? I don't even have that! Bastien, we are going to have a talk...
What about the diamonds?
Oh, umm... Well...
You idiot, you blabbered about that?!
Shut up, I was going to bamboozle them something... Damn, forget it. Look, boss, we have the diamonds. They are hidden nearby. You can have 'em. Just let us go, okay?
Give us the diamonds and get out
Thank you, boss, we won't forget your kindness, boss. Here, you can have 'em. We will meet again some sunny day, I promise.
You better hope not, mon... for your sake.
Time for you banditos to make tracks. Go on, get!
Allez, boys, let's get out of here while we can...
Drop your guns!
Eh... I don't know if that's such a good deal for us. This a dangerous island. A lot of people are up to a lot of trouble. You'd be forcing us to be at the mercy of thugs and robbers!
Sounds like your kind of people. So I'm sure you'd feel right at home.
And yet somehow I don't feel bad about it.
Ya, that is why you should lift.
humiliated Bastien's gang
Your guns! Now!
Easy now! Take it easy. That's okay. No problem. Take our weapons. Me and the boys, maybe we'll just take up fishing, right?
Merde!
Who... Who are you? Did le Major send you? I hope he is not unhappy with us. Is this an inspection?
No, we are here to liberate you
We're busting you out of the big house.
This is an illegal prison camp and we're shutting it down.
Time for you to leave your prison and open yourself to greater possibilities! Embrace the new you!
Liberate us?! Oh, mon Dieu, but... What if this is not the right time? I... I should discuss this with the guards...
Yes, this is an inspection
We just want to make sure your moldy cheeses aren't too moldy.
We want to sample your food to make sure it is good to eat. All of it.
We're just here to make sure everything is ship-shape and Bristol fashion!
Oh, of course, of course it is. Wait, I'll call the guards right away!
Yes. Back to your shack, maggot
Run away, fat man, before Fidel carve you up like roast chicken!
Hit the road before I make your face hit the floor.
You better get out of my way or the first thing I'll inspect is your ass with my foot!
Right away! You won't hear me cluck! Unless you want me to, of course.
We are looking for someone
God forbid, but are you searching for Pierre? He's right there at the flogging post. Go on and shoot him, I'll go tell the guards. They'd love to watch, you know.
How can I serve you? Would you like some scrambled eggs? Very tasty, very nourishing!
You... You killed them! All of them! What will I do now? I was a king among the prisoners, and now... Now I'm going to be just a nobody!
Don't kill me, please! I'm not with the Legion, I was just doing what I needed to do to survive! It is a tough world, you know... And I was helping the other prisoners with eggs and everything!
No one left here... Just that bitter old asshole Pangloom. He's pretending to help me with the chickens, I'm pretending not to notice when he's stealing eggs.

They call me King Chicken, because they, um, they appreciate me. I take care of all the chickens in the camp, so that everyone is well fed and happy! Even my fellow prisoners, they get a free egg each week!
There's only one king of chickens in my mind, and he's a full bird colonel.
I would like two whole chickens.
They are not for eating! Just for laying eggs.
I am very disappoint.
Sounds like you really rule the roost.
I wish I could tell you that is the first time I heard that joke.
That's okay. It wasn't my best effort.
What else are the prisoners eating?
Um, whatever they find. Mostly roots, I guess. Perhaps some bugs and worms. We have a very democratic system here in Camp Bien Chien - everyone fends for themselves!
I think maybe you mean capitalist system.
Roots and bugs?! I think I changed my mind about sampling the local cuisine.
Mash bugs, worms, and roots together and make good forest pt.
But I take care of them, yes I do. They get a free egg per week, and even more if they help me out with my chores and duties!

They called me King Chicken... They, um, they appreciated me for taking care of all the chickens in the camp. I made sure everyone was well fed and happy! Even my fellow prisoners, I was giving them one free egg each week!
There's only one king of chickens for me, and he's a full bird colonel.
I think when you say "everyone was well fed and happy" you are referring mainly to yourself.
I have a problem with my glands!
Yes. You are feeding your glands too many eggs!
Sounds like you really ruled the roost!
Was that supposed to be funny?
Hey, look, not every pitch is a strike, okay?
Why is Pierre here?

I've heard he pissed off le Major himself! Pierre was one of his lieutenants, but a bunch of mercenaries kicked his ass. It's no wonder. The Legion troops west of here are crap! Our guards in Camp Bien Chien, they are the real deal!
We will soon determine their worth for ourselves.
I look forward to seeing if they prove to be difficult game.
Oh, I'm not sure they play any games, besides the one where they throw rocks at me.
I'm sure they're lovely, dear. I can't wait to get them in my sights and see for myself.

Oh, it is our prison camp! Here are the barracks, and there is where they stash the weapons, ammo and stuff. Over there is the flogging post where that stupid asshole Pierre is being punished. That way you'll find my fellow prisoners, minding their own business in the mud.
Well, it's quite charming, isn't it? Can't wait to have a look around.
We should inspect the weapon stash to make sure everything is properly stored.
Something tells me that's not the kind of mud bath I'd be interested in.
Tell us about this place
It's just a prison camp for me and my fellow prisoners... That way is the flogging post where that stupid asshole Pierre is being punished, and over there are the guard barracks.
Where do you wash?
Wash what?
Never mind.
Most unsanitary. Do you not fear disease?
Sure! I fear all kinds of stuff: Rats, fleas, thrown rocks, hard kicks, death, disease, pollution, Edvard Munch paintings...
That's enough. Thank you.
It ain't much, but it's home, right?
It sure is!
Do not call the guards!
Oh, but of course I won't! I can see now, you are here to take them by surprise and liberate us all, right? So nice of you! I'll just remain here and wait for the shooting to stop, okay?
You wait here while more manly peoples take care of puny guards!
You just take cover, partner. Gonna be a shootout!
Do not worry. We will soon clean out your muddy hole.
You are working for the guards
I can smell a snitch from a mile away and, not to sound rude or anything, but you smell real bad.
I think maybe you have good deal with guards. Maybe too good.
The moment we turn our backs, you're going to start squeaking like a rat, aren't you?
I think you enjoy your life here far more than you reasonably should.
Dang it, Woodcock! You're gonna rat us out. Admit it!
Maybe I'm jumping to conclusions, but I get the feeling you like the guards more than you like us.
Be straight with us, mate. What's the deal with you and these guards?
I sense you're holding something back. Be honest with us about your deal with the guards. You will feel better.
Oh non, I'm a prisoner like everyone else! I'm just a bit more entrepreneurial. I take care of the chickens and everything. Everyone appreciates a good omelette du fromage, right?
Die!
Non, non, I won't cluck, I won't... Argh...
Silently kill King Chicken
You passed the test
Well, it's nice to see somebody here knows what they're doing. I hope there are more like you around.
You seem like you're hip to what's going down around here. What's the skinny?
I know, I know! Le Major has sent you to check on his goons, right? At this hour they are playing cards in the barracks... You can sneak up on them just like that, hehe.
Goodbye! Have a nice day! Thank you for coming!...
Guards! GUARDS! Intruders over here! The camp is under attack!
Goodbye! Have a nice day! If you need me, I'll be right here! King Chicken at your service!
Goodbye then... Have a nice day!
Man, you're like a... uh, like a dozer in a kindergarten. I mean... What I mean? Uh, I mean, you just can't fly. You may be big, you may be yellow, but you just can't fly, man.
Larry Roachburn. When I heard Biff was in country, I might have known you wouldn't be far.
Oh, I'm far, man. Far out! I'm, like, way beyond the planets and stuff, but I'm falling fast... or maybe slow. Like, reeeeeal slow.
Don't you know my face, mon?
Well, you got a nice face for a dozer, but you just can't fly, man. Don't you try to fool me.
Hey, look! It is the tiny man who was always trying to steal my vitamins!
Gah! A giant!
Sorry, cant fly
That's okay, man. You can't pig either. And you can't dog. Well I guess you can BITCH about something like those jerks in the camp. Always whining about something...
Can YOU fly?
Oh, man, I'm flying high in the sky. Trust me, I'm a sci-fi high fly!
Shaking hands, watery eyes, dilated pupils, occasional tremor - I would say that you must be pretty "high" indeed.
Hey man, do you like my art projects?
Im not a man
I don't know, man. Don't care who you are as long as you don't stab me with a sword in the face, or something.
Not until you claim that no mon can kill you.
Hey, watch where you're going! Don't walk on any of my art projects!
Hey, good to see you! It's a bit lonely out here since you got rid of those jerks in the camp.
Heyyyy... You got that magic pill I told you about?
Hey man! What's up?
Tell us about those jerks

Bunch of jerks, man. Sure, they give me explosives so I can make my art, but then they just take away most of what I create. I'd kick their teeth in if I, y'know, could get on my feet without falling over.
I have been there, comrade. Is terrible.
But it's cool, I guess. They got plenty of stuff for me to play around with. They keep it in the Boom Tent. You wanna fly? They got shit in there blow you straight to the moon!
Oh, Fidel wants to go to the Boom tent!
And just where might this Boom Tent be located, lad?
This tent. You will show it to us, yes?
Like to get a look inside that tent.
Maybe you show us where this tent is, huh?
Boom Tent is located locally?
All right, Larry. Understood. Just show us where this Boom Tent is.
Well, hot damn! That sounds like my Uncle Jim Bob's tent on the Fourth of July!
Sounds like where the party is. Just point me in the right direction.
This Boom Tent sounds useful. Where is it?
All right, mate. Color me curious. Which way to the Boom Tent?
Boom Tent, huh? Could probably find some useful stuff in there.
They keep explosives in tents? Not underground? Amateurs.
See? It's over there! I can mark it on your map! I...  Hmmm... where'd I put my crayons?
Tell us about the camp
Don't know, man. Ain't no summer camp, I can tell you that. Well, maybe it's sorta like summer camp: I'm doped outta my mind and blowing stuff up. It's kinda my thing. My art.
My man!
Context: Conversation Larry_1 Text reference to Rick & Morty

Text: No more jerks in the camp
Really? Oh, man, now who will appreciate my art?
Every poor soul who has the bad sense to walk on it, I'm afraid.
You call this Art?!
I don't know, I've never thought of a name. But you know, I think Art is a bit too pretentious name for a minefield. Maybe Peter? Or Larry? Ah, I just don't know...
To Fidel, it look like playground.
A minefield?
Yeah, these jerks wanted me to help them defend their camp. It's not a bad deal. I give them stuff that explodes and they give me stuff to... ummm... help with my allergies.
It's awesome!
Fidel loves it! The way how you placed detonators in all them weird parts... Ahh, you got the spark.
Oh, finally someone to appreciate it! Those jerks, they just scream and swear.
Some people do not understand modern art, partner.
It's... very nice
Yeah. It's what I'm good at, y'know? Well, this and breaking into medicine cabinets, but I don't know if you can count that.
Your mum must be so proud.
Well, the police certainly count it.
Charming.
Whoa, man. Why you gotta give me the third degree? Start with, like, some easy questions first.
You must be Larry
Must I? Ugh, I don't know. Today I feel more like Arthur, or maybe Jock. May I be Jock please?
Youre a joke alright
Then why aren't you laughing? Oh, I must be a bad joke.
Oh, it's just not right. Making fun of you while YOU are here is like playing a violin in the presence of Paganini.
Be a naughty joke, that's what I prefer doing.
And you must be quite a joker, man. You're more fun than those jerks.
Dont you know your name?
How could you be forgetting your own name, mon?
You got a head wound or something? You don't know your name?
I know my name! I know lots of names. I'm just not sure which one is mine.
I have been there, comrade. Vodka is cruel mistress. Happens to everyone.
It sounds to me like you are in need of nap.
Those jerks in the camp call me "hey weirdo".
I do not think this is a good name, but I understand why they have given it to you.
What kinds of drugs have you taken? This sounds like amnesia.
Your mind has wandered far from your body. In western medicine it is called amnesia.
Oh, honey, I think maybe you bumped your head. It sounds like you have amnesia!

Amnesia?! Man, I don't have amnesia! I just can't remember anything after I snorted some weird powder in that funny little town during the Carnival. It's not amnesia, it's... Oh, wait. That is amnesia.
Persuasion successful
You have amnesia
Amnesia?! Man, I don't have amnesia! I wash my hands every day.
Fidel washes hands even more! Every two days!
And how could you know if I had it? You're not even a doctor!
Persuasion failed
Remember Diamond Red?
I don't know, man. Was he a wrestler? Sorry, I just can't remember shit since I snorted some weird powder in that funny little town during Carnival.
What have you snorted?
Oh, it was some cheap mix I got at the Carnival celebration... Just wanted to test it, y'know? But later that night we got into a fight with, um... somebody? That's when I got captured.
Ah, it happens.
Ya got loaded and then got into a firefight? What's-a-matter-wit-you?
They gave me a shot of something... Oh man, when it mixed with that other shit? Things got REAL interesting... I think. Can't really remember.
There is a valuable life lesson somewhere in this whole story.
When the body is polluted, the mind is clouded.
You need an herbal cleanse, followed by a twenty-four fast... and then probably another herbal cleanse.
I wish there was some magic pill to clear my head, man. But all the pills I can think of will probably just make it worse.
Magic pill?

Yeah, like if there was a cure-all or something... Wait a sec. You know what? There IS a magic pill. Well technically it's a shot, but it should do the trick. Hey, you think you can find Metaviron around here somewhere?
Here, take this Metaviron
Is that it? The actual shit? Oh man, I don't even wanna know what or who you had to do to get this! Here, help me find a vein.
Oh, wow. Look at all the track marks! How are you not dead?
Do you remember now?
Anything coming back to you now, Larry?
Hey, Larry. You feelin' all right, mon?
Yes! Um, I guess. I... I remember I was with Biff's team in Pantagruel, then we attacked the Diamond Red mine... I remember EVERYTHING! It was awesome.
Ha-ha, this how I feel after first vodka shot in the morning.
Guess that stuff really works.
Well, look at you! You were lower than a whipped dog and now you're full of piss and vinegar!
I feel so alive, man! That shit's the shit! I gotta find some more of it. Can I come with you guys?
What happened in Pantagruel?
We had a deal with those communist guys, the Maquis. They said they'd help us take the Diamond Red mine from the Legion and Biff was all for it. Turned out to be horseshit! They led us into a trap.
Tell us about Diamond Red

It was fortified as hell and the Legion hit us from behind... Biff yelled "Retreat!", but my head was all blurry and I kinda retreated toward the enemy. It was an epic battle, with pink unicorns and laser raptors!
My man... someday you have got to let me see the magic show that goes on in your head.
Sound like bad deal, partner. I never work with laser raptor. Chew every scene.
Sure, mon. And which one you be riding?
No, wait. Not unicorns. I think it was elephants. Then the Legion questioned me and I told them all I knew... Which left them a bit confused, actually.
But I imagine they know all there is to know about pink elephants and laser raptors, no?
Pink elephants. Very dangerous.
And I bet they got more confused with every question you answered.
Anyway, I was already drugged to the brim, when they decided to use some "truth serum" shit on me and, boom, goodbye blue sky! It was nice though.
See you, man. Watch your step.
Time to go home, Larry. You need some rest.
Yeah, you're right, Len. Maybe I'll just find a little something to help me get straight and then I'll hit the road.
The whole reason I came here was to keep myself away from all the temptations at home.
I know what you mean. I'd get in trouble shooting people back home. That's why I do it here.
I know what you mean. I came here to get away from Mama Gianna's cannolis. Fuggetaboutit.
Ugh! I know what you mean. Too many ex-boyfriends still have my phone number!
Larry, I have to point out that keeping busy didn't exactly help you avoid these temptations here, no?
How was I supposed to know they would be celebrating Carnival!
But I guess I can check back into rehab for a while. They keep a room reserved for me, but I'll be ready for action if you need me.
I'm sure they do.
Let me know if you need a referral.
You're number one on the call list if we ever need a laser raptor.
Anyway! Here. I won't need these back home.
Let's go!
Let's go, man! I got a score to settle with these Legion dudes. I'm ready to go after them like a giant ten-tentacled robot with rainbow machine guns on fire!
You... sure you be fine, mon?!
Fine as rain, Vicki! Right as an elbow!
Uh-huh...
Is good to have one more pair of hands. Even tiny like his.
Tiny hands make quick work, right? Or something? Hey, uh, Steroid? You got any, um, vitamins on you?
Splendido! Now, how many kisses do I owe each one of you beautiful people for springing me?
I could kiss them for you, Boss.
It, uh... doesn't work that way, Joseph.
Oh... Should I take out the Thing, Boss?
Not yet. Just wait a bit, bambino.
Just call me Luigi. I'm a simple Italian cook! Right, Joseph?
You mean when you killed a guy with a spoon?
Err... Hehe. Well, you can't make pasta without breaking some heads, right?
If you say so, Boss.
Anyway, thanks for getting me out of that cell, ragazzi. Now, I have some business to attend to... I've got to serve a dish to someone special.
Context: Conversation Luigi_1 Text Friendly tone that turns dark, menacing at end

Text: Is it a dish that is best served cold?
You seem to know something about cooking, eh, ragazzi? Oh, yes, I mean to serve some cold, cold dishes on a plate that is six feet deep.
Sounds like you got a score to settle, Woodburn.
The nutritional value of revenge is quite low. In fact, it's more like poison, one that only acts on the cook's soul.
Seeking vengeance will only twist your soul into a knot and cause a lot of bloating and constipation.
Why are you in here?
I'm doing a favor for someone very special to me. I'm innocent, but I'm loyal, capiche?
Taking the rap for someone in a place like this? That's one hell of a favor.
Oh, I capiche all right. You take the rap here, while someone else takes the rap for you somewhere else. I've seen it a hundred times.
Loyalty is for defenseless herd animals.
What are you planning to do now?
I'm gonna walk around. I'm gonna breathe free air. I'm gonna go see... an old friend.
Boss Blaubert is our friend now?
He's more than a friend, he's family.
Oh... Like that guy you told me to drop the Thing on, your cousin Mario?
Shush, bambino. What happens in the family, stays in the family.
What is the Thing?
It's just a Thing that Joseph made in the prison workshop. He made it as a form of, uh... artistic expression, capiche?
I did a good Thing.
You sure did, bambino! The guard in the workshop didn't like it at first, but he soon got into the swing of things and liked it so much he let Joseph take it back to his cell.
Oh, I get it. It's a weapon. You criminals can't ever stop speaking in code, can you?
So you made the Grand Daddy of all shivs. Big fuckin' deal.
Everybody's a critic.
Sometimes you need to be beat over the head with art before you can understand it.
That is beautiful! I'm gonna put those words on a plaque and mount it over my fireplace.
We killed Boss Blaubert

You... killed him? You killed Boss Blaubert? Huh... Well, that is some real good news, ragazzi. You spared me a whole lot of cooking, eh? How did he die? I hope he didn't suffer much. He was a good man, all things considered.
He was a crime boss and he paid for it with his life. That's what crime gets you.
Easy there, pretty lady. You're starting to scare me.
He died the way all mortal creatures do. His final breath of life was agony, his first breath of death was of an ecstasy unknowable to living creatures.
Riiiiight... Hey, do me a favor and let me know the next time you're gonna say something so I can be somewhere else.
Fidel will show you how he died. I drew pictures. Come, look. Mira.
Poor Boss Blaubert. He was good to me.

Well, anyway, I guess I should be making my way back to Rimville to get all his affairs in order. Come visit me when you get the chance! I'll give you some warm Italian hospitality. And, uh, don't worry... I don't mean the kind that involves cement boots.
Sure, just don't be busting out no mattresses, neither.
Oh, my mouth is already watering for some home-cooked Italian food!
Glad to hear that! Cement boots no good for riding horse.
Boss Blaubert sent us
The Boss sent you to take care of me, eh? Well, well... You see, Joseph? He remembers his favorite cook after all!
Context: Conversation Luigi_1 Text "take care of" = mafia expression meaning "to kill"

Text: The Boss doesn't forget, Boss.
And here I thought the old man was going soft. Alright, ragaz-... mercenaries. If you're gonna take care of me, why don't you just do it already, eh?
I've been asking myself the same question.
I am thinking perhaps my understanding of this expression is not of adequacy. Is rescuing someone not taking care of them?
Context: Conversation Luigi_1 Text This character is not familiar with "take care of" mob expression

Text: What, are you from another planet?
We have freed you... is this not taking care of you? Do you require us to feed and clothe you as well?
Context: Conversation Luigi_1 Text This character is not familiar with "take care of" mob expression

Text: Are you for real? You don't know what I'm talking about? Have you been living in the desert your whole life?
Very near to it, yes.
Blaubert wants to see you
What? He sent you down here just to free me? Huh... Oh, I get it. I see his play here. He thinks I'm gonna walk back to him all innocent and grateful and apologetic and crap.
If you want to surprise him, that's a great way to sneak in through the front door.
You show him what he expects to see, he's got no chance to see anything else.
I know a mime trick you could use to make it look like you're crying!
Yeah... Alright, I guess that works for me just fine. Once me and Joseph get past whichever guards you haven't iced yet, we'll be on our way back to Rimville. Right, Joseph?
Whatever you say, Boss.

You see? Don't you worry, ragazzi. I won't start anything without you. I'd like you to watch me and Boss Blaubert resolve our, uh... differences of opinion on certain matters. Who knows, you might even take my side, eh?
I wouldn't hold my breath if I were you.
Not likely, mate. I don't like to get involved in other people's family drama. I got enough of my own.
If it suits our objectives... we'll consider it.
LeaveRedirect
Alright, we're ready. Before we go, you want that we should help you take out the rest of the prison guards? Me and Joseph, we got a Thing or two to tell 'em.
We sure do, Boss, starting with this Thing right here.
You aren't going anywhere
Good boys stay where they're told to stay, bad boys go wherever they want. Isn't that right, Joseph?
I... I kinda like it here, Boss. So... does that make me a good boy?
You're the best boy, bambino! Don't worry about it. Now, be a good boy and get the Thing ready.
Okay, boss.
Gonna be forever grateful and so on. See you in Rimville, ragazzi! Ciao!
Well meet you in Rimville

You know what? I really hope you do. Maybe you'll see how a real Boss operates, especially one that knows how to reward loyalty. Come on, Joseph, let's go gather the ragazzi! We're leaving this good place.
Okay. I'm glad we can take our new prison friends with us, Boss.
Context: Conversation Luigi_1 Text in a dramatic tone

Text: Me, too. I think they'll like Rimville... and I can't wait for Boss Blaubert to meet them. Hehehe.
Help us take the prison

Hey, it's the least we can do for our new friends. Once we're finished with the guards, Joseph and me will head back to Rimville and get prepared. Next time you visit, you'll see how a real Boss should operate.
Hey, Boss, you want I should get our prison friends to help?
Joseph, bambino! Look at you thinking with more than just your Thing. Yeah, go get the boys. Tell them it's payback time.
Great job, boys! I really enjoyed the performance. I wish I could've trained my Legion to be half as impressive, but those dummies couldn't even shoot the goddamned president!
I am not a boy.
So, we're just going to set aside the whole issue with that not really being something they should be doing in the first place?
Ja. To be honest, I am a little embarrassed for them.
Maybe they just didn't believe in you anymore.
Pierre? You still alive, kid? I'll be damned.
Spike? Spike Scallion? Is that really you?
The one and only, old buddy.
Great job, boys! I really enjoyed the performance. I wish I could've trained my Legion to be half as impressive, but at least those dummies managed to shoot the goddamned president!
And we made them pay for it. Now it's your turn.
I don't think that's really something you want to hang your hat on.
An achievement of dubious merit.
Maybe the reason your Legion "boys" aren't very impressive is that they are done trying to impress you.
Pierre? Well, I'll be damned. I figured this day would come, kid. Just didn't think you'd be flanked by A.I.M.'s finest.
Spike? Spike Scallion? Is that really you?
The one and only, old buddy.
Why were you trying to kill President LaFontaine?
Why have you killed President LaFontaine?

Honestly, I didn't really care. Idealists like him always die before their time is up anyway. If not me, it would have been some other asshole trying to carve out a piece of this place to make their own.
There it is - the excuse given for bad behavior by assholes everywhere.
That don't mean that asshole had to be you.
Perhaps this is true, which is why such people need to be protected.

Besides, I wanted to see if I could boost my boys' morale. They really hated that guy. I thought if they killed him, they might feel powerful enough to kill you. Nothing personal. As the Major, I'm expected to give those kinds of orders.
Oh, I'm very aware of the kinds of orders you give. The order to send me to Diamond Red - that was one of my favorites.
Look at the bright side, kid. I could've just ordered your execution.
Why didn't you?
Just gettin' soft, I guess.
You were a merc like us, Spike
What has gotten into you, Spike?!
What the hell ya think you're doing, Woodsman?!

Context: Conversation Major_1 Text "Spike! What have you done, Spike!"

Text: Well, I'm still just like you - only less delusional, especially since I came here. I became the Major when I decided to stop letting people yank me around on a string.
Gained a bit of influence over the Major
So, you're the Major
The name's Spike Scallion, formerly of A.I.M. Just a merc, like you - only less delusional. I became the Major when I decided to stop letting people yank me around on a string.
A merc just like us, huh? Funny, I don't see the resemblance.
Have you considered being a puppeteer? You can yank little puppets... around... on... strings. Never mind. I'll be quiet now.
Are you quite sure you're less delusional? There is a considerable amount of evidence to suggest otherwise.
RedirectMerc

Ya see, I first came here as just a merc with a contract. Your amiga Corazon hired me to destabilize the region and take some of those sweet diamond mines. I went right to work. My Legion may not be the best military force there is, but it did the job, and it spread like wildfire.
Why did you break with Adonis?

My deal was with Corazon. It was all off the books. I seized the mines and she and I split the profits. That was the deal, but that bitch got greedy, canceled my contract and demanded I hand the mines and the Legion over to her.
She strikes me as the kind of person who doesn't like to share.
Different century, same colonizer bullshit.
You got off easy, mate. First, she just wants the diamonds, but then it's the house, the car, the kids...
I told her where she could stick that idea. That's when she got stupid - hired Biff Apscott and his band of buffoons to take me out. Ha! I would've felt bad for him, except I was laughing too hard.
Never send prey to do a predator's job.
This is the problem Fidel has! I cannot feel bad, because I am always laughing... and killing.
I get the feeling you could use some sensitivity training.
You will take that back! I am no buffoon!
Hey, that's not nice!
Hey, man. That's not cool. We, like, worked really hard... sometimes.
Then you A.I.M. mercs showed up and my Legion proved to be no match for professionals. But you made the same mistake I made with Corazon and now she's got the knife ready to plunge into your backs.
That's what this whole thing is about? Just some ridiculous revenge plot and some... some... MONEY?! What about what you taught us of patriotism, pride, honor...
That was bullshit, kid. I had to spew that crap to fill the ranks. Might not have bothered, all I got was murderers and thieves anyway. Except you. You were different.
I should kill you where you stand.
Believe it or not, kid, I been waiting for you to try. I had plans for you. Big plans. Too late now. Go ahead and kill me. I guess I got it coming.

Of course! I've still got the contract. The wording is purposefully vague, but along with some correspondence I kept it'll sound pretty convincing in court. Here, this is where I keep all that stuff. You're welcome to it. I hope you nail that bitch.
Justice will be done!
The evidence of one's transgressions will always come to light.
This is why I always destroy the paper trail. It's a sword that cuts both ways.
Influence check successful Gained a piece of evidence against Corazon
Do you have any evidence against Corazon?
I burned my contract a while ago. I'm way past letting documents control my life. I'm in the jungle now. Jungle rules are the only ones I respect.
"Survival of the fittest" doesn't seem to be working out so well for you.
That's a road that dead ends quick.
Yeah? Well, I respect the rules of the road. Actually, wait. No, I don't.
Influence check failed
Biff was your friend
I don't know what gave you that idea. He was always a poor excuse of a merc and it was about time he and his bunch of M.E.R.C. clowns got a reality check.
I have to admit I do agree with your point, but I do not agree with your way of proving it.
It is true. The hard lessons of battle bring wisdom.
But why? Reality is boring.
I will warn you once again, sir! Your insults will not go unpunished!
I mean... I suppose you're not wrong.
We were a CLOWN troupe!? Oh, man, so many things make sense now.
Lost a bit of influence over the Major
We will destroy your Legion

Go right ahead! I'm done with 'em. I tried my best to make an army out of 'em, but they're a bunch of losers. Go ahead and kill the rest if you want. I won't stop you. They don't deserve to live any more than that stupid bitch Corazon.
And to think I once believed in you...
Then let the hunt begin!
I think I can see where your leadership style could use a little improvement.
Your Legion could have performed better

Yeah, that much is true. I saw the reports of your Militia doing a pretty decent job against my Legion boys. Reminded me of the good old days of training villagers how to protect themselves from tyrants. Damn, you live long enough to be a hero, and then...
It's not too late for you, old pal.
Then you retire! Dang, Spike! You're not supposed to become a monster!
Then you become a leader. Not a warlord. A leader.
What? Then what? Did you get married? That's what I did. A lot.
Gained some influence over the Major
You're going to answer for this
I think I already have. You broke the Legion. You beat me in my own camp. Major Spike Scallion's last hoorah is finished. Only thing to do now is finish the Major himself.
Don't think I won't! You wouldn't be the first man I've had to finish off.
This is why I like to move around a lot. There's SO much less you have to answer for if you don't keep a permanent address.
Well then, what the hell we waitin' for?
Go on then. I'll die like a soldier.
Wait! Before you die, tell me why you didn't just kill me after my failure in Ernie or after I tried to kill Graaf. Why send me to the camp?

I figured by the time you got yourself free, I'd have finished my business with Corazon and the rest of the corrupt assholes shitting all over this country. You'd come for me, but I'd be ready. I was gonna make you a deal. We fake my death, you take over the Legion and I... I just disappear.
Oh, no, that won't do at all. I want to die a soldier, not a fucking prisoner! Come on, boys, don't do that to me. You know I deserve better.
Wait! Before you die, tell me why you didn't just kill me after my failure in Ernie or after I tried to kill Graff. Why send me to the camp?
That's easy, kid. You were my ticket out of here. I figured a little while in the camp would make you realize the only way for you to survive was to kill me.
You're not making sense!

I figured by the time you got yourself free, I'd have finished my business with Corazon and the rest of the corrupt assholes shitting all over this country. You'd come for me, but I'd be ready. I was gonna make you a deal. We fake my death, you take over the Legion and I... I just disappear.
I... take over? You're insane.
I agree that I didn't have all the details worked out, but it doesn't matter now. Too late for all that. So, go ahead. Take your best shot, kid.
You will go to jail
Oh, no, that won't do at all. I want to die a soldier, not a fucking prisoner! Come on, don't deny me that! Damn you!...
No can do, Spike. You need to answer for your crimes in a public trial.
I think I'd rather watch you do a perp walk.
Sorry, love. We're mercenaries, not executioners.
Can't do the time, don't do the crime.
Hey, calm down, man. Think of all the time you'll have in prison to get in touch with your inner child and reinvent yourself!
Settle down, mate. I know a good lawyer. Well... a good divorce lawyer, anyway.

But I would come with you for free, just to see the face of that little bitch when she sees her worst nightmare coming true. But are you sure ya want to be involved with a war criminal? Because let's not bullshit each other, that's what I am.
What if WE hire you?
You can't hire the Major of the Legion, boys, ya don't have that kind of money. And I'm not for hire anymore...

But I would come with you for free, just because you dealt with that little bitch Corazon and I want to see how the rest of this plays out. But are you sure ya want to be involved with a war criminal? Because let's not bullshit each other, that's what I am.
Influence check successful
RedirectHire
All wars are crimes. Get your gun.
Fidel is also war criminal! It is fun to make new friend!
Then it is best to stay on the hunt, non?
Yes, but it is not ALL that you are. Don't let other people's laws define you!
Kicking a lot of ass ain't a crime in my book.
Time to join the posse, partner!
I cannot sort out how I feel about you joining us, but I know you are acting more like le Major I first met than you have in a long time.
Not the Major anymore, kid. Just call me Spike. And don't worry about your feelings. They just get in the way anyhow.
Welcome to the team
What a day! No, what a year!... I guess ol' Spike's last hoorah ain't over yet. Pretty sure I ain't leaving this country alive, but let's see how much ass I can kick before I take a dirt nap.
Allo! I am Maman Lilian. And who would you be, darlings? You certainly don't look like the usual clientele of Le Lys Rouge.
We don't? I am hurt.
Well we may want to apply! Are you hiring?
Just passing through, ma'am... and maybe looking for a little afternoon delight.
I'm warning you, I've got enough trouble on my plate and I won't be having more.
Allo! Thanks for putting away those filthy bandits. Le Lys Rouge will welcome you with open arms.
How about open legs as well?
That's between you and your purse.
Time to party!
It wasn't yer arms I had in mind, lass, but an old man takes what he can get.
However, make sure you don't start any trouble. We have enough already. If you ever hurt my darlings, I will pay someone to find and kill you.
Do not be intimidated by my massively intimidating muscles.
If you say so. It's kind of hard to look past all the guns and grenades and see good, paying customers.
Just think of us as exterminators.
I ain't here to cause friction, except maybe the friendly kind.
Hey, we no desperados. We just friendly cowboys looking to put our boots up!
There will be no trouble, unless I start to feel itchy where there should be no itchy. Understand?
Thank you for talking sense into him. Poor Savanna Lion, he was so cute with those horrible flowers he picked, all red with embarrassment...
I can hear you, honey!
Then be a good boy and don't eavesdrop!
Never! A Communist would never do such a thing!
Shoo! Shoo! Go check the girls!
At once, generalissimo! Mission accepted!

...Of course, I said yes! He is a wonderful man and I am a lucky woman to have him. But don't tell him that - he would be so full of himself that I'd have to ask the girls to throw him in the cold water basin again.
I'm so happy for both of you, love. This place needs you two as an example.
You two are adorable! I envy you. I mean, in a nice way.
I know, darling. Thank you!
Again? Why? What did he... Never mind. Forget I asked.
You... You killed Chimurenga?
That's right, baby! Don't worry no more about that bandit.
All communists must pay. It is Gontarski creep... er... creed.
Silenced the scuzzwad.

My poor Savanna Lion, you and your stupid revolution! You gave everything to it and never found time for friends and family! Who will bring flowers to your grave now? Only me, the foolish old whore who loved you.
Damn.
This maybe not so good.
Oh... biscuits.
Oh... I... had no idea. Do you need a hug or a drink or something? Sorry, I'm no good at this sort of thing.
Well, I feel like shit now. Anyone else?
It seems our choices may not have been the wisest.
Why did you kill him?! He gave up the life of a revolutionary! You heartless murderers!
My brave Savanna Lion is dead! I couldn't keep him here... not when there was a threat. He just had to go out and fight those murderers!
He died like a true patriot of Grand Chien. There is no shame in that.
He was very special to us as well. He will be sorely missed.
You can't stop an old soldier from being who he is. Believe me, I wish you could.
It's all your fault! You knew he retired... He gave you everything - and you let him die.
I heard you have punished those abusers, darlings. Thank you! This is how we teach good manners on the Adjani. Here, take your well deserved payment. Feel free to spend it in Le Lys Rouge!
Oh, we will! I'll demonstrate what good manners look like.
You better.
Your hospitality is most kind, but we have other matters to attend to.
Of course you do, but remember that we'll always be here... to attend to any matter you wish.
Mmm, we'll think about it.
Girl, I have so many special offers for you in mind, you'll have plenty to think about.
You clever scoundrels! You found the brilliant necklace of Madam Lecoq and you didn't tell me! Don't you know she was the previous owner of Le Lys Rouge? Ah, you should have seen us back in the day!
I don't got the power to go back in time, but I won't say no to looking at some pictures.
Were you friends or... more than friends?
And if ya seen me back in the day, ya would've given me a discount!
Anyway, why would les Mercenaires need such an item? Give it to me for safekeeping - it belongs to this place. I would be very, very thankful!

Have you considered returning the brilliant necklace of Madam Lecoq back to Le Lys Rouge? I will make sure that you will be loved and adored for that... I think you know what that means in a place like this.
NecklaceRedirect
Alright, you can have it for free
Oh sure, no problem. I love returning stuff. Sometimes I return stuff I never even purchased. Um, that's not what this is though, of course.
Mother was always adamant that all stolen treasures should be returned to their rightful place. Adamant. Repeatedly.
It looks so wonderful hanging from your neck. It really draws the eye!
I never needed much help with that, but thank you, sweetie.
In return, I will make sure that everyone in town treats you as a friend of Le Lys Rouge. And you should know, this comes with a neat discount for our... services.
Forgive me if I withhold my enthusiasm.
Well, I doubt I've ever heard a better excuse to get right friendly with the ladies.
Yay! I mean, it's good they like us in town. Definitely.
Oh yeah, Ace! When do we start?
Well, isn't that swell! What a nice gesture.
I'm about to give you a not-so-nice gesture, Ron. Proceed with caution.
But I think we'll pass on that, Maman.
Does that include complimentary beverlies... URP!... um, beverages.
Pffft. Unless these services include an oil change and tire rotation, I'm not interested.
A discount ya say? Well, it's been a while since old Red has had his equipment serviced.
You NEED it, dear? What for?!
It may come in handy as a bit of leverage.
It's evidence. We should probably hold onto it.
Well, it's quite simple, really. This is a very rare piece. The responsible thing to do would be to donate it to a museum.
Be cool, momma. I respect your feelings, but in this world money's king. We got bills to pay, ya dig?
This necklace really brings out the color of my eyes... er, which is really important in a combat situation.
Actually, there are many reasons, but most important among them is that there is a certain international cartel that no one should owe money to, especially me.
Look, I don't have much cash. All I have is a piggy bank with about $10,000. Would you accept it for the necklace?
returned the necklace to Le Lys Rouge
You can have it for $10,000
Thank you, dear! Once again, the treasure of Le Lys Rouge will be where it belongs!
I will miss it. But it surely looks wonderful on you, dear.
Thank you, darling!
Here, this is the Le Lys Rouge piggy bank. It's a bit sticky. People are always spilling things around here.
Ew. I don't think this is a good deal anymore.
Not to worry. I have kids. I always carry handi-wipes with me.
Fidel smash!
What a nice little piggy! I will take it to market.
We're mercenaries. We're used to getting our hands dirty for money.
Nothing a little rubbing alcohol won't fix... Er, not that I have any on me - or any other type of alcohol. Honest.
We'll think about it
Please consider it carefully, dear. This necklace belongs to Le Lys Rouge after all.
Allo. Did you find out something about my dear Mollie?
Oh, it's you, darlings! Thank you for bringing home my poor Mollie. We are her family, not these foreigners who come in here, fill her head with nonsense, and then break her heart.
Family is important!
You are most welcome, love.
But I only wanted to... Oh never mind. Can I see her?
Rescuing damsels in distress is what we're good at!
She still doesn't want to see you, but she is happier here. You did the right thing.
No need to tell me, I already know everything. I just wonder, is she really happy with that man?
She's a gold digging little hussy, so I dinnae think she could be happier.
How could she possibly be happy with that fat, disgusting pig?
Let us just say that the bitch has completed her hunt.
She seemed positively smitten!
Welcome, darlings! My lion, see who has come to visit you!
In a bit, honey! Once I'm done with the pancakes, I'll come and see them.
Hello there, darlings. Do you bring news of Mollie? Is she okay? Please, have a seat. Tell me everything!
Welcome home, darlings! Have a seat. Girls! Bring some coffee at once!
No, I won't!
Come on, Mollie, be a nice girl.
Do they prefer it with extra cyanide, or only with strychnine topping?
I see that you mean to take a double shift tonight, do you?
Do they bring any news of Smiley?
You provide the coffee, I'll ask about the news.
One more coffee for me! I enjoy it the most when I'm in the company of friends.
Welcome to Le Lys Rouge. Have fun and don't start any trouble. We already have enough of it.
Lys Rouge?
Right now Le Lys Rouge is closed and we won't open unless those filthy Legion bandits are gone. Even the communist Maquis know they should pay for service and treat my girls with respect!
Yes. It is sad, but there are many in the Legion who know nothing of respect.
Do not worry, little lady. Sheriff Tex is here to clean up town!
I can't stand blokes who don't know how to treat a lady.
Lys Rouge can't offer R&R while there is enemy presence
What is Lys Rouge?

It is a fine establishment for... Who am I kidding? It's a brothel. But at least it is clean and respectable, and the girls are healthy. If I could say the same about our country, it'd be a much nicer place to live.
But your saloon IS a fine establishment, Ma'am!
Thank you, and you are a sweet cowboy.
Just a humble mercenary.
That is an astute if perhaps overly suggestive observation.
Imagine that, Ace? A whole country run like a high-class brothel? I think I got to sit down.

Oh, well, let's see! My dear Mollie was kidnapped, the Carnival celebrations are ruined, and the town is full of scumbags who think they can abuse my girls and get away with it... What will happen next, a plague of locusts?
Context: Conversation Maman_1 Text reference to JA2

Text: Could be worse.
Could be, like, a plague of monster cats.
Yes, that would be biblically bad.
It is more likely that you will be forced into sex slavery by roaming gangs of armed men. Oh... you were making a joke.
Tell us about Carnival

It is a fiesta of love and happiness here in Pantagruel. There is music, drinking, dancing in the streets, then it always comes to its peak on the square in front of Le Lys Rouge. We are the main sponsor of the event, darling!
Sounds like great advertising strategy.
Sounds like fun!
I might become a sponsor as well, Ace!
And of course we missed it! Story of my life.
I shall make a note to try to attend next year!
Sounds like a right proper shindig. Sorry I missed it.
But this year's Carnival ended up in chaos when Chimurenga started his stupid war with the Legion... Why don't they stop with their games and make love instead? They seem to need it.
Amen, sister.
I could not agree more. Too many people focus on the wrong things.
That sounds nice. We'd be out of the job, but it does sound nice.
Chimurenga?
A fine gentleman, that's what he is. A very clean and good looking man. And what is more important, he is a good person. Any woman would fall for him.
I feel compelled to object to that.
Oh, girl, you got it bad! I can tell you're crushing hard on him.
Playing at being coy is a game for the young, darling. I don't waste my time on it.
You can't hide it from me, love. You see more in this man than just a good neighbor.
I don't like to attach labels to feelings, darling. Let's just say I think some neighbors can be very, VERY good.
Pfft. Not my type, not by a mile.
I know he likes me, but... He wouldn't leave behind this foolish "revolution" of his, and just settle down. Grand Chien doesn't need more wars, it needs people like him to rebuild it.
Good old Chimurenga with his stupid revolution again. Oh, you see this? There is a whole empty page here! Such a waste. What about we place a "Lys Rouge" advertisement there?
Communism and whores joining forces to make the People rise up to glory! Good thinking, Woody.
This puts whole new meaning in ",  ..."
?! This is... not right.
Now you're cooking with oil!
Trs bien. A little meat to lure the lion to the hunt, eh?
Hush, you.
Not a bad idea. There's not a thing in the world sex can't sell.

I know the Savanna Lion won't like the idea, but I think you darlings can persuade him that this would ensure his pamphlets get a much better reception. Everything sells better with pretty girls on the cover.
You surely got entrepreneurial spirit, sister.
Give a propaganda pamphlet
Oh... So the rumors are true! My poor, poor lovesick Juliette, why would you follow that stupid Romeo?!
My ex-wives probably asked themselves the same question about me. Uh, sorry. Bad comparison. All my exes are still alive... I think.
She tried to make her own fairy tale come true and... it killed her. That shouldn't be how the story goes, but it is.
I'm terribly sorry for your loss.
Each year they crown the prettiest of my girls as Carnival Queen, dress her only in flowers and carry her around on a throne.
Dressed only in flowers? This is not very decent.
A lady can be lady even naked!
Dressed only in flowers? This is not very decent.
Pics or it didn't happen.
Oh, give it a rest, Frank.
Oh wow... that sounds nice.

Mollie surely looked wonderful. She's a nice girl... maybe a bit too nice. She was smiling at everyone, and you know, darling, she has that twinkle in her eyes that makes everyone like her. But I guess that's why she was kidnapped by one of those crazy Commandos.
Mollie?
Mollie was kidnapped?

I think it was that lunatic boy with the rifle - he said his name was Smiley. He came here after the ceremony and wanted to see Mollie. I told him what I told everyone - she was bathing, and besides, there was a waiting list.
Waiting list for what?... Oh, never mind. I got it.
There was a waiting list for the tub? Actually, I guess that makes sense.
Dawson?
Yeah?
Be quiet.
Right.
Waiting list? Crikey. I gotta meet this girl.
This story is starting to get good.
Then he smiled like an idiot and disappeared. An hour later when I went to check on her, she was missing!
Mollie is with Boss Blaubert

What?! How? I was so sure she was kidnapped by that boy Smiley. He desperately wanted to see her after the ceremony... How is she, darling? What happened to her? That boy is working for the Boss, isn't he?!
promised Maman Liliane to talk to Mollie
We will investigate
Please see what you can do! We are all worried about our little Carnival Queen.
Don't worry, ma'am. We're on the case.
A quest to rescue a princess! Or, a queen in this case.
Rescue a president. Rescue a queen. Any other heads-of-state we want to tack onto the list?
Where is Smiley?
If I only knew, he would be dead, darling, commando or not! One cannot kidnap one of my girls and just get away with it. Le Lys Rouge has many friends.
Many plus one, Ma'am!

You are adorable, I'm sure you're aware of that. 
What was I saying?

All I know is that he was seen leaving town with my Mollie, and they were going South. And if he was stupid enough to go to the Refugee Camp, he will be easily found. Just make sure to ask my friend the Shaman about him.

All I know is that he was seen leaving town with my Mollie, and they were going South. Maybe he brought her to Fleatown or the Refugee Camp? Oh... After the terrible thing that happened at the Refugee Camp, there is no one left to ask.
All I know is that he was seen leaving town with my Mollie, and they were going South. Maybe he brought her to Fleatown? That filthy place!
Tell us about those "commandos"
They are some foreigners like you who worked with dear old Chimurenga. His Maquis have a high opinion of "les Mercenaires", but all I know is that one of those buffoons kidnapped my Mollie.
She appears to be referring to the mercenaries from M.E.R.C. Such lack of professionalism is typical for them.
Those must be Biff's mercs.
Huh. I bet those are Biff's boys.
Ah, she must be talkin' about Biff and his mercs. I'm not surprised.
You seem to know them. I won't ask questions. I just want Mollie back. If you can return my girl home, I will see that you are rewarded in the best ways Le Lys Rouge can provide to you.
What ways? Fidel has some ideas.
I feel instantly motivated!
Well, that doesn't do much for me, although a long soak in the tub might be nice.
We want to see the crime scene
She was bathing in the building nearby, and her room is upstairs. I don't know where exactly she was kidnapped from, but I ordered the girls not to move anything.
Anybody heard any screams?
Didn't she cry out for help?
If Fidel is taking girl, girl scream all the time.
It is strange... We didn't hear anything. But, of course, the party was quite loud. You know how it is, darling.
Oh, yeah, I know!
I hear that. Bass was kickin'. Joint was hoppin'.
An excellent distraction for abduction.
Anyway, please investigate - but be careful around my girls. Whatever their profession may be, they are not toys.
Abusers?
You can count on us, Ma'am! Is there lady in distress?
Thank you, darling. Well, actually yes.
No one hurts my girls. No one, ever. No matter if you are Legion or Maquis or the President of Grand Chien - you may never hit a girl... Yet there are some who did just that.
You want us to teach 'em a lesson?
You want us to kick their asses?
You want us to cut off their hands or have you done that already?
I want them dead, so that everyone will learn what happens when you mistreat a lady.
Be a gentleman or die! I love this policy.
I make painful death for them.
My father beat me every day when I was a kid. One day I grabbed a tire iron and broke his back. Maybe you should get your girls some tire irons.
Now THIS is the job for Fidel!
Their fates are already sealed.
Do you want us to bring you their hands or their heads? Both?
Give us the names
Here, I'll write them down for you. Make them all pay, and I'll pay you.
Can we get a free membership instead?
No.
Worth a shot.
I'm makin' a list. Checkin' it twice. Gonna kill some abuser assholes... which will be nice.
What if Fidel find other abusers not on list and kill them, too? Will Fidel get...
Fidel!
What?
I'll memorize the names and then eat the list so there's no evidence.
Um, okay. Or you could just burn it, darling.
Too risky. Open flames attract attention.
I see... I don't think I've ever met anyone as... intense as you, darling.
Fair service for a fair price, and mutual respect - that is my deal for all of my customers. We may sell our bodies, but we never sold our human rights.
We are no bounty hunters

Are you not?! I have heard otherwise. 
Anyway, I will find someone else to deal with those abusers.
Please find Mollie and return her home, darling. We all miss her dearly.
Be careful, darling, and don't die out there! Otherwise the girls would be crying for you, and sad girls are bad for business.
How about you, Ma'am?
If something happens to you, my sweet cowboy, I'd cry the most.
"Don't die" is our motto!
Dawson...
They won't even see us... until it's too late.
Don't worry, love. We're very good at neutralizing threats from a safe distance.
Pas de problme, mon amour. I always stay downwind of the prey.
Take care.
Well, you sure know how to handle those Legion thugs. Wish I could say the same for my husband... They waved their guns at him and he just tucked his chin and followed.
Everyone's a hero in their own way. Just not everyone has my MIGHTY BICEPS! Just look at them!
Context: Conversation Martha_1 Text reference to "Dr. Horrible's Sing-Along Blog"

Text: You make it sound like that's a bad thing.
That's what I did the first time someone waved a gun at me... And the second time. And the third...
Some guys don't like fighting. Never understood that, myself.
If he isn't kidnapped, he's going to wish he were dead when I lay my hands on him.

Welcome to Martha and Herman's... Or probably just Martha's.
Now if you would excuse me, I've got work to do.
Still no trace of my dummy husband? I'm starting to worry.
Your husband?
Those Legion bastards came here and drank everything, and then they pushed my Herman outside and said they want to pay him for his services...
If I was here, they'd never take your husband alive!
They drank... everything?
I'm guessing that didn't mean they wanted to lay some cash on him.
Did they eat everything, too? Just curious.
I am worried about him, but I have my doubts about this whole affair, I tell you!
Context: Conversation Martha_1 Text emphasis on "I am"

Text: We'll look for your husband
Thank you! It's good to know there are still decent people in this world. Please bring my Herman back to me.
Do not worry. Omryn is best tracker. I have snack and then go.
If your man's out there, we'll track him down.
We'll make sure he gets home safely.
And if he happens to be fooling around with that little hussy - Deedee from the Emerald Coast, be sure to tell me!
But if we were, we would take a "lead by example" approach: The couple that shoots together, stays together.
With all due respect, ma'am, we're not marriage counselors.
promised Martha to save Herman
I wish he was as brave as you are! Please bring him back to me.
Don't worry, ma'am. We'll do our best to bring your husband home.
Sure, we'll bring him back to you... if that's what you want.
Don't worry. We will fetch your husband with all his chakras intact.
I hope he's not fooling around with that little hussy Deedee from the Emerald Coast. If that is the case, I'll kill him myself!
Not to worry, lady! We'll save your little husband in distress.
Fear not! We will vanquish the evil-doers and return your beloved!
It is good. We will retrieve wayward husband.
What the hell could be worse, woman?!
I'll bring him dead or alive.
Alive is better.
Oh, worse than death is very bad.
He may be fooling around with that little hussy Deedee from the Emerald Coast. If that is the case, I'll kill him myself!
bad impression on Martha
We'll save your husband!
You're just saying that to comfort me. But in fact, he may be dead, or worse!
I am sure he is fooling around with that little hussy Deedee from the Emerald Coast. But that's none of your business!...
Oh, I see... You think he's stepping out on you, right?
You think he's with another woman? It's hard to see how that's worse than death. I think if you calm down and...
...If he's with her, I swear I'll kill him myself!
We saved your husband!
Then where is he?! Don't tell me that he is with that harlot Deedee!... I'll kill him myself!!!
Nothing to worry about
We'll see about that. In any case, Herman will have a lot of explaining to do. Now if you'll excuse me, I need to get back to work.
Herman has his little secrets
He's a playah, your man.
IS THAT SO?! We'll see about that! Thanks for letting me know - oh, he'll have to explain EVERYTHING once he gets home!
Deedee?
"Deedee Bombastic". She's some kind of wild child who spends her days blowing things up and making explosives for the Legion.
Fidel's kind of girl.
So she's an accomplice.
